title: Student Programmer
description:
*Are you a student who loves helping others and automating tasks? Do you have a passion for tackling exciting projects that utilize software to solve automation problems for a rapidly growing organization? Are you eager to gain valuable experience and skills for your future career? If yes, then we have the perfect opportunity for you!*

**Foundations of Your Job**


As a student programmer in TWD’s Software Engineering Group (SWEG), you'll tackle real\-world automation projects using software solutions. You'll learn to work with various tools and coding languages (Python, TypeScript), work with our ERP system, conduct testing and debugging, and collaborate with others. You'll also have the chance to innovate solutions, with projects like an AI support for our IT department or developing project management apps. You will be able to choose projects aligned with your interests and goals.


If you're seeking a part\-time role, we have an opportunity tailored for you. You'll be based at our office in Rotterdam, collaborating closely with the SWEG team in a supportive and friendly work environment.

**What Makes You Great**


We're searching for motivated and talented students who want to join SWEG as part\-time workers. SWEG is a team of software engineers that work on supporting different branches of the company with software solutions, for example: our Python platform (PyTWD) for structural and mechanical engineering, design automation in Inventor, and dashboards and tools for business automation. You will be a part of the business automation team and create innovative solutions for enabling services teams and project managers. We have lots of ideas for improvements and new features, and we need your help to make them a reality.

**TWD – A Fun Challenge to Be Part Of**


At TWD, we love to create construction methods and design installation equipment. We achieve creative, simple, and efficient solutions through dedicated teamwork. Thanks to our core values – Fun, Development, and Happy Clients – we grow at a rapid pace with over 300 talented people in five locations: Rotterdam, London, Athens, Taipei, and Perth.


Every day we contribute to the energy transition and key infrastructure projects worldwide. We do this by offering innovative design solutions to our clients, mainly in the offshore wind and heavy civils industry.

**Why You Will Love Working at TWD**


Working at TWD means being part of an exciting, fast\-paced industry where you can make a real difference in shaping a more sustainable future. Our collaborative and supportive environment empowers you to take the lead in both your professional and personal development. Our culture at TWD is described as open, no\-nonsense, diverse, and informal, where your ideas and contributions are highly valued.


You'll receive a competitive salary and flexible hours, along with feedback and guidance from experienced mentors who will support your growth as both a programmer and project responsible.


Working at TWD includes:

* Contract benefits tailored to the type of employment (internship/working student).
* A free healthy and sustainable lunch buffet, prepared daily in our own Lunchroom
* An exciting company trip each year where TWD offices come together
* Friday afternoon drinks and special TWD events such as sports events, pub quizzes, ladies’ night, and various social gatherings

**Join Our Team!**


Do you have what it takes to join our SWEG team? We are happy to meet you! Submit your CV and motivation letter through the apply button. Also send us your portfolio of our previous projects (if any). We will get in touch with you within one working week.

*At TWD, we celebrate diversity and inclusivity, welcoming individuals from all backgrounds. We continuously work on enhancing our recruitment process, ensuring fairness and inclusiveness at every step.*

title: AI Software Engineer
description:
**We’re on the lookout for a Senior AI Full Stack Developer to join our expanding team and drive our company’s growth!**

**The Challenge**

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced AI Developer to join our IT department. This is a unique opportunity for someone who thrives in both the development and application of AI technologies, and is excited to lead a team of junior developers. As an AI Developer, you will work on building cutting\-edge tools that leverage AI and also use AI to accelerate the development process itself. If you are passionate about AI, constantly learning about the latest advancements, and eager to implement them in real\-world applications, we want to hear from you.

**Day in the Life of a Senior AI Full Stack Developer at GT Ecom**

* **AI Tool Development:** Design, develop, and maintain tools that integrate AI to enhance functionality and user experience.
* **AI Integration:** Use AI to automate, optimize, and improve development processes, resulting in faster coding and more efficient solutions.
* **Team Leadership:** Manage a team of junior developers and "coders," helping them utilize AI to build their own solutions and encouraging collaboration.
* **Full\-Stack Development:** Apply your expertise as a full\-stack developer to build both frontend and backend systems that incorporate AI technologies.
* **Stay Current with AI Trends:** Continuously monitor the latest advancements in AI, integrating new features and updates into your work to stay ahead of the curve.
* **Problem\-Solving \& Innovation:** Work on complex problems where AI solutions can drive significant business impact, always seeking the most effective approach.

**We would love to hear from you if…**

* **Extensive Full\-Stack Development Experience:** Over **5 years of hands\-on experience** in full\-stack development (both frontend and backend), with a solid track record of building scalable applications and solutions. Proven history of working as a developer before AI became widespread, demonstrating deep foundational knowledge of software engineering principles.
* **Strong AI Expertise:** **2 years of experience** using AI to build tools and solutions. Skilled at applying AI both to enhance application functionality and to accelerate the software development process.
* **Leadership Skills:** Adept at managing, mentoring, and leading teams of junior developers. Promotes a collaborative and innovative team culture, fostering continuous learning and growth.
* **Passion for AI:** Genuinely enthusiastic about AI technologies, with a strong commitment to staying up to date with the latest advancements, tools, and methodologies in the field.
* **Tech\-Savvy:** Proficient in a wide range of AI tools and frameworks, as well as modern coding languages and technologies relevant to full\-stack development. Brings a practical, solution\-oriented mindset to technical challenges.
* **Location: Netherlands**

If you are excited about the opportunity and feel like you are a good fit, we encourage you to apply today and talk to one of our recruiters. We look forward to seeing how your skills and experiences align with our vision. If unsure, we still welcome your application and would be happy to discuss other potential roles that may be a good fit for you.

Job Types: Full\-time, Permanent

Work Location: In person

Expected Start Date: 05/05/2025

title: Field Research and Development Specialist
description:
The **Carbon Robotics LaserWeeder™** leverages advanced robotics, computer vision, AI/deep learning, and lasers to eliminate weeds with sub\-millimeter accuracy—all without herbicides. This innovative solution reduces environmental impact, promotes soil health, and helps farmers address labor shortages and rising costs. Designed in Seattle and built at our cutting\-edge manufacturing facility in Richland, Washington, the LaserWeeder is setting a new standard for automated weed control. With $157 million in funding from prominent investors such as **BOND, NVentures (NVIDIA's venture arm), Anthos Capital, Fuse Venture Capital, Ignition Partners, Revolution, Sozo Ventures, and Voyager Capital**, Carbon Robotics is driving innovation.



As a no\-nonsense team with a bias for action, we take pride in executing our ideas. Whether it's designing transformative technology or visiting farms to ensure our products are reliable and safe, we do whatever it takes to deliver for our customers.



Working here means tackling big problems with big impact. You'll find opportunities to grow professionally, solve complex challenges, and make meaningful contributions to a mission that matters. At Carbon Robotics, we trust our team to act independently and make practical, real\-world decisions.



Join us as we innovate, execute, and build the future of farming together.



YouTube \| X \| Instagram \| LinkedIn \| News


Have you ever wanted to work with cutting edge technology that combines artificial intelligence, lasers, and is shaping the future of farming?



As a **Field Research \& Development Specialist at Carbon Robotics**, you'll operate and be responsible for your very own Carbon Robotics' LaserWeeder and tractor field and trial research equipment, manage logistics for demos and trials, and provide critical feedback on machine performance in the field. This role is hands\-on and field\-focused, ideal for someone who's comfortable with equipment and curious about how things work.



In addition to the hands\-on field work, you'll be assessing the operational effectiveness in specific targeted field trials, data collection, and collaboration with cross\-functional teams. Your insights will help inform product improvements and support the sales team with real\-world results for current and prospective customers.


**What you'll do:**



Data Collection and Analysis:


* Collect and compile comprehensive data on the LaserWeeder and its associated features, with a focus on its impact on agricultural practices and cost analysis.
* Analyze data to identify trends, strengths, weaknesses, and areas of potential improvement.


Demonstrations \& Field Events:


* Operate the LaserWeeder during live customer demonstrations and field events, showcasing machine capabilities and performance in real\-world conditions.
* Collaborate with the sales and marketing teams to ensure successful setup, operation, and troubleshooting of equipment during on\-site demos and promotional events.


Cost\-Benefit Analysis:


* Assess the economic and operational benefits, including labor savings, yield improvement, and reduced chemical usage, to determine the overall cost\-effectiveness.


Report Generation:


* Prepare clear and comprehensive reports and presentations that summarize findings, methodologies, and recommendations.
* Communicate complex technical information in an easily understandable manner for stakeholders.


Collaboration:


* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams, including sales, engineers, agronomists, and universities, to gather insights and data necessary for analysis.


Recommendations:


* Offer actionable recommendations and insights to help farmers make well\-informed choices about implementing the LaserWeeder.


Quality Assurance:


* Ensure the accuracy and reliability of data, calculations, and analysis methods.


Market Research:


* Stay updated on industry trends, pricing, and the competitive landscape for laser weeding technology and similar farming equipment.
* Evaluate the market demand and potential return on investment for adopting laser weeding machinery.


Financial Modeling:


* Develop financial models to simulate various scenarios and assess the potential outcomes of adopting laser weeding technology.


Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities for Success:


* Proficient in operating tractors with various implements and safely trailering large machinery.
* Professional proficiency English, French, German, and Spanish
* Familiarity with farm machinery, agricultural technology, and precision agriculture.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, statistical software).
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Knowledge of agricultural economics and cost\-benefit analysis principles is a plus.
* Bachelor's degree in Plant Sciences, Agricultural Science, Agricultural Economics, Agricultural Business, or a related field. A master's degree is preferred.


Experience:


* Previous experience in agricultural machinery analysis or a related field is advantageous.
* Experience in conducting cost\-effectiveness studies and financial modeling is a plus.


Working Conditions:


* This position will involve a lot of travel to farms to conduct on\-site assessments and event demonstration locations. Travel should be considered as much as 70% of the time.

**Why would you join Carbon Robotics?**



Passion for building teams capable of **solving uniquely interesting problems**. Innovation while **disrupting the market** is what we do. Profiled in WSJ and Forbes, Carbon Robotics is poised to become the next billion dollar company in the rapidly growing worldwide Ag\-Tech industry.


**We offer competitive compensation and benefits to our full time US based\* employees, including:**


* Competitive salaries
* Pre\-IPO Stock Options
* Generous Benefits:
	+ Fully\-paid medical, dental, and vision insurance premiums for you and all dependents
		- Choice of PPO or HDHP/HSA
		- Virtual Care \- Doctor on Demand
		- Employee Assistance Program
	+ Mental Health HRA
	+ Restricted Healthcare Travel support
	+ Menopause Support
	+ Life Insurance
	+ Long Term Disability
	+ Flexible PTO
	+ 401(k) plan
	+ Pet Insurance
	+ Commuter Benefits
* Work Culture: Be a part of an inclusive and tight\-knit company culture that values innovation and mission\-driven success.


* Internationally based employees benefits varies \& Contractors are not eligible for Carbon Robotics Benefits or Stock


**Carbon Robotics is building a culture of diversity and inclusion for all.** We welcome everyone's voice and believe in open and transparent communication. We believe the best products, services, and companies are built by strong teams that include a diversity of backgrounds, perspectives, ideas, and experiences. We are committed to supporting and enabling growth and opportunity for every employee at every level. This is the foundation to which we will build a truly unique environment.



We are equally committed to equal employment opportunity, and it is foundational to how we recruit and hire our talented team. Employment is determined based upon capabilities and qualifications without discrimination on the basis of race, creed, color, religion, sex, gender identification and expression, marital status, military status or status as an honorably discharge/veteran, pregnancy (including potential pregnancy, pregnancy\-related conditions, and childbearing), sexual orientation, age (40 and over), national origin, ancestry, citizenship or immigration status, physical, mental, or sensory disability , HIV/AIDS or hepatitis C status, genetic information, status as an actual or perceived victim of domestic violence, sexual assault, or stalking, or any other protected class as established by law.

company_description: Carbon Robotics partners with farmers to challenge the status quo by building innovative tools to efficiently feed the world.

title: Software Engineer II, Box Sign
description:
**WHAT IS BOX?**



Box (NYSE:BOX) is the leader in Intelligent Content Management. Our platform enables organizations to fuel collaboration, manage the entire content lifecycle, secure critical content, and transform business workflows with enterprise AI. We help companies thrive in the new AI\-first era of business. Founded in 2005, Box simplifies work for leading global organizations, including AstraZeneca, JLL, Morgan Stanley, and Nationwide. Box is headquartered in Redwood City, CA, with offices across the United States, Europe, and Asia.



By joining Box, you will have the unique opportunity to continue driving our platform forward. Content powers how we work. It's the billions of files and information flowing across teams, departments, and key business processes every single day: contracts, invoices, employee records, financials, product specs, marketing assets, and more. Our mission is to bring intelligence to the world of content management and empower our customers to completely transform workflows across their organizations. With the combination of AI and enterprise content, the opportunity has never been greater to transform how the world works together and at Box you will be on the front lines of this massive shift.


**WHY BOX NEEDS YOU**



As the leader in cloud content management, Box helps enterprises transform how people work together. With Box Sign we are enabling all businesses to manage their e\-signature document flows in the same place where content lives. The team is growing very fast to bring Sign to all the customers using Box and to simplify their needs of signing critical business documents.  

  

**WHAT YOU'LL DO**


* You'll be part of the core team to build, improve and support the young Box Sign product.
* This team's product roadmap is focused on security and compliance aspects of Box Sign along with reporting capabilities. Some examples are:
* + Secure signatures through CFR part 11 compliance.
	+ Signing using smart cards.
	+ Leverage reporting of customers sign request.
* Team up with other engineers to foster solid engineering principles and represent our engineering values.
* Utilize both your technical and interpersonal skills to lead large scale projects to completion.
* Model solid engineering practices around architectural design, testability, scalability and maintainability.
* Partner with product managers, designers and other cross\-functional stakeholders to align on requirements and understand how your work will impact the business.
* Create APIs to be consumed by frontend and/or integration with other systems.


**WHO YOU ARE**


* You have 1\+ year of professional software development experience in an object\-oriented or functional programming language, such as Python, Java, Scala, Javascript, etc.
* You are a problem solver and you look for a team of like\-minded people.
* You like to be an owner and strive to do work you're proud of, both technically and in your team interactions.
* You appreciate an efficient developer environment.
* You are passionate about solving hard technical problems.
* You inspire other people to work with you and enjoy mentoring, coaching and learning from other engineers.
* You understand the importance of balancing security, performance and usability.
* You geek out on web architectures, spanning front\-end and back\-end layers.
* You have a deep understanding of algorithms, data structures and software design.
* You are experienced in collaborating with other internal and external engineers to define API contracts.
* Ability to go into our Amsterdam office in a hybrid fashion.


**TOOLS WE'RE USING**


* Build server \- Jenkins
* Virtualization \- Docker
* Provisioning \- Terraform/Terragrunt
* Cloud infrastructure \- GCP/AWS
* Operating system \- Linux, macOS
* Application stack \- Python/Django/Javascript/Vue.js/React.js/Node.js and Java
* Databases \- PostgreSQL


**PERCENTAGE OF TIME SPENT**


* New features \- 50%
* Maintaining existing features \- 30%
* Developer support \- 10%
* Meetings \- 10%


At Box, we believe unique and diverse experiences benefit our culture, our products, our customers, our company, and our world. We aim to recruit a passionate, high\-performing workforce that reflects the world we live in. If you are head\-over\-heels about this role but unsure if you meet all the requirements, we encourage you to apply!



Box lives its values, with community and in\-person collaboration being a core part of our culture. Boxers are expected to work from their assigned office a minimum of 2 days per week, with a focus on Tuesdays and Thursdays. Your Recruiter will share more about how we work and company culture during the hiring process.


**EQUAL OPPORTUNITY**



We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability, and any other protected ground of discrimination under applicable human rights legislation.



 For details on how we protect your information when you apply, please see our Personnel Privacy Notice.
company_description: We started Box in 2005 to make it easy to access information from anywhere and collaborate with anyone.

title: Visual designer TU Delft professional education
description:
**Visual designer TU Delft professional education**
===================================================

***Are you a professional and talented designer? Do you get excited about creating visuals for courses aimed at technical professionals? Then we’d love to hear from you!***

  


#### **Job description**


TU Delft \| Learning for Life is an independent division within TU Delft, focused on developing educational products for Lifelong Learning (LLO). These include online courses, masterclasses, and summer schools designed for professionals. The content of our courses aligns with TU Delft’s core themes, such as Energy Transition, Quantum Technology, and AI, Data \& Digitalization. In close collaboration with the academic staff, we develop high\-quality learning experiences that meet the needs of (technical) professionals around the world.

  


What will you be doing?


We are looking for a creative and visually skilled designer to create visuals for our courses as well as for branding, house style, and other communication materials. You will collaborate with course instructors, marketers, and communication professionals from Learning for Life. As a visual designer, you’ll be part of the Business Team, which focuses on the development and promotion of our course portfolio and the optimization of the customer journey.

  


Your responsibilities:


* Designing visuals for courses, in close collaboration with instructors. You will translate content into strong visuals through an iterative design process. These visuals are used on course websites, in marketing campaigns, and within the courses themselves.
* Creating marketing and communication materials, such as brochures, posters, banners, presentations, and reports.
* Advising on branding and house style, and helping to develop visual guidelines and style assets.
* Translating complex and technical information into clear and engaging visuals, including infographics, research visualizations, and data illustrations.

  


#### **Job requirements**


We’re looking for someone who:


* Has a completed education in graphic design or visual communication.
* Is proficient with tools such as Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop) and ideally Figma or similar platforms.
* Can transform complex content into visual formats that are clear and accessible.
* Can translate technical language into visuals that are easy to understand for a broad audience.
* Has experience with multiple formats: print, digital, presentations, and reports.
* Designs with inclusivity and accessibility in mind, including the use of colorblind\-friendly palettes and legible fonts.
* Is skilled in layout, visual hierarchy, and typography, particularly in academic or research\-focused contexts.
* Has a strong command of the English language, both written and spoken.

  


#### **TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)**


Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world\-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem\-solvers, both in business and in a social context.

  


At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core values and we actively engage to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.

  


Challenge. Change. Impact!

  


#### **University Corporate Office – Extension School**


‘To educate the world and enhance the quality of campus and online education’ is the mission of the TU Delft Extension School for Continuing Education. A mission that has guided all activities of our innovation\-oriented organisation since its foundation in 2014\.


We focus on online continuing education. Together with the TU Delft faculties and external partners, we create and deliver courses and short programs that help learners at various stages of their professional life. We help them stay on top of their game, whether they are looking to change career, broaden their skillset, or acquire further academic qualifications. Think of international graduates who want to develop further through online education, and of people who have been in the labour market for a while and want to brush up on their skills and take the next step. Upon completion, our learners receive an official certificate for the educational module(s) they have taken.


The Extension School is part of the University Corporate Office and reports directly to the Executive Board. Our international team of about forty skilled, passionate colleagues comprises over ten different nationalities \- Our culture is inclusive and very diverse!

#### **Conditions of employment**


* Duration of contract is tot juni 2026\. Temporary.
* A job of 19\-24 hours per week.
* A salary based on Schaal 09 of the CAO for Dutch Universities with a salary between €3537 \- €4860 gross per month based on a fulltime contract (38 hours), plus 8% holiday allowance and an end\-of\-year bonus of 8\.3%.
* An excellent pension scheme via the ABP.
* The possibility to compile an individual employment package every year.
* Discount with health insurers on supplemental packages.
* Flexible working week.
* Every year, 232 leave hours (at 38 hours). You can also sell or buy additional leave hours via the individual choice budget.
* Plenty of opportunities for education, training and courses.
* Partially paid parental leave
* Attention for working healthy and energetically with the vitality program.

  


#### **Additional information**


If you would like more information about this vacancy or the selection procedure, please contact Maaike van Buul, Manager Business Development, via m.a.j.p.m.vanbuul@tudelft.nl.

  

#### **Application procedure**


Are you interested in this vacancy? Please apply no later than **4 May 2025** upload the following documents:


* CV
* Motivational letter


You can address your application to Maaike van Buul, Manager Business Development.  

  

**Please note:**


* You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post.
* A pre\-employment screening can be part of the selection procedure.
* For the final candidates, a knowledge security check will be part of the application procedure. For more information on this check, please consult Chapter 8 of the National Knowledge Security Guidelines. We carry out this check on the basis of legitimate interest.
* Please do not contact us for unsolicited services.

  
Faculty/Department: University Corporate Office – Education \& Student Affairs
Salary range: €3537 \- €4860
Hours per week: 19\-24
FTE: 0,5\-0,6
Submission is possible until: 4 May 2025

title: Corporate Finance Analyst
description:
Within the Investment team based in Amsterdam, we’re currently looking for an **Analyst/Reporting specialist Corporate Finance, capable of combining technical/programming skills with affiliation for investments**.


The main responsibilities of the Analyst Corporate Finance are:

* Prepare the Solvency II files and reconciliations relating to investments using programming languages (RStudio, potentially Python at a later stage),
* Identify opportunities to improve the quality of reports produced as well as to achieve process efficiency, while using Excel and programming capabilities,
* Actively support transition between old and new investment administration systems, including managing data enhancement, reconciliations, and cleaning, ensuring proper data administration in the new environment, co\-designing reports answering the current reporting and information sharing demands regarding investment assets,
* Provide in\-depth analysis of the Atradius investment portfolio,
* Liaise with internal and external parties providing information on investments,
* Liaise with various stakeholders in adapting internal systems and processes to the changes within the investment portfolio, in line with the EIOPA updates and IFRS regulations.

**Knowledge, skills and experience**

* Solid experience in Excel and programming languages like R or Python,
* Excellent quantitative and analytical skills,
* Affinity with financial instruments is an advantage,
* Track record of gathering requirements, defining and executing analysis,
* Experience in designing and developing models (e.g. relating to risk, income projections),
* Proven track record in building tools automating generation of enhanced data results, comparisons, visualization of data,
* Being goal\-minded towards efficiency, quality, and practicality,
* Capable of working independently or with minimal supervision, but also being an effective team player,
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills,
* Languages: English is a must, command of Spanish is an advantage,
* Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in Business Economics, Finance, Computer/Data Science, Mathematical Finance, Econometrics,
* Experience with any modern investment administration tool will be an advantage,
* Eligible to work in the Netherlands (without a requirement for a visa).

**Atradius**


The Atradius Group provides trade credit insurance, surety and collections services worldwide, and has a presence through 160 offices in 52 countries. The products offered by Atradius protect companies around the world against the default risks associated with selling goods and services on credit.


At Atradius, we believe in personal development and the Growth Mindset. Our Culture is based on teamwork, reliable accountability, constantly improving and unrivalled service. Read on more on our Career site: https://careers.atradius.com/en/careers.

 **Department Description**


The investment team, being a part of Corporate Finance, Tax \& ESG department, is the centralised unit responsible for developing and implementing the Atradius Group’s investment strategy, maintaining a state\-of\-the\-art investment process, optimising the Group’s investment result, and delivering of the Solvency II data relating to market risk.

 **What do we offer?**

* A dynamic, international and challenging work environment
* Training and support to reach your full potential including the opportunity for continuous professional development
* Attractive terms and conditions, including competitive salary, pension package and a range of flexible benefits and rewards
* Challenging tasks with individual development and training opportunities

 **Equal opportunities for all**


The success of our organisation stands with the quality of our people and the ideas they have. Insights and innovative solutions for our customers are the result of an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. That is why diversity is extremely important to Atradius. To ensure that all colleagues within Atradius can develop their qualities, we promote an inclusive culture in which everyone feels involved and valued. We encourage and welcome everyone to apply to our positions.

 **I am Atradius! \- Do you want to know who we are?**  

Get to know Atradius colleagues in this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v\=NnsgT04OpTU\&t\=4s  

  

*Atradius is a global provider of credit insurance, bond and surety, collections and information services, with a strategic presence in over 50 countries. The products offered by Atradius protect companies around the world against the default risks associated with selling goods and services on credit. Atradius is a member of Grupo Catalana Occidente (GCO.MC), one of the largest insurers in Spain and one of the largest credit insurers in the world.*

title: Data Scientist II - Smart Benefits Insights
description:
Role Description:
**About Us:** At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you encounter. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the memories you make. Through our products, partners and people, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

 **The team:**


You’ll join “Smart Benefits”, a track of 12 data professionals based in Amsterdam. The track’s mission is to optimize our accommodation discounting product to achieve growth for Booking.com.

  

“Smart Benefits” is part of the Pricing department that has a thriving data community, which is part of the wider Accommodations Business Unit. This is the largest business unit at Booking.com, so your work is going to impact millions of customers!

 **The role:**


We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our ML / Insights team. This role will focus on generating actionable insights and providing tactical guidance to support our product development efforts. The ideal candidate will conduct extensive data exploration, develop and test hypotheses, and suggest product changes based on experimental results. You will collaborate closely with Machine Learning Scientists, Data Scientists and Product teams to enhance our understanding of the product's inner workings, identify key areas of focus on, and improve overall product strategy. This role requires strong statistical inference skills and the ability to translate data insights into practical recommendations as well as solid stakeholder management skills to achieve business impact through the generated recommendations.

 **Key Job Responsibilities and Duties**

* Leading the design and delivery of entire Data Science solutions based on business requirements, bringing them from the initial idea\-generation phase to implementation independently. E.g.


	+ Continuous exploration of product data to deliver actionable insights on how/where to develop the product next (product health throughout the funnel, feature exploration, etc.)
* Working autonomously on consuming data, preparing it for data science use, translating business problems to data stories and solving them effectively by applying suitable statistical data analysis and modeling methods. Leverage input from business partners in all of the above to determine the right technical solutions to deliver customer value. E.g.


	+ Design data collection mechanisms that are needed for product development
* Designing and interpreting quantitative experiments to objectively guide key business decision making.
* Responsible for collaborating with peers in related crafts (i.e. Machine Learning, (Data) Engineering), anticipating data needs to ensure smooth progress of their individual projects.
* Responsible for contributing to the community of their area by supporting community projects aimed at making other data professionals more effective, actively participating in community strengthening activities (i.e. recruitment) and connecting with peers beyond their area.

 **Role qualifications and requirements**

* Experience solving real problems using data mining techniques and with statistical rigor
* Strong skills in translating business problems into data problems
* Strong knowledge of the possibilities and limitations of different types of data analysis and/or data science modelling
* Experience in experimentation, statistical and hypothesis testing
* Strong technical skills regarding data analysis, statistics and programming in python and pyspark
* Working knowledge of data management (engineering, data pipelines, workflows) with pyspark / Snowflake
* Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal; the ability to clearly convey your message to different stakeholders.
* Achieve impact as a team player, and maintain solid relationships with technical and non\-technical stakeholders.

  

The following skills are assets for this role:

* Strong stakeholder management skills
* Experience in new product development
* Solid understanding of how Machine Learning models work
* Strong knowledge of reporting/visualization techniques (e.g. Tableau, Grafana, Power BI, etc.)
* Close collaboration with product teams (not just PMs, but directly with developers/engineers)

 **Benefits \& Perks****: Global Impact, Personal Relevance**

* Annual paid time off and generous paid leave scheme including: parental (22\-weeks paid leave), grandparent, bereavement, and care leave
* Hybrid working including flexible working arrangements, working from home furniture and ergonomic support, and up to 20 days per year working from abroad (home country)
* A beautiful sustainable HQ Campus in Amsterdam, that offers on\-site meals, coffee, and snacks, multi\-faith and breastfeeding rooms at the office
* Commuting allowance and bike reimbursement scheme
* Discounts \& Wallet credits to spend on our products, upgrade to Booking.com Genius Level 3, and friends \& family Booking.com discount vouchers
* Free access to online learning platforms, development and mentorship programs
* Global Employee Assistance Program, free Headspace membership

 **Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at Booking.com:**


Diversity, Equity \& Inclusion have been a core part of our company culture since day one. This ongoing journey starts with our very own employees, who represent over 140 nationalities and a wide range of ethnic and social backgrounds, genders and sexual orientations.

  

Take it from our Chief People Officer, Paulo Pisano: “At Booking.com, the diversity of our people doesn’t just create a unique workplace, it also creates a better and more inclusive travel experience for everyone. Inclusion is at the heart of everything we do. It’s a place where you can make your mark and have a real impact in travel and tech.”

  

We ensure that colleagues with disabilities are provided the adjustments and tools they need to participate in the job application and interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

 **Career Development Opportunities:**

* Bi\-annual performance conversations, company\-wide mentoring program, and internal development opportunities
* Unlimited access to online learning platforms: Udemy, Coursera, LinkedIn learning, O'reilly

 **Application Process:**

* Let’s go places together: How we Hire
* The interview process for this role entails a total of 3 interviews.
* This role does not come with relocation assistance.

  

Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.
company_description: Making it easier for everyone to experience the world.

title: AI Solution Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 Hey there! We’re Lleverage.ai, and we’re making AI automation actually achievable for businesses. We enable teams to capture, automate, and integrate AI\-driven workflows and agents into their business, because AI is only useful when it actually fits into daily operations.
   

  

 We’re a team of entrepreneurs and innovators, who believe the future of work is 80% creativity, strategy, and human interaction, because AI takes care of the rest. If that sounds something you want to help build, we’d love to have you on board!
   

  

**About The Role**
 We're looking for an AI Solution Engineer to bridge the gap between our sales team and our clients' technical needs. You'll be the technical expert who works with potential clients during the sales process, designs custom AI solutions, and ensures successful implementation on our platform. This role is perfect for someone who’s fascinated by the technical possibilities of AI and loves working directly with clients to solve real business problems.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Pre\-Sales Support: Join the sales team in technical scoping calls with potential clients, answering complex questions and demonstrating technical feasibility.
* Solution Design: After successful sales, take ownership of designing tailored AI solutions that meet our customers' specific needs.
* Implementation: Work with project managers to build AI solutions on the Lleverage platform, either independently or collaboratively with customers. You will also take on some project management responsibilities within the project.
* Quality Improvement: Take responsibility for improving quality metrics once solutions are live, ensuring they deliver measurable business value.
* Customer Success: Serve as a technical advisor throughout the customer journey, from initial interest to successful implementation.
* Platform Expertise: Become an expert on the Lleverage platform capabilities and help shape the product roadmap based on customer needs.
* Voice of the Customer: Represent customers’ needs when discussing improvements to the Lleverage platform.


**Job Specific Requirements**
* Technical Background: Deep interest and hands\-on experience with LLMs and prompt engineering. Technical proficiency in API integration, data analysis, troubleshooting, and basic programming.
* Communication Skills: Excellent ability to explain complex technical concepts to non\-technical stakeholders.
* Solution\-Oriented: Proven track record of designing and implementing technical solutions for business problems.
* Customer\-Focused: Experience working directly with clients in a technical advisory role.
* Self\-Starter: Ability to take ownership of projects and drive them to completion with minimal supervision.
* Adaptability: Comfortable in a fast\-paced startup environment where priorities and technology are constantly evolving.
* Entrepreneurial: We are a fast growing startup, so you will be responsible for designing your processes.


**Nice to haves**
* Experience in a pre\-sales or solutions architecture role
* Background in SaaS or enterprise software
* Knowledge of low\-code/no\-code platforms
* Project management experience
* A carry\-on ice cream bar (it's becoming our thing)


**We offer**
 You are ready for the ride of a lifetime with experienced entrepreneurs and innovators who aim for hyper growth on a global scale. We look for an enormous drive and hands\-on mentality. Somebody who can work with us in creating the best AI low code solution out there!
   

  

 We offer a good salary, a highly experienced (and very entertaining...) team and considerable share packages.

title: AI engineer
description:

While we fully embrace remote work, we also value culture and connection \- so our ideal candidate will be excited to come and join us at our studio at least once a week to share the energy and excitement of what we’re building together.***




  
 



**About Us** 




 Huub is a platform that fully automates specific business processes by leveraging AI intelligently. We operate with a lean team of tech professionals and subject matter experts to develop and roll out these functionalities in the market. Are you looking for a place where you can work on

 As an

 and

 to build

title: Specialist – Technology & Development (Machine Learning Engineer Cybercrime)
description:
Europol is looking for
 **Specialist – Technology \& Development (Machine Learning Engineer Cybercrime)** 
 ,
 
 to join
 **Cyber Intelligence Support Team** 
 in the
 **Digital Support Unit (DSU)** 
 ,
 **European Cybercrime Centre (EC3\)** 
 ,
 **Operations Directorate** 
 of
 **Europol** 
 .
 



  





 This role focuses on assisting MS law enforcement by designing, developing, and optimising Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) and data enrichment processes to ensure efficient operational data integration and management across Europol’s systems. The Specialist handles large volumes of structured and unstructured data contributed by MS or collected from open sources, ensuring data quality and maintaining ETL pipelines, enhancing machine learning models and leveraging AI for data enrichment and analysis and reporting needs.
 



  





 The successful candidate will further contribute to operational activities by scanning the environment and identifying emerging technologies, analysing patterns and developing new toolsets and technical solutions for the purpose of supporting investigations.
 



  





 She/he will be entrusted with the following tasks:
 



  




* Extracting, transforming and loading data from multiple sources; cleaning, enriching and standardising data for consistency and usability;
* Loading and storing transformed data into platforms or systems and optimising for performance;
* Developing and implementing machine learning models to extract insights, optimising processes, and enhancing data\-driven decision\-making for operational and investigative purposes;
* Preparing reports, identifying opportunities for Europol and MS to collaborate on specific intelligence and information initiatives, leveraging data science techniques;
* Maintaining close contact with EC3 other staff members across Europol and other relevant partner agencies or organisations;
* Staying up to date with developments and emerging technologies, particularly in the field of AI and machine learning, that may impact the law enforcement environment, ensuring state\-of\-the\-art support and expertise for MS;
* Developing new toolsets and data science solutions particularly leveraging machine learning and AI and supporting the administration, maintenance and technical management of these solutions; documenting processes for repeatability, transparency and future enhancements;
* Enhancing Europol’s ability to exploit criminal intelligence by implementing automated enrichment and analysis of datasets to support MS investigations;
* Participating in meetings, working groups, and conferences and deliver presentations;
* Providing on\-the\-spot operational support if and when needed;
* Performing any other duties within the area of competence as assigned by line management.



  





**Compensation and benefits:** 




 To promote a healthy work\-life balance, Europol provides flexible working hours, a comprehensive yearly leave plan, and parental leave.
 



  





 Employees are protected against illness, accidents, and the risk of occupational disease by the Joint Sickness Insurance Scheme (JSIS), which offers global insurance coverage. Staff pay EU tax at source, but salaries are exempt from national taxes.
 



  





 Europol offers a competitive basic salary and various supplementary allowances (e.g. expatriation allowance, foreign residence allowance, household allowance, dependent child and/or education allowance.) A list of the basic salaries and the type of allowances you may receive is available on our website. However, the salary package and allowances depend on the personal situation of each individual, so a more precise calculation is done when an offer of employment is made.
 



  





 The basic monthly salary is EUR
 **EUR 6,681\.51** 
 (step 1\) or
 **EUR 6,962\.30** 
 (step 2\).
 



  





 The indicative salary for a staff member (single) in receipt of expatriation allowance (16%) is:
 



 a) Staff member (single) in receipt of expatriation allowance (16%):
 
 EUR
 **6,883\.74** 




 b) Staff member with two dependent children in their custody in receipt of expatriation allowance (16%): EUR
 **8,961\.71** 




  





**Please refer to the job posting on our website for additional details regarding the qualifications and duties. The only way to submit an application is via the Europol website.**

title: Shoots Producer (ASAP)
description:
**About Us**
 Gisou is born out of a passion for bees, haircare and natural beauty. Based on a six\-generation beekeeping heritage, each Gisou product is inspired by and made with the finest, sustainably sourced ingredients from our very own Mirsalehi Bee Garden. With this method, our founder Negin and her father continue the family tradition of beekeeping. Our hair care and complexion products harness the transformative benefits of Mirsalehi Honey and rich botanical sources, selected to enhance ones natural beauty.
   

  

 We are committed to a bee\-friendly \& sustainable production method that puts the Mirsalehi Honey Bees first, not only for the sake of the bees, but the greater ecosystem as well. In the upcoming years, we intend to continue to develop high\-quality honey infused beauty products as we develop a globally renowned label and raise awareness about the importance of a healthy bee population.
   

  

 We have been experiencing double digital growth YoY and have established ourselves as a leading hair care line across our global retailers such as Sephora, Selfridges, Mecca, and Harrods. We are currently available in over 40 countries and are on an explosive journey of growth as we launch in new markets, open additional channels and focus on building our team internationally.
   

  

 Our team is the heart of our business, without an incredible team we would not be where we are today and where we dream to go tomorrow. Being a part of Gisou is for those who are passionate, ambitious, hard working, agile and approachable. Join us on this epic journey!
   

  

**About The Role**
 At Gisou, exciting times are ahead. As a fast\-growing company we are ready to take on more projects that we are very enthusiastic about. To make those projects happen, we are looking for an experienced and confident freelance Creative Producers that will take responsibility for the execution of our creative productions from brief\- until delivery of assets, working closely with our Marketing, Digital and Creative decision\-makers. You will:
   

  

* Bridge the gap between our Marketing and Creative department, taking on a wide variety of creative production responsibilities within the wider campaign execution phase of our campaigns.
* Define the creative production plan based on the marketing brief and creative concept in close collaboration with the creative and marketing project\-leads.
* Set up production task\-forces based on the project brief, making sure the appropriate support from in\- and external partners is planned
* Organize pre\- and post\-production meetups, making sure all is approved with relevant stakeholders prior to shooting and final delivery
* Define and manage production timelines and budgets
* Organize, attend, and take ownership of shooting day(s)
* Make sure assets are delivered on time and according to Gisous brand\-standards, consulting the creative project\-lead on a regular basis
* Create and maintain a database of freelancers / production partners


**We Are Looking For**
* 3\+ years of hands\-on experience in creative production/project management (agency experience is a plus)
* Excellent planning and organisation skills
* Advanced knowledge of a creative production eco\-system
* Ability to adapt to a fast\-growing and quickly changing environment; therefore a solution\-minded, innovative, and creative mindset is essential
* Great stakeholder / vendor relationship management skills
* A critical vision; always determined to achieve only our Gisou brand standards
* A personal interest for and knowledge about (social media) trends within the beauty / lifestyle / fashion industry is a plus
* Preferably you bring along a little black book with a network of freelancers / vendors that can contribute to our creative productions


**What We Offer**
 The opportunity to be part of an ambitious, fun and dynamic team, with a pleasant informal and international working atmosphere and regular team activities and drinks. You will be working 4 days a week from our stunning office in the centre of Amsterdam, and have the possibility to work one day from home if you like. Lunch, drinks and snacks in the office are being provided every day.
   

  

 Gisou is a fast growing and disruptive beauty company that offers huge opportunities for personal development and growth.
   

  

**INTERESTED?**
 We can't wait to hear from you.

title: Data Analyst / Analytics Expert
description:
**Company Overview** 




 Join WorldACD, a thriving and dynamic data company with 20\+ employees on the forefront of the air cargo industry. We are expanding and seek highly motivated individuals to be part of our growing team. As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in our data team. Based in the vibrant center of Amsterdam, WorldACD operates in a fascinating international environment, collecting, analyzing, and publishing market data about air cargo worldwide. As the world's largest air cargo market database manager, we are ambitious to further grow our benchmark information services and product portfolio, serving customers on all continents and engaging with diverse cultures. 
 



  
 



**Position Overview** 




 We are looking for a skilled Data Scientist / Analyst who is passionate about delivering the best possible market data on worldwide air cargo in all its colours and flavours. You will need to be eager to explore large datasets and find meaningful patterns. You will need to keep an overview, but also enjoy taking a deep dive without getting lost in the details. Even when the topic is complicated, you should be able to convey your insights in a clear story for colleagues and/or customers, making use of analytics \& visualizations as necessary. 
 



  
 



**Responsibilities** 



* Production of market data: analyse trends, monitor data quality, investigate \& solve data issues.
* Participate in product development by exploring data, creating proof\-of\-concepts.
* Support colleagues and customers in making optimal use of the data; Support new customers in delivering the best possible inputs according to our definitions.



  





**Qualifications** 
  
 


* Master’s degree in Econometrics, Business Analytics, Mathematics, Industrial Engineering or a related field. A high score in the quantitative subjects is very helpful.
* Passion for analytics and business intelligence.
* Structured, analytical approach to problem\-solving and a high attention to detail.
* Experience with SQL and one or more Business Intelligence tools, but also a Microsoft Excel expert.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.



  
 



**Benefits** 
  
 


* Active in a fascinating \& dynamic international environment.
* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Serving customers on all continents, dealing with a wide variety of cultures.
* Working for a growing company, ambitious to further grow its benchmark information services and products. portfolio.
* Office in the city center of Amsterdam.



  
 



**How to Apply** 




 If you are passionate about data and thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment, we encourage you to apply for this position at WorldACD. Please submit your resume and a (short) cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are a good fit for the role before
 **Tuesday April 22nd** 
 . Speaking Dutch is not required, but it is required to live in the Netherlands within 1 hour traveling time to Amsterdam Central Station when you apply for this role. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Business Intelligence Specialist
description:
**Data warehousing/ dimensional modelling/ OLAP functionality/ reporting tools/ PowerPivot, PowerBI, SSRS, PerformancePoint, SSIS, \& SSAS/BISM/ data management tools/ T\-SQL/ BI Portal/ maintain BI solutions/ internal testing/ user acceptance testing/ SSRS/ SSIS/SSAS** 




  





 This company is organized into three distinct businesses. These include World Financial Group (including World Financial Advisors), Protection Solutions and Savings \& Investments (comprised of life insurance, annuities, employee benefits, and Investment Solutions) and Financial Assets, which includes legacy blocks of long term care, universal life, and variable and fixed annuities. These are supported by Corporate, which includes Finance, People and Places, General Counsel, Risk, Internal Audit, Strategy and Development, and Corporate Affairs, which covers Communications, Brand, and Government and Policy Affairs. This MNE employs nearly 4,000 people worldwide. It’s part of a Dutch financial brand, an integrated, diversified, international financial services group serving approximately 20 million customers worldwide.
 



  





 More than a century ago, this company were among the first financial services companies in America to serve everyday people from all walks of life. Today, they’re part of an international holding company, with millions of customers and thousands of employees worldwide. Their insurance and investment solutions help people make the most of what’s important to them. They’re empowered by a vast agent network covering Europe and America’s, with diversity to match. Together with their non\-profit research institute and foundation, they tune in, step up, and are a force for good — for customers and the communities where they live, work, and play. United in purpose, they help people create the financial freedom to live life on their terms.
 



  





 At this impressive international company, hard work, innovative thinking, and personal accountability are qualities they honour and reward. They understand the potential of leveraging the talents of a diverse workforce and embrace an environment where employees enjoy a balance between their careers, families, communities, and personal interests. Ultimately, they appreciate the uniqueness of a company where talented professionals work collaboratively in a positive environment; one focused on helping people look forward and plan for the best life possible while providing tools and solutions that make it easier to get there.
 



  





**Job Description Summary Business Intelligence Developer:** 




 As part of the Strategic Insights team, you will manage and build third party data extracts, and work with internal stakeholders (e.g., Product, Distribution, Finance teams) to develop industry\-leading Business Intelligence tools to expand commercial success. Responsibilities include the development and support of the Business Intelligence Analytics products and platforms (e.g., data warehouse, data visualizations and interactive reports).
 



  





**Responsibilities BI Developer:** 




 \-Continuously develops and maintains an understanding of Business Intelligence technology including data warehousing, dimensional modeling, OLAP functionality, reporting tools, and other methods of information delivery.
 



 \-Develop \& maintains expertise with MSBI tools including: Excel/PowerPivot, PowerBI, SSRS, PerformancePoint, SSIS, \& SSAS/BISM.
 



 \-Develop database and/or data presentation solutions to deliver information to end\-users accurately and efficiently.
 



 \-Extracts, transforms, \& loads data using data management tools and T\-SQL.
 



 \-Analyse, understand, and document user needs to ensure accurate fulfilment of user story requests from internal business customers.
 



 \-Generate, analyse and interpret data extracts.
 



 \-Contribute to, and possibly lead, project teams that are developing or modifying highly complex information solutions.
 



 \-Administers \& maintains the BI Portal, data warehouse, and existing BI solutions.
 



 \-Continuously develops expertise in the data and data models within the data warehouse, as well as an understanding of supported business domains.
 



 \-May construct data models, data dictionaries, and report glossaries.
 



 \-May conduct user interviews and training sessions
 



 \-May mentor teammates on BI tools and methods.
 



 \-Conducts and may facilitate internal testing and user acceptance testing.
 



  





**Qualifications BI Developer:** 




 \-Bachelor’s degree or equivalent education/experience.
 



 \-Minimum of 1\-2 years (depending on the level) work experience.
 



 \-Conversational understanding of BI concepts \& tools.
 



 \-Demonstrated ability to write SQL/TSQL queries to retrieve/modify data.
 



 \-Experience with PowerBI or other visualization tools.
 



 \-Ability to abstract a concept into a series of lifecycle components and events.
 



 \-Experience/education developing physical dimensional models, OLAP processes or data visualizations OR
 



 \-Experience/education in data modeling, data discovery and the application of data to solve business problems.
 



 \-Proven problem solving ability and a willingness to think “outside\-the\-box”.
 



 \-Preferably experience with MSBI tools, including SSRS, SSIS, and/or SSAS.
 



 \-Preferably moderate to advanced skills with MS Excel, including Office data connections and pivot tables.
 



  





**The BI Developer offered:** 




 \-Competitive Pay
 



 \-Bonus for Eligible Employees
 



 \-Benefits Package
 



 \-Pension Plan
 



 \-Employee Stock Purchase Plan
 



 \-Tuition Reimbursement
 



 \-Medical Insurance
 



 \-Career Training \& Development Opportunities
 



 \-Health and Work/Life Balance Benefits
 



  





 This MNE has grown into an international company serving more than 20 million people across the globe. It offers investment, protection, and retirement solutions, always with a clear purpose: Helping people live their best lives. As a leading global investor and employer, the company seeks to have a positive impact by addressing critical environmental and societal issues, with a focus on climate change and inclusion and diversity.
 



  





**Are you interested in this permanent vacancy? Please forward your CV directly by LinkedIn or by john@servicedrivenprofessionals.nl or call \+31 (0\)6 10 29 91 58\. Also, for additional questions you are welcome to get in contact.** 




  





 Met vriendelijke groet/ Kind regards,
 



  





  





 M. John Lemmers BSc.
 



 Service Driven Professionals \| Senior IT Staffing Consultant
 



 \-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-
 



 e\-mail: john@servicedrivenprofessionals.nl
 



 mob: \+31 (0\)6 10 29 91 58
 



 tel: \+31 (0\)20 895 09 52
 



  





 website: www.servicedrivenprofessionals.nl
 



  





 Connect me on Linkedin:
 



 www.linkedin.com/in/mariojohnlemmers01

 Office hours: Monday to Saturday from 09\.00 till 20\.00 hours
