title: Business Analyst Client Reporting
description:
Business Analyst
 
 Utrecht, Utrecht
 



  





 We are a specialist in temporary assignments. Our clients are wellknown banks, government, energy, construction and other companies
 







 For our an international bank in Utrecht we are looking for a
 **Business Analyst Clients Reporting** 












**Assignment:**
 Business Analyst
 



**Location:** 
 Utrecht
 



**Startdate 22\-04\-2025** 




**Enddate:** 
 31\-12\-2025 with possible extension
 



**Working hours a week :** 
 36 hours
 







 Deadline to apply : 15\-04\-2025 at 13\.00 PM
 







**ONLY APPLY IF YOU ARE LIVING IN THE NETHERLANDS (ONSITE), HAVE A VALID WORKING PERMIT FOR EU AND DO NOT NEED A SPONSORSHIP** 
 .
 







**\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_** 












**Job description** 








**English mandatory** 




**ZZP Allowed: No** 




**Resident NL** 




  





**Business analyst Client Reporting** 




**Imagine…** 




**that you work in the dynamic and complex world of client reporting, an international environment which is continuously evolving, where you can clearly contribute to Rabobank’s mission to be a customer\-focused and rock\-solid bank with strong online services, and where you can develop yourself professionally and as a person.** 




**Client Reporting is a customer facing application and available for clients via the Rabobank Business Banking portal. The application provides customers insight to their Treasury portfolio and ensures regulatory compliance. As a business analyst you play a central role in the development and support of Client Reporting. Together with your colleagues in a squad, which consists of IT and business expertise, you ensure continuity and continuous improvement of the Client Reporting service in an agile way of working.** 




  





**Making a difference** 




**Client Reporting is a global product application and enables clients and Sales worldwide to do business in an easy, efficient and user\-friendly way. Enabling them to manage the lifecycle of the executed transactions whilst providing them insight to trade details and valuation information. The services includes processes to ensure regulatory compliance of Rabobank and our clients via a user friendly, visually appealing and stable end\-user application (correct data and 24/7 availability).** 




  





**As a business analyst you help define the product and boost innovation and improvement of the product. This leads to a product that provides in a well\-founded need of the customers in which the products are always functionally transparent, meaning that the consequences of the products are acceptable and explainable in all scenarios. You will also be involved in monitoring, solving problems and dealing with business and customer requests. In short: customer interests, being in control and quality are at the core of the activities.** 




**Main challenges in the role are to satisfy all customer needs whilst not over complicating the application and the ever\-changing regulatory environment, posing new standard and requirements.** 




  





**With each other** 




**Collaboration is at the heart of what we do. The Client Reporting squad is part of the Tribe Markets \& Treasury and Area Reporting \& Value Chain Services within the new CPO domain. Purpose of this area is to provide best in class and efficient technology to underpin all product agnostic operational controls and reporting services, driving global standardisation.** 




**The squad Client Reporting acts in close collaboration with other squads within the Tribes Markets \& Treasury and the Digital Platform. You also align with business, architecture and IT stakeholders in your daily work.** 




  





**With your talent** 




**The ideal candidate possess strong analytical skills, has experience in electronic distribution of products, has knowledge of the products traded by Markets \& Treasury and is an excellent coordinator and communicator in a complex international environment.** 




  





**In addition, it's important that you recognise the things in the checklist below:** 




**‒ Experience with Scrum/Agile way of working** 




**‒ Flexible, hands\-on and pro\-active** 




**‒ Being able to switch between all stakeholders and facets, from customer, management, IT and team to product, market, organization and own vision** 




**‒ Always looking for the highest possible value for the customer. Make decisions again and again about the highest priority of that moment** 




**‒ Able to manage different interests and getting people involved** 




**‒ Helicopter view and able to keep oversight, but also able to dive into details if needed** 




**‒ KPI driven and result\-oriented, you have an intrinsic motivation to improve and realise results, and you know how to make progress transparent** 




**‒ Senior** 




**‒ Basic knowledge of financial products like FX, Interest Rate Derivatives, Money Markets, Commodities, etc** 




**‒ Able to discuss and challenge requirements with business** 




**‒ Can communicate well in English, Dutch is preferable but not required** 




**‒ Collaborate closely with the product owner and team to translate requirement** 




**‒ Identify gaps and translate requirements** 




**‒ Define requirements for Client Reporting developers** 



* **‒ Basic knowledge of SQL and Cloud (Azure)**

title: Head Of Marketing
description:
**About Us:** 
 Scaler helps pave the way for a net\-zero carbon future in the real estate market. Our innovative ESG software tools empower investors and fund managers with the insights needed to enhance asset performance and reduce environmental impact.
   

  

**Role Overview:** 
 We are looking for a
 **Head of Marketing** 
 to launch and lead our marketing department. This role is ideal for someone with experience in B2B SaaS marketing who can create and execute a strategy to grow our brand, attract leads, and enhance our online presence. You will play a key role in increasing website traffic, generating high\-quality leads, and establishing our company as a recognized name in the market.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Develop strategies to increase website and LinkedIn traffic.
* Improve search engine visibility (SEO) and online engagement.
* Execute marketing campaigns to attract and convert high\-quality leads.
* Optimize marketing funnels for customer acquisition.
* Strengthen brand positioning through creative storytelling and targeted initiatives.
* Expand brand reach through partnerships and industry collaborations.
* Use data insights to refine marketing strategies and improve performance.
* Align marketing efforts with sales, product, and engineering teams.
* Create compelling marketing materials, case studies, and promotional content.
* Stay updated on market trends to ensure competitive positioning.


**Requirements**
* Minimum 8 years of total marketing experience, preferably for a B2B Saas business with a product\-led strategy
* Proven experience in launching and scaling a marketing function.
* Expertise in modern B2B marketing strategies, including SEO, content marketing, and demand generation.
* Ability to analyze data and make informed marketing decisions (SQL knowledge is a plus).
* Experience using CRM tools such as Salesforce, HubSpot, or Pipedrive.
* Strong problem\-solving, analytical, and organizational skills.
* Excellent verbal and written communication abilities.
* Ability to manage multiple projects while maintaining attention to detail.
* Self\-motivated, results\-driven, and able to work in a fast\-paced environment.


**Benefits**
* Top\-of\-market salary and a generous equity stake in the company
* Variable compensation plan to reward high sales achievement
* 25 paid vacation days per year, but the opportunity for more if needed
* We offer a hybrid work policy: 2 days working from home and 3 days in\-office each week
* Four months of parental leave
* Annual personal development budget
* We are a global company that meets in person at least once a year


**Why Scaler?**
 When you join Scaler, you will collaborate with a team of curious, sharp, supportive, and genuinely enthusiastic individuals about Scaler's product and unique value. Our people are committed to making a positive impact on our customers' journey to achieving absolute zero carbon.
   

  

 Compensation Range: €75K \- €125K

title: Associate Scientist
description:
**Job Overview** 




  





 Following on from the recent successful hire of the recent Scientist position, my client is now looking for a curious and ambitions Associate Scientist (Technician equivalent) to join their expanding team. This is a brand new position, not a backfill or promotion rehire, so a great opportunity for the right candidate to join the business on their own merits and be part of a new and dynamically expanding team!
 



  





 What is most unique about this role, is that whilst it is an entry level lab position, the development opportunity in being team member number 3, is far greater than the equivalent lab based position at a CRO with a truly exciting developing pipeline, team expansion and potential for career development and growth where you can be part of exciting science focused in Gamma Delta (γδ) therapeutics with an opportunity for immediate start for the right candidate.
 



  





 My client is currently in stealth mode so you will not find information about the company or wider team online and we are working exclusively with them on this role. You will have to sign a CDA in order to interview for this role, in order to fully understand the IP and how you can add value to the team so please only apply if you are willing to be part of a very dynamic business looking for the best to work on some truly innovative and exciting Gamma Delta pipeline!
 



  





 The purpose of this role is to form the foundation of a team responsible for the generation of data that advances the biologic properties and functional activity of my clients innate immune cell engaging multiprotein complexes.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Experimental planning, collaborating with scientists, executing and aiding in the analyse of experiments.
* Evaluate product candidates through cell\-based and immunological assays.
* Contribute to lab organisation, protocol development, and workplace maintenance.
* Analyse data and create precise documentation (ELNs, reports) with effective visual and oral presentations for research meetings.
* Maintain clear communication with supervisors and project leads.



  





**Education/Experience** 



* BSc or higher in relevant scientific field with minimum 1 year lab experience, industry experience preferred.
* Demonstrated expertise in laboratory techniques, cell culture, and cell\-based functional assays.
* Background or experience in immunology, NK, T\-Cell or Gamma Delta (γδ) (or similar) is advantageous.
* Experience with primary human cell culture is a bonus.



  





**Requirements** 



* Adaptable and solutions\-oriented professional who can meet tight deadlines.
* Self\-motivated with ability to work both independently and under supervision (especially as this is a new team, for reference there are 10 others working in the lab on other projects).
* Strong commitment to research quality, detailed record\-keeping, and data integrity.
* Collaborative team player who communicates effectively with colleagues at all levels.
* Thrives in structured environments and adheres to company procedures.
* Proficient with scientific software and IT systems.
* Willing to work flexible hours when needed for tissue/cell availability or team requirements.



  





*Whilst a lot of these requirements might sound generic or non\-specific, my client is looking for a great cultural fit for their team, this means someone who is excited to do the work, curious scientifically and teachable. Even at the junior level this means finding someone who can be trusted to do the work, take on advise and has a good understanding of their own capabilities so that they can contribute to life changing science from day one!* 




  





**Other:** 



* This is a lab based role.
* There are multiple career growth and expansion opportunities based on successful completion of work and personal contribution.
* This is a fulltime, cull contract 40 hour a week position from day one.
* Salary, bonus, stocks and other benefits will be applicable for this role from day one.
* This role will report to: Senior Scientist/Director Department: Research.



  





***If you do not meet all of the above skills, or even if you a PhD level, but willing to work fulltime onsite in the lab at entry level, please reach out to me! My client is looking for the best, for Rockstars, that may be unconventional and they are open to those who believe they can demonstrate the work and commitment required to deliver world changing therapeutics at the bleeding edge of science!***

title: Investment Management Traineeship(EN)
description:
Create your own future
   

  

 The Van Lanschot Kempen Investment Management traineeship offers two young professional the opportunity to explore every aspect of Investment Management, starting September 2025 for a period of 16 months.
   

  

 Within this traineeship, you will rotate between departments on a four\-month basis. The departments which are part of this traineeship are:
   

  

**Wholesale \& Investment Strategies:** 
 consists of the wholesale sales team, the investment teams (Credits, Dividend, Small Caps, Real Assets, Listed Infrastructure \& Private Markets) and the trading desk;
   

  

**Institutional Advisory \& Specialists:** 
 responsible for fiduciary management and investment solutions for pension funds and insurance companies, including liquid and illiquid manager research \& monitoring;
   

  

**Private Clients Solutions \& Specialists:** 
 responsible for the VLK default propositions and tailored portfolio solutions for private clients and semi\-institutional clients. Also the Investment Strategy Research \& Tactical Asset Allocation team are part of this department;
   

  

**Project Management Office:** 
 responsible for the coordination of a broad range of projects related to the development of solutions and products
   

  

 During the traineeship, you will be supported by a mentor and a buddy and follow a training program for both personal and professional development. The traineeship is a bespoke process allowing each step to be planned in close consultation with you, whereby your personal and professional growth is key.
   

  

 After the 16 months, you will have a good impression of the opportunities and possibilities within the investment management, leading to a discussion on which career path is the best match with you here at Van Lanschot Kempen.
   

  

 Your talents
   

  

 Affinity with finance and investing, curious, ambitious, and ready for a challenge. This is how we can best describe you as an Investment Management trainee. Talents that you use to guide our customers in a constantly changing world every day. By thinking out of the box and asking questions. Our ideal candidate is someone who wants to start their career in investment management and open to various areas of investment management, not set on a specific team. You also have:
   

  

* Completed a Master’s degree in the field of Finance, Business Administration, Econometrics, Economics, or other relevant field. Even if you have a Master’s in a field not mentioned, the key is your affinity with finance
* Max. 2 years of work experience after your studies
* Relevant extracurricular activities or past work experience
* Good mastery of English, both oral and written.


 Move ahead at Van Lanschot Kempen
   

  

 Investing in a more future\-oriented, sustainable, and data\-driven way with various clients. Both nationally and internationally. With over 300 years of experience, we make this ambition a reality at Van Lanschot Kempen. We do this with some 1,700 colleagues in various fields of expertise.
   

  

 Van Lanschot Kempen Investment Management is a European leader in investment management and advisory services for institutional, family offices and wholesale clients. Sustainability is fully integrated within each and all our investment processes. We help investors meeting their goals and overcome challenges with a range of products across equity, fixed\-income and alternative asset classes. We also offer fiduciary advisory / solution services to a broad base of institutional investors, predominantly in the Netherlands and the UK.
   

  

 An organisation's degree of innovation and agility also depends on the diversity of its workforce. Our differences make us stronger together. We promote an inclusive work environment where all colleagues feel at home. With us, you can be yourself. And we are proud of that.
   

  

***Curious about the stories of colleagues and how they experience working at Van Lanschot Kempen? Go to People \& Projects and find out more!***
 Turning talent into value!
   

  

 That's what we do! The fact is, if you add value, you can expect the same from us in return. A good work\-life balance with our 'hybrid way of working' is a good example of this. As a trainee, you will also be given:
   

  

* an all\-in salary of € 56k gross
* a complete training programme for personal and professional development, and a mentor and buddy who guide you through the entire traineeship;
* a pension scheme;
* flexible working hours: you come to the office for team meetings or brainstorming sessions and work from home by mutual agreement; and
* a flex budget to partly determine your own extra benefits. Choose what you spend this budget on, from vacation allowance to a thirteenth month, extra leave days and much more.


***And we have many other employment benefits ready for you. Discover all the benefits of working at Van Lanschot Kempen.***
 Working on tomorrow's capital
   

  

 Just the vacancy you were looking for?
 **Please apply as soon as possible. We will be closing this vacancy once we receive sufficient applications.**
 Please note that once you pass the CV screening, you will be asked to do an assessment in which you are invited to elaborate on your motivation in English.
   

  

 Do you have any questions? Please get in touch with Rea Desai, Campus Recruiter, at r.desai @vanlanschotkempen.com

title: Financial Controller
description:
**Financial Controller** 




  





**The Company:** 




 Join a rapidly growing billion\-pound international technical construction contractor with operations across EMEA, USA and APAC. They are looking to expand their finance team in the Netherlands with an experienced Financial Controller.
 



  





**Role \& Responsibilities:** 



* Oversee all financial operations for their projects within Netherlands and Belgium
* Prepare and submit monthly financial data to Group in line with deadlines
* Manage cash flow including weekly 6\-week forecasts and payment authorisations
* Lead annual budgeting process and monthly budget reviews
* Reconcile all General Ledger accounts and daily bank reconciliations
* Ensure compliance with local Dutch GAAP, IFRS and regulatory requirements
* Work with external advisers on statutory reporting and tax filings
* Support the Group CFO and Finance Director on strategic projects
* Drive process improvements and optimise project costs



  





**Essential Experience:** 




 Proven Financial Controller with extensive multi\-million\-pound project accounting experience. Strong communicator capable of translating complex financial information for both technical and non\-technical stakeholders across multiple departments.
 



  





**Package:** 



* Competitive salary (DOE) with comprehensive benefits
* Car allowance
* Easily accessible office from Amsterdam
* Pension Contribution



  





 This is an exceptional opportunity to join a high\-growth international contractor offering substantial personal development and career progression. If this is well suited to your financial background, please register your interest!

title: Digital Workplace Transformation Leader
description:
**Role** 
 – Industry Principal /Digital Workplace Transformation Leader
 



**Skill** 
 \- Digital Workplace Transformation
 



**Location** 
 – Netherlands, Sweden
 



**Compensation** 
 – Competitive (including bonus)
 



  





**Job Description:** 




 The Digital Workplace Advisory Group is a strategic practice unit established to help orchestrate the breadth of Infosys digital workplace service offerings across the technology service\-lines, complemented with experience design, digital adoption \& learning services to deliver an integrated and human\-centric experience to our enterprise clients in their journey to the future of work. This team is responsible for driving integrated Go To Market incubating industry solutions, Managing Analyst Briefings \& provide technology advisory services to Client execs in their digital transformation of workplace.
 



  





**Your role** 




 In the role of Industry Principal, you would be part of team of digital workplace transformation leaders and evangelists on future of work who specialize in leading organizations through digital workplace transformation by leveraging emerging workplace technologies. You will work on customer engagements to define, sell and guide customers on initiatives in the areas of digital workplace strategy, employee experience transformation, workplace modernization, organizational change and smart workspace design.
 



  





**Role and Responsibilities:** 



* Provide technology advisory services to Client Executives on their digital workplace strategy \& roadmap.
* Lead large digital workplace transformation programs as a trusted Technology advisor to clients working with multiple client stakeholders, business groups and service providers.
* Provide best\-fit architectural solutions, technology consultation, assist in defining scope and sizing of work, create technology differentiation to ensure high quality technical solutions and thought leadership for digital workplace.
* Manage a range of stakeholders and subject matter experts to ensure alignment to business needs.
* Liase with various integration forums and internal governance committees
* Strategic and Large deal advisory – Lead integrated solutions for large proposals or client programs (digital workplace).
* Program manage large consulting/advisory engagements for digital workplace.



  





**Required \- Mandatory:** 



* Experience in IT .
* A Digital Workplace Technology strategist and evangelist who specializes in leading organizations through digital transformation by leveraging emerging technology and articulating the strategy to deliver new products, business paradigms and ecosystem partnerships that enable growth and increase operational efficiency.
* Well versed with Industry Standards, OEM Standards, and Service Offerings in the “Digital Workplace” domain to be able to provide solution advisory and transformation strategy.
* Experience across the breadth of Digital Workplace Technology domains in Three or more of the below service offering domains – Employee Experience, Modern Workplace and Endpoint Management, Digital Collaboration (Team Collaboration , Cloud Voice \& Meeting \& Collaborative Apps ), DaaS \& Device lifecycle Management (Modern device and endpoint management, Cloud Virtual Desktops, Device Analytics \& experience management ), Connected Workspaces ( IoT, AR/VR ), Workplace Security), Digital Adoption \& Change Management ( incl. Workplace Analytics), Service desk \& experience, ( incl. Conversational AI \& Automation).



  





**Personal:** 




 Besides the professional qualifications of the candidates, we place great importance in addition to various forms personality profile. These include:
 


* Excellent in Verbal, written communication.
* Strong stakeholder management and negotiation skills to be able to influence or manage difficult stakeholders both internal and external – partners, service providers and customers.
* Willingness and flexibility to learn new technologies (learnability, having a pulse on industry trends), scale up quickly and adapt to different roles as the situation demands.



  





**Why Infosys** 




 Infosys is a global leader in next\-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 56 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI\-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always\-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.
 



  





 Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys (NYSE: INFY) can help your enterprise navigate your next.
 



  





*“By applying via Easy Apply option you confirm you have read, and you accept Infosys Data Privacy notice for the country of the job posting. Please see the relevant Data Privacy Notice under the link: https://digitalcareers.infosys.com/infosys/privacy\-notice\-emea.”*

title: Business Development Representative
description:
Join our dynamic and growing EMEA team.
 









 As Business Development Representative, you will play an important role within the sales and marketing organization, qualifying and generating leads, prospecting for new clients and developing and executing sales campaigns at named accounts in Europe, primarily in the Nordics as well as the Benelux region.
 





  




**What You’ll Do (aka Responsibilities)** 
* These may include but are not limited to:
* Generate new discovery calls and qualified pipeline for the sales team through outbound prospecting efforts: account planning and research, messaging, list building, and cadence execution (e\-mail, phone calls, social selling.)
* Leveraging tools such as LinkedIn to network with prospects and educating our market on Azul.
* Achieving and exceeding weekly/monthly metrics (Opportunity creation and progression.)
* Gain/Deepen business knowledge through researching how different businesses operate, leadership structures, what their pain points are and challenges they face every day.
* Understand prospect pain points, gather technical requirements and correlate business value to customer needs
* Pipeline organization and collaboration with Account Executives and Sales Directors for qualified meetings.
* This is an individual contributor role that reports to BDR Director who values in\-the\-moment coaching, weekly one\-on\-ones as well as autonomy to allow you to own your success.
* Occasional travel within the region.



  




**What You’ll Bring (aka Experience, Skills Education)** 
* B2B telephone lead generation (minimally 1 year)
* IT or Software Solutions sales, highly desired
* Proficient in MS Office, Salesforce.com, SalesLoft, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, 6Sense and Drift (preferred).
* Passion for outbound sales, cold calling and prospecting.
* Ability to have discussions at all levels within all businesses from Enterprise to mid\-market across all sectors.
* High energy, results oriented, self\-motivated/self\-reliant, team player that can think ‘out of the box’.
* Excellent communication, listening, presentation, and writing skills.
* Exceptional organization and multi\-tasking skills, able to adapt to changing priorities and the ability to maintain excellent call records.
* Demonstrated ability to work autonomously and have a very stable work history.
* You can think on your feet in a conversation and answer unexpected questions with ease.
* You are resilient in the face of objections and rejection.
* Willingness and desire to work in a fast\-paced and high growth environment.
* You are good at finding ways to motivate yourself and your teammates.
* Language: Business English and Danish, Swedish, Norwegian, or Finnish


**Location** 
* Remote Nordics





- 


  




  


**What we Offer** 




 ·
 
         
 
 Comprehensive compensation and healthcare packages
 



 ·
 
         
 
 Equity Program – be part of our success
 



 ·
 
         
 
 Referral Program
 



 ·
 
         
 
 Work\-life balance, remote\-first, paid time off, company shutdown, holidays
 



 ·
 
         
 
 Work with top experts worldwide whom contribute to the Java ecosystem
 



  
 



**Our Culture \& Values** 




  
 



 ·
 
         
 
 Maniacal Customer Focus
 



 ·
 
         
 
 Innovation \& Excellence
 



 ·
 
         
 
 Initiative \& Courage
 



 ·
 
         
 
 Impact \& Influence
 



 ·
 
         
 
 Integrity \& Transparency
 



 ·
 
         
 

 Diversity, Inclusion \& Teamwork
company_industry: Software Development, Technology, Information and Media, and IT Services and IT Consulting

title: Senior Software Engineer (C++, Utrecht/ Noord-Brabant)
description:
**At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life\-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R\&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.**

**Your Role**
-------------

**As a Software Engineer at Capgemini Engineering, you’ll be at the forefront of designing, developing, and deploying cutting\-edge technical applications. Based in Eindhoven, Utrecht or Hengelo you’ll work on high\-tech and defense projects, collaborating with skilled engineers to create innovative, high\-performance software solutions.**

**In this role, you will play a key role in:**

* **Designing and developing advanced C\+\+ applications that meet the highest industry standards.**
* **Writing clean, high\-quality code with a strong focus on efficiency and continuous improvement.**
* **Working closely with cross\-functional teams to define, shape, and implement new features.**
* **Contributing to mission\-critical projects in high\-tech and defense, making a real\-world impact.**
**Your Profile**
----------------

* **Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.**
* **At least 3 years of experience in C\+\+ (14 or higher), preferably in high\-tech, defense, or related industries. Experience with Python is a plus.**
* **Strong understanding of object\-oriented programming and design patterns.**
* **Excellent command of Dutch and English.**
* **You enjoy working in multiple industries, have strong communication skills, and thrive in an international, inclusive environment with a focus on professional growth.**
**Note**
--------

**You will be required to pass SC Security Clearance if you are successful in this recruitment process, which is a condition of undertaking the role. Please ensure you are aware of the requirements before submitting your application.**

**Disclaimer**
--------------

**Capgemini is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to diversity and inclusion. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment, regardless of background. Reasonable accommodations will be provided to individuals with disabilities as needed.**

**For more information on your rights as an applicant, visit www.capgemini.com/resources/equal\-employment\-opportunity.**

**What you'll love about working here**
---------------------------------------

* **Challenging projects in innovative, high\-tech industries with a global impact.**
* **A strong technical community, where you can collaborate with top engineers and expand your expertise.**
* **At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs, digital learning platforms and ongoing performance management are crafted in a way to support you in shaping your path.**
**Need to know**
----------------

* **A permanent contract and a salary aligned with your experience level.**
* **26 vacation days, with the option to buy additional leave.**
* **Capgemini contributes to your pension. Additionally, you also have the flexibility to make additional contributions yourself.**
* **Work wherever you want on a device of your choice with our connectivity allowance. A fast laptop and a SIM card that you can also use private.**
**Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55\-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end\-to\-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22\.5 billion.**

title: (Senior) Specialist - Sustainability / ESG
description:
**Step into a career with ASM, where cutting edge technology meets collaborative culture.**


For over 55 years ASM has been ahead of what's next, at the forefront of innovation and what's technologically possible. With more than 4,500 ASMers representing 70 nationalities, our people and our advanced semiconductor devices are playing a crucial role in trends such as 5G, cloud computing, AI, and autonomous driving. But we're more than just a tech company. We value diversity, inclusion and sustainability as we strive to make a positive impact on the world. Our development programs help support your growth, shaping your future and pushing the boundaries of innovation to unleash potential.


### **What you will be working on**


* Support ESG reporting activities by validating KPI data, documenting control activities, and monitoring process performance across business functions.
* Identify gaps in ESG data management and control processes, and propose improvements to enhance accuracy, transparency, and audit\-readiness.
* Manage customer sustainability queries by triaging requests, coordinating responses with subject matter experts, and ensuring timely, high\-quality communication.
* Coordinate and manage submissions to ESG rating agencies (e.g., MSCI, Sustainalytics, ISS ESG), including data collection, documentation, and analysis.
* Conduct ESG risk assessments for ASM sites, identifying key risks, control deficiencies, and opportunities for operational improvement.
* Perform sustainability benchmarking exercises to evaluate ASM's position against industry peers and identify emerging best practices.
* Monitor global ESG regulations (e.g., CSRD, EU Taxonomy), interpret their impact on ASM's operations, and support internal teams in aligning with new requirements.
* Proactively identify and drive opportunities to improve ESG reporting workflows, enhance control mechanisms, and support long\-term sustainability targets.

### **What we are looking for**


* 3\+ years of experience in sustainability reporting, data analytics, controls management, or corporate sustainability programs.
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Industrial Engineering, Business Administration, Finance, Data Analytics, Sustainability, or a related field.
* Working knowledge of ESG regulations, standards, and benchmarks, including CSRD and related frameworks.
* Excellent analytical and problem\-solving skills; familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI is a plus.
* Strong communication and project management skills, with the ability to translate complex sustainability data into actionable insights.
* Experience with third\-party verification processes and ESG audit practices.
* A proactive mindset with strong critical thinking skills and a genuine passion for sustainability.

### **What sets you apart**


* Experience using Power BI to develop ESG dashboards or sustainability reports.
* Deep understanding of ESG rating methodologies and investor disclosure requirements.
* Ability to think critically and take initiative in solving complex sustainability challenges.

**Apply today to be part of what's next.**



We make the tech that enables the chips in devices which improve lives around the world. We do this with an eye to the future, pushing the boundaries of what's possible through cutting\-edge innovation, and driving the next wave of technological breakthroughs that shape how we live, work, and connect.



To learn more about ASM, find us at asm.com and on LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, X and YouTube.



*ASM is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, nationality, social or ethnic origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identify or expression, marital status, pregnancy, political affiliation, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

title: Corporate Finance Analyst
description:
Within the Investment team based in Amsterdam, we’re currently looking for an **Analyst/Reporting specialist Corporate Finance, capable of combining technical/programming skills with affiliation for investments**.


The main responsibilities of the Analyst Corporate Finance are:

* Prepare the Solvency II files and reconciliations relating to investments using programming languages (RStudio, potentially Python at a later stage),
* Identify opportunities to improve the quality of reports produced as well as to achieve process efficiency, while using Excel and programming capabilities,
* Actively support transition between old and new investment administration systems, including managing data enhancement, reconciliations, and cleaning, ensuring proper data administration in the new environment, co\-designing reports answering the current reporting and information sharing demands regarding investment assets,
* Provide in\-depth analysis of the Atradius investment portfolio,
* Liaise with internal and external parties providing information on investments,
* Liaise with various stakeholders in adapting internal systems and processes to the changes within the investment portfolio, in line with the EIOPA updates and IFRS regulations.

**Knowledge, skills and experience**

* Solid experience in Excel and programming languages like R or Python,
* Excellent quantitative and analytical skills,
* Affinity with financial instruments is an advantage,
* Track record of gathering requirements, defining and executing analysis,
* Experience in designing and developing models (e.g. relating to risk, income projections),
* Proven track record in building tools automating generation of enhanced data results, comparisons, visualization of data,
* Being goal\-minded towards efficiency, quality, and practicality,
* Capable of working independently or with minimal supervision, but also being an effective team player,
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills,
* Languages: English is a must, command of Spanish is an advantage,
* Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in Business Economics, Finance, Computer/Data Science, Mathematical Finance, Econometrics,
* Experience with any modern investment administration tool will be an advantage,
* Eligible to work in the Netherlands (without a requirement for a visa).

**Atradius**


The Atradius Group provides trade credit insurance, surety and collections services worldwide, and has a presence through 160 offices in 52 countries. The products offered by Atradius protect companies around the world against the default risks associated with selling goods and services on credit.


At Atradius, we believe in personal development and the Growth Mindset. Our Culture is based on teamwork, reliable accountability, constantly improving and unrivalled service. Read on more on our Career site: https://careers.atradius.com/en/careers.

 **Department Description**


The investment team, being a part of Corporate Finance, Tax \& ESG department, is the centralised unit responsible for developing and implementing the Atradius Group’s investment strategy, maintaining a state\-of\-the\-art investment process, optimising the Group’s investment result, and delivering of the Solvency II data relating to market risk.

 **What do we offer?**

* A dynamic, international and challenging work environment
* Training and support to reach your full potential including the opportunity for continuous professional development
* Attractive terms and conditions, including competitive salary, pension package and a range of flexible benefits and rewards
* Challenging tasks with individual development and training opportunities

 **Equal opportunities for all**


The success of our organisation stands with the quality of our people and the ideas they have. Insights and innovative solutions for our customers are the result of an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. That is why diversity is extremely important to Atradius. To ensure that all colleagues within Atradius can develop their qualities, we promote an inclusive culture in which everyone feels involved and valued. We encourage and welcome everyone to apply to our positions.

 **I am Atradius! \- Do you want to know who we are?**  

Get to know Atradius colleagues in this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v\=NnsgT04OpTU\&t\=4s  

  

*Atradius is a global provider of credit insurance, bond and surety, collections and information services, with a strategic presence in over 50 countries. The products offered by Atradius protect companies around the world against the default risks associated with selling goods and services on credit. Atradius is a member of Grupo Catalana Occidente (GCO.MC), one of the largest insurers in Spain and one of the largest credit insurers in the world.*  

*You can find further information on our website:* *https://group.atradius.com*

title: Data Entry Clerk - German, AGI-Data Services
description:
\- An Associate’s Degree or related work experience 
\- CEFR C1\+ or equivalent fluency in German language
\- Written and spoken knowledge of English is essential (CEFR B2\+)
\- Strong business writing skills with ability to create reports, proposals, and professional correspondence
\- Advanced reading comprehension with ability to analyze complex business documents
\- Developed analytical thinking and structured problem\-solving capabilities
\- Strong ability to interpret and implement detailed instructions across various projects
\- Proficient research skills with experience gathering and synthesizing information from multiple sources
\- Proven attention to detail in managing complex tasks and documents
  

AI is the most transformational technology of our time, capable of tackling some of humanity’s most challenging problems. Amazon is investing in generative AI and the responsible development and deployment of large language models (LLMs) across all of our businesses. Come build the future of human\-technology interaction with us.
We are looking for those candidates who just don’t think out of the box, but make the box they are in ‘Bigger’. The future is now, do you want to be a part of it? Then read on!
Key job responsibilities
\- Maintain and follow strict confidentiality as customer privacy is our most important tenet
\- Work with a range of different types of data including, but not limited to: text, speech, audio, image, and video
\- Deliver high\-quality labelled data, using guidelines provided to meet our KPIs and using in\-house tools and software, as part of Amazon's commitment to developing and deploying AI responsibly.
\- Demonstrate proficiency in generating high quality human insight data across a range of modalities, inclusive of text, image video and audio. 
\- Capable of making sound judgments and logical decisions when faced with ambiguous or incomplete information while performing tasks.
\- Eye for detail and ability to pivot from one category of requirement to another instantaneously.
\- Demonstrate support on daily operational deliverables for multiple task types assigned to you and the team
\- Analyze root causes, identify error patterns, and propose solutions to enhance the quality of labeling tasks and their outputs.
\- Responsible for identifying day\-to\-day process and operational issues in Standard Operating Procedure, tools and suggest changes to unblock operations
\- Demonstrate ownership in floor support to clarify internal queries during execution on need basis
A day in the life
We are looking for a ML Data Associate (MLDA) to undertake the task of foundational labeling functions, such as dialogue evaluation on speech, text, audio, video data.
Your ability to concentrate, multi\-task and your high attention to detail helps you deliver high\-quality work as well as maintaining strict confidentiality and follow all applicable Amazon policies for securing confidential information. You will be a part of a diverse team with the shared vision of improving customers’ lives with practical, useful generative AI innovations. An inner drive, individuality, and a creative mind are extremely beneficial.
  

* Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field
* 2\+ years of professional work experience with demonstrated task execution ability
* Proven capacity to leverage open\-source resources effectively for comprehensive research purposes
* Ability to adapt well to fast\-paced environments with changing circumstances, direction, and strategy
* 2\-3 years project coordination or management experience (for support functions teams)
* Experience managing stakeholder relationships across departments
* Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and common business applications.

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how\-we\-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Group Financial Controller
description:
Our client is a company in transition, new ERP systems are build and the finance function needs more professionalization and structure and clear processes. To help our client to achieve this goal, Hef Associaties is looking for a
 **Group Financial Controller.** 




  





**The Job:** 




 The Group Financial Controller (GFC)is coordinating the group consolidation and maintains contact with local controllers and administrators of the worldwide branches.
 



 The GFC is responsible for the delivery and analysis of the consolidated financial and is. reporting to the Group Controller .
 



  





 The goal is to provide the Business Controller and Business Leaders with timely, concise, and accurate management information, thereby enabling them to make decisions supported by the correct data. Furthermore, the GFC is the holding controller and therefore act as the financial counterpart to the manager of the staff departments.
 



  





**Key responsibilities:** 



* Deliver financial and non\-financial consolidated figures and manage the reporting packs for actuals, budget and year end reporting.
* Maintain the consolidation tool.
* Manage and Optimize working capital structure.
* Cashflow forecasting and planning.
* Continuously improve the treasury processes and participate in improvement projects.
* Financial control activities for the staff departments.



  





**Your profile** 
 :
 


* Master’s degree in either Accounting or Economics supplemented by at least 5 years of relevant work experience.
* Understanding of financial close and consolidation tooling.
* A good communicator with a strong analytical skillset who is able to manage and influence the organization while not being the formal manager.
* knowledge on treasury topics, such as: international cash management, cash flow forecasting, risk management (liquidity, FX, interest).



  





 Are you the financial that likes to improve structure and processes and always curious about consolidated figures? Apply and become the new Group Financial Controller at our client.

title: Creative Strategist
description:
Beyond Alpha (sister company of Happy Mammoth) is a fast\-growing natural food tech business selling across the United States, Australia and Europe. We specialize in formulating, producing and marketing gut, digestive and microbiome health foods and natural supplements, designed to help our clients make long\-lasting positive health changes and start living very full lives again.
   

  

 Why You'll Love Working at Beyond Alpha
   

  

* Competitive Salary – Your skills and expertise deserve to be rewarded
* Paid Holidays – Relax, recharge, and enjoy well\-earned time off
* Work from Anywhere – Your home, a cozy café, or a beachside co\-working space—it’s your call!
* Join a Supportive, Global Team – Work with passionate professionals from around the world
* Flexible Working Hours – Manage your schedule in a way that works best for you
* Growth Opportunities – Access free books, courses, and resources to expand your expertise
* Exciting \& Dynamic Work Environment – Every day brings new challenges and opportunities
* Make a Real Impact – Help create products that improve people’s lives


 We are looking for a Creative Strategist to join our growing Marketing Team on a full\-time basis.
   

  

 Before you dive deeper, please note the following key points:
   

  

 \&\#128205;This is a full\-time fully remote contractor role
   

  

 \&\#128205;We are seeking someone preferably with a background in B2C marketing
   

  

 \&\#128205;Although the role is remote, the candidate must be available during EU hours (GMT)
   

  

 Your primary role will center on digital media advertising with a keen focus on enhancing our ad campaigns.
   

  

 As a Creative Strategist, you will be responsible for developing innovative and effective strategies that align with our company's objectives and resonate with our target audience. Your role will blend creativity with strategic thinking to drive impactful campaigns and initiatives. You will collaborate closely with cross\-functional teams, including marketing, design, product development, to ensure cohesive messaging and brand consistency across all channels. The ideal candidate will possess a combination of analytical skills, creative flair, and a deep understanding of consumer behavior and market trends.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Strategy Development:
+ Develop comprehensive creative strategies that support business goals and objectives
+ Conduct thorough research and analysis to identify market trends, consumer insights, and competitive landscapes
+ Translate insights into actionable strategies that differentiate our brand and resonate with our target audience


* Campaign Planning and Execution:
+ Collaborate with internal teams to conceptualize and execute integrated marketing campaigns across various channels, including digital, social media, print, and events
+ Develop creative briefs and provide clear direction to design and content teams to ensure alignment with strategic objectives
+ Monitor campaign performance and metrics to evaluate effectiveness and identify areas for optimization


* Brand Development and Positioning:
+ Contribute to the development and evolution of our brand identity and messaging
+ Ensure brand consistency across all touchpoints and communication channels
+ Identify opportunities for brand positioning and differentiation in the marketplace


* Cross\-Functional Collaboration:
+ Work closely with marketing, design, product development, and sales teams to ensure alignment of messaging and strategy
+ Foster a collaborative environment that encourages creative thinking and innovation
+ Communicate effectively with stakeholders to gather input and feedback on creative initiatives


* Trend Analysis and Innovation:
+ Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and cultural shifts
+ Apply insights to inform creative strategies and develop innovative solutions
+ Experiment with new approaches and techniques to continually improve campaign performance and engagement


 Qualifications:
   

  

* Proven experience in a creative strategy role, preferably in an advertising agency or marketing department
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and insights to drive strategic decisions
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly and persuasively
* Creative mindset with a passion for developing innovative and compelling campaigns
* Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines effectively
* Proficiency in digital marketing platforms and tools
* Familiarity with design principles and an eye for aesthetics
* Ability to thrive in a fast\-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to change
* Strong collaborative spirit and ability to work effectively in cross\-functional teams


 CVs must be in ENGLISH.
   

  

 Powered by JazzHR

title: Director, Marketing Production - EMEA
description:
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with 283 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.
   

  

 The EMEA Regional team aims to bring scalability, innovation, connectivity and efficiencies to the EMEA region. The team comprises 5 different disciplines from Production, Operations, Planning to Studio Relations and Media. With the formation of the team in the last 2 years, it is time to build a true Production org where the leader will oversee all aspects of production for our campaigns, brand and global initiatives: pre\-production, production and post production.
   

  

**Overview**
 The EMEA Regional team is seeking a Production Director to lead regional production solutions across Brand Partnerships, Live, Ads, Brand and title campaigns. This role is critical for providing trusted campaign production support, establishing innovative workflows, and adapting to evolving business needs. The Director will enable scalable deployment of technology solutions and foster cross\-functional collaboration to achieve key objectives.
   

  

 The EMEA Production organization evaluates emerging technologies, implements new workflows and tools for promotional assets, and supports internal and external teams to deliver EMEA marketing assets. This team collaborates closely with content production, marketing, regional leadership, and global stakeholders to support the Netflix ‘pitch\-to\-play’ ecosystem. Collaboration and continuous improvement are essential to ensure initiatives align with business goals and strategies.
   

  


**Key Responsibilities**
* Fostering Netflix Culture: Cultivate a strong shared purpose within the production team, and actively promote this positive culture across internal and external partners.
* Diverse Stakeholder Engagement: Effectively engage with a wide range of stakeholders across different functions and regions, gathering input, understanding perspectives, and clearly communicating priorities and progress.
* Aligning Operations and Technology with Strategy: Ensure that production operations and technology initiatives are closely aligned with and support the overall business strategy.
* Collaboration with Product Teams: Work closely with product teams (PDP and Globalization) to develop shared goals, key results, and implementation plans.
* Program and Project Selection: Make informed and consistent decisions about which programs and projects to pursue, considering the overall portfolio of work and strategic priorities.
* Global Partnership Optimization: Optimize partnerships with other global teams to support their work across regions and prioritize the allocation of shared resources.
* Shaping EMEA Production Strategy: Contribute to and support the development of the overall EMEA Production strategy, providing a framework for informed business decisions and regional prioritization.
* Strategic Planning and Execution: Lead strategic planning and execution for a diverse portfolio of projects in production operations, working closely with senior leadership and title management teams to identify opportunities for improvement and optimize resources.
* Bridging Local and Regional Needs: Identify, prioritize, and communicate local and regional needs, ensuring alignment with global initiatives and supporting the successful rollout of new operational processes and tools.
* Knowledge Sharing and Expertise: Work closely with global and local teams to share knowledge and expertise on local opportunities (e.g., vendor and talent landscape) and support effective data gathering and curation (e.g., industry/market trends, production metrics).
* External Partnership Building: Support the development of relationships with pan\-regional external partners and vendors.
* Post Production: Knowledge in post production with experience in leading teams for finishing and delivery.
* Social Editorial \& Localization: Familiarity with social editorial and localization processes to facilitate the scalability of the title work.
* Project Management: Proven ability to manage producers while juggling varying campaign volumes and timelines.
* Vendor Ecosystem: Establish a network of vendors to meet the diverse business requirements across the region.


**Candidate Profile**
* 15\+ years of experience in content production or production management.
* Proven experience leading large, diverse teams across multiple locations and cultures, demonstrating exceptional empathy and people management skills.
* Deep understanding of creative campaigns lifecycle, from initial concept through to launch.
* Ability to interact effectively with senior business leaders, showcasing excellent communication skills and executive presence.
* Exceptional creative problem\-solving abilities, with the capacity to rapidly assess new information and propose optimal business solutions.
* Openness to feedback and actively seeks out diverse perspectives from stakeholders.
* Comfortable working in ambiguous situations, independently setting goals and desired outcomes that align with broader business strategy.
* Thrives in fast\-paced, high\-pressure environments and possesses intellectual curiosity and sound judgment in uncertain situations.
* Keeps abreast of emerging technologies (including AI) and production trends.
* Demonstrates curiosity and a passion for innovation in production.


 Inclusion is a Netflix value and we strive to host a meaningful interview experience for all candidates. If you want an accommodation/adjustment for a disability or any other reason during the hiring process, please send a request to your recruiting partner.
   

  

 We are an equal\-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

title: Creative Designer
description:
**Company Description**
**This is King of Reach by B\&S**
 Join the King of Reach team, where innovation meets impact in the vibrant world of food and beverage distribution! As part of the esteemed B\&S family, we're on a mission to make premium consumer goods accessible to everyone, everywhere—infusing everyday lives with joy and comfort through top\-quality products.
   

  

 At King of Reach, we’re not just about distributing products; we’re about delivering happiness and flavour to the farthest corners of the globe. From duty\-free channels to government sites and remote retail locations, our expertise ensures that the world's leading food and beverage brands find their way into the hands of consumers across distinct markets globally.
   

  

**If this sounds like the right role for you, we’d love to see your work!
   

  

 Please send your CV along with an online portfolio showcasing your best design projects. Be sure to include:**
* Your strongest digital and print work
* Any AI\-driven or motion design projects
* Examples of work created in collaboration with others (e.g. developers, marketing teams, clients)


 Job Description
   

  

***If you’re a bold, passionate, and extroverted designer who thrives on creativity, collaboration, and innovation, this role is for you. We’re looking for a Creative Designer to join our in\-house team and play a key role in shaping King of Reach’s visual identity across both digital and print. This is an exciting opportunity for a proactive and innovative designer to collaborate with the Design Lead and a growing team of designers, producing high\-quality creative assets that drive our brand’s growth***
***!***
**Reach your full potential as a Creative Designer**
 As a Creative Designer, you’ll work closely with our design team and the broader marketing team, contributing to creative projects that shape our brand’s presence across multiple channels. We’re in an exciting phase of expansion, having recently rebranded King of Reach into a bold and playful identity. We believe that just because we are a serious B2B brand doesn’t mean we can’t be relevant and cool.
   

  

 What makes working with us exciting? You’ll get to collaborate on high\-impact projects for global brands like
 **Mars Wrigley, Nestlé, Heineken, and Diageo** 
 . You'll be part of a growing creative team that thrives on innovation and values collaboration—because we believe great ideas can come from anyone, anywhere. You'll work side\-by\-side with a talented Design Lead and fellow designers who truly live and breathe creativity. Plus, you’ll gain exposure to
 **AI\-driven workflows** 
 and enjoy plenty of room for learning, growth, and ownership of your projects.
   

  

 This is what you’ll be doing:
   

  

* Graphic Design \& Content Creation – Develop creative assets for digital campaigns, social media, website content, presentations, and branding materials.
* Print \& Event Design – Design high\-quality print materials, including large\-format graphics for events, banners, posters, and planograms. Ensure designs are scalable and optimized for high\-resolution printing.
* Brand Consistency – Ensure all visual output aligns with our brand identity and meets a high standard of quality.
* Concept Development – Work closely with the Design Lead and design team to generate and execute ideas that elevate our brand and engage audiences.
* Website \& UI Support – Assist in refining and enhancing digital experiences through thoughtful design.
* AI \& Innovation in Design – Experiment with AI tools to enhance creative workflows and push design boundaries.
* Collaboration – Work alongside copywriters, videographers, designers, and marketing teams to produce cohesive, impactful creative projects.
* Production \& File Preparation – Ensure final files meet print production requirements, working with vendors to guarantee top\-quality execution.


**Qualifications**
**This is you**
 You thrive in fast\-paced, ever\-evolving environments. Juggling multiple projects and adapting to shifting priorities feels like second nature to you. You're a strong conceptual thinker, able to translate abstract ideas into bold, compelling visuals that truly stand out.
   

  

 You’re not just creative, you’re also highly organized. You know how to manage your time wisely and stick to deadlines without compromising quality. What truly sets you apart is your passion for innovation—especially when it comes to AI—and your curiosity about how technology can take creativity to the next level.
   

  

 Collaboration is in your nature. You're comfortable working within a large, global organization and enjoy teaming up across different brands and departments. At the same time, you're perfectly capable of working independently, taking ownership of projects while staying open to feedback and co\-creation.
   

  

 And when it comes to communication? You’re confident, clear, and ready to present and defend your creative ideas with flair.
   

  

 You:
   

  

* Have 3 to 5 years of experience in graphic design, ideally within a creative agency, marketing team, or brand studio with FMCG experience.
* Are proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, After Effects) and Figma.
* Have experience with motion graphics or AI\-assisted design – we primarly use Canva for animations
* Have strong print skills, including experience designing for large\-scale formats and preparing files for professional printing
* You have a true passion for AI \& innovation, with curiosity about how technology can enhance creativity.
* Are able to provide an online portfolio including your strongestdigital and print work, any AI\-driven or motion design projects and examples of work created in collaboration with others (e.g. developers, marketing teams, clients)


 Additional Information
   

  

**We offer you**
* A salary between €45k to €55k gross a year, in line with your experience, plus a yearly fixed Christmas bonus and a performance dependent bonus
* Initially, a one\-year contract with the prospect of permanent employment
* 25 vacation days, with the possibility to purchase additional days
* A travel allowance of up to 75 km on single trip travel when working at the office, or an allowance if you’re working remotely (from home)
* The flexibility to work 1 day a week from home
* A pension scheme where 2/3rd of the pension costs are paid by us
* The possibility to take courses related to your growth ambitions and function
* A coaching program focused on your mental health (non\-binding)
* Participation in group insurance such as disability insurance and survivor’s insurance
* Free use of our company gym
* Bicycle plan where you can benefit from a substantial discount

title: Data Consultant (Italian)
description:
**Company Description**
 Assent is the leading solution for supply chain sustainability tailored for the world's top\-tier, sustainability\-driven manufacturers. Hidden risks riddle supply chains, many of which weren't built with sustainability in mind. That's where we step in. With insights from experts, Assent is the tool manufacturers trust for comprehensive sustainability.
   

  

 We are proud to announce that Assent has crossed the US $100M ARR milestone, granting us Centaur Status. This accomplishment, reached just 8 years following our Series A, makes us the first and only Certified B Corporation in North America's SaaS sustainability industry to celebrate this milestone.
   

  

 Our journey from $5 million to US $100M ARR in just eight years has been marked by significant growth and achievements. With our $350 million US funding led by Vista Equity Partners, we're posed for even greater expansion and are on the lookout for outstanding team members to join our mission.
   

  

**Hybrid Work Model**
 At Assent, we proudly embrace a remote\-first work model, valuing the flexibility and autonomy it provides our team. We also acknowledge the intangible benefits of occasional in\-person workdays. For team members situated within 50kms/31 miles of our five global offices in Ottawa, Eldoret, Penang, Columbus, and Amsterdam, you can expect to come into the office at least one day a week. Similarly, those near our co\-working spaces in Nairobi and Toronto are encouraged to work onsite once a month.
   

  

**Job Description**
**Position Summary**
 Reporting to the Manager, Data Consulting, the Data Consultant serves as a primary point of contact regarding data quality for assigned client accounts. Through ongoing consultation, implementation support and issue resolution, the Data Consultant ensures client meet their business goals using best in class data practices.
   

  

**Key Requirements And Responsibilities**
* Guide existing clients to keep data updated and optimized for success
* Conduct strategy sessions, workshops and ongoing consultation aligned with Assent's data standards and processes
* Proactively monitor client data and systems to ensure ongoing data quality and accuracy
* Perform ad hoc analysis, report development and troubleshooting as needed.
* Maintain expertise in Assent's products, features and roadmap to help clients maximize value
* Develop documentation covering all clients data assets, processes and best practices
* Deliver client presentations, trainings and knowledge transfer sessions
* Manage client relationships and act as the primary point of contact for all data needs
* Identify process improvements, technical issues and make recommendations
* Proactively identify data risks, assess potential impacts, and collaborate with internal teams to implement effective mitigation strategies
* Collaborate cross\- functionally to continually enhance Assent's data solutions and client experience


 This is not an exhaustive list of duties. Responsibilities may be altered and/or added from time to time to meet business needs.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Your Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**
 We strongly value your talent, energy and passion. It will also be valuable to Assent if you have the following qualifications,
   

  

* Bachelor’s Degree/Higher diploma from recognized learning institution in Information Systems/Computer Science;
* Minimum 3\-4 years related work experience;
* Proven track record of building trusted advisory relationships
* Proven ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non technical audiences
* Great verbal and written communication skills in English as well as an additional language in Italian

title: People & Culture Specialist
description:
**Company Description**
**Hello, we’re nuud.**
**A vegan natural deodorant, highly effective and super concentrated.**
 We live for fresh armpits; fresh as a polar bear garden party. That means fresh without aluminium, parabens, no micro plastics and no nanoparticles. No salts and no cheap perfume. We don’t do propellants or canisters but put nuud in a bioplastic tube made from sugarcane. With this we made over 4\.283\.000 armpits happy in 100\+ countries
   

  

**Job Description**
**How you’ll make a difference:**
 As a Talent \& Culture Specialist, you’ll maintain and build on our HR foundation. With core processes in place, your focus will be on improving the employee experience and ensuring everything runs smoothly. You’ll act as a trusted advisor to management, offering people\-focused insights that help shape thoughtful, inclusive decisions. Your mission? To foster a workplace where everyone feels supported, valued, and able to thrive.
   

  

**Your responsibilities:**
* Being the first point of contact for all HR\-related matters.

* Collaborating on 'People \& Culture' initiatives to build a company culture aligned with our brand values.
* Ensuring flawless onboarding and offboarding of employees alongside team leads.
* Continuously optimizing HR and recruitment processes to support our growth trajectory.
* Managing the annual agenda, including important HR and company activities such as quarterly meetings and parties!


**What we're looking for:**

* A Bachelor's degree in HR, Organisational Psychology or a relevant field.
* Available for 24 – 32 hours per week; distribution of hours can be arranged.
* 1 \- 4 years of HR experience, preferably in a dynamic, international startup environment.
* Strong organizational and administrative skills, with a keen eye for detail.
* Proficiency in labor law, Collective Labor Agreements, and awareness of relevant HR trends.
* Ability to work autonomously, prioritize tasks, and make informed decisions.
* Excellent communication skills, adept at building relationships across all levels of the organization.
* Fluent in English; Dutch proficiency is considered advantageous.
* Proficiency in working with tools such as SmartRecruiters, Officevibe, NMBRS, and Notion is considered advantageous.


**What’s in it for you:**
* The opportunity to make a huge impact at a young and thriving start\-up.
* A hybrid working model
* Competitive salary with biannual bonuses and additional benefits.
* Holiday package of 24 days (for 38\-hour workweek), ensuring you have enough time to recharge.
* For full\-time roles, we offer up to 10 working days per year to work from abroad, so you can save your vacation days for a proper holiday! (Pro rata for part\-time roles.)


**Interested? Apply now! Please include your CV.**
**Job descriptions can be tough to interpret. Even if you may not tick all the boxes, we have ambitious plans for our team, and we value people who share our vision and look forward to growing with us. Apply today and let's embark on this exciting journey together!**
