title: Junior/Medior Python Engineer (40 hours per week, including 24 hours on-site in Amsterdam)
description:
**Junior/Medior Python Engineer (40 hours per week, including 24 hours on\-site in Amsterdam)** 




  





 In this position, you will be working on our application backend system that processes hundreds of millions of URLs and webpages per day. At Business Radar, we use state\-of\-the\-art technology to check daily for negative media coverage surrounding companies and affiliated individuals. This technology enables our customers to select and maintain a network of sustainable and reliable business partners. You will gain unique insights into global media trends, uncover previously unknown patterns, and empower our clients with valuable intelligence. You will work alongside a visionary team of highly motivated and ambitious colleagues who continuously seek innovative ways to extract additional insights and benefits from the daily stream of unstructured data generated worldwide.
 



  





**Developer Requirements:** 




  




* Strong Python experience
* Expertise in Django and Django REST Framework
* PostgreSQL database knowledge (experience with pgvector is a plus)
* Experience with search technologies (OpenSearch/Elasticsearch)
* Skills in implementing Celery task queues
* Familiarity with AWS cloud services (S3, SES, SQS, CloudWatch, etc.)
* Working knowledge of LLM integrations (OpenAI, LangChain)
* Experience in natural language processing (NLTK, spaCy)
* Proficiency with testing frameworks (Pytest or equivalent)
* Experience with authentication systems (JWT, SAML, SSO)
* Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines
* Data processing skills are a plus (Pandas, Tableau, Microsoft BI, etc.)
* Experience working with high\-volume data systems



  





**What we offer:** 




  




* An entrepreneurial startup environment with substantial freedom to shape your own career path
* An innovative culture encouraging experimentation, mistakes, and learning
* Excellent base salary (€70K) and bonus/equity options for top performance
* Opportunities to travel and attend conferences such as PyCon USA
* Personal budget for mental health, including coaching and therapy
* Personal budget for professional development
* Opportunity to play padel and participate in other sports at our office during business hours
* Daily free lunches and drinks at our office
* Company credit card
* Excellent pension plan and 25 vacation days

title: Product Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 Hey there! We’re Lleverage.ai, and we’re making AI automation actually achievable for businesses. We enable teams to capture, automate, and integrate AI\-driven workflows and agents into their business, because AI is only useful when it actually fits into daily operations.
   

  

 We’re a team of entrepreneurs and innovators, who believe the future of work is 80% creativity, strategy, and human interaction, because AI takes care of the rest. If that sounds something you want to help build, we’d love to have you on board!
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Product Engineering: Build, ship, and maintain core functionality across both frontend and backend of our platform.
* Product Collaboration: Work closely with product and design to deliver intuitive, powerful user experiences.
* Code Quality: Write clean, scalable code with a strong focus on testing, maintainability, and performance.
* CI/CD \& DevOps: Maintain mature CI/CD pipelines and deployment processes to ensure rapid, stable delivery.
* Architecture: Help define the architecture and tech stack as the product and team grow.
* Iterate Fast: Contribute to fast feedback loops — release quickly, learn, and improve.
* Value Delivery: Constantly assess how engineering decisions impact customer value and business outcomes.


**Job Specific Requirements**
* Technical Stack: Strong experience with Typescript and React.
* Cloud Experience: Familiarity with modern cloud platforms and services (preferably GCP, but AWS works too).
* Engineering Best Practices: You write testable, production\-grade code and build with scalability in mind, but are also pragmatic and can ship fast.
* Startup Mentality: You're comfortable with ambiguity and excited to work in a fast\-moving, constantly evolving environment.
* AI Enthusiast: You are deeply interested in generative AI and eager to build cutting\-edge applications with and around this technology.


**Nice to haves**
* Deep expertise in prompt engineering and LLM evaluations
* Experience with machine learning or building AI\-powered products
* Background in SaaS or low\-code platforms
* Contributions to developer tools or workflow automation
* A carry\-on ice cream bar (it's becoming our thing)


**We offer**
 You are ready for the ride of a lifetime with experienced entrepreneurs and innovators who aim for hyper growth on a global scale. We look for an enormous drive and hands\-on mentality. Somebody who can work with us in creating the best AI low code solution out there!
   

  

 We offer a good salary, a highly experienced (and very entertaining...) team and considerable share packages.

title: GTM Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 Hey there! We’re Lleverage.ai, and we’re making AI automation actually achievable for businesses. We enable teams to capture, automate, and integrate AI\-driven workflows and agents into their business, because AI is only useful when it actually fits into daily operations.
   

  

 We’re a team of entrepreneurs and innovators, who believe the future of work is 80% creativity, strategy, and human interaction, because AI takes care of the rest. If that sounds something you want to help build, we’d love to have you on board!
   

  

**About The Role**
 We're pioneering the future of sales with our GTM Engineering team—reimagining traditional sales roles by collapsing SDRs, AEs, and sales engineers into a single, high\-leverage function. As a GTM Engineer at Lleverage.ai, you'll design and build scalable revenue\-generating systems rather than simply executing manual outreach.
   

  

 Unlike traditional sales roles where individual effort determines success, you'll create automated workflows that can reach thousands of prospects without adding headcount—similar to how engineering teams build software that serves millions without requiring more engineers.
   

  

**Why Lleverage?**
* Change the world, literally: 2025 is the year AI works, and Lleverage.ai is at the forefront of making AI accessible and valuable for businesses
* Work, learn, have fun: You'll be part of a technical sales team that thinks and operates like product builders
* Build a unique network: Connect with decision\-makers and technical leaders across industries as you help them implement AI solutions
* Get autonomy \& ownership: Build and own entire revenue\-generating systems rather than just hitting call quotas
* Compensation: We pay top of market cash and equity, with compensation tied to the value you create, not just activities you perform


**Responsibilities**
* Design Revenue Systems: Create scalable, automated systems for prospect research, personalized outreach, and lead qualification
* Generate Pipeline: Build processes that drive demand at 10x the scale of traditional SDR teams
* Close Deals: Take ownership of the entire sales cycle from initial contact to closed deal
* Technical Consultation: Provide expert product guidance and help prospects understand how to transform their own operations with AI
* Build Automation: Leverage our platform, LLMs, and other tools to automate personalized outreach at scale
* Measure \& Optimize: Continuously improve your systems based on data and results
* Product Feedback: Share insights from customer interactions to help shape our product roadmap
* Technical Workshopping: Help customers implement and get maximum value from our platform


**Job Specific Requirements**
* Systems Thinking: Ability to design scalable processes rather than just executing manual tasks
* Technical Curiosity: Comfortable learning and using new tools to automate sales processes
* Sales Acumen: Strong interpersonal skills and ability to guide prospects through complex buying decisions
* Product Understanding: Capacity to quickly develop deep product knowledge and explain technical concepts clearly
* Data\-Driven: Experience using data to measure results and optimize processes
* High Agency: Self\-starter who can identify problems and implement solutions independently
* Automation Experience: Background working with sales or marketing automation tools
* Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication for both technical and non\-technical audiences


**Nice to haves**
* Experience using or building with AI/LLM tools for sales or marketing
* Background in a technical or product role with customer\-facing responsibilities
* Experience with CRM customization, data enrichment tools, or sales automation platforms
* Understanding of data pipelines and how to structure data for sales intelligence
* Previous experience in a hybrid commercial/technical role
* A carry\-on ice cream bar (it's becoming our thing)


**Our approach to GTM engineering**
 Our GTM Engineers combine three traditional roles:
   

  

* Generate pipeline through automated systems (traditionally SDR work)
* Close existing pipeline through consultative selling (traditionally AE work)
* Technical workshopping to help customers implement solutions (traditionally Sales Engineer work)


 This creates tighter feedback loops, better customer experiences, and more valuable product insights—all while achieving more efficient revenue growth.
   

  

**We offer**
 You are ready for the ride of a lifetime with experienced entrepreneurs and innovators who aim for hyper growth on a global scale. We look for an enormous drive and hands\-on mentality. Somebody who can work with us in creating the best AI low code solution out there!
   

  

 We offer a good salary, a highly experienced (and very entertaining...) team and considerable share packages.

title: Senior Software Engineer (Back-end)
description:
***FOR THIS ROLE YOU MUST BE BASED IN THE NETHERLANDS***




  





**🚀 Join Saber \- Transforming Sales with AI \& Automation!** 




 At Saber, we’re revolutionizing sales with AI\-driven solutions that make teams more efficient and effective. Backed by top VCs, we’re on a mission to disrupt the sales industry. Here, you’ll be part of something truly impactful.
 



  





**Why Saber?**

 : If you’re dreaming of founding your own company one day, this is the best place to learn, innovate, and get the hands\-on experience you need.



  





**Your Role:** 




 Lead R\&D to design and develop cutting\-edge AI and data solutions that revolutionize sales processes. Collaborate across teams, innovate, and make an immediate impact.
 



  





**What You Bring:** 



* 7\+ years in software engineering.
* Expertise in Node.js (Typescript).
* Experience with cloud platforms and AI models like LLMs.
* Startup mindset: You thrive in fast\-paced, innovative environments.



  





**Our Tech Stack:** 



* Frontend: ReactJS, TypeScript
* Backend: Node.js, TypeScript, NestJS
* Databases: Postgres, MongoDB
* AI: LLMs (OpenAI, Anthropic)
* Cloud: GCP (Docker containers in Cloud Run)

**Perks:** 



* **Equity \& Competitive Salary:** 
 We value your contributions and ensure you are rewarded for them (€70,000 \- €100,000 p.a. \+ equity).
* **Work Flexibility:** 
 Enjoy a hybrid work setup tailored to your needs (3 days a week in the office).
* **Flat Structure:** 
 Work in a transparent, decision\-making environment alongside leadership.



  





 🌟
 **Ready to Build the Future of Sales? Apply Now and Help Us Shape What’s Next!**

 : We believe in small, co\-located, highly efficient teams. As one of our top engineers, we ensure your contributions are recognized and rewarded.
* **Take Ownership** 
 : Scope, plan, and deliver your work independently \- no micromanagement.
* **Direct Collaboration with Leadership** 
 : Enjoy working closely with the founders in a flat structure where your voice is heard and decisions are transparent.
* **Competitive Salary \& Equity** 
 : We offer a competitive salary and equity package so you can grow with the company’s success.
* **Growth \& Future Opportunities** 
 : If you’re dreaming of founding your own company one day, this is the best place to learn, innovate, and get the hands\-on experience you need.



  





**Your Role:** 




 Lead R\&D to design and develop cutting\-edge AI and data solutions that revolutionize sales
 



 processes. Collaborate across teams, innovate, and make an immediate impact.
 



  





**What You Bring:** 



* 7\+ years in software engineering.
* Expertise in strictly typed languages (Go preferred)
* Expertise and willingness to work with Node.js (Typescript).
* Experience with cloud platforms and AI models like LLMs.
* Startup mindset: You thrive in fast\-paced, innovative environments.



  





**Our Tech Stack:** 



* **Frontend** 
 : ReactJS, TypeScript
* **Backend** 
 : Go, Node.js, TypeScript, NestJS
* **Databases** 
 : Postgres, MongoDB
* **AI** 
 : LLMs (OpenAI, Anthropic)
* **Cloud** 
 : GCP (Docker containers in Cloud Run)
* **Infrastructure** 
 : Terraform



  





**Perks:** 



* **Equity \& Competitive Salary:** 
 We value your contributions and ensure you are rewarded for them (€70,000 \- €100,000 p.a. \+ equity).
* **Work Flexibility:** 
 Enjoy a hybrid work setup tailored to your needs (3 days a week in the office).
* **Flat Structure:** 
 Work in a transparent, decision\-making environment alongside leadership.
* 🌟
 **Ready to Build the Future of Sales? Apply Now and Help Us Shape What’s Next!**

title: Lead (Back-end) Engineer
description:
**Woub is looking for a Lead (Back\-End) Engineer** 





 Are you ready to unleash your magic as a Lead Engineer at a fast\-growing SaaS scale\-up in the cozy town of Wateringen? We are looking for a Lead (Back\-End) Engineer who not only excels in back\-end code (Laravel/PHP), but also knows how to inspire the team with vision, technical direction, and occasionally a nerdy joke by the coffee machine ☕️.
 




  





**Who are we?** 





 We are
 
**Woub** 

 , a close\-knit team of about 20 enthusiastic professionals working together on one mission:
 
**to give 1,000,000 people more peace of mind in their work** 

 . Our project communication app is used daily by thousands of professionals in the construction industry. We help them collaborate more efficiently, structured, and without hassle.
 




  






 We are growing by 200% per year across Europe. It's time to strengthen our development team with a technical leader who will make a difference with us.
 




  





**Our stack** 





 We build scalable, stable software that must perform daily. Our tech stack:
 



* **GitLab (CI/CD)** 

 – for version control and automated deployments
* **Docker** 

 – for consistent development environments
* **Laravel \& PHP 8\.2** 

 – for rock\-solid back\-end code
* **Linux** 

 – as a reliable OS
* **AWS** 

 – for cloud scalability
* **Websockets** 

 – for real\-time functionality
* **Redis** 

 – for super\-fast caching
* **OpenAI \& Google Gemini** 

 – for that touch of AI magic ✨
* **MySQL (AWS Aurora RDS)** 

 – for scalable databases
* **Vue.js 3** 

 – for a flawless front\-end



  





**On our radar (your input welcome):** 





 Kubernetes · React Native · Storybook · Tailwind · AWS SQS/SNS · gRPC · Go
 




  





**What will you do?** 





 As a Lead (Back\-End) Engineer, you will be at the helm of our tech. Together with your team, you will take our apps, infrastructure, and development processes to a level ready for international expansion. We are scaling rapidly – and that requires robust architecture, smart solutions, and a team that works together like a well\-oiled machine. Your mission? Ensure that Woub can handle millions of users per day without a hitch, in multiple languages, time zones, and markets.
 




  




* **🔧 Leadership:** 

 You will lead our development team (DevOps, Back\-End, Front\-End, React Native, and QA) and ensure structure, synergy, and continuity.
* **🚀 Building \& Scaling:** 

 You are co\-responsible for the performance and stability of our entire tech stack: web app, mobile app, APIs, and infrastructure.
* **💡 Innovating:** 

 You will design smart APIs, explore new technologies, and integrate AI solutions (OpenAI/Gemini) where it adds value.
* **✅ Code Quality \& DevOps:** 

 You will do code reviews, help optimize CI/CD pipelines, and work on test automation. You will safeguard the technical foundation.
* **🤝 Sparring Partner:** 

 You are the technical point of contact for our Product Owner and business stakeholders. You translate technology into understandable choices for every audience.



  





**What do you bring?** 



* **Laravel pro** 

 – You know PHP and Laravel like the back of your hand
* **Framework knowledge** 

 – You can talk shop with our front\-enders (Vue, React Native)
* **Leadership** 

 – You have experience with team coaching and technical decision\-making
* **Clear communication** 

 – You make complex tech understandable
* **Collaborator** 

 – You are not a lone wolf, but enjoy building with others
* **Curious** 

 – You keep a close eye on the latest tools and trends
* **Language skills** 

 – Fluent English is required; Dutch is a big plus



  





**What do you get from us?** 



* **Salary:** 

 €6,000 – €7,500 gross based on full\-time
* **SAR scheme:** 

 Share in Woub's success
* **Bonus:** 

 Minimum €1,000 gross per year
* **Pension:** 

 100% employer contribution
* **25 vacation days**
* **Training budget:** 

 €2,000 per year
* **Flexibility:** 

 Work where and when you perform best
* **Setup of your choice:** 

 Mac, Linux, or Windows
* **Exercise during work hours:** 

 2x per week company fitness, 1x padel per month
* **Quarterly parties** 

 – from team outings to surprising events
* **Daily lunch:** 

 Provided at the office
* **'More peace of mind at work' coach** 

 – because we live what we build



  





**Our culture** 



* **Customer\-focused:** 

 One fan per day
* **Driven:** 

 A little better every day
* **Friends:** 

 Honest, enthusiastic, and loving
* **Quirky:** 

 Dare to be different. 100% You.
* **Eager to learn:** 

 Making mistakes is okay.. Experiment.
* **Humor:** 

 Don't eat bananas with eye contact.



  





**How does the application process work?** 





 We like to keep the process personal and to the point:
 



1. **Apply:** 

 Apply here or email your CV \& GitHub link to suraj@woub.chat
2. **Introduction (call or video):** 

 We call or video call to see if we click
3. **1st Interview:** 

 You talk to our tech leads and stakeholders. We dive a little deeper into the content – about your experience, our tech, and how you like to work.
4. **Case/Assignment:** 

 Are we both enthusiastic? Then you will get a small case or assignment to show how you think, build, and make choices. We keep it relevant and realistic.
5. **2nd Interview:** 

 You present your case and meet a 'friend' – a colleague from another team. This way you immediately get a feel for the culture and the broader team.
6. **Offer:** 

 At Woub, the team decides, not the management. The friend team gives the green light. And if it feels good from both sides? Then we will make you an offer that you will be happy with.



  





**Do you fit in with Woub?** 





 At Woub, you get the freedom to make a real impact. You work in an enthusiastic, informal team where your ideas are taken seriously and your work makes a direct difference.

title: Integrations Lead
description:
#### **About the Team**



The Business Technology team is a global group of Architects, Product Owners, Analysts, and Developers, who are committed in aligning technologies with the strategic goals of the business. We thrive on collaboration and deep expertise and aim to support the business technology landscape through strategic management while facilitating seamless, end\-to\-end business process automation. We take pride in owning the architecture and design of business systems, crafting durable, advanced designs that drive Miro's progress.


#### **About the Role**



We are seeking an experienced Senior Integration Engineer to lead our BizTech Integration team in transforming our digital ecosystem.



As a key member of our BizTech organization, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and managing enterprise\-wide integration solutions using cutting\-edge Integration Platform as a Service (iPaaS) technologies. Additionally, you will support the development of microservices to enhance the capabilities of our internal agents and business systems.


#### **What you'll do**


* **Design \& Develop Integration Solutions**: Develop scalable, robust integrations using modern iPaaS platforms to connect various SaaS providers (e.g., CRM, ERP, marketing tools, project management systems)
* **API Development**: Design and implement secure APIs, particularly for AI and Agent\-based systems
* **Collaboration**: Work with cross\-functional teams to gather integration requirements and translate them into technical solutions
* **Integration Architecture**: Develop and maintain integration architectures that align with the organization's long\-term technology strategy
* **Lifecycle Management**: Oversee the entire integration lifecycle, from conception to production deployment and maintenance
* **Innovation \& Trends**: Stay updated on the latest trends in integration technologies and recommend innovative solutions to improve integration capabilities
* **Security \& Compliance**: Establish and enforce best security practices for secure connections across various systems, ensuring data integrity and compliance

#### **What you'll need**


* 10\+ years of proven experience as a Software Architect, Integration Architect, and/or as Senior Software developer
* Outstanding functional and technical communication skills and demonstrated business and IT collaboration
* Hands on/working knowledge of most environments described below is required:
	+ Strong knowledge of building APIs, REST APIs, Kafka, IPaaS etc. Hands on experience any of the IPaaS (Mulesoft, Workato, Tray.ai etc..)
	+ Experience with cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/GCP)
	+ Knowledge of Container orchestration technologies (Kubernetes/Docker) is a plus
	+ Knowledge of Microservices and/or JAVA/Python is a plus
* Experience in designing and implementing integrations between various SaaS applications like Salesforce, ZenDesk, Marketo, Workday etc., and on\-premises systems, and databases
* Working experience with AI models and their integration requirements, including familiarity with language models and their applications in agent\-based systems
* Innovator with quick absorption of new technologies; strong understanding of technology solutions.

#### **What's in it for you**


* Competitive equity package
* Medical insurance coverage
* Lunch, snacks and drinks provided in the office
* Wellbeing benefit and WFH equipment allowance
* Annual learning and development allowance to grow your skills and career
* Travel allowance for your commute
* Opportunity to work for a globally diverse team
* Inspiring workplace in the heart of Amsterdam

#### **About Miro**



Miro is a visual workspace for innovation that enables distributed teams of any size to build the next big thing. The platform's infinite canvas enables teams to lead engaging workshops and meetings, design products, brainstorm ideas, and more. Miro, co\-headquartered in San Francisco and Amsterdam, serves more than 90M users worldwide, including 99% of the Fortune 100\. Miro was founded in 2011 and currently has more than 1,600 employees in 12 hubs around the world.



We are a team of dreamers. We look for individuals who dream big, work hard, and above all stay humble. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do and through our work together we hope to create a supportive, welcoming, and innovative environment. We strive to play as a team to win the world and create a better version of ourselves every day. If this sounds like something that excites you, we want to hear from you!



Check out more about life at Miro:


* Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/@lifeatmiro
* Blog: https://miro.com/careers/life\-at\-miro/all/
* Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mirohq/


At Miro, we strive to create and foster an environment of belonging and collaboration across cultural differences. Miro's mission — *Empower teams to create the next big thing* — is how we think about our product, people, and culture. We believe that creating big things requires diverse and inclusive teams. *Diversity* invites all talent with different demography, identities and styles *to step in*, and *inclusion* invites them to step *closer together.* Every day, we are working to build a more diverse Miro, cultivate a sense of belonging for future and current Mironeers around the world, and foster an environment where everyone can collaborate and embrace differences.


**Miro handles and uses personal data of job applicants in line with its** **Recruitment Privacy Policy** **found** **here****.**
company_description: Miro is a visual workspace for innovation that enables distributed teams of any size to dream, design, and build the future together. Our mission is to empower these teams to create the next big thing

title: SMTS Software Development Eng.
description:
Overview:
**WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING**

We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next\-generation computing experiences – the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives.

AMD together we advance\_
Responsibilities:
**THE ROLE:**  

AI Performance Engineers focus on optimizing machine learning models, profiling, bottleneck analysis, and optimal mapping to GPU.
As an AI Performance Engineer, you will analyze and explore recent ML models, understand their compute and memory requirements, and optimize them on various compute hardware for both inference and training. In addition you would do profiling and analyzing various workloads on current hardware and coming up with new ways to improve their performance. **THE PERSON:**  

The ideal candidate will have strong experience with software optimization, GPU programing and hardware architecture. Passionate of getting the best performance out of various hardware’s under different tradeoffs.
If you are passionate about performance optimization, getting the best out of the HW, and shaping the future AI performance, then this role is for you. **KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:*** Benchmark, analyze, and optimize performance of key machine learning applications, on single and multi\-GPU systems
* Design, implement, and test GPU kernels and algorithms for tensor operations like matrix multiplication and convolutions used in a variety of high\-performance machine learning libraries and frameworks
* Deliver high\-quality code and documentation following best practices for open\-source software development

**PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:*** Understanding of GPU architectures and low\-level optimization techniques, memory hierarchy, instruction scheduling, and performance tradeoffs
* Strong background developing applications and libraries in C\+\+, especially high\-performance computing and/or scientific software
* GPU software development using HIP, CUDA, or OpenCL
* In\-depth knowledge of best\-practices in software development, including testing, profiling, debugging, documentation, version control, issue tracking, and planning
* Experience with C\+\+ and Python programming
* Experience in PyTorch, Tensorflow or MXNet
* Experience in high\-performance computing (HPC)
* Strong written and spoken English language skills (our company language)

**ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS:*** BSc, MSc, PhD or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or a related field

  

\#LI\-DB1  

\#LI\-HYBRID  


Qualifications:
*Benefits offered are described:* AMD benefits at a glance. *AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee\-based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity, inclusive employers and will consider all applicants without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third\-party affiliation, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective laws throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.*

title: Full-Stack Developer
description:
At Basic\-Fit, we are on a mission to make fitness accessible for everyone. And we are well on our way! With 4\.1 million members and more than 1,500 clubs in 6 different countries, we are the largest gym chain in Europe, and we’re not slowing down any time soon—we open a new Basic\-Fit almost every day!



One of the reasons we can grow this quickly is because we supercharge our clubs with hardware and software. Because of this our club hosts have more time for our members and it even lets us have clubs accessible 24/7!



We are also very fond of self\-service. We try to make sure that a member has full control over their membership. Going on a long vacation and want to temporarily freeze your membership? There’s a button for that! Canceled your membership but have second thoughts? There’s a button for that! Our goal is that every member is be able to help themselves, whenever they want, wherever they want.



To contribute to our mission we also build features that get our members moving. Either by helping them pick their very first workout or by giving them a little present to get them moving again. We even give users badges for coming to the club!



But be aware, this is not an easy task.



What we do is important to a lot of people, every error and every performance bottleneck can have impact on the fitness experience a member has. As a developer you need to make sure that all our software and hardware runs smoothly. This means the applications you build must handle millions of requests without breaking a sweat, and the hardware needs to be properly serviced and operational across all 6 countries. On top of that Basic\-Fit likes to move quickly, and so do our teams! That’s why we minimize unnecessary rituals and focus on the exciting stuff—building software that really matters.



What it takes to work at Basic\-Fit:


* You need to be a problem solver at heart, using software as your weapon of choice.
* You understand that there is wide array of different people required to make the really big impact, and you are not afraid to knock on some doors to get things done.
* Working at Basic\-Fit means you eat scale and complexity for breakfast, and that growth is a guarantee.
* You are eager to take responsibility and know how to manage risk well.
* You are knowledgeable about your craft and have demonstrated experience with at least some of our tech stack (down below).


And that’s where a smart person like you comes in—if you’re up for the challenge.



Don’t worry, you’ll have plenty of back\-up!



In Tilburg, a talented team awaits you with open arms. In our development teams, you’ll find a mix of:


* React (Native) developers
* Node.js developers
* Product Owners
* Designers
* QA Engineers


To help you become the best version of yourself, you’ll even have a Talent Coach who looks out for your personal growth.



Besides all the amazing people you get to work with, you’ll also have a powerful arsenal of tools at your disposal:



We build our applications with:


* React
* TypeScript
* Tailwind
* Storybook
* Service Workers
* Next.js / Express
* Cypress


We build our APIs with:


* Nest.js
* TypeScript
* Prisma
* Postgres
* Redis
* Azure EventGrid
* Azure ServiceBus


To keep everything running, we use:


* Heroku as our cloud environment
* Azure DevOps for all of our repositories and CI/CD pipelines
* New Relic as our logging, monitoring, and alerting stack
* Akamai as our primary WAF and CDN
* GitHub Copilot as your AI pair\-programming partner


If the challenge, the people, and the software weren’t enough… working at basic\-fit also comes with a few nice perks!


* A free Basic\-Fit gym membership;
* We host internal hackathons (sometimes even in the club!)
* An informal (you can wear jeans and sneakers if you like), international (many cultures and languages) and friendly, down\-to\-earth environment;
* Plenty of opportunities for your own initiatives and to make an impact;
* Unlimited access to the online training courses of LinkedinLearning and GoodHabitz;
* Good benefits, including travel allowance, a bicycle plan, discount on additional health insurance, work from home allowance and participation in our pension scheme (Basic\-Fit pays 52% of the premium);
* We work hybrid, this means 3 days at the office and 2 days remote by a fulltime workweek;
* You will be working in a brand\-new office in the Plan\-T building next to Tilburg Central Station;
* A beautiful gym (fitness equipment, spinning bikes, virtual group lessons) at our headquarters which you can use anytime.

Apply for this job



You can apply via the button, and we will inform you as soon as possible. The process consists of two interviews in our office.



Before applying, please make sure you are eligible to work in the Netherlands. Unfortunately, we do not sponsor new work visa or permits for this position. If you already have a sponsorship, it is possible to transfer this sponsorship to Basic\-Fit.



If you have any questions, please contact Dorus (Corporate Recruiter) via dorus.wolters@basic\-fit.com.
company_description: Our mission is to make fitness accessible to everyone and a habit you love.

title: Senior Product Engineer (Growth)
description:
n8n is a workflow automation platform that uniquely combines AI capabilities with business process automation. We give technical teams the flexibility of code with the speed of no\-code, backed by a passionate community of builders. With 500\+ integrations and fair\-code principles, we're revolutionizing how businesses connect their systems and processes.


We were founded end of 2019 and currently:


* We’re a diverse team of \+ 90 talented people Our annual recurring revenue is growing 3x year\-over\-year
* ️ With \+70k GitHub stars, we are in the top 150 most popular projects of all time on Github
* We’re Europe’s 25th fastest growing startup in 2024 according to Sifted
* We now count a total of $58m in funding: we were Sequoia's first seed investment in Germany, and most recently secured our €35m Series B (February 2025 \- led by Highland)

**Missions**


As a **Senior Product Engineer on our new Growth team**, your mission would be to build and iterate on features and systems that drive user acquisition, activation, and retention—ultimately accelerating n8n’s self\-serve growth engine.


This is a unique opportunity to be a founding engineer on a high\-impact team where you’ll collaborate closely with product, design, marketing, and engineering peers to improve the entire Cloud user journey—from sign\-up to subscription.

 **What You’ll Do**

**Improve and maintain growth\-critical features** – You’ll take ownership of flows like signup, onboarding, and the admin dashboard to ensure a smooth, performant experience for every new user

**Ship high\-impact experiments** – You’ll design, build, and A/B test new features to increase conversion and retention — think upgrade flows, contextual prompts, or new pricing nudges

**Scale our growth systems** – You’ll help build and optimize services to enable user growth at scale, like in\-app messaging platforms, billing systems, and email orchestration tools

**Drive measurable business outcomes \-** Your work will directly contribute to n8n’s ARR, user retention, and growth KPIs. You'll track performance, identify areas to improve, and ship iteratively to increase activation and retention

 **Projects You Might Tackle**

* Adding social login and personalization to our signup flow to optimise the signup funnel
* Building new upgrade and downgrade flows to optimize conversion and retention
* Building an in\-app notification platform to push and orchestrate messages to users

**Requirements**
----------------

**Who You Are \& What You’ll Bring**

* **5\+ years of full\-stack engineering experience** with **TypeScript/JavaScript**, **Node.js**, and **Vue** or **React** (plus HTML/CSS/UI libraries)
* Experience building **user\-facing SaaS products** end\-to\-end in a start\-up environment
* **Product mindedness**: you deeply care about the user experience and business impact
* **Comfort with ambiguity:** You don’t wait for perfect specs, designs, or ideal conditions. You move forward with what’s available and iterate quickly. You know when to ship a fast MVP and when to design for scale.
* **Speed \+ ownership mindset:** You move fast but responsibly, understanding that experimentation and velocity are core to unlocking growth.

 **Nice\-to\-have**

* Data fluency – You know how to interpret metrics and make decisions based on user behavior and experiments.
* Experience with CI pipelines, cloud deployments, or DevOps tooling
* Exposure to pricing strategy, funnel optimization, or revenue KPIs
* Past experience as a founder or early\-stage startup engineer

**Interested in learning more about our engineering teams?**  

Check out our different teams to get a better understanding of what they do: Discover Engineering at n8n. Please check all our engineering openings and apply to the team that feels like the best fit for you.

*n8n is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*

*We can sponsor visas to Germany; for any other country, you need to have existing right to work.*

***Our company language is English.***

*You care about diversity and inclusion? We do too! Check out our* *Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging initiatives at n8n* *(**https://www.notion.so/n8n/Diversity\-inclusion\-and\-belonging\-n8n\-c1bec2fff536422d868b1a438d990e35**).*

***Location disclaimer:*** *If you see multiple job postings for the same role, it is most likely because we're hiring remotely for this role and posting in different locations to make sure every potential candidate can see the role. Please apply to the location you're the most likely to work from in the future.*

**Benefits**
------------

* **Competitive compensation** – We offer fair and attractive pay.
* **Ownership** – Our core value is to “empower others,” and we mean it—you’ll get a slice of n8n with equity.
* **Work/life balance** – We work hard but ensure you have time to recharge:


	+ **Europe:** 30 days of vacation, plus public holidays wherever you are.
	+ **US:** 15 vacation days, 8 sick days, plus public holidays wherever you are.
* **Health \& wellness** –


	+ **Europe:** We provide benefits according to local country norms.\*
	+ **US:** Comprehensive medical (PPO 1200\), dental, and vision plans.
* **Future planning** –


	+ **Europe:** We provide pension contributions according to local country norms.\*
	+ **US:** 401(k) retirement plan.
* **Financial security** –


	+ **Europe:** We provide benefits according to local country norms.\*
	+ **US:** Short\-term \& long\-term disability insurance, life \& AD\&D coverage, and additional hospital coverage.
* **Career growth** – We hire rising stars who grow with us! You’ll get €1K (or equivalent) per year to spend on courses, books, events, or coaching to level up your skills.
* **A passionate team** – We love our product, and we prove it with regular hackathons where we see who can build the coolest thing with it!
* **Remote\-first** – Our team works remotely across Europe, with regular off\-sites for team bonding. Some roles, like sales in the US, are hybrid—please check the job description.
* **Giving back** – We're big fans of open source, and you'll get $100 per month to support projects you care about.
* **Transparency** – We all know what everyone’s working on, how the company is doing—the whole shebang.
* **An ambitious but kind culture** – People love working here—our eNPS for 2024 is 94!
* *Country\-specific details are provided in your contract.*

title: Senior Product Engineer (Enterprise features)
description:
n8n is a workflow automation platform that uniquely combines AI capabilities with business process automation. We give technical teams the flexibility of code with the speed of no\-code, backed by a passionate community of builders. With 500\+ integrations and fair\-code principles, we're revolutionizing how businesses connect their systems and processes.


We were founded end of 2019 and currently:


* We’re a diverse team of \+ 90 talented people Our annual recurring revenue is growing 3x year\-over\-year
* ️ With \+70k GitHub stars, we are in the top 150 most popular projects of all time on Github
* We’re Europe’s 25th fastest growing startup in 2024 according to Sifted
* We now count a total of $58m in funding: we were Sequoia's first seed investment in Germany, and most recently secured our €35m Series B (February 2025 \- led by Highland)


As a **Senior Product Engineer** on the **Payday** team (Enterprise features), you won't just write code—you’ll **solve business problems for our enterprise users**. Your primary focus will be on **designing**, **building**, and **delivering high\-impact features** that address the needs of larger teams using n8n.  

You’ll **own features end\-to\-end** and work across the stack, **collaborating closely with Product and Design** to translate complex requirements into robust, scalable, and user\-friendly solutions.
  

We're looking for someone who brings strong engineering skills *and* a **product mindset**—someone who cares about user impact, focusing on *why* we're building something just as much as *how*.  

  

**What we've shipped**  

To give you a better idea of the impact you can have, here are some examples of features and improvements recently delivered for our enterprise users:

* **Centralised insights dashboard** providing administrators with a real\-time overview of instance health, and workflow execution performance, enabling better monitoring, visibility, and confidence in managing large\-scale n8n deployments.
* **Enhanced Role\-Based Access Control (RBAC)** allowing allowing administrators to precisely control user access to workflows, credentials, and execution data, improving security and compliance.
* **Git\-backed Environments** to enable teams to adopt safer development lifecycles (e.g. Development, Staging, Production), allowing controlled versioning and promotion of workflows without impacting live automation workflows.

 **What you'll bring**

* **5\+ years** of professional software engineering experience, primarily focused on building web applications or SaaS products.
* Strong proficiency in **Node.js** and **TypeScript/JavaScript**.
* Experience working with **Vue.js** or other modern frontend frameworks (e.g. React, Angular).
* Experience in **designing, building, and consuming robust APIs** (e.g. RESTful, GraphQL).
* Solid understanding of **relational databases** (e.g. PostgreSQL) and SQL.
* Experience **shipping features end\-to\-end** in a product\-driven environment, demonstrating ownership from concept to deployment.
* Experience with **modern testing practices** and frameworks (e.g. Jest, Vitest, Cypress).
* **Excellent communication and collaboration skills**, with a track record of working effectively in cross\-functional teams
* You’re **curious** and you **love learning new things**.
* You value feedback, believe in continuous learning, and enjoy working with others to create a positive team environment.

**Nice to have / bonus points**

* Experience developing features specifically for **enterprise software** (e.g. Role\-Based Access Control (RBAC), Single Sign\-On (SSO)).
* Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and containerisation (Docker, Kubernetes).
* Experience contributing to or working with **open\-source projects**.
* Familiarity with workflow automation concepts or platforms.

 **Interested in learning more about our engineering teams?**  

Check out our different teams to get a better understanding of what they do: Discover Engineering at n8n. Please check all our engineering openings and apply to the team that feels like the best fit for you.

*n8n is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*

*We can sponsor visas to Germany; for any other country, you need to have existing right to work.*

***Our company language is English.***

*You care about diversity and inclusion? We do too! Check out our* *Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging initiatives at n8n* *(**https://www.notion.so/n8n/Diversity\-inclusion\-and\-belonging\-n8n\-c1bec2fff536422d868b1a438d990e35**).*

***Location disclaimer:*** *If you see multiple job postings for the same role, it is most likely because we're hiring remotely for this role and posting in different locations to make sure every potential candidate can see the role. Please apply to the location you're the most likely to work from in the future.*

**Benefits**
------------

* **Competitive compensation** – We offer fair and attractive pay.
* **Ownership** – Our core value is to “empower others,” and we mean it—you’ll get a slice of n8n with equity.
* **Work/life balance** – We work hard but ensure you have time to recharge:


	+ **Europe:** 30 days of vacation, plus public holidays wherever you are.
	+ **US:** 15 vacation days, 8 sick days, plus public holidays wherever you are.
* **Health \& wellness** –


	+ **Europe:** We provide benefits according to local country norms.\*
	+ **US:** Comprehensive medical (PPO 1200\), dental, and vision plans.
* **Future planning** –


	+ **Europe:** We provide pension contributions according to local country norms.\*
	+ **US:** 401(k) retirement plan.
* **Financial security** –


	+ **Europe:** We provide benefits according to local country norms.\*
	+ **US:** Short\-term \& long\-term disability insurance, life \& AD\&D coverage, and additional hospital coverage.
* **Career growth** – We hire rising stars who grow with us! You’ll get €1K (or equivalent) per year to spend on courses, books, events, or coaching to level up your skills.
* **A passionate team** – We love our product, and we prove it with regular hackathons where we see who can build the coolest thing with it!
* **Remote\-first** – Our team works remotely across Europe, with regular off\-sites for team bonding. Some roles, like sales in the US, are hybrid—please check the job description.
* **Giving back** – We're big fans of open source, and you'll get $100 per month to support projects you care about.
* **Transparency** – We all know what everyone’s working on, how the company is doing—the whole shebang.
* **An ambitious but kind culture** – People love working here—our eNPS for 2024 is 94!
* *Country\-specific details are provided in your contract.*

title: Data Scientist AI/ML in Product Development (ENG)
description:
**Requisition Number:** 23584BR


**Description:**


Are you a data scientist with a passion for AI and machine learning? Do you want to work on groundbreaking projects that shape the future of environmental management and data engineering? At Stantec in the Netherlands, you'll have the opportunity to use your skills for innovative solutions that make a real impact on the world around us. All from a sustainability perspective to improve our living environment, accelerate the energy transition, and reduce societal costs.


At Stantec, we combine cutting\-edge technologies with in\-depth knowledge of environmental management to fully relieve our clients. With the Soil Risk Map, we quickly, affordably, and pragmatically provide advice on underground risks such as soil contamination, groundwater, unexploded ordnances, ecological and archaeological values. And that's just the beginning. We have ambitious plans to let AI/ML play a central part in our big data product landscape.


As a Data Scientist, you are the driving force behind designing, developing, and implementing AI and machine learning models. You work on improving our products using advanced algorithms and big data technologies, such as Azure Databricks and Azure Data Factory. Our goal? Enable self\-service data access, apply both predictive and generative AI and ensure the business can make faster and better decisions.


At Stantec, you have the freedom to experiment and work with the latest technologies. You design and build CI/CD\-based ETL pipelines within our Azure Landing Zones and closely collaborate with the business to translate their needs into data solutions they can independently manage and use. With your passion for AI/ML and automation, you are a pioneer in creating pipelines that not only integrate and transform data but also open the door to innovation and autonomy for our users.


The multicultural team you'll be joining combines expertise in (geo) data engineering, software development, automated testing, UI/UX design, and environmental management. As a dev team, we meet at least once a week at the Delft office for planning, retro, and refinement. A joint lunch outing is more the rule than the exception. We also periodically visit our other locations in the Netherlands.


Our way of working is scrum infused with agile principles. We primarily focus on developing and delivering long\-term solutions that solve problems for an entire industry or market. Currently, we're focused on accelerating the energy transition, automated ETL processes, and smarter data analyses using the latest techniques. We see this way of working as a perfect fit to maintain and increase engagement with customers, the organization, and team members. As a team, we set clear goals and results, giving the development team the freedom to decide how best to achieve them.


What will you be doing?


* Develop and implement AI and Machine Learning models, including supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, to enhance the Stantec Soil Risk Map and other product initiatives.
* Utilize big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, and NoSQL databases to manage and analyze large datasets.
* Collaborate with a scrum team to achieve project goals and meet OKRs, employing agile methodologies and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) practices.
* Serve as the sole expert on AI/ML within the team, demonstrating a high level of self\-reliance and autonomy in decision\-making.
* Educate and mentor other developers on AI/ML concepts and techniques, including neural networks, deep learning, and natural language processing (NLP).
* Communicate complex AI/ML concepts to stakeholders in simple and understandable terms, ensuring alignment with business objectives and technical feasibility.

What are we offering:


* Projects that truly impact people and society.
* A meaningful career with learning and development opportunities.
* A good salary, a year\-end bonus, and a personal choice budget.
* 28 vacation days, with the possibility to buy or sell leave days.
* Working from home arrangement with a monthly internet allowance.
* Flexible working with various green mobility options.

**Qualifications:**


* Proven experience in AI and Machine Learning, with expertise in algorithms such as regression, classification, clustering, and reinforcement learning.
* Strong background in big data technologies, including experience with data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and SQL, as well as frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Scikit\-learn.
* A good command of the English language in both spoken and written forms. Proficiency in Dutch is valued.
* It is not mandatory, but a plus when you have experience in / knowledge of version control tools (GIT is preferred), geographic information systems (GIS), and tools like FME, ArcGIS en QGIS.
* Additionally, we are looking for someone who does not hesitate to test hypotheses without knowing the outcomes, enjoys proactively sharing ideas, and gets energized by working in a team.

**About Stantec:**


At Stantec, you are given the freedom and trust to work in your own way. Sustainability is our priority in both our operations and projects. We support sustainable initiatives worldwide and integrate them into the market and for our clients. Our culture is centered around connection and collaboration, with a genuine commitment to inclusion, diversity, and equality. Sustainability is part of our DNA, and we work on projects that truly impact people and society.


**Additional Information:**


Apply now! Help build our DEV\-team and become a shaper of sustainable change. Send your CV and motivation letter to hr.continentaleurope@stantec.com.


Do you have any questions about this vacancy? Contact our Product owner: Christiaan Jolly


Tel: 06\-22775689


Mail: christiaan.jolly@stantec.com


For more information about Stantec; www.stantec.com/nl/werkenbij


An assessment may be part of the procedure.


Applications can be submitted until 1st May 2025\.


**Work Location(s):**


Netherlands \- Oosterhout, Netherlands\-Arnhem, Netherlands\-Breda, Netherlands\-Delft


**Employment Type:** Full\-Time or Part\-Time


**Job Type:** Regular


**Job Category:** Environmental Engineer, Technical Advisor
company_description: Stantec is a global leader in sustainable engineering, architecture, and environmental consulting. We are a community of more than 31,000 employees working in over 450 locations across 6 continents.

title: Data & AI Platform Lead
description:
+ Rotterdam

+ IT
+ From 32 Hours Per Week

Are you ambitious and entrepreneurial? Do you get energized by enabling the energy transition and climate adaptation using data and AI solutions? Is data democratization in your DNA? Then Van Oordis looking for you as Data \& AI Platform Lead!
THE POSITION
Digitalisation is one of Van Oord’s strategic themes. As the Data \& AI Platform Lead in the Data and Analytics team, you will play a role in unlocking value from our data and contribute to our purpose: “To create a better world for future generations by delivering Data Driven Marine Ingenuity”. We're looking for a Data \& AI Platform Lead to connect with our business stakeholders and drive data democratization across the organization, such that data sharing is the norm and everyone is an analyst.


As the Data \& AI Platform lead, you'll bridge business strategy and technical implementation while fostering data democratization throughout Van Oord. You’ll lead a team of five motivated data \& AI engineers from our head office in Rotterdam to carry out Van Oord’s data \& AI strategy. You are successful if the organisation is successful in working with data

  

YOUR IMPACT* Define and execute the platform roadmap through close collaboration with stakeholders across the organization
* Translate organizational strategy into a compelling platform vision with targeted features and capabilities
* Champion a platform\-as\-product philosophy, emphasizing self\-service capabilities
* Lead an agile team, providing coaching and mentorship to ensure excellence
* Expand platform adoption by making data and analytics accessible to all employees
* Cultivate new customer relationships and strengthen existing partnerships
* Drive the technical evolution of our big data and AI architecture

ABOUT YOU
You are a strong communicator, pro\-active, analytical person with a love for IT and its systems. You speak up when necessary and offer help and advice where relevant.


Furthermore, you have

* 8\+ years of experience in data \& analytics roles with technical and/or product leadership responsibility
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex technical concepts
* Strong background in big data architecture and data \& AI platform technologies, such as Azure Synapse, Azure ML, and Databricks
* Demonstrated success in agile environments
* Experience implementing and advocating for self\-service analytics capabilities
  

WE OFFER YOU
We offer you a role where you will make a significant contribution to our mission of 'building a better world for future generations'. Additionally, we offer you:

* A salary that matches your responsibilities and experience;
* Attractive travel allowance (€0,31 per km) and home working allowance (€2\.40 per day);
* 32 holidays (of which a maximum of 7 are collective);
* Variable bonus, partly dependent on company results;
* Attractive pension scheme;
* Option for collective health insurance (Van Oord pays for your supplementary package);
* Flexible home working arrangement; on a full\-time basis, you can work from home 2 days a week;
* Extensive development opportunities, including a comprehensive online academy via Goodhabitz;
* Communities to join, such as Young Van Oord, Van Oord Women, and the Van Oord staff association;
* Various events and sports activities, such as skiing, sailing weekends, cycling, and motorcycling.

  

Acquisition in response to this vacancy is not appreciated.

title: Digital Twin Engineer
description:
Gradyent is looking for Engineers in digital twin technology, AI, and energy efficiency



Join our talent community to explore FY 2025 opportunities and help shape our district heating systems



Full\-time · Rotterdam, Netherlands



**About Gradyent**
------------------



Providing heating and cooling for homes, buildings and industry accounts for roughly 50% of global energy consumption. Smart production, exchange, and consumption of heat in heating grids is the most significant opportunity for cities and industries to decarbonise. Yet, as heating grids transform towards renewables, they become increasingly complex and require a new approach to control and design.



Gradyent is a leading software provider that helps cities and heavy industry decarbonise faster by digitising, optimising, and transforming their heat networks with our Digital Twin. We are scaling the platform globally and looking for a driven Senior Product Analyst to support our product team.



**What you will do**
--------------------



Our tech team consists of several teams: the Back\-End, Front\-End, Digital Twin and Cloud team.



We are looking for a digital twin engineer to join our Digital Twin team (consisting of software engineers, digital twin engineers and data analysts). We are a passionate team at the intersection of software development and engineering, aiming to maximize our sustainable impact through our SaaS platform. As part of the Digital Twin team, you will be working on a layer of intelligence (a combination of physics, mathematics and machine learning) that simulates, analyses and optimizes heat networks. As a digital twin engineer you will be building generalized software that can be configured by the colleagues in the Customer Solutions \& Operations team. As a digital twin engineer you specifically focus on improving our models, control strategies, parameter estimation, and optimization strategies. These models could range from pipe flow calculations to heat source modelling, and from demand forecasting to time delayed heat transfer.


**Our high level stack:** Python, GCP, UbiOps, DuckDB, MongoDB, Parquet, Polars.


**Responsibilities**
--------------------


* Understanding the hydraulical and thermodynamical behaviour of heating systems
* Writing scalable and efficient Python code where performance is key
* Using and extending our digital twin software in state\-of\-the\-art projects
* Research and development of new experimental digital twin features
* Collaborating with software engineers and solution engineers
* Take lead in larger projects/epics where you will guide several junior engineers in day\-to\-day
* Managing your tasks, planning, and potentially a sub\-component of our product


**Who you are**
---------------



Don’t meet all of the requirements but still enthusiastic and think you can make a difference? Apply!


**NOTE:** We only consider applicants that are already based in The Netherlands


* BSc/MSc in applied physics, mathematics, mechanical engineering, computer science or equivalent
* 1\-5 years of experience in similar role
* Expertise in Python software development and software engineering principles. At least 1\+ years of hands on experience
* Team player
* High degree of ownership and strong intrinsic drive
* Experience with Git
* Knowledge of fluid dynamics and thermodynamics
* Knowledge of simulation, control systems, parameter estimation, and/or optimization
* And nice to have (not required):
	+ Knowledge of machine learning and ML OPS
	+ Familiarity with GIS data and QGIS

**What we offer**
-----------------


* A very ambitious scale\-up: raised Series A from an international consortium of investors in the sustainable energy industry, approaching Series B
* The opportunity to directly impact sustainability and the energy transition in a senior role.
* Being part of a mission to make the world more sustainable by reducing losses in heating: the most significant opportunity for cities to decarbonise.
* A competitive salary with a variable incentive (SAR) on top.
* An excellent benefits package and fantastic team events.
* A great scale\-up dynamic with a high\-performance culture while having fun (drinks, offsites, sports events).
* Full flexibility of working location, including an inspiring location in Berlin where our (currently seven) German colleagues meet regularly if they want to work face to face
* We invest in your personal growth – the team is competent at coaching, mentoring and development, entirely focused on you (and not on completing some rusty HR process).
* Get unique opportunities to shape your path in a fast\-growing team.

title: Data Engineer

Your contributions will support predictive modelling to optimise marketing spend, personalise customer experiences, and anticipate demand trends.

title: Forecast Operations Engineer
description:
We are Dexter Energy! We are an **Amsterdam\-based scale\-up** that’s building **AI\-based forecasting and optimization products** to help renewable energy companies become **more predictable and profitable**, helping push fossil fuels out of the market, and speeding up the energy transition. Our mission is to enable a sustainable and affordable power system that changes the energy market. We truly believe we can make a significant impact on climate change.

#### **Your team**


This position is part of the **Customer Success team**. This team ensures that our AI\-based forecasting and optimisation products are live and running smoothly with our energy clients.

#### **Role overview**


As our **Forecast Operations Engineer**, As Forecast Operations Engineer you will be the key source of knowledge on Dexter’s forecasting platform for our clients. Together with the Customer Success Managers you will be driving our operational excellence and striving for an exceptional customer experience.

  

Are you an analytical person who values open communication and embraces challenges? Read along!

#### **Responsibilities**

* You will be responsible our **energy customers' full technical lifecycle**: from pilot to integration, to expansion, and to operational excellence.
* The crucial element is **operational excellence**: ensuring technical integrations progress efficiently and smoothly, monitoring product performance, validating operational data flows, and proactively helping customers where you can.
* You will be an **internal product advocate**, tracking product processes and contributing to the platform by synthesizing feedback you get back from customers into actionable issues.
* You will be customers’ key **source of knowledge on the Dexter platform** and APIs, the underlying web technologies, and industry\-standard integration methods and best practices.

#### **Why consider this role?**

**Mission** – Minimising balancing risk and maximizing trade profits for renewable energy companies.  

**Smart Colleagues** – Experts in mathematics, physics, energy, and meteorology.  

**Ambitious, Supportive Culture** – A place where high performance meets genuine care for people.  

**AI \& Forecasting** – Core components of our product.

#### **What we offer**

* Our salary is in the **top 30% of the market**
* We offer a **NS Business card** or a **Swapfiets**
* A personal **Learning \& Development budget**, plus a dedicated **Learning \& Development Day every month**
* A healthy, flexible work environment with **trust, ownership**, and **room for your ideas**
* Budget for home office setup
* **Chef\-prepared office lunch**, 5 min from Amstelstation

#### **About you**


To be successful in this role, you’ll at least need:

* A **university degree** in Computer Science, Econometrics, Mathematics, or a related technical field
* **At least 2 years experience in a customer facing role in the energy domain**, ideally working with forecasting or trading systems
* Hands\-on skills with **Python**, and preferably **SQL** and tools like Pandas or Jupyter Notebook
* At least **two signs of excellence**, e.g. rapid career growth, experience in high\-barrier companies, academic achievements (PhD is a plus)
* Experience working with **APIs** and navigating technical systems
* A strong interest in clean energy and solving complex operational challenges

**Join Dexter Energy as a Forecast Operations Engineer**, where you'll harness the power of data to drive the renewable energy revolution.

  

Apply now and be part of an inclusive, innovative team that is shaping the future of sustainable energy.  

  

*Dexter is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.*

title: Regional Marketing Specialist
description:
MongoDB's mission is to empower innovators to create, transform, and disrupt industries by unleashing the power of software and data. We enable organizations of all sizes to easily build, scale, and run modern applications by helping them modernize legacy workloads, embrace innovation, and unleash AI. Our industry\-leading developer data platform, MongoDB Atlas, is the only globally distributed, multi\-cloud database and is available in more than 115 regions across AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. Atlas allows customers to build and run applications anywhere—on premises, or across cloud providers. With offices worldwide and over 175,000 new developers signing up to use MongoDB every month, it's no wonder that leading organizations, like Samsung and Toyota, trust MongoDB to build next\-generation, AI\-powered applications.



This role works in close alignment with the sales and marketing teams to drive MongoDB's value proposition and go\-to\-market strategy supporting sales in the Nordics and Benelux region. You'll own relationships across MongoDB's marketing and sales network to ensure we are positioned to access, leverage, and collaborate effectively while executing our yearly plan.



You will monitor results of field marketing programs that generate new prospects and advance existing opportunities and work closely with other teams to develop and share best practices and industry trends across marketing.



This role requires travel of up to 30% and is optional remote. Availability to join the local team in the MongoDB office in Amsterdam on a hybrid cadence is a plus.  

  

We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in Amsterdam for our hybrid working model.


### **Candidate Profile**



Our ideal candidate for this role will have the following:


* 3\+ years experience in Field Marketing with event/ marketing experience
* Demonstration of a metrics\-driven approach to success and can show Return on Investment by supervising results from funded/co\-marketing activity against budget
* Fluent in English and Dutch
* Highly results\-driven with strong analytical ability
* Experience working cross functionally with sales, customer success and partner teams
* Excellent written and oral communications skills
* Strong project management skills
* Salesforce experience a plus
* Problem solving skills
* Time management, prioritization, and organizational skills are key
* Ability to shift priorities and help other team members as needed

### **Position Expectations**


* Closely integrate with regional Account Executives, supporting the needs of their territory and executing regional marketing strategies
* Understand the needs of the market and develop programs and campaigns to drive top of funnel awareness and bottom funnel conversions
* Working in collaboration with the Field Marketing team, build and execute a lead generation plan that delivers significant inbound, qualified leads and pipeline growth to hit targets
* Work with events team to coordinate local programs and enable the sales team to make the most of them
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams when crafting integrated marketing campaigns
* Work closely with the xDR teams to ensure rigorous follow up of all marketing leads across your region
* Communicate and educate the sales team regarding new and planned marketing activities including global, regional, and local programs
* Ensure performance and return on investment are supervised, supporting processes set up to optimally measure outcomes
* Coordinate MongoDB sponsored trade shows, events and digital programs from end to end
* In collaboration with our global marketing team support the coordination of local content strategy by understanding our key audiences and industries
* Support the digital assets needed to drive specific activities (set\-up of landing pages, webinars \& events registration, email campaigns, follow up)
* Generate ideas for, and assist with, the creation of high\-quality marketing content for the region (e.g. video, customer stories, blog articles)
* Analyze and provide insights on campaign performance and propose any improvements needed

### **Success Measures**



The Field Marketing Specialist will be successful in this role when they can execute the following strategic tasks/responsibilities


* In 3 months you'll have cultivated a relationship with your regional Account Executives, understand their top target accounts, and grasped the MarTechStack to begin planning field marketing opportunities, you will be able to analyze regional campaign performance
* In 6 months you'll have a clear understanding of your key objectives, have executed events, and have started to become a trusted partner to your field marketing colleagues, sales leaders and manager
* In 12 months you'll have cultivated relationship across internal MongoDB teams and have executed tailored programs, co\-produced partner events using the MongoDB partnership ecosystem, contributed to creating an integrated plan in region, maintained flawless reporting of all programs to ensure success, and have a stake in future programming


To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we're committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees' wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it's like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!



MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.



MongoDB is an equal opportunities employer.

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
**YOUR ROLE**
-------------

**As a Mechanical Engineer at Capgemini Engineering, you will work on cutting\-edge projects in precision mechanics, system dynamics, tribology, and mechatronics. You will be involved in the entire development process, from concept to full\-scale production, helping to shape next\-generation machines and systems. Your responsibilities include:**

* **Delivering mechanical designs across all development phases, from specifications to prototype qualification.**
* **Ensuring high\-quality technical documentation, including 3D models, Bill of Materials, and Technical Product Documentation.**
* **Collaborating with multidisciplinary teams to integrate mechanical systems into complex engineering solutions.**
* **Applying GD\&T and advanced manufacturing technologies to develop innovative solutions.**
**YOUR PROFILE**
----------------

**We are looking for a proactive engineer who thrives in a multidisciplinary environment. You bring:**

* **A university degree in mechanical engineering, aerospace engineering, or a related field.**
* **3 to 15 years of experience as a mechanical design engineer, with expertise in GD\&T and manufacturing technologies.**
* **Proficiency in 3D CAD modeling (preferably Siemens NX) and experience with PLM systems such as Teamcenter.**
* **Strong analytical and coordination skills to drive projects and meet client expectations.**
**WHAT YOU’LL LOVE ABOUT WORKING HERE**
---------------------------------------

* **Challenging projects in innovative, high\-tech industries with a global impact.**
* **A strong technical community, where you can collaborate with top engineers and expand your expertise.**
* **Career growth opportunities, supported by mentoring, development programs, and leadership training.**
**NEED TO KNOW**
----------------

* **A permanent contract and a salary aligned with your experience level.**
* **26 vacation days, with the option to buy additional leave.**
* **Capgemini contributes to your pension. Additionally, you also have the flexibility to make additional contributions yourself.**
* **Work wherever you want on a device of your choice with our connectivity allowance. A fast laptop and a SIM card that you can also use privately.**
**NOTE**
--------

**To ensure safety and integrity within our organization, an identity check and background check are part of the onboarding process.**

**DISCLAIMER**
--------------

**At Capgemini, we believe in a workplace where everyone feels valued for who they are is part of our DNA and instrumental to our long\-term performance. We are building broad talent pools to be able to provide high quality capabilities to our clients, with the right skills and talent mix.**

**ABOUT CAPGEMINI**
-------------------

**Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55\-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end\-to\-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22\.1 billion.**

**Get the Future You Want \|** **www.capgemini.com**

-------------

description:

-------------

**As an Embedded Software Engineer at Capgemini Engineering, you will be part of our Software Engineering division, a dynamic team of 200 professionals. Working in a multidisciplinary SCRUM team, you will contribute to the entire embedded software development lifecycle for advanced machines, devices, and appliances for one of our clients in the high\-tech.**
