title: Principal AI/Machine Learning Engineer
description:
At Skillsoft, we propel organizations and people to grow together through transformative learning experiences. We believe every team member has the potential to be AMAZING. Join us in our quest to transform learning and help individuals unleash their edge.


Skillsoft is the global leader in eLearning. Trusted by the world's leading organizations, including 65% of the Fortune 500\. Our 100,000\+ courses, videos and books are accessed over 100 million times every month, across more than 100 countries. At Skillsoft, we believe knowledge is the fuel for innovation and innovation is the fuel for business growth. Join us in our quest to democratize learning and help individuals unleash their edge.  

  

Are you ready to shape the future of learning through cutting\-edge AI? As a Principal AI/Machine Learning Engineer at Skillsoft, you'll dive into the heart of innovation, crafting intelligent systems that empower millions worldwide. From designing generative AI solutions to pioneering agentic workflows, you'll collaborate with internal and external teams to transform knowledge into a catalyst for growth—unleashing your edge while helping others do the same. Join us in redefining eLearning for the world's leading organizations!

 **Responsibilities****:**

* Hands\-on Principal AI/ML engineer, driving technical innovation
* Partner with product owners to define visionary AI features
* Collaborate cross\-functionally to assess impacts of new AI capabilities
* Consult and guide teams to productize prototypes with provable accuracy
* Lead research and selection of COTS and development of in\-house AI/ML technologies
* Evaluate foundational models and emerging AI advancements
* Explore new technologies and design patterns through impactful prototypes
* Present research and insights to inspire innovation across teams
* Guide, design and testing of agentic workflows and prompt engineering
* Fine\-tune models, validate efficacy with metrics, and ensure reliability
* Evaluate and guide synthetic data generation for training and validation
* Design and guide scalable data pipelines for AI/ML training and inference
* Oversee data analysis, curation, and preprocessing
* Collaborate with external partners on AI development and integration
* Establish AI design best practices and standards for alignment
* Contribute to patentable AI innovations
* Utilize and apply generative AI to increase productivity for yourself and the organization
 **Environment,** **Tools \&** **Technologies:**

* Agile/Scrum
* Operating Systems – Mac, Linux
* JavaScript, Node.js, Python
* PyTorch, Tensorflow, Keras, OpenAI, Anthropic, and friends
* Langchain, Langgraph, etc.
* APIs GraphQL, REST
* Docker, Kubernetes
* Amazon Web Services (AWS), MS Azure
* Sagemaker, NIMS
* SQL: Postgres RDS
* NoSQL: Cassandra, Elasticsearch (VectorDb)
* Messaging – Kafka, RabbitMQ, SQS
* Monitoring – Prometheus, ELK
* GitHub, IDE (your choice)
**Skills \& Qualifications:**

* 8\+ Years of Relevant Industry Experience (with a Master's Degree Preferred)
* Experience with LLMs and fine\-tuning foundation models
* Development experience including unit testing
* Design and documentation experience of new APIs, data models, service interactions
* Familiarity with and ability to explain:
* Agentic AI development and testing
* AI security and data privacy concerns
* Synthetic data generation and concerns
* Foundation model fine\-tuning
* Generative AI prompt engineering and challenges
**Attributes** **for Success****:**

* Proactive, Independent, Adaptable
* Collaborative team player
* Customer service minded with an ownership mindset
* Excellent analytic and communication skills
* Ability and desire to coach and mentor other developers
* Passionate, curious, open to new ideas, and ability to research and learn new technologies
### **MORE ABOUT SKILLSOFT:**



Skillsoft delivers online learning, training, and talent solutions to help organizations **unleash their edge**. Leveraging immersive, engaging content, Skillsoft enables organizations to unlock the potential in their best assets – their people – and build teams with the skills they need for success. Empowering 36 million learners and counting, Skillsoft democratizes learning through an intelligent learning experience and a customized, learner\-centric approach to skills development with resources for Leadership Development, Business Skills, Technology \& Development, Digital Transformation, and Compliance.



Skillsoft is partner to thousands of leading global organizations, including many Fortune 500 companies. The company features three award\-winning systems that support learning, performance and success: Skillsoft learning content, the Percipio intelligent learning experience platform, which offers measurable impact across the entire employee lifecycle. Learn more at www.skillsoft.com.


**Thank you for taking the time to learn more about us.**  

**If this opportunity intrigues you, we would love for you to apply!**



NOTE TO EMPLOYMENT AGENCIES: We value the partnerships we have built with our preferred vendors. Skillsoft does not accept unsolicited resumes from employment agencies. All resumes submitted by employment agencies directly to any Skillsoft employee or hiring manager in any form without a signed Skillsoft Employment Agency Agreement on file and search engagement for that position will be deemed unsolicited in nature. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is subsequently hired as a result of the referral or through other means.



Skillsoft is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information, and other legally protected categories.

title: Commercial Performance Analyst d/f/m
description:
**Commercial Performance Analyst d/f/m**
----------------------------------------

* **Location(s):**
* Geertruidenberg, Noord Brabant, NL, 4931 NC
* Swindon, Wiltshire, GB, SN5 6PB
* Essen, NW, DE, 45141
**RWE Generation SE**  

**To start as soon as possible, full time, permanent**

**About the role**

* Analyse value contribution across from portfolio view.
* Perform benchmarks of RWE Generation SE portfolio vs. the market.
* Commercial interface to RWE Supply \& Trading, analyse and challenge commercial strategies from a portfolio perspective.
* Identify optimization potential on a portfolio level and derive according measures.
* Analyse infrastructural / general cost and optimization potential.
* Interact with RWEG’s AI development for use in portfolio optimization.
* Moderate a technology\-overarching fair cost valuation on potential conflicts.

**Job requirements and experience**

* Economic/technical education (university degree) as well as at least 3 years’ experience from working in the energy industry.
* Expertise in performing business evaluations under complex conditions.
* Profound experience in the power industry including plant operation \& maintenance.
* Interpersonal skills in dealing with conflicting targets and convincing people.
* Fluent English; German and Dutch skills are an advantage but not essential.

RWE is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment – we value your passion, your willingness to learn and your desire to thrive. So, if you don’t display all the skills above but think this is the job for you, need flexible working arrangements or adjustments which aren’t outlined already, we would still like to hear from you.  



  

**Your Benefits**

* Independent, responsible, and flexible work with the freedom to develop and implement ideas and innovations.
* A diverse team with a strong collaborative spirit in a dynamic and international work environment.
* Flexible work options both in the office and from home (Hybrid Working).
* Various qualification and development opportunities for professional and personal growth.
Attractive remuneration and additional benefits, such as employer\-funded pension plans and employee discounts.  
* 

**Apply with just a few clicks:** ad code **89884** , application period: **17\.05\.2025**  

Any questions: **Contact HR:** Nuria Hetschel, \+49 172 8605977
  

  

We look forward to meeting you. Of course, you can find us on LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, YouTube and Xing, too.
  

  

We value diversity and therefore welcome all applications \- regardless of gender, disability, nationality, ethnic and social origin, religion/belief, age, sexual orientation, and identity. \#inclusionmatters
  

  

RWE Generation is Europe’s second biggest gas company. Its approximately 3,000 employees \- among them many specialist technicians and engineers \- operate power plants in Germany, the UK, the Netherlands and Turkey and are moving with purpose towards our vision for a clean future. With hydropower and biomass plants already online, they blend conventional energy expertise with renewables innovation.
  

  

We are bridging the gap to the age of renewables by focusing on hydrogen, biomass and battery storage. By converting our power plant fleets to carbon\-neutral fuels such as hydrogen and biomass, and successfully developing new storage technologies RWE Generation is making a key contribution to our ambitious goals. You'll discover we are continuously challenging ourselves creating a team that’s built on trust and respect.

title: Analyst/Reporting Specialist at Investments, Corporate Finance
description:
Within the Investment team based in Amsterdam, we’re currently looking for an **Analyst/Reporting specialist Corporate Finance, capable of combining technical/programming skills with affiliation for investments**.


The main responsibilities of the Analyst Corporate Finance are:

* Prepare the Solvency II files and reconciliations relating to investments using programming languages (RStudio, potentially Python at a later stage),
* Identify opportunities to improve the quality of reports produced as well as to achieve process efficiency, while using Excel and programming capabilities,
* Actively support transition between old and new investment administration systems, including managing data enhancement, reconciliations, and cleaning, ensuring proper data administration in the new environment, co\-designing reports answering the current reporting and information sharing demands regarding investment assets,
* Provide in\-depth analysis of the Atradius investment portfolio,
* Liaise with internal and external parties providing information on investments,
* Liaise with various stakeholders in adapting internal systems and processes to the changes within the investment portfolio, in line with the EIOPA updates and IFRS regulations.

**Knowledge, skills and experience**

* Solid experience in Excel and programming languages like R or Python,
* Excellent quantitative and analytical skills,
* Affinity with financial instruments is an advantage,
* Track record of gathering requirements, defining and executing analysis,
* Experience in designing and developing models (e.g. relating to risk, income projections),
* Proven track record in building tools automating generation of enhanced data results, comparisons, visualization of data,
* Being goal\-minded towards efficiency, quality, and practicality,
* Capable of working independently or with minimal supervision, but also being an effective team player,
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills,
* Languages: English is a must, command of Spanish is an advantage,
* Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in Business Economics, Finance, Computer/Data Science, Mathematical Finance, Econometrics,
* Experience with any modern investment administration tool will be an advantage,
* Eligible to work in the Netherlands (without a requirement for a visa).

**Atradius**


The Atradius Group provides trade credit insurance, surety and collections services worldwide, and has a presence through 160 offices in 52 countries. The products offered by Atradius protect companies around the world against the default risks associated with selling goods and services on credit.


At Atradius, we believe in personal development and the Growth Mindset. Our Culture is based on teamwork, reliable accountability, constantly improving and unrivalled service. Read on more on our Career site: https://careers.atradius.com/en/careers.

 **Department Description**


The investment team, being a part of Corporate Finance, Tax \& ESG department, is the centralised unit responsible for developing and implementing the Atradius Group’s investment strategy, maintaining a state\-of\-the\-art investment process, optimising the Group’s investment result, and delivering of the Solvency II data relating to market risk.

 **What do we offer?**

* A dynamic, international and challenging work environment
* Training and support to reach your full potential including the opportunity for continuous professional development
* Attractive terms and conditions, including competitive salary, pension package and a range of flexible benefits and rewards
* Challenging tasks with individual development and training opportunities

 **Equal opportunities for all**


The success of our organisation stands with the quality of our people and the ideas they have. Insights and innovative solutions for our customers are the result of an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. That is why diversity is extremely important to Atradius. To ensure that all colleagues within Atradius can develop their qualities, we promote an inclusive culture in which everyone feels involved and valued. We encourage and welcome everyone to apply to our positions.

 **I am Atradius! \- Do you want to know who we are?**  

Get to know Atradius colleagues in this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v\=NnsgT04OpTU\&t\=4s  

  

*Atradius is a global provider of credit insurance, bond and surety, collections and information services, with a strategic presence in over 50 countries. The products offered by Atradius protect companies around the world against the default risks associated with selling goods and services on credit. Atradius is a member of Grupo Catalana Occidente (GCO.MC), one of the largest insurers in Spain and one of the largest credit insurers in the world.*  

*You can find further information on our website:* *https://group.atradius.com*

title: Data Management Consultant
description:
**Data Management Consultant**
==============================


In the role of Data Management Consultant at Planon, you will play a pivotal role in reshaping our data management landscape and managing BI reports. Working closely with other professionals within the Information Management Department, your tasks will involve securing data governance, enhancing data quality, analyzing data, and crafting Business Intelligence insights that are clear, actionable, and aligned with our corporate strategic objectives. Your role will also cover areas such as AI and Product Data Management, showcasing your broad skill set in a dynamic environment.

**You successfully fulfil your role by:**

* You will champion the integration of data quality and new business insights into the daily activities of employees, ensuring ongoing improvement, revision, and maintenance of current Business Insights.
* You will lead data quality improvement initiatives within existing systems such as Salesforce, Certinia, Exact Globe, LucaNet, and Jira.
* As a trusted advisor, your colleagues within Information Management will consult you about the impacts on BI and Data Quality before initiating process improvements.
* You will be a key player in elevating Data Management as a critical agenda item within our organization.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Define the current data landscape and develop future data architectures, including data models across key data domains like Customers, Products, Suppliers, etc.
* Create data project roadmaps, detailing the translation of business requirements into solution designs and target operating models.
* Establish data requirements for various functional areas to ensure alignment with business needs.
* Coordinate commercial product data management, you will ensure all relevant information flows smoothly between departments and systems.
* Provide expert advice on Master Data Management (MDM), enhancing both operations and systems through strategic data handling.
* Collaborate in multidisciplinary teams across the globe, with Nijmegen as your base location.

**Profile**
-----------


Where would we be without a passion for data? That's why we'd like you to be passionate about it too, and keen to share it with your colleagues. You are a team player, customer\-oriented, and driven to make things happen, even when it's never been done before. Being open and transparent are key traits we would like to see in you.


You are truly energized by the opportunity of the transition and shape the future of Data Management within a corporate organization.


An innovator who is not bound by traditional methods and is open to trial and error in the pursuit of change.


A quick learner with a solid understanding of business processes and the ability to adapt to new ones rapidly.

**Our ideal candidate:**

* Academic Background: Bachelor’s or higher degree in ICT \& Business, Economics, Computer Science, Data Science, Analytics, or a related field.
* Professional Experience of at least 2 years in data management or a closely related field, with demonstrated success in designing and implementing data management solutions.
* Proven experience in Power BI enterprise solution development, including semantic models, composite models, report and dashboard creation, DAX, and Power Query \& strong understanding of dimensional modelling principles and experience with SQL and relational databases.
* Knowledge of data processing, data architecture, and BI best practices. Advanced skills in Power BI. Proficient in SQL and knowledge in Fabric, Cloud, Azure, Python is a plus.
* Exceptional communication skills, adept at data storytelling and influencing decisions through insights. Collaborative team player able to work effectively across technical and business teams.

**We offer**
------------


A healthy work\-life balance and the possibility of working hybrid. We encourage a collaborative and learning work environment, which is why we offer constant learning and meaningful training opportunities. In addition, we offer challenging projects with world\-leading clients and extraordinary experiences. For this role, we offer a good salary and the following benefits package.


Join us on our journey to become the recognized world leader in Real Estate software. How do we do this? By putting our people at the heart of our company and creating an inspiring and safe environment that allows all of us to work, learn, live, and play.

**Do you love building connections? So do we! Apply now.**
company_description: Planon provides Smart Sustainable Building Management software. We create connected places where people work, live, play and learn, creating a positive impact on our users’ lives and our planet.

title: Educational design & Assessment Coordinator
description:
**About GoodHabitz**
 At GoodHabitz, we're on a mission to make learning a habit. We empower individuals, teams, and organisations to unlock their full potential through engaging, accessible online courses. Our unique approach combines educational expertise with top\-quality media production, making personal development both enjoyable and effective. Join us, and be part of a passionate, ambitious and positively charged team where your development never stops!
   

  

**The Role**
 To support our next phase of growth, we're looking for an Educational Design \& Assessment Coordinator with a strong foundation in instructional design, assessment, and evaluation. In this role, you'll coordinate the creation of scalable, engaging learning products that are rooted in learning science.
   

  

 You'll ensure both the pedagogical and evaluative quality of our content by collaborating with educational designers, assessment developers, creatives, and product teams. Together, you'll embed meaningful assessment and data\-informed evaluation into everything we create.
   

  

 As a key sparring partner in cross\-functional projects, you'll also shape and share best practices, drive innovation in how we measure learning, and make sure our learning products don't just inspire change—they make measurable impact.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead and support a team of Educational Designers and Assessment Developers by setting clear expectations, providing coaching, and fostering a culture of learning and innovation.
* Coordinate the planning and prioritization of projects across the team, ensuring smooth collaboration and timely delivery of high\-quality learning products.
* Safeguard the educational quality of all content, co\-owning our pedagogical frameworks and translating trends and insights into effective learning practices.
* Drive innovation in assessment design and evaluation, ensuring validity, reliability, and continuous optimization through learner feedback and analytics.
* Co\-create new learning formats with our Creative Producer and project teams, identifying opportunities to boost engagement and learning outcomes.
* Collaborate cross\-functionally with our colleagues from Product and Revenue to solve educational challenges and support strategic initiatives.
* Stay ahead of trends in EdTech and learning design, bringing fresh ideas, tools, and practices into our way of working.


**Requirements**
****What we're looking for****
* 8\+ years of experience in instructional design, learning experience design, or assessment development
* Proven ability to lead or coordinate educational teams or projects
* Experience working in content production or EdTech environments
* A degree in Educational Science, Psychology, Learning Design, or a related field
* Deep understanding of instructional design principles, digital learning formats, and learning experience optimization
* Expertise in assessment and evaluation methods, with a strong focus on valid and reliable design
* Familiarity with learning analytics and data\-informed decision\-making.


**On top of that, you are:**
* You're a strong and inspiring leader who knows how to coach and empower a team
* With your clear communication and stakeholder skills, you bring structure to complex projects
* You turn vision into action, are data\-driven, and always looking to improve
* Organized, detail\-oriented, and curious by nature—you love staying ahead of trends in education and tech


**Benefits**
****Here's a glimpse of what's waiting for you****
 Joining us means becoming part of a vibrant and dynamic team that's revolutionizing the world of learning. A flexible and supportive work culture that values a healthy work\-life balance. A magical office space equipped with all the comforts you need. Stunning teambuilding activities and company events.
   

  

 And there's more:
   

  

* A competitive salary package that rewards your hard work
* 25 paid holiday days. And if that's not enough, you can purchase up to 10 more
* Annual Company Success Share
* A world of growth and development opportunities to enhance your skills. You'll have unlimited access to our treasure trove of GoodHabitz resources and MyAcademy
* Access to mental coaching through our partner, OpenUp, to keep your mind in top shape
* An annual do\-good\-day, fully paid, so you can contribute to a cause you're passionate about
* Travel and expense reimbursement because we've got your journey covered
* Pension and disability insurance, securing your financial well\-being in the long run


**You can apply until May 5 \- after that, we'll close the vacancy and start reviewing the applications. So, just a heads\-up: you can expect to hear from us in the week of May 5\.**

title: Junior Researcher on Generative AI Use and Computational Social Science
FinOps Business Analyst
description:
**This Is What We Offer You**
* Gross monthly salary between EUR 4,516 and EUR 6,449 (scale 09\) for a 36 hour week
* Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
* 10% Employee Benefit Budget
* EUR 1,400 development budget per year
* Hybrid working: balance between home and office work (possible for most roles)
* A pension, for which you can set the maximum amount of your personal contribution


 View all our benefits.
   

  

 As a FinOps Business Analyst you will get the opportunity to work in the beating heart of data, FinOps and sustainability within the Rabobank. You will work together with people who have an insatiable curiosity in technology, data, and self\-development. You will heavily invest in your career. You will make memories.
   

  

**As a FinOps Business Analyst you can make a difference**
 Within the Domain Tech 4 Data \& Analytics you will work in the centre of a data driven enterprise.
   

  

 As a FinOps Business Analyst you will manage the optimization of cloud costs and promote within the Rabobank. You ensure financial transparency on cloud solutions and help the organization make data\-driven decisions. Additionally, you collaborate with sustainability teams to reduce the carbon footprint of IT operations. This includes using tools and data to report and optimize carbon emissions. This role is crucial in harmonizing technological advancement with Rabobank’s environmental goals.
   

  

**Responsibilities, Experience And Competences**
 Above all we are looking for new colleagues with an insatiable curiosity in FinOps, sustainability, data, technology and self\-development on a senior level. We don’t look for the sheep with the 5 legs. We believe that if you are a good FinOps Business Analyst you are capable to work as a specialist and generalist. There is absolutely
 **no need to tick all of below mentioned boxes** 
 but it gives you an idea of which topics are important to us:
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Manage and optimize cloud spending, particularly focusing on GenAI business cases.
* Manage the scaling of GenAI with regard to sustainability and cloud usage.
* Develop and implement strategies for measuring sustainability.
* Develop approaches for tracking costs related to use cases and identify optimization opportunities..
* Set up a reporting structure to monitor and report on costs and sustainability.
* Communicate frequently with stakeholders to create awareness about cost management and sustainability.
* Analyze our architecture to identify and implement optimizations for costs and sustainability


**Experience**
* Experience in cost management and cloud spend.
* FinOps Certified Practitioner FOCP preferred
* Knowledge of sustainability and energy management.
* Strong analytical skills and experience with architecture analysis.
* Excellent communication skills for creating awareness and reporting to stakeholders.
* Ability to develop and implement strategies that optimize costs and sustainability.


**Competences**
* Strong communication skills
* Open communication.
* Proactive and results\-oriented.
* Strong problem\-solving skills.
* Team player with the ability to collaborate effectively with different stakeholders.
* Innovative and able to develop new approaches to cost and sustainability management.
* Quick learner.
* Curiosity.


**You and the job application process**
 Reply to the vacancy for FinOps Business Analyst at Rabobank.
   

  

* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Ashley Lumbantobing, IT Recruiter, ashley.lumbantobing@rabobank.nl
* We will hold the interviews through a video call.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq
* A screening is part of the process.
* We respect your privacy.


*To be considered for this position, you must be located in the Netherlands or elsewhere in the EU and have the legal right to work in the Netherlands. We are unable to consider candidates requiring relocation from another country.*
**Growing a better world together**
 You are already aware that Rabobank is a financial services provider for millions of customers in 40 countries. But did you know that we aim to contribute to real change with our “Growing a better world together” mission? We do so in countless ways, such as:
   

  

* A third of all the food we purchase is thrown away. Together with Nature \& Environment, we’re working to increase awareness among consumers of how to reduce food waste.
* As part of a project with Humanitas, we are helping people who are experiencing financial difficulties to get their household finances in order.
* Together with Vluchtelingenwerk Nederland (the Dutch Council for Refugees), we are helping 1,500 refugees find a suitable job.


 Interested? Please contact us.

title: AI/LLM Expert
description:
A forward\-thinking tech start\-up in Eindhoven is looking for a talented problem\-solver to specialize in the implementation of advanced language models. The core challenge of this role is to engineer solutions for deploying these models on cutting\-edge hardware accelerators.
 



  





**Responsibilities Include:** 




  




* Developing and applying innovative techniques to adapt and optimize Large Language Models for deployment on datacenter\-scale computational infrastructure.
* Working closely with cross\-functional teams to create and execute projects that utilize language models to address specific application needs, such as automated text creation, summarization of complex information, and language translation.
* Staying abreast of the latest developments in artificial intelligence, machine learning, and generative modeling to inform the direction of our technology roadmap.
* Offering technical guidance and support to less experienced team members, promoting a collaborative learning environment.



  





**Qualifications:** 




  




* A graduate degree (Master's or Ph.D.) in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field of study.
* Significant experience in the practical application of Large Language Models, particularly those based on the Transformer architecture.
* A strong theoretical and practical background in generative models, deep learning techniques, and natural language processing.
* Proficiency in Python programming and hands\-on experience with deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
* A proven ability to take projects from the initial planning stages through to successful completion.
* Experience with deploying AI\-driven solutions in a production setting is a plus.



  





 If you are a highly motivated engineer with a passion for solving complex challenges and believe you possess the skills and drive to excel in this role, we encourage you apply now or email your CV directly to nk@eu\-recruit.com.

title: Software Engineer C++
description:
**CAPGEMINI ENGINEERING**
-------------------------

At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life\-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R\&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.


**YOUR ROLE**
-------------

As a Software Engineer at Capgemini Engineering, you’ll be at the forefront of designing, developing, and deploying cutting\-edge technical applications. Based in Eindhoven, Utrecht or Hengelo you’ll work on high\-tech and defense projects, collaborating with skilled engineers to create innovative, high\-performance software solutions.  



In this role, you will play a key role in:


* Designing and developing advanced C\+\+ applications that meet the highest industry standards.
* Writing clean, high\-quality code with a strong focus on efficiency and continuous improvement.
* Working closely with cross\-functional teams to define, shape, and implement new features.
* Contributing to mission\-critical projects in high\-tech and defense, making a real\-world impact.
**YOUR PROFILE**
----------------

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* At least 3 years of experience in C\+\+ (14 or higher), preferably in high\-tech, defense, or related industries. Experience with Python is a plus.
* Strong understanding of object\-oriented programming and design patterns.
* Excellent command of Dutch and English.
* You enjoy working in multiple industries, have strong communication skills, and thrive in an international, inclusive environment with a focus on professional growth.
**WHAT YOU’LL LOVE ABOUT WORKING HERE**
---------------------------------------

* Challenging projects in innovative, high\-tech industries with a global impact.
* A strong technical community, where you can collaborate with top engineers and expand your expertise.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs, digital learning platforms and ongoing performance management are crafted in a way to support you in shaping your path.
**NEED TO KNOW**
----------------

* A permanent contract and a salary aligned with your experience level.
* 26 vacation days, with the option to buy additional leave.
* Capgemini contributes to your pension. Additionally, you also have the flexibility to make additional contributions yourself.
* Work wherever you want on a device of your choice with our connectivity allowance. A fast laptop and a SIM card that you can also use privately.
**NOTE**
--------

To ensure the safety and integrity within our organization, an identity check and background check are part of the onboarding process.


**DISCLAIMER**
--------------

At Capgemini, we believe in a workplace where everyone feels valued for who they are is part of our DNA and instrumental to our long\-term performance. We are building broad talent pools to be able to provide high quality capabilities to our clients, with the right skills and talent mix.


**ABOUT CAPGEMINI**
-------------------

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55\-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end\-to\-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22\.1 billion.  



**Get the Future You Want \|** **www.capgemini.com**

title: Scada Technical Specialist
description:
**CAPGEMINI ENGINEERING**
-------------------------

At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life\-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R\&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.


**YOUR ROLE**
-------------

As a SCADA Technical Specialist at Capgemini Engineering, you will play a crucial role in supporting the energy industry, especially as more and more investments are made in green energy sources. These investments pose new challenges for grid management, but Capgemini Engineering is at the forefront of providing expertise in SCADA and Energy Management Systems (EMS). With a team of around 60 professionals, we help clients across the Energy, Life Science, High Tech, and Manufacturing industries drive innovation and overcome these challenges.


In this role, you will:


* Configure and maintain On\-premise and cloud\-based SCADA systems to meet specific requirements, including change management systems such as AspenTech/OSI Monarch.
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams to integrate SCADA systems seamlessly with EMS and other industry\-specific platforms.
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to SCADA systems, ensuring continuous operation and performance.
* Design and implement system enhancements and upgrades for SCADA and other systems to improve functionality.
* Provide technical support and training to end\-users, ensuring effective adoption and efficient system use.
**YOUR PROFILE**
----------------

To succeed in this role, you should have:


* A degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Experience configuring and maintaining On\-Premise and cloud\-based SCADA systems with a deep understanding of SCADA and domain principles
* Strong knowledge of SCADA, EMS, DCS, and network protocols like ISA\-88, ISA\-95, IEC60870\-5\-101 and 104, IEC61850, C37\.118, OPC UA, MQTT, or Kafka.
* A strong understanding of the energy sector and the challenges posed by increasing integration of green energy sources into the grid.
* Excellent problem\-solving, analytical skills, and the ability to communicate complex technical concepts to diverse teams.
* The ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
**WHAT YOU’LL LOVE ABOUT WORKING HERE**
---------------------------------------

At Capgemini Engineering, we offer a dynamic, collaborative environment where innovation thrives:


* Permanent contract from day one, ensuring job security.
* Competitive salary and benefits package, including remote work allowances and high connectivity options.

* A collaborative and diverse work environment encourages creative problem\-solving and teamwork across various industries.
* Flexible work arrangements, including hybrid work models, to promote a healthy work\-life balance.
* 26 vacation days, with an option to purchase additional leave.

--------

To ensure safety and integrity within our organization, an identity check and background check are part of the onboarding process.


**DISCLAIMER**
--------------

At Capgemini, we believe in a workplace where everyone feels valued for who they are is part of our DNA and instrumental to our long\-term performance. We are building broad talent pools to be able to provide high quality capabilities to our clients, with the right skills and talent mix.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Do you want to make a real impact by improving Dutch healthcare? At ZorgDomein, we help patients get the right care in the right place — every single day. We're building a modern digital platform that plays a crucial role in the Dutch healthcare system. Want to be part of something meaningful? Read on — you might be the next addition to our enthusiastic and purpose\-driven team.

**We are ZorgDomein**
---------------------


How can you continually improve healthcare in the Netherlands? How do you make extra time and space for patients, and give them more attention? These are the sort of questions that are central to our work at ZorgDomein. We develop smart technology to create more room for human work in healthcare. That’s how we help healthcare professionals such as family doctors, physiotherapists and lab technicians to do what they do best: give patients the best possible healthcare. We have been doing just that for 25 years.

**Established name with ambition**
----------------------------------


Did you know that nearly all referrals and diagnostic requests are channelled through our platform? In fact, in 2024 our platform was used nearly 24 million times to refer or request research for patients. ZorgDomein is an established name in the Netherlands, but for us the adventure has only just begun. Our healthy ambition is to ensure even better coordination of supply and demand in the healthcare sector. With a user\-friendly, high\-tech platform and digital solutions. And by building lasting relationships with healthcare professionals. There’s plenty of work to be done at ZorgDomein and we could use your help in it.

**Your role at ZorgDomein**
---------------------------


As a Senior Software Engineer, you play a key role in shaping and building the foundation of our platform. You work closely with the Product Manager and collaborate with your team to turn complex healthcare challenges into smart, scalable technical solutions. You bring vision, technical leadership, and a strong sense of ownership to the table.


You will be part of a team who is responsible for core functionalities like user authorization, registration, login flows, and organization management — the essential building blocks that ensure a secure and seamless experience across our platform.


Together with your team, you are responsible for:

* Designing and delivering high\-quality, scalable features
* Balancing technical decisions with business goals
* Keeping the platform’s architecture clean and future\-proof
* Writing, deploying, and maintaining production\-ready code
* Monitoring key metrics and platform performance
* Conducting thorough code reviews
* Driving innovation within your team and across the engineering organization
* Experiment and implement AI powered solutions

**Our tech stack:**

* Scala 3
* Kafka / Event Streaming
* Kubernetes / Helm / ArgoCD
* AWS (including S3 and related services)
* Microservices architecture
* Domain Driven Design \& Hexagonal Architecture
* Event Sourcing \& CQRS
* ZIO

**About you**
-------------

* 10\+ years of relevant experience in backend development
* Solid experience with Scala (or similar, such as Java)
* Familiarity with Functional Programming principles
* A proactive, curious, and independent mindset
* A strong sense of responsibility and craftsmanship
* A collaborative attitude — you love working with others to solve complex problems

**Working in your own way**
---------------------------


You will join a hard\-working family of 200 colleagues. A great bunch of professionals working together to achieve something valuable: better flow in the Dutch healthcare sector. ZorgDomein employees enjoy working here because the work climate is ideal. The secret? You enjoy the total confidence of your colleagues to do what you do best. That means you have a high degree of autonomy. You have freedom to work in your own way.

**Healthy work environment**
----------------------------


Are you looking for a work environment where you feel comfortable? ZorgDomein is the right place for you. Here, you can be yourself and work in a way that suits you. We highly value a healthy work\-life balance. That's why we provide a pleasant workplace where you feel at home and can collaborate well with your team.


What else do we offer you:

* An informal team of enthusiastic and driven professionals that is fully committed to realize the mission on a daily basis
* A workplace in our beautiful office on the Vecht, but also an ergonomical workspace at home
* Salary between € 6\.000,\- and € 7\.000,\- based on fulltime employment (you are available to work for 36 to 40 hours per week)
* Flexible leave policy
* Full payments for your pension policy by ZorgDomein
* Attention for your growth through personal attention, our development days and an additional personal development budget
* As a part of the Visma Group you will have access to the Visma learning environment
* Fun! With our (digital) events and (sport)activities we create an relaxed atmosphere and we will keep you sharp and fit!

**Do you see yourself working at ZorgDomein?**
----------------------------------------------


In that case, we want to know more about you! You can apply by clicking on the orange button below. If you have any questions about the vacancy, get in touch withrecruitment@zorgdomein.nl addressed to Robina Schouten.

title: VP of Engineering
description:
We’re on a mission to help recruitment agencies and in\-house teams go to zero admin and unlock more hires with less hassle. Our AI\-powered platform is built by a team that previously exited a disruptive recruitment tech company \- and now, we're rewriting the rules of hiring again.  

  

With a strong foundation already in place, we're scaling fast and looking for a VP of Engineering to lead the charge as we evolve Carv’s platform, culture, and team to the next level.

#### **What do we look for?**


We’re looking for a VP of Engineering who thrives at the intersection of leadership, technical depth, and innovation. Someone who can lead with clarity, scale with intention, and still roll up their sleeves when needed. You're a strong believer in high standards, fast feedback loops, and the power of culture in building world\-class engineering teams.

  

You’re likely someone who:

* Balances product intuition with engineering discipline
* Has scaled SaaS teams and systems, and knows what good looks like
* Communicates clearly across functions, from code to company vision
* Sees AI not as a buzzword, but as a lever for real productivity
* Loves turning chaos into clarity, and challenges into momentum
* Builds trust fast and earns it over time through delivery and integrity
* Thinks big, but knows that great execution starts small

#### **Your Responsibilities?**

**Engineering Leadership \& Team Management**

* Build and scale a high\-performing engineering team (15\+ engineers), fostering a culture of ownership, growth, and collaboration.
* Drive hiring, coaching, and performance management to attract and retain top technical talent.
* Partner with the SVP of Product \& Engineering to define org structure, roles, and strategic priorities.
* Instill best\-in\-class engineering management practices, aligned with Carv’s goals and culture.

**Product Delivery \& Technical Excellence**

* Ensure consistent, high\-quality product delivery in close partnership with Product and Design.
* Champion modern development processes and best practices (Agile, CI/CD, intra\-day releases).
* Balance speed and quality while managing technical debt and platform scalability.

**Innovation \& AI Adoption**

* Bring a forward\-thinking mindset to how we build software, championing the use of AI in development.
* Drive experimentation with approaches like "vibe coding" and other AI\-driven dev methodologies.
* Stay ahead of trends and ensure Carv’s tech stack evolves with our ambitions.

**Platform Reliability \& Security**

* Own the stability, scalability, and security of our SaaS platform (hosted on GCP, microservices architecture).
* Lead architectural initiatives that enhance platform resilience and performance.
* Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR), especially within the recruitment domain.

**Strategic Execution \& Leadership**

* Translate business goals into engineering strategy and roadmaps.
* Manage budgets and resources effectively while reporting on delivery and performance metrics.
* Be a strong voice in the ELT, ensuring engineering is tightly aligned with Carv’s broader mission.

#### **Your Mission**


You’ll shape the team structure, delivery model, and tech culture while ensuring our platform remains scalable, secure, and innovative. From driving delivery excellence to championing AI\-powered development, this is a hands\-on leadership role for someone ready to make an outsized impact.

#### **Our offer to you**


You’re not starting from scratch \- you’re stepping into a company that’s already found strong early traction, with a leadership team that has done this before. You’ll play a defining role in shaping the next chapter of Carv.

  

Here’s what else you can expect:

* Unlimited paid time off
* Competitive base salary
* Company stock options
* MacBook Pro
* Personal development budget
* The thrill of building something truly category\-defining
* 8\+ years of progressive engineering leadership experience in a B2B SaaS environment.
* Proven track record leading and scaling engineering teams (15\+ engineers).
* Strong technical foundation as a former IC and deep understanding of SaaS architectures (GCP, APIs, databases, microservices).
* Experience delivering software using Agile methodologies and modern DevOps practices.
* Strong communicator and cross\-functional collaborator.
* Enthusiastic about AI’s potential in engineering workflows and curious about how it can unlock speed and creativity.
* Bonus: Familiarity with the recruitment tech ecosystem or HR technology space.

title: Staff Performance Support Consultant (Escalations Engineering)
description:
**Company Description**  

It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI\-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud\-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.

 **Job Description**  

The Staff Performance Support Consultant (Escalations Engineering) role is a unique opportunity to join the Customer Service and Support team, working with some of our largest customers with their toughest performance and scalability challenges. You will be accountable for driving the successful closure of critical escalated technical issues for our most complex and strategically important customers.


As someone who can think outside the box, you will work on a mixture of reactive and proactive engagements where your technical troubleshooting skills in the stack will come to the fore. In addition, your top\-notch consulting skills will be put to good use as you will take on the role of “trusted advisor” to help turn a bad situation around and help customers get maximum value from our platform.


We’re looking for the best of the best and the cream of the crop. In return, we offer highly competitive base salaries and benefits, including generous holiday allowances, bonus scheme, stock options, and flexible working arrangements. Our inclusive work culture embraces belonging and individuality, collaboration, and customer orientation.


Our customers are our North Star, and we are passionate about making them successful!

**What you get to do during a typical week:**


You will be partnering with our largest customers \& Internal stakeholders to identify and root cause performance and scalability issues impacting their ServiceNow deployments. Successful hires will get a chance to:

* Use problem\-solving skills alongside industry\-leading tools to holistically analyse ServiceNow instances to identify and remediate resource contention at all layers of the stack
* Explore platform Java and JavaScript code to gain a detailed understanding of the behaviour of ServiceNow applications
* Improve the throughput of Java Virtual Machines (JVMs) by deep diving into memory allocation and garbage collection tuning
* Optimise relational database performance by refactoring queries at the application layer or by applying tuning within the database itself
* Use extensive lab/test environments to reproduce and root cause issues impacting customers’ ServiceNow deployment(s)
* Engage with cross\-functional teams to highlight identified product defects, assist with implementation of workarounds, or devising long\-term fixes
* Drive improvement from within by creating high\-quality knowledge articles, developing tooling for use within the support organisation, or mentoring and training junior colleagues
* Build and deliver compelling presentations to a variety of internal and customer stakeholders, acting as a trusted advisor on how they can improve the performance of their ServiceNow deployment and adhere to leading practice guidelines

  

**Qualifications** **To be successful in this role you have:**

* Experience in leveraging or critically thinking about how to integrate AI into work processes, decision\-making, or problem\-solving. This may include using AI\-powered tools, automating workflows, analyzing AI\-driven insights, or exploring AI's potential impact on the function or industry
* 7\+ Years of Progressive experience in technical support, software development, performance load testing or professional services
* Good working knowledge of the components in a web applications stack
* Experience with one (or more) scripting languages: e.g. JavaScript, Python, Perl, Unix Shell, Windows Powershell etc..
* Good Experience with working (or debugging) Object Oriented code (Java preferred)
* Good working knowledge of one (or more) Relational Database technologies e.g. Oracle / MySQL / SQL Server / PostgreSQL
* Strong problem\-solving, leadership, time management, and critical thinking skills
* Excellent communication and presentation skills with an aptitude for learning new technologies

**Whilst not essential requirements, skills and experience with the following will be highly regarded**

* Prior experience of ServiceNow Architecture is preferred but not essential as full product training will be provided
* Performance tuning of databases \+ SQL query tuning
* Prior experience of Cloud/SaaS software
* Knowledge of memory management, including core / heapdump analysis (Java heap dump analysis preferred)
* Fundamental understanding of ITSM, ITIL, or CMDB
* Experience administering: Linux/Unix OR Microsoft Windows Server
* Experience of Firebug, Chrome Developer Tools, Fiddler, etc.

  

JV20

*Not sure if you meet every qualification? We still encourage you to apply! We value inclusivity, welcoming candidates from diverse backgrounds, including non\-traditional paths. Unique experiences enrich our team, and the willingness to dream big makes you an exceptional candidate!*

 **Additional Information** **Work Personas**


We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work. Learn more here.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**


ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.

**Accommodations**


We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.

**Export Control Regulations**


For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.


From Fortune. ©2024 Fortune Media IP Limited. All rights reserved. Used under license.
company_description: At ServiceNow, our technology makes the world work for everyone, and our people make it possible.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Do you want to make a real impact by improving Dutch healthcare? At ZorgDomein, we help patients get the right care in the right place — every single day. We're building a modern digital platform that plays a crucial role in the Dutch healthcare system. Want to be part of something meaningful? Read on — you might be the next addition to our enthusiastic and purpose\-driven team.

**We are ZorgDomein**
---------------------


How can you continually improve healthcare in the Netherlands? How do you make extra time and space for patients, and give them more attention? These are the sort of questions that are central to our work at ZorgDomein. We develop smart technology to create more room for human work in healthcare. That’s how we help healthcare professionals such as family doctors, physiotherapists and lab technicians to do what they do best: give patients the best possible healthcare. We have been doing just that for 25 years.

**Established name with ambition**
----------------------------------


Did you know that nearly all referrals and diagnostic requests are channelled through our platform? In fact, in 2024 our platform was used nearly 24 million times to refer or request research for patients. ZorgDomein is an established name in the Netherlands, but for us the adventure has only just begun. Our healthy ambition is to ensure even better coordination of supply and demand in the healthcare sector. With a user\-friendly, high\-tech platform and digital solutions. And by building lasting relationships with healthcare professionals. There’s plenty of work to be done at ZorgDomein and we could use your help in it.

**Your role at ZorgDomein**
---------------------------


As a Senior Software Engineer, you play a key role in shaping and building the foundation of our platform. You work closely with the Product Manager and collaborate with your team to turn complex healthcare challenges into smart, scalable technical solutions. You bring vision, technical leadership, and a strong sense of ownership to the table.


You will be part of a team who is responsible for core functionalities like user authorization, registration, login flows, and organization management — the essential building blocks that ensure a secure and seamless experience across our platform.


Together with your team, you are responsible for:

* Designing and delivering high\-quality, scalable features
* Balancing technical decisions with business goals
* Keeping the platform’s architecture clean and future\-proof
* Writing, deploying, and maintaining production\-ready code
* Monitoring key metrics and platform performance
* Conducting thorough code reviews
* Driving innovation within your team and across the engineering organization
* Experiment and implement AI powered solutions

**Our tech stack:**

* Scala 3
* Kafka / Event Streaming
* Kubernetes / Helm / ArgoCD
* AWS (including S3 and related services)
* Microservices architecture
* Domain Driven Design \& Hexagonal Architecture
* Event Sourcing \& CQRS
* ZIO

**About you**
-------------

* 10\+ years of relevant experience in backend development
* Solid experience with Scala (or similar, such as Java)
* Familiarity with Functional Programming principles
* A proactive, curious, and independent mindset
* A strong sense of responsibility and craftsmanship
* A collaborative attitude — you love working with others to solve complex problems

**Working in your own way**
---------------------------


You will join a hard\-working family of 200 colleagues. A great bunch of professionals working together to achieve something valuable: better flow in the Dutch healthcare sector. ZorgDomein employees enjoy working here because the work climate is ideal. The secret? You enjoy the total confidence of your colleagues to do what you do best. That means you have a high degree of autonomy. You have freedom to work in your own way.

**Healthy work environment**
----------------------------


Are you looking for a work environment where you feel comfortable? ZorgDomein is the right place for you. Here, you can be yourself and work in a way that suits you. We highly value a healthy work\-life balance. That's why we provide a pleasant workplace where you feel at home and can collaborate well with your team.


What else do we offer you:

* An informal team of enthusiastic and driven professionals that is fully committed to realize the mission on a daily basis
* A workplace in our beautiful office on the Vecht, but also an ergonomical workspace at home
* Salary between € 6\.000,\- and € 7\.000,\- based on fulltime employment (you are available to work for 36 to 40 hours per week)
* Flexible leave policy
* Full payments for your pension policy by ZorgDomein
* Attention for your growth through personal attention, our development days and an additional personal development budget
* As a part of the Visma Group you will have access to the Visma learning environment
* Fun! With our (digital) events and (sport)activities we create an relaxed atmosphere and we will keep you sharp and fit!

**Do you see yourself working at ZorgDomein?**
----------------------------------------------


In that case, we want to know more about you! You can apply by clicking on the orange button below. If you have any questions about the vacancy, get in touch withrecruitment@zorgdomein.nl addressed to Robina Schouten.

title: AVEVA PI ENGINEER
description:
**FULL TIME**


**Boxmeer, Netherlands**  

Réalta Technologies is currently seeking a skilled PI Engineer to join our team and work on behalf of our Animal Health client. As an PI Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining the PI system to support data collection, analysis, and reporting for our client's animal health operations. This is a hybrid role that will require a combination of remote work and occasional on\-site presence.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Collaborate with the client to understand their data requirements and translate them into PI system configurations.
* Design and develop customized data collection, storage, and visualization solutions using PI tools.
* Configure and optimize data acquisition interfaces, data access points, and data storage structures within the PI system.
* Develop and implement data integration strategies, ensuring seamless integration between PI and other enterprise systems.
* Create and maintain data analysis and reporting tools using Aveva PI applications and modules.
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams, including software developers, system administrators, and data scientists, to ensure the smooth functioning of the PI system.
* Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to PI system performance, data integrity, and connectivity.
* Conduct regular system maintenance activities, including software upgrades, patches, and security enhancements.
* Stay up\-to\-date with the latest industry trends and best practices in Aveva PI technology and animal health data management.


**Qualifications and Skills:**


* Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field. Equivalent work experience will also be considered.
* Proven experience working as an PI Engineer or similar role, preferably in an industrial or manufacturing environment.
* Strong knowledge of the Aveva PI system, including PI Asset Framework (AF), PI Data Archive, PI ProcessBook, PI Vision, and PI Integrators.
* Proficiency in configuring and optimizing data acquisition interfaces, such as OPC, Modbus, or other industrial protocols.
* Familiarity with relational databases, SQL, and data modeling concepts.
* Experience in developing custom applications or tools using PI software development kits (SDKs) or programming languages (e.g., C\#, Python).
* Ability to collaborate effectively with clients and internal stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver solutions.
* Excellent problem\-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues efficiently.
* Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non\-technical audiences.
* Self\-motivated, proactive, and able to work independently as well as in a team environment.
* Flexible and adaptable to changing project requirements and deadlines.


Preferred Qualifications:


* PI certification(s) or relevant professional certifications.
* Experience working in the animal health or pharmaceutical industry.
* Familiarity with other industrial automation and data historian systems.

title: Privacy Counsel
description:
Introduction
Shimano is a global leader in cycling and fishing components that are used in recreation and sports at every level. We have been around for more than a hundred years, creating products that help people connect with nature, and with each other. Our longevity is closely linked to our commitment to excellence and trust in the people we work with. Joining Team Shimano means being part of a dynamic, vibrant, and rewarding work environment where individuals can thrive and make real impact—cycling into a healthy future.  

  

 Are you a privacy pro with a passion for tech? We are looking for a senior Privacy Counsel for our Shimano Europe Group who is ready to roll up their sleeves and deep dive into the technical layers behind our data flows and digital systems. Become part of a culturally diverse team of currently six Legal Counsel, based in Eindhoven. In the role of senior Privacy Counsel, you are a compliance sparring partner to various stakeholders inside our company. You are expected to fluently communicate with colleagues in technical domains. As Privacy Counsel you drive the continuous efforts to increase privacy compliance in close collaboration with Technology Services, Project Management Office, Japanese headquarters and DPO. Furthermore, the senior Privacy Counsel is required to provides ervices to the Japanese headquarters, all European sales offices, Own Brands teams, including PRO, LAZER, Bikefitting.com as well as the Shimano Experience Center. The senior Privacy Counsel is expected to respond to data security incidents or government inquiries and handle related (crisis) management. If you thrive at the intersection of law and technology, understand the fine print and the backend architecture, and are eager to shape privacy in a global innovation driven environment, we would love to hear from you.
The Challenge* The senior Privacy Counsel will act as a first contact point towards software developers / engineers, Security Officers and other colleagues with a strong technology background. The senior Privacy Counsel should be able to articulate the importance of privacy requirements to such audience and build bridges between the legal and tech teams.
* As part of the regular work the senior Privacy Counsel will perform case research and keep abreast with relevant legislative changes and developments in jurisprudence, work on dedicated projects. Prepare privacy policies and compliance documents, check suppliers data processing agreements, provide feedback on DPIA’s and DTIA’s and organize documentation according to department filing/archiving instructions. Independently manage your own workload to ensure internal and external business deadlines are met.
* The senior Privacy Counsel of Shimano is accountable to provide advice to the dedicated projects independently on day\-to\-day matters and supervise more complex matters whenever those are handled by a junior team member. Projects are often international, with potential data transfers outside of EU. Therefore, the senior Privacy Counsel is expected to have a solid technology expertise, project management skills and good acumen of potential compliance risks in such settings.
* The strategic roadmap to increase privacy compliance, including required training to the organization, is determined by the senior Privacy Counsel in close consultation with the General Counsel and in close collaboration with Japanese stakeholders.
* The senior Privacy Counsel is accountable to (i) use the tools available in the department (DocuSign, One Trust, TopDesk, the Internal Compliance library), (ii) develop relevant content for these tools, and (iii) standardize workflows within these tools to generate efficiencies in work and (iv) instruct outside counsel if required.
* The senior Privacy Counsel is accountable to supervise the creation and revision of compliance templates of a less experienced Legal Counsel.

What are we looking for?* You hold a university degree (preferably LLM (equivalent) title) and have solid experience in a European jurisdiction in a data privacy related role, good knowledge and understanding of GDPR, regulations, and industry best practices.
* You are qualified with EADPP, CIPP/E/CIPM/CIPT or other similar certifications.
* You are flexible and can take on tasks across various business units and projects in parallel.
* You have excellent written and verbal communication skills in both Dutch – mandatory – and English language.
* You have affinity with Shimano’s product portfolio and an interest in adding value to raise compliance standards of its brand.
  

What do we have to offer?
Shimano and its subsidiaries offer a pleasant, informal working environment with colleagues who work well together, and are proud to work for Shimano. Next to good working conditions, Shimano offers you the opportunity to work in a responsible and challenging position within a dynamic, international and ambitious environment. Together we want to win therefore we have a strong focus on team achievement.
How to get in touch!
If you have any questions regarding this vacancy please get in touch with:
taniya.nayyar@shimano\-eu.com

title: Data & AI Solution Architect
description:
**Role Overview** 




  
 



 We are seeking an entrepreneurial and technically excellent 
 **Data \& AI Solution Architect** 
 to lead our solution design and delivery practice. You will act as a key strategic and technical lead, working with enterprise clients to design modern AI\- and data\-driven architectures that are robust, scalable, and aligned with their transformation goals.
 



  
 



 You will own the blueprinting of data \& AI platforms, lead technical pre\-sales, shape service offerings, and act as a thought leader across our engagements. This role requires hands\-on architectural leadership combined with deep commercial awareness and the ability to manage and mentor technical teams.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




**• Lead the design and delivery of enterprise\-grade data and AI architectures for clients across multiple sectors (e.g., retail, marketing, energy, finance).** 




**• Translate client business challenges into technical blueprints using best\-of\-breed AI/ML, data engineering, and cloud\-native tools.** 




**• Define and maintain Intellerts’ architectural frameworks, templates, and accelerators for reusability and scalability.** 




**• Own solution architecture throughout the full project lifecycle — from discovery and concept through design and implementation oversight.** 




**• Collaborate with sales and account teams during pre\-sales to define solution scope, estimates, and value propositions.** 




**• Engage with C\-level and technical stakeholders to explain complex AI/data topics in a clear, consultative way.** 




**• Oversee solution integrity across hybrid teams of engineers, data scientists, and DevOps professionals.** 




**• Promote responsible AI, privacy\-by\-design, and compliance with regulatory standards.** 




**• Identify and incorporate the latest GenAI, LLM, vector database, and MLOps capabilities into architectural offerings.** 




**• Mentor and grow a high\-performing team of solution and enterprise architects.** 









**Required Qualifications** 




**• 10\+ years of experience in data architecture, analytics, or AI/ML system design, with at least 3 years in a consulting or solution provider context.** 




**• Proven track record leading solution architecture in client engagements, from design to delivery.** 




**• Proven track record in data design, engineering, and demonstrable programming skills (SQL, Python).** 




**• Deep experience with cloud\-native architectures \- GCP (preferred), and Azure, data platforms and AI/ML ecosystems.** 




**• Familiarity with GenAI concepts, LLM stack integration (RAG, embeddings, vector DBs), and MLOps practices.** 




**• Strong understanding of API\-driven architecture, event\-driven systems, and real\-time/streaming pipelines.** 




**• Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, both technical and business\-facing.** 




**• Fluent in English; Dutch is a plus.** 




**• IMPORTANT Netherlands based (region Utrecht).** 









**Nice to Have** 




**• Experience working with European clients in highly regulated industries.** 




**• Background in knowledge graphs, semantic layers, or data fabric.** 




**• Certifications in cloud architecture (e.g., Azure Solutions Architect, GCP Certified Solutions Architect).** 









 About Intellerts
 



  
 



 At Intellerts, we turn data into action. As a leading European AI and data consultancy, we help organizations unlock value from data by delivering scalable, production\-grade AI, analytics, and data management solutions. Our cross\-functional teams work across industries to build and integrate state\-of\-the\-art machine learning systems, big data platforms, and Generative AI solutions — with a strong emphasis on real\-world impact.
 








**What Intellerts Offers** 




**• A strategic leadership position in a fast\-growing, innovative AI consulting company.** 




**• Autonomy to shape architectural strategy and drive client value across sectors.** 




**• Access to cutting\-edge projects and a collaborative, international team.** 




**• Competitive salary, bonus scheme, flexible hybrid working, and professional development opportunities.**

title: Business Intelligence Specialist
description:
Location: Hengelo, Netherlands
   

  

**Business Intelligence Specialist (32 \- 40 hours per week, Hengelo)**
 ‘The goal is to turn data into information and information into insight’
   

  

 The Enterprise Information Management team of Thales in the Netherlands is looking for an experienced BI specialist to further professionalize information management.
   

  

**About The Job**
 Thales in the Netherlands has committed to the objective to become a ‘data\-driven company’, where facts and unambiguous information are leading in decision making. As BI specialist, you will be responsible for gathering the requested business information and designing clear dashboards for our internal customer, the business user. At the start of the week, you check the sprint backlog to see what tasks are assigned to you. You align with the product owner and business analyst of the team and you are in touch with the business user to sharpen the information specifications. Together with the solution architect and data manager, you investigate which data is required to build the dashboard and together you determine how much time it will take to extract and validate the data. You are capable of executing ETL activities yourself. In the meantime, you start designing one component of the new dashboard in PowerBI. You are in close contact with the business user to agree upon the visual design. At the end of the sprint, which takes two weeks, you deliver the new component of the new dashboard, and in the next sprint you will extend your work with a new component.
   

  

 You play an important role in the internal digital transformation journey of Thales in the Netherlands. There is a lot of work to be done; you are a ‘go\-getter’ and consider this assignment, which we accepted as a team, to be a journey full of chances and possibilities. You are flexible and know how to work around challenges along the way. You are someone who dares to challenge the status quo and someone who brings new energy to our team. Also, you have strong communication skills and you know to address different audiences.
   

  

 There are many possibilities to build your career at Thales. You could further develop within the domain of BI, yet you could choose to specialize towards IT, or to increase your knowledge about our interesting business and grow to an operational position on the intersection of Business and IT. Furthermore, with some own initiative and a good portion of curiosity, you are able to continue your career at Thales at a completely different department.
   

  

 The most important activities are:
   

  

* Develop and design dashboards in PowerBI to meet the information demands of the business user
* ETL activities to extract and format data for the dashboards which need to be developed
* Contribute to the improvement of our work processes


**About You**
* Holds a relevant Bachelor degree in IT or Business\&IT
* Has basic knowledge of PowerBI
* Has extensive knowledge of SSIS and SQL and the ability to complete ETL activities independently
* Can align the business information request with the technical possibilities
* Is proactive, flexible, a go\-getter, and enthusiastic
* Knowledge of Mendix is a pre
* Good understanding of the Dutch language


**What's In It For You**
* Position is based on vakgroep 55/ vakgroep 60 (LR\-08\) CLA metalektro\-HP;
* Become part of a great team in a high tech, innovative international organization
* (International) opportunities for growth in tech\-, management\- and commercial roles;
* Attention for personal development and own initiative;
* A nice workplace in a modern building, where we value a good work\-life balance and flexibility;
* 40 leave days per year, travel expenses and a flexible benefits à la carte package with options like purchase/sale of leave hours, internet costs, bicycle plan, company fitness, trade union contribution or relocation costs.


**Interested?**
 Apply now! Click on the button below to upload your profile and show your interest.
   

  

 To ensure that we are a good match, we can ask you to participate in an assessment.
