title: Senior Consultant - Finance Transformation
description:
**EY**
 At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture, and technology, to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
   

  

***The opportunity***
*– What future are you building towards?*
 It is becoming increasingly important for organizations to critically think about improving their strategy and performance in a rapidly changing, digital and innovative world. We advise CFOs of mainly multinationals, but also mid\-market or start\-ups, on the future of their Finance function and support them during large transformation programs. For example, in their journey of becoming ever more data\-driven, we help our clients accelerate by exploring opportunities that emerging technologies such as GenAI and ML bring to the Finance and Finance Analytics space. Next to that, think about advising CFOs on optimal steering information, improving clients’ financial planning and analysis capabilities, realizing a new organizational model, or implementing improved Finance processes and technologies. Also, projects focusing on sustainable Finance and long\-term value get more and more attention. In short, we advise on a broad range of topics that are sky high on the CFO agenda and that our BC Finance team is passionate about.
   

  

***Responsibilities***
*– How can you make a lasting impact in a rapidly changing world?*
 As a Senior Consultant you understand the complex problems our clients face in this rapidly changing environment. Within a multidisciplinary team, you are contributing to key topics that are important to CFOs by:
   

  

* Dealing with topics and changes impactful to both the industry and society
* Owning the topics on the CFO agenda, to contribute to a better working world
* Doing project\-based work in a team and express your ideas on how to help clients improve
* Working in teams and at the same time working independently; at our EY office, at our clients’ offices and remote from home
* Building, maintaining and strengthening internal and external relationships
* Working across multiple projects and geographies in a dynamic and diverse working environment with colleagues from our global EY network
* Demonstrating eagerness and willingness to deliver high quality work
* Incorporating feedback to demonstrate your learning curve
* Combining various skills such as executive presentation, storytelling, analytical skills, conceptual thinking, writing skills, communication skills and project management


***Job requirements***
*– Where do you start if you want to change the world?*
* You completed a university Master’s degree in (Digital) Business, (Business/Financial Economics), Finance, Accounting and Controlling, or a related field
* A minimum of 3 years work experience at a Consulting firm or in the Finance function (e.g., as business controller) of a multinational
* You have proven experience in (Digital) Finance and Finance process improvement (e.g., Order\-to\-Cash, Procure\-to\-Pay and/or Record\-to\-Report) and the desire to obtain more knowledge in the field of Finance, digital enablers and improving the Finance function
* Expertise in Consulting and experienced within the field of Global Business Services (GBS)
* Preferred: experience with processes in transactional systems
* You have a proactive, flexible and positive work attitude and you like to work on challenging and diverse projects
* You are focused on collaborating and working in a multidisciplinary team, and are capable of influencing, encouraging and stimulating others
* You can pick up work independently, individually run client meetings and are able to lead (a part of) a project
* You have the ambition to supervise and coach junior colleagues and contribute to their development
* You are client\-oriented, able to listen carefully to our clients’ questions and needs, and able to translate these into concrete results
* You dare to lead in finance transformation and digitization, and willing to put bold ideas on the table
* You have strong analytical and problem\-solving skills
* You possess excellent communication and presentation skills in English


**Already interested? Apply now!**
***What we offer***
*– Is everything that counts being counted?*
 At EY, personal and professional development and growth are crucial. We like to invest in you and your capabilities, as these determine the quality of our services. You will receive coaching and support, but we encourage taking ownership of development opportunities.
   

  

 In addition, we offer you:
   

  

* Vitality: ample opportunities and the choice is yours. An online session with an external vitality coach, practical tips on topics such as nutrition, energy, sleep and mindset, a discount at Healthcity and/or a voucher card to rent a padel court
* Flexible working: you decide where and when you work in consultation with your team. At home, at the office, at the client or from another European country (up to 20 working days per year)
* Home office arrangement: to optimize your home office, EY provides the following resources for you: office chair, sit/stand desk, an external monitor, a desk lamp, a (Bluetooth) headset, and a large external keyboard
* Laptop and smartphone: you are entitled to a laptop and smartphone with a business subscription.
* Salary: in addition to your fixed salary, depending on EY's financial performance, you may be eligible for a bonus. You are also entitled to an expense allowance (depending on the position) and an internet allowance of €40 net per month
* Time off: you are entitled to 29 vacation days per year when full\-time employed and you have the option to purchase additional days
* Sabbatical: the option to take unpaid leave after consultation
* Birth leave: EY will pay 100% of the birth leave; in the case of additional birth leave, EY will pay 70% of the salary
* Training and education: EY believes it's important to provide everyone with the opportunity for continuous development. Therefore, we offer various soft and hard skills training programs, external courses, and the possibility to enroll in additional education. For example, you can obtain an MBA to broaden your skills in leadership, business, and tech
* Mobility: contribute directly to our ambition to reduce EY's carbon footprint to zero by 2025\. With the new scheme, you can choose from diverse sustainable options through the EY My Daily Travel app or online platform. This includes lease bicycles, electric shared scooters, electric shared cars, flexible lease cars, and various subscriptions for public transport. You can also track your CO2 footprint using the app
* Bicycle arrangement: finance the purchase cost of your new bicycle through a monthly deduction from your gross salary (the purchase cost is spread over 12 months) or from your non\-statutory holiday entitlement
* Pension scheme: you will start building a pension capital immediately upon joining EY. Each month, a premium is allocated to your pension account with our pension provider. You also have the option to voluntarily contribute additional funds to your pension


 For a full overview of our employment package click here: What it's like to work here \| EY \- Netherlands
   

  

***The office***
 Our office in Amsterdam is located on the Zuidas: a bustling area where many companies are based. In our Cross Towers, as many as 1000 people are welcomed daily. Haven't had breakfast yet? Then a special smoothie will be made for you or simply a delicious cappuccino. During lunchtime, the team is ready to serve you a fresh lunch. For a breathtaking view of Amsterdam, head to the 22nd floor. Collaboration takes on a new meaning through the Wavespace. This high\-tech environment brings together clients and colleagues virtually worldwide!
   

  

***Recruitment procedure***
*– How can you prepare for a long life together?*
* Online assessment
* First interview
* Second interview
* Third interview


 Would you like to apply directly? Please click on the Apply button.
   

  

 Due to laws and regulations, and because EY (and in some cases its clients) has high demands on the reliability and integrity of its employees, every new employee will be screened. Depending on your rank the pre\-employment screening could contain the following: Certificate of Conduct (in Dutch: VOG) or \- if requesting a Dutch VOG is not possible \- Criminal Background Check of the country you are currently living or have lived during the last five years, integrity questionnaire, verification of ID, diploma’s and/or work experience and consultation of the Dutch insolvency registry.

title: Content Marketing Manager
description:
**About Gladia**
 Founded in 2022 by Jean\-Louis Queguiner (ex\-OVHCloud) and Jonathan Soto (ex\-MIT/Sigfox), Gladia builds
 **best\-in\-class speech AI tools** 
 that empower businesses to deliver faster, more accurate, and innovative communication solutions worldwide.
   

  

 Headquartered in vibrant tech hubs like
 **Paris** 
 and
 **New York City** 
 , Gladia is leading the charge in
 **speech AI innovation** 
 . In under two years, we’ve grown exponentially, now serving over
 **150,000 users** 
 and
 **700 enterprise client** 
 s—including industry leaders like Attention, Circleback, Method Financial, and VEED.IO.
   

  

 Our API supports advanced speech recognition and analysis in over
 **100 languages** 
 , setting a new standard for speed and accuracy across customer support solutions, voice agents, meeting assistants, and more.
   

  

 Backed by world\-class investors like
 **Sequoia Capital,** 
**New Wave,** 
 and
 **XAnge** 
 , we recently raised
 **$16M in Series A funding** 
 —bringing our total funding to $20\.3M. This investment powers our mission to build the ultimate AI audio infrastructure for leading platforms across the globe.
   

  

**Role**
* Content creation: Write a variety of marketing content, including blog articles, checklists, guides, ebooks, social media posts, decks and video scripts. While some specific pieces may be occasionally outsourced to subject matter experts, youʼd write the vast majority of marketing collateral yourself in the foreseeable.
* Content roadmap: Own and maintain the content calendar, ensuring consistent production of high\-quality content across multiple mediums and audiences. Work closely with the marketing lead to establish and refine Gladia’s voice and tone.
* Content distribution: Think distribution from the time you build a content roadmap and work in tandem with our growth expert to increase traffic to content. Update existing content to improve SEO and drive conversions and repurpose content across multiple channels.
* Content measurement: Together with the team, analyze the impact of content and prioritize the roadmap based on content that builds our brand, drives traffic, and converts.
* Collaborate cross\-functionally: Interview and/or ghostwrite with subject matter experts, and serve as the primary editor across teams.
* Content process: We do not have all of our processes, tools, and workflows built out yet; so together with our marketing lead, youʼll help us maintain and develop Gladiaʼs voice and tone.
* Content project management: If necessary, manage external content contractors or agencies.


**Profile**
* 5\+ years of experience in content marketing, preferably within B2B SaaS companies, ideally centered around either GenAI/LLMS OR APIs.
* Proven ability to develop and execute content strategies that align with business objectives.
* Demonstrated ability to educate audiences through industry\-leading content, with established processes/frameworks/ideas to bring to the table.
* Strong passion for generative AI, ASR, and related AI technologies, with a focus on both developer and decision\-maker audiences.
* Exceptional ability to transform complex ideas into easy\-to\-understand, visually appealing content.
* Highly skilled in both writing and editing with an uncompromising quality bar.
* Experience autonomously managing content roadmaps, editorial calendars, and production processes across multiple content types.


 High level of autonomy, creativity, and initiative in researching information, generating new ideas, and solving challenges.
   

  

**What Gladia Offers**
* The compensation offered is based on seniority and experience and would typically range from €60k to €70k in base salary for roles based in France \+ BSPCE
* Full remote policy with team gathering in Paris every 1\.5 months or work from our amazing offices \& rooftop in the heart of Paris (Sentier)
* Lunch vouchers (approx. 200€/month)
* An allowance of 360 euros/year for your sports activities
* An allowance of 300 euros for the adaptation of your workstation
* A health insurance (100% coverage) and a pension contract with Alan Blue for you \& your family
* Unlimited vacation policy


 At Gladia, we thrive on
 **creativity, collaboration, and a shared passion for pushing the boundaries** 
 . Our team is made up of brilliant AI minds, all working together to deliver solutions that make a real\-world impact. Whether you're looking to solve complex challenges, innovate in a fast\-paced environment, or be part of a global movement transforming communication, Gladia is the place for you !

title: Consultant - Service Operations
job_function: Administrative, Customer Service, and Project Management
description:
**Who You'll Work With**
 You will be based in one of our European offices as part of our Operations Practice.
   

  

 Our Operations Practice assists our clients in solving complex operational challenges. Blending strategic thinking with hands\-on practicality, our teams of consultants and experts work to develop and implement operational strategies that solve our clients’ most pressing problems.
   

  

 McKinsey’s Service Operations service line is part of our Operations Practice. It helps clients create and execute service strategies that lead to competitive advantage, an improved customer experience, higher effectiveness and quality of work, and measurable bottom\-line impact.
   

  

 The service areas we work in range from end\-customer services (e.g., call centers and field services) to internal back\-office operations (e.g., in IT, HR, and Finance). In each of these areas, we help our clients enhance their productivity and set them up for the future, which, in many cases, leads to the longer\-term transformation of the operating model (including structures, processes, technology, and people).
   

  

 When you join McKinsey as a Consultant, you join a firm that will challenge you and invest heavily in your professional development. You will have the opportunity to work in dynamic teams and help leading global organizations solve some of their most challenging and complex problems.
   

  

**Your Impact**
 You will play an active role in problem\-solving for clients, including identifying issues, forming hypotheses, designing and conducting analyses, and synthesizing conclusions into recommendations.
   

  

 You will shape clients’ digital agendas and lead them toward next\-generation operational models—digitally transforming end\-to\-end journeys using advanced analytics, intelligent automation, GenAI, and agile methodologies in service\-oriented industries. Additionally, you will assist our client teams in developing strategies and technology roadmaps for implementing processes and operating systems that support applications connected to digital service operations.
   

  

 As part of your role, you will help clients imagine and implement the future of service delivery—where AI, GenAI, and agentic technologies are reshaping how services are designed, delivered, and scaled.
   

  

 You will work with cross\-functional teams to explore AI\-native operating models, integrate intelligent agents into service ecosystems, and help client’s future\-proof their service strategies by embedding emerging technologies across front\- and back\-office operations.
   

  

 While hands\-on experience in these areas is a plus, what matters most is your ability to think ahead, connect technology to business outcomes, and inspire bold change.
   

  

 You will also gain new skills and build on the strengths you bring to the firm. You will receive exceptional training, frequent coaching, and ongoing mentoring from colleagues and senior leaders on your teams.
   

  

 As part of our two\-year Operations Excellence Program (OEP), you will work on client engagements in the same way as any other McKinsey consultant. You will gain leading edge operations and consultancy skills, primarily through on\-the\-job coaching, which will be complemented by the OEP’s structured capability\-building program.
   

  

 We view the OEP position as the start of a rewarding, challenging and highly flexible career with McKinsey and the Operations practice. During your first few years with the firm, you will serve as a junior practice specialist on multiple client engagements and work with a number of colleagues and clients in a range of industry and operations service lines. You will acquire the necessary knowledge and expertise to help companies achieve excellence in their operations.
   

  

 Along with other members of the OEP community, you will dedicate many days to functional training and knowledge development under the leadership of our operations experts. You will follow a curriculum based on operations excellence themes and will receive advanced training in one of six specific areas of operations manufacturing, product development, purchasing, service operations, supply chain management, or capital excellence.
   

  

 Upon completion of the program, successful consultants will join our global group of leading experts in operational excellence. We already have OEP graduates working at all levels of the firm from associate to partner.
   

  

 Your application should be in English and include your CV and your transcripts (high school, university, etc.), indicating all relevant grades.
   

  

 OPS2024
   

  

**Your Qualifications and Skills**
* Master’s degree and exceptional academic performance
* Initial experience or strong interest in AI\-powered service innovation, including digital solutions, robotics, and emerging technologies such as Generative AI, intelligent agents, and AI\-native service models—ideally in banking, insurance, software, or consulting contexts
* Proven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities
* Mobility and enthusiasm for taking on European assignments during the work week
* Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem\-solving skills
* Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English and local office language

title: Graphic Design Intern
description:
**Graphic Design intern** 




  





 As a Graphic Design Intern at DPDK, you’ll have the opportunity to become a core member of our marketing team. In this role, you will sharpen your skills, expand your portfolio, and contribute to creative and digital assets that define our brand. You’ll focus on designing high\-impact visual and marketing materials while collaborating with a multidisciplinary team of creatives, marketers, and tech specialists. You’re eager to gain hands\-on experience in a fast\-paced, high\-energy environment within an international team.
 



  





**Duties \& Responsibilities** 



* Work closely within the Marketing team to create and redesign high\-quality creative assets that elevate the DPDK brand.
* Play a key role in rebranding DPDK’s marketing assets across multiple platforms and media.
* Translate briefs into stunning, high\-quality designs throughout different productions that align with our brand vision.
* Apply and enhance design systems to ensure consistency and innovation.
* Sweat the details while maintaining an eye for the big picture.
* Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of content creators, marketers, designers, and developers to produce top\-tier creative work.
* Operate GenAI engines to create brand visuals.



  





**Requirements** 



* We are looking for someone who embodies our values of putting people first, chasing the exceptional, embracing change and taking ownership
* A jaw\-dropping portfolio showcasing a multitude of design styles
* Excellent skills in Figma, Adobe Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop, and Firefly
* Fluent in English
* People oriented, team player, disciplined, resourceful, accurate, detail oriented, representative, energetic and flexible
* Preferably available from end of June and for a 5\+ months internship, full\-time (40 hours per week)



  





**Perks and benefits** 



* Be part of a leading international digital agency from the coolest office in Rotterdam
* Join a highly diverse and international team of driven colleagues
* Free lunch at the office, with healthy snacks, drinks, and lots of coffee
* Attend exclusive expertise\-sharing events, relaxing after\-work drinks, and tasty summer BBQs on the roof terrace with the best view in town!
* Internship compensation of 300 euros (based on full\-time)



  





**At DPDK, we lead with our values of putting people first, chasing the exceptional, embracing change and taking ownership. We’re committed to delivering exceptional digital design and challenge everyone to be better and bolder every day. Our team looks forward to welcoming you as a fellow DPDKer!**

title: GenAI Lab Technical Lead
description:
**About The Job**
 Are you a GenAI expert looking to lead the innovation in AI and generative AI, delivering cutting\-edge solutions and transforming business processes while driving cost efficiency and increasing adoption? Join us as out GenAI Technical Lead and be at the forefront of AI advancements and make a significant impact in a dynamic and collaborative environment at our HQ in Hoofddorp, NL.
   

  

**About The Job**
 The GenAI Lab is an expert organization focused on consolidating GenAI expertise within operations. Our mission is to innovate in the GenAI space, delivering state\-of\-the\-art solutions, driving cost efficiency, and increasing adoption. As a GenAI Lab Expert, you will lead GenAI expertise in operations, deliver Proof of Concepts (PoCs) for selected use cases, scale up learnings, and build in\-house capabilities. You will support the delivery of ambitious projects to transform business processes using AI and generative AI, drive cost reduction, and increase the adoption of GenAI. Additionally, you will define and implement sustainable AI/GenAI development and management processes in line with Responsible AI principles and stay updated on new developments in the GenAI market.
   

  

**About You**
 You should have a strong understanding of AI and GenAI technologies, including machine learning, natural language processing, computer vision, and relevant tools. You should have experience in developing and delivering Proof of Concepts (PoCs) quickly, along with strong project management skills to handle multiple projects and ensure timely delivery. Excellent collaboration and communication skills are essential, as is the ability to work closely with other departments and explain technical concepts to non\-technical stakeholders. An innovative mindset and willingness to experiment with new technologies are crucial.
   

  

 Proficiency in at least one programming language (e.g., Python, Java, C\#) and experience with cloud computing platforms (preferably Azure) are necessary. Familiarity with foundation models and orchestration tools is a plus. You should also have experience in backend software development and AI solution development, and the ability to learn and work with emerging technologies in the Cloud/IT space. Fluency in English and a strong interest in cutting\-edge technologies and user experience are essential.
   

  

 Furthermore you have
   

  

* You should have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field. A PhD is a plus.
* You should have professional experience in IT \& Data innovation (preferably AI/GenAI).
* You should have significant experience in project management and delivery of PoCs.
* You should have experience working with cross\-functional teams and managing stakeholder relationships.
* You should have demonstrated ability to stay updated with the latest advancements in AI, machine learning, and natural language processing.
* You should have experience with cloud computing platforms and services (AWS, GCP, Azure).
* You should have proficiency in various programming languages and frameworks relevant to AI development.


 About us
   

  

 Working at Danone is a unique experience. It’s fast\-paced and complex and, at times, it can get a little challenging. But it’s packed with opportunities to learn and grow working with some of the best\-known brands in the world, like Alpro! Bring your unique perspective, ambitions and entrepreneurial ideas to the table – the impact you could make might just surprise you. One Planet. One Health – BY YOU.
   

  

 We’re proud to be a B\-Corp certified company. That means we meet the highest verified standards of social and environmental performance, transparency, and accountability in everything we do.
   

  

 We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. As an Equal Opportunities Employer, we base our hiring decisions on merit, job requirements and business needs.
   

  

**We offer**
 It’s an exciting time to join Danone as
 **GenAI Lab Technical Lead** 
 . You will be able to really see how your work impacts the business. And the best part? You’ll be supported to grow an impactful career that you can be proud of. Together, we’ll build a healthier world.
   

  

 All Danoners receive a complete package of benefits. This includes a competitive salary and yearly bonus, a premium free pension and great discounts on health insurance and Danone products. You will also be eligible for a lease car or car allowance. We understand the importance of flexibility and offer 30 days of annual leave (with the opportunity to purchase more) and a hybrid working environment, where you can work either from home or from one of our People Hubs in Hoofddorp, Utrecht and Rijswijk.
   

  

**What’s Next**
 It’s simple – hit the “apply” button! In order to comply with GDPR we can’t process your personal data without your given consent, so please apply directly via this website. The deadline to apply for this role is 30th April 2025\. Good luck! We can’t wait to meet you.
   

  

 Need more information? Please contact Fariha Samad, Talent Manager at fariha.samad@danone.com.
   

  

* all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status
company_industry: Manufacturing, Food and Beverage Services, and Food and Beverage Manufacturing

title: HR / People Operations Manager
description:
*You know that corporate document or piece of research you know you have somewhere but you can’t seem to find it?* 
 🤯
 *The struggle to gather, organize and visualize all corporate knowledge and insights is real.*
**We are Stravito and this is the problem we solve.**
 Due to the universal nature of the problem, our customers come from various industries all around the world. We help world\-leading organizations, such as McDonald’s, Nestlé, Burberry and Heineken, better understaind their customers and make better, insights\-backed decisions by organizing their knowledge and making it easy to access through our intuitive platform.
   

  

 We really mean it when we say we're a diverse and international team as our team of 100 has more than 30 different nationalities! We are guided by our operating principles: simplicity first, an “own it, do it” mentality, embracing different perspectives, and enjoying the journey together.
   

  

**About The Job**
 We’re looking for an HR/ People Operations Manager who can be a steady anchor to our People team, and play a pivotal role in developing, implementing and continuously improving policies, systems and processes that support the entire employee lifecycle of attracting, developing and retaining high\-performing talent.
   

  

 Our team also covers People Experience and Internal Communications and is led by the Founder and Chief of Staff. Success in this role calls for broad HR and People Operations experience, a strong balance of data\-driven thinking and empathetic leadership, and a commitment to ongoing learning and development.
   

  

****What you’ll do****
* Be the HR/People partner: Act as a resource and trusted advisor to people managers, providing support and guidance on recruitment and development of talents.
* Establish People processes \& best practices: Develop and implement standard operating procedures (SOPs) and people\-centric policies to ensure a consistent and positive employee experience.
* Talent Acquisition: Oversee our recruitment process, assisting with steps from sourcing to onboarding, ensuring we’re bringing in the best talent to elevate our team.
* Talent development \& retention: Create and implement structures and processes to build a high\-performance culture. Operationalize salary benchmarking, job leveling and oversee benefit structure.
* Culture \& Employee engagement: Design and facilitate initiatives with our People Experience Manager that create a warm, inclusive, and inviting remote\-first culture.
* HR legal and VISA\-sponsorship: Operationalize to ensure compliance in collaboration with Legal\- and Finance teams.
* Ownership of HR platform and tools
* Ownership and POC to EoRs.


****About you****
* Background: HRBP or People Operations experience from a global context, ideally from a start up or scale up background. You have proven experience developing and implementing HR processes, policies, and SOPs for companies with several legal entities.
* Analytical mindset: Your problem solving process starts with the end in mind, with a strong focus on desirable outcomes rather than activities. Prioritization comes easy for you in balancing importance/urgency with effort/reach and impact.
* A doer: You love crafting processes, building frameworks, and creating order from scratch. Strong willingness to take ownership and accountability.
* A people person: You enjoy creating connections, fostering relationships, and driving engagement.
* A master of Project Management: You know how to manage your time effectively, and keep things moving forward even when juggling multiple responsibilities. You have the ability to zoom in and out, balancing tactical execution with strategic planning.
* Minimum 5\-7 years of experience in a People Operations/HR role


**What’s in it for you?**
 You will join a remote\-first and globally spread team, with company events a couple of times each year as the icing on the cake 🎂 We offer a fun, collaborative environment where everyone truly cares and helps each other. We have zero micro\-management and instead you are encouraged to cultivate your own processes while giving and receiving feedback for improvement. Add to that a competitive compensation package, the possibility of working with cutting\-edge technology in our industry (such as GenAI) and to be part of simplifying the professional lives of many \- what’s not to like?
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: VP Marketing
description:
*You know that corporate document or piece of research you know you have somewhere but you can’t seem to find it?* 
 🤯
 *The struggle to gather, organize and visualize all corporate knowledge and insights is real.*
**We are Stravito and this is the problem we solve.**
 Due to the universal nature of the problem, our customers come from various industries all around the world. We help world\-leading organizations, such as McDonald’s, Nestlé, Burberry and Heineken, better understaind their customers and make better, insights\-backed decisions by organizing their knowledge and making it easy to access through our intuitive platform.
   

  

 We really mean it when we say we're a diverse and international team as our team of 100 has more than 30 different nationalities! We are guided by our operating principles: simplicity first, an “own it, do it” mentality, embracing different perspectives, and enjoying the journey together.
   

  

**About The Job**
 Stravito is looking for a passionate and experienced VP of B2B (Enterprise) Marketing to reach our North Star Goal of serving 50% of the Fortune 500\. The VP Marketing will be part of the leadership team, with a pivotal role in driving day\-to\-day marketing operations and delivering on the broader company objectives.
   

  

 The VP of Marketing will translate Stravito’s strategic goals and Objectives and Key Results into an actionable marketing strategy. Success in this role requires someone with deep enterprise SaaS experience, the ability to make data\-driven decisions and the leadership to guide marketing teams toward swift and continuous improvement.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Marketing Strategy: Define, implement, and manage a strategic marketing plan aligned with Stravito’s company vision and business objectives. Balance short\-term lead\-generation and demand\-generation goals with initiatives for long\-term brand positioning, market education, and category leadership. This also includes owning and optimizing the website to ensure it effectively communicates Stravito’s value proposition, supports conversion goals, and acts as a key channel for customer engagement and education.
* Continuous Market Insight and Innovation: Foster a customer\-centric approach to marketing through deep understanding of customer pain points, buyer journeys, and market trends. Regularly test, measure, and iterate messaging, channels, and campaigns to optimize impact and conversion rates.
* Team Leadership \& Management: Build, develop, and lead a high\-performing marketing team, providing clear strategic direction, mentoring, and professional development. Create a culture of experimentation, learning, and continuous improvement.
* Cross\-Functional Collaboration: Establish strong, collaborative partnerships with Sales, Client Development, Customer Success, Product, and Operations teams. Ensure marketing strategies effectively support sales pipeline goals, customer retention, and product positioning.
* Operational Excellence: Instill disciplined marketing processes, clearly defined metrics, and accountability for outcomes. Set rigorous standards for performance tracking, reporting, budget management, and continuous process improvement to maximize marketing efficiency and effectiveness
* Guide and scale the company’s Account\-Based Marketing (ABM) strategy to drive pipeline growth from 10 to 50\+ mEUR in ARR, aligning closely with Sales, Product, and Customer Success to target high\-value enterprise accounts.
* Expertise in Account\-Based Marketing (ABM), with demonstrated results in targeting and converting enterprise\-level accounts through highly coordinated, multichannel programs.
* Ability to balance brand and demand initiatives, supporting the efforts of the global brand team to establish top\-of\-funnel visibility and awareness, while driving pipeline expansion to ensure sustained long\-term growth.
* Hands\-on experience developing and executing field marketing strategies, particularly for breaking into new international markets and engaging complex buying committees.
* Oversee the redesign of the corporate website, optimizing UX, conversion paths, and messaging to reflect evolving go\-to\-market priorities and better serve enterprise buyers across global regions.
* Drive SEO performance and visibility in large language model (LLM) search environments, ensuring the brand remains discoverable, credible, and competitive in both traditional and AI\-driven search experiences.
* Lead field marketing strategy and execution to penetrate new international markets, engage enterprise buying committees, and accelerate revenue growth from high\-potential regions.
* Support expansion efforts within existing accounts, working cross\-functionally with Sales and Customer Success to deepen relationships, uncover upsell opportunities, and increase customer lifetime value.
* Guide the corporate events strategy, from industry conferences to proprietary experiences, ensuring brand alignment, high\-value engagement, and strong ROI from in\-person and virtual activations.


**About You**
* Proven B2B Marketing Leadership: Demonstrated success in leading marketing organizations within enterprise SaaS companies, driving measurable pipeline generation, revenue impact, and category growth.
* Proven experience leading a marketing organization through rapid scaling, including growing revenue from 10 to 50\+ mEUR in ARR, with deep understanding of the challenges and opportunities that come with high\-growth phases.
* A track record of success in fast\-paced, entrepreneurial environments, with the agility to pivot, the foresight to prioritize, and the leadership maturity to guide teams from start\-up scrappiness to structured growth.
* Highly Analytical: Adept at leveraging both quantitative and qualitative data to inform marketing strategy, segmentation, messaging optimization, and resource allocation.
* Customer\-Centric Mindset: Proven ability to deeply understand enterprise buyer personas, develop compelling value propositions, and design marketing initiatives aligned with customer needs and purchasing cycles.
* Strategic Alignment: Skilled at synthesizing input from Sales, Product, Customer Success, and external market trends to ensure marketing activities consistently align with and support broader company objectives.
* Excellent Communicator: Exceptional storytelling and communication skills, capable of articulating marketing strategies, initiatives, and outcomes clearly and persuasively to senior executives, board members, customers, partners, and internal teams.


**What’s in it for you?**
 You will join a remote\-first and globally spread team, with company events a couple of times each year as the icing on the cake 🎂 We offer a fun, collaborative environment where everyone truly cares and helps each other. We have zero micro\-management and instead you are encouraged to cultivate your own processes while giving and receiving feedback for improvement. Add to that a competitive compensation package, the possibility of working with cutting\-edge technology in our industry (such as GenAI) and to be part of simplifying the professional lives of many \- what’s not to like?
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Automation Manager
description:
**Wij zijn DELTA Fiber Nederland, de werkgever achter de merken DELTA en Caiway. We zijn een groeiende en ambitieuze telecomaanbieder met de ambitie om zo veel mogelijk mensen in Nederland van razendsnel internet, interactieve televisie en (mobiele) telefonie te voorzien. Wij zijn de glasvezel experts van Nederland en breiden we ons supersnelle netwerk uit met de nieuwste technologie glasvezel, ook in gebieden waar snel internet nog niet vanzelfsprekend is. Bouw jij mee aan onze ambitie?** 




  





**Ga jij verder als Automation Manager?** 




 Als Automation Manager binnen de afdeling Business Process Management definieer, coördineer en implementeer je de lange termijn visie voor automatisering en digitale transformatie binnen de organisatie. De afdeling Business Process Management zorgt ervoor dat technologie en bedrijfsstrategie naadloos op elkaar aansluiten, met als doel een efficiënte, innovatieve en data\-gedreven organisatie. In samenwerking met de Digital Strategy Lead en Lead Architect stuurt en ondersteunt Business Process Management de technologische visie en uitvoering.
 



  





 In deze rol ben je verantwoordelijk voor het ontwikkelen en uitvoeren van de lange termijn visie voor automatisering en digitale transformatie binnen de organisatie. Je werkt nauw samen met verschillende stakeholders om procesautomatisering te identificeren, geavanceerde technologieën te integreren en het IT\-landschap te optimaliseren. Jij fungeert als sparringpartner voor digital strategy en architectuur en speelt een belangrijke rol in het implementeren van strategische automatiseringsoplossingen en het leiden van projecten.
 



 Daarnaast ben je op de hoogte van markttrends en de activiteiten van de concurrentie. Je blijft up\-to\-date door relevante externe kennissessies bij te wonen en speelt een actieve rol binnen DFN. Je zoekt teams en managementteams op en inspireert de Digital Strategy Lead, architecten en andere belangrijke stakeholders.
 



 Jij bent de verbindende schakel tussen teams zoals Business Change Management, IT DevOps en andere belangrijke stakeholders. Je zet zowel technische expertise als strategisch inzicht in om innovatieve automatiseringsoplossingen te realiseren en processen te verbeteren.
 



  





**Tot jouw takenpakket behoren o.a.:** 




  




* In samenwerking met Business Process Management identificeren van procesautomatiseringsmogelijkheden in verschillende afdelingen en het bepalen van prioriteiten.
* Sparringpartner voor architectuur en de digital strategy lead. Houdt het grotere plaatje in de gaten en denkt mee over versimpeling van het IT\-landschap en toekomstige automatiseringsbehoeften.
* Samenwerken met stakeholders om robuuste business cases te ontwikkelen voor automatiseringsinitiatieven, waarbij de voordelen, kosten en risico’s helder in kaart worden gebracht.
* Zelfstandig actief onderzoeken van nieuwe technologieën, producten of processen die de prestaties verbeteren.
* Samenwerken met de Vendor Manager om relaties met externe leveranciers te beheren en nieuwe mogelijkheden te verkennen voor automatisering en optimaal gebruik te maken van bestaande oplossingen.
* Organiseren en faciliteren van kennissessies, verkenningssessies en ideation workshops voor interne teams en stakeholders.
* Beheren van de integratie van automatiseringstools zoals bijvoorbeeld: robotprocesautomatisering (RPA), workflow automatisering en AI\-oplossingen.



  





**Wordt dit jouw nieuwe uitdaging?** 




 Jij weet hoe je helder en begrijpelijk kunt communiceren, zodat complexe concepten voor iedereen duidelijk zijn. Jij durft buiten de gebaande paden te denken en opent nieuwe wegen voor innovatieve oplossingen. Met jouw initiatief draag je bij aan het verbeteren van werkstandaarden, zodat we altijd consistente en hoogwaardige resultaten behalen. Door feitelijke informatie van aannames te onderscheiden, kun je weloverwogen beslissingen nemen en de lange termijn gevolgen van acties goed overzien. Jij maakt heldere afspraken over hoe we lange termijn doelen bereiken en zorgt ervoor dat deze afspraken nageleefd worden. Met een proactieve, flexibele en oplossingsgerichte houding weet jij zowel strategische als operationele vraagstukken te combineren en kansen te benutten.
 



 De standplaats voor deze functie is in Schiedam, perfect gelegen tussen de snelweg en het station in.
 



  





**Dit neem je mee:** 




  




* HBO/WO werk\- en denkniveau, bij voorkeur in de richting van Bedrijfskunde, Informatica, of een vergelijkbare studie;
* Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke rol, met aantoonbare ervaring in bedrijfsautomatisering en procesverbetering binnen de IT, data, AI of technologiebranche;
* Ervaring met het ontwikkelen van business cases en het beheren van leveranciersrelaties;
* In staat om zowel zelfstandig als in samenwerking met andere teams resultaatgericht te werken;
* Begrip van software\-architecturen en de integratie van automatiseringsoplossingen binnen IT\-landschappen;
* Diepgaande kennis van de verschillende toepassingen en tooling binnen de automatiseringswereld zoals RPA, process mining en GenAI.
* Kennis van of ervaring met oplossingen zoals Camunda, Ui\-path en Genesys is een pre;
* Kennis van de telecombranche is een pre.



  





**Waarom DELTA?** 




 Onze arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn niet alleen goed, maar ook nog eens flexibel in te zetten. Met onze uitstekende pensioenregeling wordt ook aan je toekomst gedacht en met jouw Benefit Budget bepaal je zelf hoe je jouw arbeidsvoorwaarden inzet. Ook zijn er volop ontwikkelmogelijkheden binnen onze organisatie.

title: (Senior) Manager Digital Transformation
description:
**Job Description \& Summary**
 In our digital transformation team, we work on complex transformation projects, where the impact of new laws and regulations (e.g. CSRD, ESEF), reporting requirements and changes in the IT landscape play a crucial role. We work closely with our clients to make optimal use of technology during these complex processes (e.g. during an IPO, merger or acquisition), stimulate innovation and help them transform to a future\-proof and agile business model.
   

  

 Are you a driven professional with a business, technical or financial background? Do you have an affinity with financial reporting rules and experience with IT, digitalisation or information management? Will you help our clients with the successful completion of digital transformation projects associated with those developments and provide them with strategic advice? Would you also like to work in an ambitious team and continue your personal and professional development? If that profile suits you, then you are the Manager Digital Transformation we are looking for!
   

  

**What will you be doing?**
 As Manager Digital Transformation, you will mostly operate in multidisciplinary teams (including deals \& technical accounting experts, ERP \& technology specialists, software developers and data analysts) to successfully execute challenging digital transformation projects. You will often assume the role of project manager, acting as the customer’s contact point and being responsible for the correct delivery of the end product. Your role for a particular project will be the one best suited to the specific transformation project: from strategic reorientation, to choosing technology, to actual implementation and process optimisation.
   

  

 Your work environment is dynamic; it ranges from working at a client's offices or at the PwC office to the flexibility of working from home. To meet the needs of our customers, we continuously invest globally in the development of our team members, our skills and the innovative tools that we use to help our clients transform sustainably and stay ahead of the competition. This leads to many opportunities to develop yourself into a “trusted boardroom advisor”.
   

  

 As a Manager Digital Transformation the activities that you will be working on include:
   

  

* Developing and shaping digital and IT strategies and solutions along with the associated road maps for the client, which are necessary for the success of the digital transformation (e.g. during an IPO or major transformation).
* Working out business requirements (functional and non\-functional) in a multidisciplinary team to optimise the organisation, processes, systems and reporting.
* Advising clients on how to optimise their financial reporting processes and comply with relevant legislation.
* Identifying operational and financial risks and implementing and/or automating controls.
* Building a relationship of trust with our clients, actively challenging them based on your expertise and expanding our client portfolio.
* Coaching colleagues in the areas of personal growth and development of various consulting skills.


 At PwC, you will be part of a dynamic, international and multidisciplinary team of experts. Along with your colleagues, you will excel in our clients’ environments. You will also help to optimise our knowledge, methodologies and tools.
   

  

**Does this describe you?**
 You have a combination of strategic and analytical insights. You have a passion for emerging technologies (including (GenAI, Cloud \& RPA) and demonstrable experience with (financial) business processes. You are ambitious, want to solve complex problems and make an impact on our customers. You are people\-oriented, enjoy leading multidisciplinary teams. In addition, you can create powerful reports and visuals and give convincing presentations for (senior) management.You are bursting with energy and:
   

  

* You have at least five years of relevant work experience with (digital) transformation projects in complex environments.
* You have a university degree in a subject such as technical or non\-technical business administration, financial management, information management or similar.
* You have an affinity with financial reporting rules (an RA or RC training is a plus) or want to further develop this knowledge
* You have demonstrable experience and affinity with IT, digitalisation, information management and/or advanced technical skills in data and software development.
* You are motivated to advise clients on how to optimise their IT operations, financial \& operational processes, associated systems \& controls.
* You have an understanding of emerging technologies, such as AI, Cloud, RPA and are open to further explore innovative solutions from our alliance partners (including Workiva, SAP, Workday, Microsoft).
* You are people\-oriented and socially adept in political, dynamic and complex environments. You are also creative when it comes to managing different stakeholders.
* You are able to draw up powerful reports and give convincing presentations to senior management.
* You are fluent in Dutch and English, both spoken and written.


**What are we offering?**
 At PwC, you will have the opportunity to be yourself, get the best out of yourself in a high\-performance organisation and grow within our global network. As part of our team we offer:
   

  

* A competitive salary, attractive pension plan and the opportunity to grow;
* Customised training for professional growth and leadership development;
* Motivating work environment where collaboration with ambitious colleagues and recognition for your contributions are highly valued;
* Comprehensive benefits including "well\-being budget" for physical and mental health;
* Flexibility of hybrid working, including ergonomic home office and fixed expense allowance including internet allowance;
* Attractive mobility options, including electric lease car, car waiver allowance and the possibility of using different shared transport providers;
* 32 vacation days per year;
* Fun extras such as various informal company activities.


 These are just a handful of our terms of employment. Find more information on our website.
   

  

**Getting started at PwC**
 Are you interested in this vacancy and do you meet the requirements? Then let us know what motivates you and fill in your details. After we’ve received your application,
   

  

* you’ll immediately receive confirmation in your inbox.
* If your qualifications match the profile that we have in mind, then we’ll contact you within two weeks for a short introduction meeting.
* If everyone is enthusiastic, we’ll schedule an online assessment. Depending on the result, you'll receive an invitation for an initial interview. Click here for more information about the application process.


 If you would like more detailed information about the position of Manager Digital Transformation at PwC, don't hesitate to contact us! Hester van Meurs will be happy to help you by phone, e\-mail, or WhatsApp.
   

  

 Hester van Meurs –
 **hester.van.meurs@pwc.com** 
 \- 06 3875 6994

title: Customer Success Manager Europe
description:
*You know that corporate document or piece of research you know you have somewhere but you can’t seem to find it?* 
 🤯
 *The struggle to gather, organize and visualize all corporate knowledge and insights is real.*
**We are Stravito and this is the problem we solve.**
 Due to the universal nature of the problem, our customers come from various industries all around the world. We help world\-leading organizations, such as McDonald’s, Nestlé, Burberry and Heineken, better understaind their customers and make better, insights\-backed decisions by organizing their knowledge and making it easy to access through our intuitive platform.
   

  

 We really mean it when we say we're a diverse and international team as our team of 100 has more than 30 different nationalities! We are guided by our operating principles: simplicity first, an “own it, do it” mentality, embracing different perspectives, and enjoying the journey together.
   

  

**About The Job**
 As a Customer Success Manager, you will have ownership of driving engagement and value for a portfolio of enterprise customers. You will:
   

  

* Manage, support and develop a portfolio of enterprise customers (B2B)
* Connect with stakeholders to understand and develop expertise when it comes to what drives user value and engagement
* Develop the business by identifying patterns and synergies between different end\-user use cases
* Proactively share customer learnings and insights with the broader Stravito team.
* Report to the Lead Customer Success Manager for Europe
* Work closely with Product, Tech \& Design to make it happen!


**About You**
 To be successful in this role, you need:
   

  

* Previous experience as Customer Success Manager (B2B)
* “Customer mindset” \- knowing what to listen for, be able to separate between what is being said and what the underlying drivers are
* Business\-orientation \- constantly thinking of how to grow and scale your customer.
* Ability to thrive in start\-up and remote\-first environments
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills
* Fluency in English, both spoken and written


 This role is remote but applicants must be located in The Netherlands, The UK or Sweden.
   

  

**What’s in it for you?**
 You will join a remote\-first and globally spread team, with company events a couple of times each year as the icing on the cake 🎂 We offer a fun, collaborative environment where everyone truly cares and helps each other. We have zero micro\-management and instead you are encouraged to cultivate your own processes while giving and receiving feedback for improvement. Add to that a competitive compensation package, the possibility of working with cutting\-edge technology in our industry (such as GenAI) and to be part of simplifying the professional lives of many \- what’s not to like?
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Senior Software Engineer** 




 📍 Amsterdam (hybrid)
 



  





 🚀
 **The Mission:** 




 This well\-funded, ambitious startup—backed by top\-tier investors—is on a mission to transform how employees understand and make the most of their compensation and benefits. Their innovative platform empowers employees to clearly grasp their financial opportunities, while enabling employers to drive higher engagement and appreciation for their rewards packages.
 



 The environment is fast\-paced, entrepreneurial, and highly collaborative.
 



  





 🫵
 **About you** 




 They’re looking for a
 **Senior Backend Engineer** 
 to help build the technical foundation of a modern total rewards platform. Join a small, collaborative team where you’ll own backend systems, lead cloud infrastructure efforts, and shape core architectural decisions.
 



  





 This role prioritizes
 **deep backend and AWS infrastructure experience** 
 . Frontend experience isn’t required—just a willingness to pitch in across the stack when needed.
 



  





**🛠️ What You’ll Do** 



* Own and evolve backend services (NestJS, Express) and cloud infrastructure (AWS with Terragrunt).
* Build scalable, secure systems powering real\-time dashboards, personalization, and enterprise features.
* Integrate AI/LLM capabilities where they add real value to the HR and employee experience.
* Collaborate with product, design, and engineering to ship high\-quality features fast.
* Drive code reviews, design discussions, and improve engineering practices.
* Occasionally pitch in on the frontend (Next.js)—with support as you ramp up.



  





 ✅
 **Requirements** 



* 6\+ years of experience with a strong backend focus and a track record of building well\-architected systems.
* Expertise in
 **TypeScript** 
 ,
 **Node.js** 
 , and frameworks like
 **NestJS** 
 or
 **Express** 
 .
* Hands\-on experience with
 **AWS** 
 infrastructure, using
 **Terraform** 
 or
 **Terragrunt** 
 .
* Solid grasp of scalable, secure, and automated infrastructure design.
* Clear communicator with a collaborative, product\-driven mindset.
* Comfortable in a fast\-paced startup—ownership, autonomy, and ambiguity don’t scare you.

title: Senior Product Manager (TractoAI)
description:
We are looking for a Senior Product Manager to join our
 
 TractoAI
 
 team.
 



  





**About Nebius:** 
 Nebius is a Nasdaq\-listed tech company that aims to become one of the world’s leading AI infrastructure providers. Headquartered in Amsterdam, we have R\&D and commercial hubs across the US, Europe and Israel.
 



  





 Nebius is growing fast, and we’re always looking for the best talent to join our company. Along with highly competitive compensation and extensive opportunities for professional development, we offer a dynamic work environment where innovation, creativity and teamwork are highly prized and open up exciting new opportunities. As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace, where all applicants are given fair consideration and every team member is empowered to contribute to their fullest potential.
 



  





**About TractoAI:** 

 TractoAI
 
 is built on top of the mature, open\-source
 
 YTsaurus
 
 technology, which boasts a decade\-long proven track record within BigTech companies. Our platform is designed to be highly scalable, resilient, and multitenant, capable of handling up to tens of thousands of servers, exabytes of data, millions of CPU cores, and tens of thousands of GPUs. TractoAI is a new experimental direction within Nebius AI, aiming to provide an end\-to\-end platform solution for all kinds of BigData and AI challenges, including data preparation, distributed training, offline model inference, and more.
 



  





 We have already secured multiple clients, including such names as
 
 JetBrains Mellum
 
 ,
 
 PleIAs.fr
 
 . Some of these clients use TractoAI as their primary data lake or as a foundation for large language model (LLM) pre\-training.
 



  





**Our Vision:** 
 We aim to create a leading BigData and ML product, competing with top cloud\-like Data/AI platforms such as Databricks, Snowflake, VastData, MosaicML, and corresponding products from the hyperscaler clouds like AWS, Azure, or GCP. Our challenge lies in converting powerful technology into a successful product by defining the target audience, and expanding our existing client base. We are committed to making AI research and development more accessible, empowering experts worldwide to accelerate their work and generate reliable data and models.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 
 We are seeking a skilled professional to join our team and contribute their expertise in shaping TractoAI into a superior product. You will collaborate closely with a team of accomplished professionals who have played key roles in the success of groundbreaking technological products such as
 
 YTsaurus
 
 and
 
 DataLens
 
 . In this role, you will focus on developing the most user\-centric and cutting\-edge features of TractoAI, including Tracto Notebooks, Tracto Images, Orchestracto and TractoRun. Additionally, you will help drive the next generation of AI\-driven capabilities, such as agentic data exploration, dataset and model marketplaces, and a generative AI workflow library, among many others.
 



  





 As one of your initial responsibilities, you will work on enhancing user\-facing learning materials, including technical demonstrations, interactive playgrounds, comprehensive documentation and a solution library.
 



  





**Must\-haves:** 



* Experience with Cloud and SaaS services.
* Experience in AI domain area, including model training, model fine\-tuning and model inference.
* Knowledge of the latest advancements and trends in BigData and AI.
* Experience in creating user\-focused educational content such as documentation and tutorials.
* Product management experience, working with cross\-functional teams.
* Capability to thrive in a fast\-paced, experimental environment and be comfortable with ambiguity.
* Not being afraid of command\-line interfaces, Python notebooks and reading logs.



  





**Key responsibilities:** 



* Collaborate with multiple front\-end and back\-end development teams.
* Define and refine product strategy while prioritizing the development backlog.
* Conduct in\-depth competitive analysis, benchmarking TractoAI against both proprietary and open\-source solutions.
* Identify the needs and pain points of current and prospective customers, translating them into actionable product strategies.
* Work alongside a core group of product leaders to validate product\-market fit and position TractoAI as the industry standard for BigData and AI workloads.



  





*We conduct coding interviews as part of the process.* 




  





 We’re growing and expanding our products every day. If you’re up to the challenge and are excited about AI and ML as much as we are, join us!
