title: Scada Technical Specialist
description:
**CAPGEMINI ENGINEERING**
-------------------------

**At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life\-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R\&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.**

**YOUR ROLE**
-------------

**As a SCADA Technical Specialist at Capgemini Engineering, you will play a crucial role in supporting the energy industry, especially as more and more investments are made in green energy sources. These investments pose new challenges for grid management, but Capgemini Engineering is at the forefront of providing expertise in SCADA and Energy Management Systems (EMS). With a team of around 60 professionals, we help clients across the Energy, Life Science, High Tech, and Manufacturing industries drive innovation and overcome these challenges.**

**In this role, you will:**

* **Configure and maintain On\-premise and cloud\-based SCADA systems to meet specific requirements, including change management systems such as AspenTech/OSI Monarch.**
* **Collaborate with cross\-functional teams to integrate SCADA systems seamlessly with EMS and other industry\-specific platforms.**
* **Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to SCADA systems, ensuring continuous operation and performance.**
* **Design and implement system enhancements and upgrades for SCADA and other systems to improve functionality.**
* **Provide technical support and training to end\-users, ensuring effective adoption and efficient system use.**
**YOUR PROFILE**
----------------

**To succeed in this role, you should have:**

* **A degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.**
* **Experience configuring and maintaining On\-Premise and cloud\-based SCADA systems with a deep understanding of SCADA and domain principles**
* **Strong knowledge of SCADA, EMS, DCS, and network protocols like ISA\-88, ISA\-95, IEC60870\-5\-101 and 104, IEC61850, C37\.118, OPC UA, MQTT, or Kafka.**
* **A strong understanding of the energy sector and the challenges posed by increasing integration of green energy sources into the grid.**
* **Excellent problem\-solving, analytical skills, and the ability to communicate complex technical concepts to diverse teams.**
* **The ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.**
**WHAT YOU’LL LOVE ABOUT WORKING HERE**
---------------------------------------

**At Capgemini Engineering, we offer a dynamic, collaborative environment where innovation thrives:**

* **Permanent contract from day one, ensuring job security.**
* **Competitive salary and benefits package, including remote work allowances and high connectivity options.**
* **Access to training, certifications, and career development programs.**
* **A collaborative and diverse work environment encourages creative problem\-solving and teamwork across various industries.**
* **Flexible work arrangements, including hybrid work models, to promote a healthy work\-life balance.**
* **26 vacation days, with an option to purchase additional leave.**
**NOTE**
--------

**To ensure safety and integrity within our organization, an identity check and background check are part of the onboarding process.**

**DISCLAIMER**
--------------

**At Capgemini, we believe in a workplace where everyone feels valued for who they are is part of our DNA and instrumental to our long\-term performance. We are building broad talent pools to be able to provide high quality capabilities to our clients, with the right skills and talent mix.**

**ABOUT CAPGEMINI**
-------------------

**Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55\-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end\-to\-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22\.1 billion.**

**Get the Future You Want \|** **www.capgemini.com**

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Do you want to make a real impact by improving Dutch healthcare? At ZorgDomein, we help patients get the right care in the right place — every single day. We’re building a modern digital platform that plays a crucial role in the Dutch healthcare system. Want to be part of something meaningful? Read on — you might be the next addition to our enthusiastic and purpose\-driven team.


**We are ZorgDomein**
---------------------



How can you continually improve healthcare in the Netherlands? How do you make extra time and space for patients, and give them more attention? These are the sort of questions that are central to our work at ZorgDomein. We develop smart technology to create more room for human work in healthcare. That’s how we help healthcare professionals such as family doctors, physiotherapists and lab technicians to do what they do best: give patients the best possible healthcare. We have been doing just that for 25 years.


**Established name with ambition**
----------------------------------



Did you know that nearly all referrals and diagnostic requests are channelled through our platform? In fact, in 2024 our platform was used nearly 24 million times to refer or request research for patients. ZorgDomein is an established name in the Netherlands, but for us the adventure has only just begun. Our healthy ambition is to ensure even better coordination of supply and demand in the healthcare sector. With a user\-friendly, high\-tech platform and digital solutions. And by building lasting relationships with healthcare professionals. There’s plenty of work to be done at ZorgDomein and we could use your help in it.


**Your role at ZorgDomein**
---------------------------



As a Senior Software Engineer, you play a key role in shaping and building the foundation of our platform. You work closely with the Product Manager and collaborate with your team to turn complex healthcare challenges into smart, scalable technical solutions. You bring vision, technical leadership, and a strong sense of ownership to the table.



You will be part of a team who is responsible for core functionalities like user authorization, registration, login flows, and organization management — the essential building blocks that ensure a secure and seamless experience across our platform.



Together with your team, you are responsible for:


* Designing and delivering high\-quality, scalable features
* Balancing technical decisions with business goals
* Keeping the platform’s architecture clean and future\-proof
* Writing, deploying, and maintaining production\-ready code
* Monitoring key metrics and platform performance
* Conducting thorough code reviews
* Driving innovation within your team and across the engineering organization
* Experiment and implement AI powered solutions

**Our tech stack:**


* Scala 3
* Kafka / Event Streaming
* Kubernetes / Helm / ArgoCD
* AWS (including S3 and related services)
* Microservices architecture
* Domain Driven Design \& Hexagonal Architecture
* Event Sourcing \& CQRS
* ZIO

**About you**
-------------


* 10\+ years of relevant experience in backend development
* Solid experience with Scala (or similar, such as Java)
* Familiarity with Functional Programming principles
* A proactive, curious, and independent mindset
* A strong sense of responsibility and craftsmanship
* A collaborative attitude — you love working with others to solve complex problems

**Working in your own way**
---------------------------



You will join a hard\-working family of 200 colleagues. A great bunch of professionals working together to achieve something valuable: better flow in the Dutch healthcare sector. ZorgDomein employees enjoy working here because the work climate is ideal. The secret? You enjoy the total confidence of your colleagues to do what you do best. That means you have a high degree of autonomy. You have freedom to work in your own way.


**Healthy work environment**
----------------------------



Are you looking for a work environment where you feel comfortable? ZorgDomein is the right place for you. Here, you can be yourself and work in a way that suits you. We highly value a healthy work\-life balance. That’s why we provide a pleasant workplace where you feel at home and can collaborate well with your team.



What else do we offer you:


* An informal team of enthusiastic and driven professionals that is fully committed to realize the mission on a daily basis
* A workplace in our beautiful office on the Vecht, but also an ergonomical workspace at home
* Salary between € 6\.000,\- and € 7\.000,\- based on fulltime employment (you are available to work for 36 to 40 hours per week)
* Flexible leave policy
* Full payments for your pension policy by ZorgDomein
* Attention for your growth through personal attention, our development days and an additional personal development budget
* As a part of the Visma Group you will have access to the Visma learning environment
* Fun! With our (digital) events and (sport)activities we create an relaxed atmosphere and we will keep you sharp and fit!

**Do you see yourself working at ZorgDomein?**
----------------------------------------------



In that case, we want to know more about you! You can apply by clicking on the orange button below. If you have any questions about the vacancy, get in touch withrecruitment@zorgdomein.nl addressed to Robina Schouten.

title: Conversational Designer
description:
Als conversational designer speel jij een belangrijke rol in het leveren van een betekenisvolle en aangename gebruikservaring voor onze klanten. Je werkt voor de merken Essent en energiedirect en zorgt voor een optimale dienstverlening die de energietransitie ondersteunt.



Digital service is een belangrijk onderdeel van onze doelstellingen: steeds meer mensen helpen met energie\-inzicht en het bieden van eenvoudige, efficiënte service. Door jouw expertise in chatbots en voicebots krijgen onze klanten snelle en slimme antwoorden op hun vragen, precies wanneer ze die nodig hebben.


Alleen samen zetten we de volgende stap in de energietransitie. Als Conversational Designer zorg jij ervoor dat onze digitale assistenten goed werken. Je bouwt dialogen, zorgt voor slimme antwoorden en verbetert de bots met data en AI. Zo help je klanten elke dag beter! Jij bent als Conversational Designer dé expert binnen jouw vakgebied bij het:


* Ontwerpen van gesprekken en dialogen aan de hand van data, gebruikersonderzoek, input van de kennishouders en volgens de huisstijl.
* Maken van user flows voor interacties tussen gebruikers en de gespreksinterface.
* Conversaties testen en verbeteren om de gebruikerservaring te optimaliseren.
* Gebruikersfeedback en data analyseren om de gesprekken te verbeteren en aan te passen.
* Samenwerken met teamleden zoals Conversational engineers, UX\-designers, Content specialisten en kennishouders om een samenhangende en effectieve gesprekservaring te ontwikkelen.


Daniëlle Scheers, Manager Experience Design: 'In deze functie ben je onderdeel van een ambitieus team dat bestaat uit UX designers, contentspecialisten en conversational designers. Samen met het agile conversational team werk je aan de chatbots en voicebots van Essent en Energiedirect. De sfeer in ons team is gedreven, gezellig en gericht op het maken van echte impact voor onze klanten.'


Wij zoeken teamspelers en doeners die Nederland een stukje duurzamer willen maken. Die kijken naar wat er nú kan. Vandaag. Om ons dichter te brengen bij morgen. Jij herkent jezelf hierin en in het volgende plaatje:


* Meerdere jaren werkervaring als conversational designer: je kan natuurlijke dialogen maken en hebt ervaring met het testen en optimaliseren van conversaties
* Ervaring met platforms zoals Cognigy, Dialogflow of een ander platform
* Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal en je bent goed in klantgericht schrijven
* Je vindt het leuk om met data te werken en verbeteringen te vinden


De ideale kandidaat voor deze functie heeft bovengemiddeld talent voor klantgerichtheid, resultaatgerichtheid, taalvaardigheid en samenwerking.


We waarderen de energie en motivatie die jij in je werk stopt zodat wij energiepartner van onze klanten kunnen zijn. Dat doen we met een mooi pakket aan voorwaarden. Wij bieden je:


* De kans om vanuit jouw expertise bij te dragen aan de energietransitie in Nederland!
* Een bruto maandsalaris tussen €3\.844 en €5\.920
* Een flexibel benefit budget dat je maandelijks naar wens opspaart, laat uitbetalen of inzet voor verlof. Dit budget is opgebouwd uit de waarde van: 8% vakantiegeld, 1,8% benefit bijdrage, 4,5% eindejaarsuitkering, 7 bovenwettelijke vakantiedagen, 13 ADV\-dagen, 3,5 dag vitaliteitsverlof.
* Een jaarlijkse resultaatafhankelijke uitkering van 3% om onze waardering nog meer uit te spreken.
* De mogelijkheid om hybride te werken, maar dan ook echt. Jij bepaalt waar je werkt, ieder dag weer. Liever een workation? 20 dagen per jaar mag je vanuit een ander land binnen Europa werken.
* Korting op je energierekening én op alle energieproducten (zonnepanelen, warmtepomp, onderhoud etc.).
* Een prachtig hoofdkantoor op loopafstand van Centraal Station Den Bosch met o.a. een goede koffiebar, twee bedrijfsrestaurants en gratis vers fruit.
* Een NS Business Card voor woon\-werk verkeer of een kilometervergoeding. Jij bepaalt.
* Ontwikkel\- en doorgroeimogelijkheden en bijbehorend persoonlijk ontwikkelbudget van €500 per jaar. Ook functie\-gerelateerde opleidingen, trainingen en cursussen volg je op onze kosten. Internationale ambitie? Als onderdeel van de E.ON Group bieden we je ook volop ontwikkelkansen binnen de andere E.ON landen.
* En last but not least: een omgeving waarin je jezelf kunt zijn. Voor ons telt alleen wie je bent en wat je kunt. Voel je vrij om je sekse, nationaliteit en leeftijd weg te laten op je cv.


Dit is dé kans om als Conversational Designer aan de slag te gaan. Solliciteren kan tot 5 mei. Daarna hoor je snel meer van ons. Neem je Conversational portfolio mee naar het gesprek. Tijdens de sollicitatie vragen we je om twee dialogen te presenteren, met een focus op het proces en de gemaakte keuzes. Benieuwd naar het vervolg? Bekijk de stappen van onze sollicitatieprocedure hieronder.


Als energieleverancier helpen we ruim 2,5 miljoen klanten in de particuliere en zakelijke markt. Met onze merken Essent, energiedirect, Powerhouse, Vandebron en onze servicepartners door heel Nederland, helpen we onze klanten met energieoplossingen. Met duurzamer leven én energie besparen. Dat doen we met duurzame producten zoals zonnepanelen, warmtepompen en isolatie voor een energiezuinige woning. Daarnaast investeren we volop in innovatieve oplossingen die onderdeel uitmaken van het energiesysteem van de toekomst, zoals waterstof en koude\- en warmte oplossingen. Samen met onze klanten, zetten we de volgende stap in de energietransitie. Essent is onderdeel van Europese speler E.ON.
company_description: Energy is in transition, but so are we. At Essent you will find an organization that wants to be the personal, expert and reliable energy partner for everyone.

title: Senior Test Automation Engineer
description:
**Introductie**
---------------

**Wil je klanten helpen om de software die wij ontwikkelen met het volste vertrouwen in productie te nemen? Als Senior testautomatiseerder bouw jij met je eigen team aan automatiseringsoplossingen voor onze klanten.**

* **Uren: 32\-40**
* **Werkplek: Utrecht, Flexwerken**
* **Ervaring: Senior, \>3 jaar ervaring**
**Jouw mogelijkheden als Senior Test Automation Engineer bij Capgemini**
------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Klinkt het verbeteren van testprocessen jou als muziek in de oren? Wil jij graag werken aan de allerbeste applicaties? En word jij enthousiast van het delen van jouw ervaringen binnen en buiten onze mooie afdeling? Dan zoeken wij jou! Jouw focus? Het zelfstandig opzetten en onderhouden van test automation\-frameworks, het uitbreiden van jouw technische\- (en niet\-technische) skillset en het delen van jouw kennis.**

**In het kort:**

* **Jij kunt zelfstandig test automation\-frameworks opzetten en onderhouden;**
* **Jij verdiept je graag in nieuwe programmeertalen, frameworks en tooling;**
* **Jij deelt graag jouw kennis met anderen in de vorm van trainingen of coaching.**
**Je thuisbasis bij Capgemini**
-------------------------------

**Hoewel je het grootste deel van de tijd bij en voor je klant werkt, kun je altijd terugvallen op een vertrouwde thuisbasis: Testing: Engineering Quality (TEQ). In onze practice kom je terecht bij verschillende vakgebieden die staan voor kwaliteit. Om alvast een paar collega\-testers aan je voor te stellen: Karmen, Kemal, Melissa, Edwin \& Jeroen, de rest ontmoet je vanzelf! Het mooie van dit team: hoe druk we ook zijn, we maken graag tijd voor elkaar vrij. Voor een pingpong toernooi, een pubquiz, maar ook kennisdeel\- en intervisie\-sessies. Om je goed op weg te helpen in je ontwikkeling krijg je bovendien een buddy en persoonlijke counselor. Benieuwd naar de ervaringen van je toekomstige collega's? Bekijk het** **hier** **!**

**Benefits**
------------

* **Cold feet? Kennen we niet. Bij ons krijg je direct een vast contract.**
* **All You Can Train zonder enige verplichtingen.**
* **Een goed gevulde koffer met vakantiegeld én genoeg tijd (26 dagen) om het uit te geven.**
* **Capgemini draagt bij aan jouw pensioen. Daarnaast heb je ook de vrijheid om hier zelf nog extra aan bij te dragen.**
* **Werk waar je maar wilt op een device naar keuze met onze connectiviteitsvergoeding.**
* **Je eerste levensbehoefte als professional: een snelle laptop en een simkaart.**
* **Altijd lekker onderweg met je leaseauto of NS\-businesscard. Of kies voor uitbetaling van je reiskostenvergoeding.**
* **En uiteraard een passend salaris. Hierover gaan we graag met je in gesprek.**
**Waarom past deze vacature bij jou?**
--------------------------------------

**Jij bent op de hoogte van de laatste ontwikkelingen op het gebied van testautomatisering en IT in het algemeen. Het leren toepassen van verschillende programmeertalen is jouw passie, maar low\-code tools zijn jou ook niet geheel onbekend. Dankzij jouw analytische vermogen en communicatieve vaardigheden ben je in staat uiteenlopende vraagstukken te analyseren en de klant van passend advies te voorzien op het gebied van testautomatisering. Daarnaast vind je het leuk om jouw kennis en ervaring met anderen te delen en hen te coachen.**

**Voldoe jij aan de onderstaande eisen?**

* **Afgeronde HBO\-/WO studie;**
* **Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse (B2\) en Engelse taal;**
* **Minimaal 3 jaar aantoonbare ervaring als testautomatiseerder;**
* **Minimaal 3 jaar aantoonbare ervaring met een programmeertaal zoals Java, Python of Cypress;**
* **Minimaal 3 jaar aantoonbare ervaring met een test automation tool op UI level zoals Playwright, Selenium Webdriver of Robot Framework;**
* **Ervaring met API testing tools zoals Postman, SoapUI of REST\-Assured;**
* **Bekend met de Agile werkwijze en affiniteit met AI.**
**Get the future you want**
---------------------------

**Die belofte doen wij aan jou. Dat begint al op dag één. Met een goede onboarding en gestructureerde en transparante groeipaden. Maar ook: volop mogelijkheden om daarvan af te wijken, zelf te pionieren en je eigen weg te kiezen. Daarbij kun je van onze kant rekenen op grenzeloos vertrouwen én collegiale support.**

**Werken bij Capgemini betekent ook werken in het internationale hart van de innovatie. De eredivisie van de technologie. Een werkgever met oog voor jou en het vizier op de toekomst, waarin** **duurzaamheid** **en** **diversiteit en inclusie** **de hoofdrollen spelen.**

title: Intern Product Security Center of Excellence
description:
Eindhoven, Netherlands
Category
 Research \& Development
Posted Date
 04/17/2025
Job Id
 357994
  
**About Signify**


Through bold discovery and cutting\-edge innovation, we lead an industry that is vital for the future of our planet: lighting. Through our leadership in connected lighting and the Internet of Things, we're breaking new ground in data analytics, AI, and smart solutions for homes, offices, cities, and beyond.


At Signify, you can shape tomorrow by building on our incredible 125\+ year legacy while working toward even bolder sustainability goals. Our culture of continuous learning, creativity, and commitment to diversity and inclusion empowers you to grow your skills and career.


Join us, and together, we’ll transform our industry, making a lasting difference for brighter lives and a better world. You light the way.

**More about the role**


This is an exciting job opportunity for you to light the way as a **Intern Product Security Center of Excellence** in Eindhoven with Signify.


Connected lighting products are not only devices, but systems and services, hence data. As such, they are exposed to threats coming from cyber space with greater impact. One of the most critical prerequisites for our success is ensuring the security of our offerings and related information end\-to\-end. The speed of innovation has increased drastically, and the scope of product security has been expanded: from electronics components (hardware) only, to software, communications and information technology, engineering systems and data analytics. The Product Security Center of Excellence is a team of seasoned security experts that is responsible for the security of our professional connected lighting systems.


To support our work we have several processes around risk, vulnerability and incident management, activities in the Security Development Lifecycle as well as organizing training and awareness sessions for the Product Security Community. The Signify Product Security Community is a dedicated platform designed to foster collaboration and knowledge exchange among product security professionals across Signify. The Signify Product Security Community offers amongst others:

* Informative and interactive webinars featuring in\-depth discussions on a wide range of product security topics.
* Access to Product Security process documents, news updates and best practices, located within the community platform in Sharepoint.
* Product Security Awareness and other trainings
* Security Conference in October Security Awareness month


We are looking for someone that can help us build the community further, improve our training and awareness sessions, set up our security service catalogue and check/complete the relevant documentation.


Some other tasks are:

* Define and describe the security services we offer (create a 'datasheet')
* Improve the workflow of our risk \& incident management in Jira
* Align our security documentation pages in Confluence and identify gaps
* Gather information for our Business Continuity \& Disaster recovery plans and help determine RTO and RPO

**What we are looking for:**

* You have a relevant background in Cybersecurity, Business \& IT, or Business Management studies (Bachelor or Master student).
* You are a proactive, confident student with an eye for detail and accuracy and you are a good communicator with excellent oral and written English skills.
* You learn fast and have the ability to manage on your own.
* You can work collaboratively on multiple projects within an international team.
* You are based in the Netherlands, available for at least 4 months.

**Your Team**


You will report directly to the Product Security Lead and work closely together with the Product Security Architects, Specialists and Engineers in the Product Security of Excellence of Professional Business, as well as Corporate Security.

**Your Location**


The main working location will be High Tech Campus in Eindhoven, but you will also be working remotely.

**Everything we’ll do for you**


You can grow a lasting career here. We’ll encourage you, support you, and challenge you. We’ll help you learn and progress in a way that’s right for you, with coaching and mentoring along the way. We’ll listen to you too, because we see and value every one of our 30,000\+ people.


We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace fosters creativity, innovation, and a full spectrum of bright ideas. With a global workforce representing 99 nationalities, we are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment where every voice is heard and valued, helping us all achieve more together.


Come join us, and together we can light the way.

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
**CAPGEMINI ENGINEERING**
-------------------------

At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life\-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R\&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.  



**YOUR ROLE**
-------------

As a Full\-Stack Engineer at Capgemini Engineering, your role is to develop high\-quality technical applications for the high\-tech industry. For example, you will create interfaces used to optimize manufacturing processes, diagnostic tools, or other complex software applications.


In this role, you will:


* Design, implement, and test robust backend solutions using Java, Spring Boot.
* Create seamless and engaging user experiences with TypeScript and React.
* Test frontend components using Cypress.
* Utilize Atlassian tools such as Jira SW, Bamboo, and GIT.
**YOUR PROFILE**
----------------

* Experience and expertise in developing industry software using Java, Spring Boot, TypeScript and React (framework).
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science or software engineering or related field.
* Embody Capgemini’s values of Boldness, Trust and Team Spirit, a proactive problem\-solving mindset delivering high quality software.
* Looking for an impactful career in a collaborative environment with a high level of autonomy.
**WHAT YOU’LL LOVE ABOUT WORKING HERE**
---------------------------------------

* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs, digital learning platforms and ongoing performance management are crafted in a way to support you in shaping your path.
* Active employee networks promoting diversity, equity and inclusion, like OutFront, CapAbility or Women@Capgemini.
* Internal annual global tech challenges to showcase your skills and help address world issues.
**NEED TO KNOW**
----------------

* A permanent contract and a salary aligned with your experience level.
* 26 vacation days, with the option to buy additional leave.
* Capgemini contributes to your pension. Additionally, you also have the flexibility to make additional contributions yourself.
* Work wherever you want on a device of your choice with our connectivity allowance. A fast laptop and a SIM card that you can also use privately.
**NOTE**
--------

To ensure safety and integrity within our organization, an identity check and background check are part of the onboarding process.


**DISCLAIMER**
--------------

At Capgemini, we believe in a workplace where everyone feels valued for who they are is part of our DNA and instrumental to our long\-term performance. We are building broad talent pools to be able to provide high quality capabilities to our clients, with the right skills and talent mix.


**ABOUT CAPGEMINI**
-------------------

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55\-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end\-to\-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22\.1 billion.

title: Senior QA Engineer
description:
**Full\-time · Amsterdam**



At Build in Amsterdam, we're looking for a Senior QA Engineer who doesn't just test — but builds quality into everything we do. You will lead the charge in setting up and professionalizing our internal QA processes, making them scalable, efficient, and future\-proof.
**ABOUT US**
------------



Build in Amsterdam is an award\-winning Amsterdam\-based design \& development agency. We build digital flagship stores by combining strategy branding and e\-commerce. In our amazing office in the heart of Amsterdam, we work with an international team of passionate builders — designers, developers, writers, and strategists — to create award\-winning work for both local \& international brands like: Suitsupply, Mammut, Adidas, Polaroid, Moooi \& Vitra.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**
--------------------


* Collaborate closely with Developers, Designers, and Project Managers to ship the best possible digital products
* Create and maintain automated and manual test suites across devices and environments
* Analyze bugs and errors, document test results, and validate fixed issues
* Maintain and or set up a test framework
* Develop and run E2E tests, Checkout tests, SEO validation tests, and API monitoring checks
* Proactively monitor test results and integrate real\-time reporting
* Define and maintain a QA release checklist for critical flows to guarantee quality pre\- and post\-release
* Recommend improvements to enhance user experience and overall development workflows
* Continuously optimize and scale our QA tooling, automation strategy, and processes
* Research new trends, especially around AI\-assisted testing, to future\-proof our QA practice


**IT WOULD BE AWESOME IF YOU**
------------------------------


* Have solid experience as a Senior QA Engineer within complex and scalable projects in a digital environment
* Have a collaborative, problem\-solving, and flexible attitude
* Have experience with e\-commerce platforms and understand critical flows like buying flows, checkout, and account creation
* Are experienced in writing and maintaining automated tests (especially with Cypress or similar frameworks)
* Can set up and maintain the internal QA process and automation framework from scratch
* Pro\-actively professionalize and streamline the QA process within BiA, aiming for efficiency, transparency, and scalability
* Have experience integrating automation into CI/CD pipelines (e.g., GitHub Actions or similar)
* Are familiar with test monitoring and reporting tools
* Know how to test APIs and set up synthetic monitoring for uptime and endpoint reliability
* Have a strong sense of UI/UX and Accessibility Testing principles, even if execution is in collaboration with design
* Are structured in using tools for test planning and logging
* Are familiar with agile frameworks and sprint\-based release cycles
* Have experience or strong interest in AI\-driven test tooling
* Have strong oral and written English communication skills
* Have an eye for detail and quality at every level
* Want to be more than just a tester — you proactively improve our full development and release process


**WHAT WE OFFER**
-----------------


* A full\-time job in a passionate \& international team
* Good work\-life balance
* Beautiful office in the centre of Amsterdam
* Freedom to explore, make mistakes \& develop your talents
* Compelling projects for national \& international top brands, start\-ups \& cultural institutions
* Daily fresh cooked lunch by our own chef
* Gym subscription \& weekly sports activities available
* Vitality workshops \& coaching on the job
* Free access to the Stedelijk Museum in Amsterdam
* Occasional evening gathering \& an unforgettable annual company trip ‍ ️
* A competitive salary, depending on your experience \& skills
* Pension Plan
* Mac Book Pro Laptop
* 50\+ new friends


**DIVERSITY, EQUITY \& INCLUSION**
----------------------------------



At BiA, we take pride in creating an inclusive workplace where everyone has an equal opportunity to thrive. We actively seek to recruit, develop, nurture, and retain talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with varying skills and perspectives, as we believe that a multifaceted team enriches our culture and challenges conventional thinking.

title: PhD position: Ethical and Societal Challenges of Agricultural Automation
description:
*The increasing automation of agriculture is often framed as an inevitable and necessary response to global challenges such as labour shortages, rising costs, and sustainability imperatives. Autonomous greenhouses, AI\-driven farming, and robotics promise efficiency, precision, and sustainability—but what will this transition look like, in practice? This PhD project critically examines the potential emergence of ethical and societal frictions, as agricultural automation reshapes knowledge, labour, and governance structures.*  



**Job Description**  

This project will explore fundamental questions raised by agricultural automation as a politically and societally embedded phenomenon. For example, what does it mean when decisions about cultivation—once made by farmers—are increasingly determined by algorithms and robotic systems? How do these technologies structure new forms of dependence, control, and opacity, and what kinds of epistemic assumptions about farming, efficiency, and nature underpin their design? Who designs these systems, and whose expertise is legitimized or erased in the process? What knowledge traditions—sensor data, machine learning models, agronomic science—are prioritized over others, such as local, experiential, or traditional agricultural knowledge?

  

  

Automation does not just transform work; it reconfigures entire agro\-technical imaginaries, shaping new relationships between humans, technology, and the environment. By adopting a critical, interdisciplinary approach, the aim of this PhD project is to open up new ways of thinking about automation—beyond progress\-driven narratives—to address the structural, normative, and ontological shifts that automated agriculture entails.

  

  

This project will be embedded within the Faculty of Arts and Social Sciences (FASoS, Maastricht) as well as at the Brightlands Smart Autonomous Sustainable Systems research facility (Venlo), a site where cutting\-edge automation is being developed and tested. The facility will not only serve as a case study but as an active field of engagement, allowing the PhD researcher to observe and interact with engineers, farmers, policymakers, and other stakeholders. The research will involve a combination of theoretical inquiry and empirical investigation, potentially including ethnographic fieldwork, interviews, discourse analysis, and policy studies.

  

  

At FASoS the position is embedded in the Maastricht University Science and Technology Studies Research Group (MUSTS). There you will be supervised by Professor Darian Meacham and Dr. Dani Shanley. You will be provided with training on general academic skills in the faculty’s Graduate School. Further training is available through the Dutch national research school in science and technology studies (STS) and/or philosophy. As part of this project, you will also work together with other PhD students working on topics related to the philosophy of technology.

  

  

**Tasks**


* Conduct empirical and theoretical research on the socio\-technical entanglements of agricultural automation.
* Investigate how automation reconfigures knowledge, labour, and agency within agrifood systems.
* Analyse legal and regulatory frameworks for autonomous farming and assess how they reflect—or obscure—broader ethical concerns.
* Engage with engineers, farmers, policymakers, and technology developers to trace the frictions and negotiations shaping automation in practice.
* Contribute to philosophy of technology, science and technology studies (STS), and legal scholarship on automation, control, and governance.

  




The main task will be to complete the PhD in the allotted time.

  


The successful candidate is also expected to take part in the main activities of the department and the research group (MUSTS). These include:


* Publish results at top\-tier (international) conferences and in international journals;
* Assist with educational tasks (e.g., teach at undergraduate level, supervise students and internships);
* Assist with the organisation of workshops, conferences and meetings;
* Participate in conferences, workshops and internal meetings and seminars.

  




**Requirements**


* An MA or Research Master degree, in one or more of the following fields: philosophy of technology, science and technology studies (STS), political philosophy, or a related field;
* A strong critical perspective on emerging technologies and their societal implications;
* Experience with qualitative research methods (e.g., ethnography, discourse analysis, policy analysis);
* An interest in automation, AI ethics, and socio\-technical imaginaries, particularly in the context of agriculture;
* Excellent analytical and writing skills, with the ability to engage across disciplines;
* Fluency in English (Dutch proficiency is an advantage but not required).

  




**What we offer**  

**As** **PhD position: Ethical and Societal Challenges of Agricultural Automation** **at** **Faculty of Arts and Social Sciences****, you will be employed by the most international university in the Netherlands, located in the beautiful city of Maastricht. In addition, we offer you:**


* Good employment conditions. The position is graded in scale P according to UFO profile PhD, with corresponding salary based on experience ranging from €2901,00 and €3707,00 gross per month (based on a full\-time employment of 38 hours per week). In addition to the monthly salary, an 8\.0% holiday allowance and an 8\.3% year\-end bonus apply.
* An employment contract for a period of 12 months with a scope of 1,0 FTE. Upon a positive evaluation, an extension of 3 years will follow.
* At Maastricht University, the well\-being of our employees is of utmost importance, we offer flexible working hours and the possibility to work partly from home if the nature of your position allows it. You will receive a monthly commuting and internet allowance for this. If you work full\-time, you will be entitled to 29 vacation days and 4 additional public holidays per year, namely carnival Monday, carnival Tuesday, Good Friday, and Liberation Day. If you choose to accumulate compensation hours, an additional 12 days will be added. Furthermore, you can personalize your employment conditions through a collective labor agreement (CAO) choice model.
* As Maastricht University, we offer various other excellent secondary employment conditions. These include a good pension scheme with the ABP and the opportunity for UM employees to participate in company fitness and make use of the extensive sports facilities that we also offer to our students.

Last but certainly not least, we provide the space and facilities for your personal and professional development. We facilitate this by offering a wide range of training programs and supporting various well\-established initiatives such as 'acknowledge and appreciate'.  
* 

The terms of employment at Maastricht University are largely set out in the collective labor agreement of Dutch Universities. In addition, local provisions specific to UM apply. For more information, click here.

  

  

**Maastricht University**  

Why work at Maastricht University?  

At Maastricht University (UM), everything revolves around the future. The future of our students, as we work to equip them with a solid, broad\-based foundation for the rest of their lives. And the future of society, as we seek solutions through our research to issues from all around the world. Our six faculties combined provide a comprehensive package of study programmes and research.  

  

In our teaching, we use the Problem\-Based Learning (PBL) method. Students work in small groups, looking for solutions to problems themselves. By discussing issues and working together to draw conclusions, formulate answers and present them to their peers, students develop essential skills for their future careers.  

  

With over 22,300 students and more than 5,000 employees from all over the world, UM is home to a vibrant and inspiring international community.  

  

Are you drawn to an international setting focused on education, science and scholarship? Are you keen to contribute however your skills and qualities allow? Our door is open to you! As a young European university, we value your talent and look forward to creating the future together.

  

  

**Faculty of Arts and Social Sciences**  

The Faculty of Arts and Social Sciences FASoS is a close\-knit community of approximately 250 staff members and 2100 students. During breaks and before meetings, you can often find us at our favourite local coffee spot Bandito Espresso.  



Communication lines within our faculty are short and colleagues are always ready to assist each other. FASoS consists of a highly international student population and a significant part of our staff comes from abroad. Our faculty offers four bachelor programs, eight masters programs and two research master programs that are all characterized by their interdisciplinary approach.  



Our research institute studies societies and cultures as they have developed in the modern and contemporary periods. We adopt a radically interdisciplinary approach, analysing the interconnections between Europeanization, globalization, scientific and technological advancement, political change, and cultural innovation.  



In addition to teaching and research, our colleagues enjoy expressing themselves creatively. They create podcasts, write poetry as well as fiction.  



Working at FASoS means working in a challenging yet informal environment. We believe in crafting your own career path and are always ready to help you in making the most of your job. For more information about FASoS, you can visit our website FASoS  



**Department**


The department of Philosophy participates in all of the faculty's courses. The curriculum's philosophical input is mainly thematically oriented: teaching and research is intended to contribute to conceptual clarification and normative reflection on technological, social, and cultural problems.

  


The philosophical expertise of the department focuses on three specialist areas or points of special interest relevant to the various Bachelor and Master programmes:


* philosophy of technology, particularly the ethics and politics of new and emerging technologies
* the philosophy of art and culture, with an important focus on artistic research
* political and social philosophy, with a special interest in political culture

  




**Curious?**  

Are you interested in this exciting position but still have questions? Feel free to contact Dr Dani Shanley via danielle.shanley@maastrichtuniversity.nl for more information.

  

  

**Applying?**  

Or are you already convinced and ready to become our new PhD position: Ethical and Societal Challenges of Agricultural Automation? Apply now, no later than May 4, for this position. Please upload:


* your CV
* motivation letter (stating your research interests, the reasons why the PhD project matches your interests and knowledge; what your contribution would be and what practical impact would it have)
* copy of your MA Thesis
* contact information of 2 referees

  




The first interviews preferably take place on May 27, 2025\.


The vacancy is open for internal and external candidates. In case of equal qualifications, internal candidates will be prioritized.

  

  

Maastricht University is committed to promoting and nurturing a diverse and inclusive community. We believe that diversity in our staff and student population contributes to the quality of research and education at UM, and strive to enable this through inclusive policies and innovative projects led by teams of staff and students. We encourage you to apply for this position.

title: Systems Engineer
description:
**SYSTEMS ENGINEER**
--------------------

**At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life\-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R\&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.**

**YOUR ROLE**
-------------

**As a Systems Engineer at Capgemini Engineering, you will work on high\-impact projects across multiple domains, such as defense, energy, and infrastructure. Your role involves:**

* **Developing system architectures that ensure seamless integration of components in complex environments.**
* **Automating engineering processes to enhance efficiency and accelerate innovation in key industries.**
* **Defining functional and technical requirements for large\-scale infrastructure projects, such as tunnel ventilation systems.**
* **Collaborating with stakeholders to design solutions that meet both business needs and user expectations.**
**WHAT YOU'LL LOVE ABOUT WORKING HERE**
---------------------------------------

* **Challenging projects that make a direct impact on major industries**
* **A collaborative work environment, where knowledge\-sharing and teamwork drive success.**
* **Continuous learning opportunities, including access to our Centre of Excellence Digital Engineering and industry organizations like INCOSE.**
**YOUR PROFILE**
----------------

**You are a structured problem solver who can communicate complex methodologies in a clear and engaging way. You bring:**

* **A bachelor's or master’s degree in a relevant engineering or technology field.**
* **Experience with systems engineering methodologies, such as requirements management and model\-based systems engineering (MBSE).**
* **Strong analytical and communication skills to align stakeholders and drive innovation.**
* **Fluency in Dutch and English, both written and spoken.**
**NEED TO KNOW**
----------------

* **A permanent contract and a salary aligned with your experience level.**
* **26 vacation days, with the option to buy additional leave.**
* **Capgemini contributes to your pension. Additionally, you also have the flexibility to make additional contributions yourself.**
* **Work wherever you want on a device of your choice with our connectivity allowance. A fast laptop and a SIM card that you can also use private.**
**NOTE**
--------

**To ensure safety and integrity within our organization, an identity check and background check are part of the onboarding process.**

**DISCLAIMER**
--------------

**At Capgemini, we believe in a workplace where everyone feels valued for who they are is part of our DNA and instrumental to our long\-term performance. We are building broad talent pools to be able to provide high quality capabilities to our clients, with the right skills and talent mix.**

**ABOUT CAPGEMINI**
-------------------

**Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55\-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end\-to\-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22\.1 billion.**

title: Project Manager

title: Directeur Library & Information Services
description:
De Technische Universiteit Eindhoven is een toonaangevende internationale universiteit die ingenieurs van de toekomst opleidt en de grenzen van wetenschap en technologie verlegt voor een betere wereld. Op de bruisende en inspirerende campus werkt en studeert een internationale gemeenschap van bijna 7\.000 medewerkers en 13\.000 studenten.


Maatschappelijke uitdagingen vragen om nieuwe kennis. Het is de taak van de TU/e om deze kennis te ontwikkelen door onderzoek en onderwijs aan te passen en te veranderen. Bij Library and Information Services (LIS) kijken we samen met onze wetenschappers en studenten vooruit en bieden we voortdurend de best mogelijke bibliotheek\- en informatiediensten om het creëren van deze nieuwe kennis mogelijk te maken.

### **Functieomschrijving**

**DE ORGANISATIE**


De Technische Universiteit Eindhoven (**TU/e**) is een toonaangevende en internationaal georiënteerde universiteit, gespecialiseerd in techniek, wetenschap en technologie. Zij staan bekend om grote wetenschappelijke impact en de ontwikkeling van technologische innovaties. De TU/e is *“the place where innovation starts”* met digitalisering als een van de belangrijkste *enablers*. De universiteit onderscheidt zich door een nauwe samenwerking met de industrie en gezamenlijke onderzoeksprogramma’s met andere onderwijsinstellingen en onderzoekscentra. Zij zijn een koploper in AI\-onderzoek, en investeren dan ook fors in een state\-of\-the\-art infrastructuur voor haar onderzoekers; zo zijn zij één van de eerste Europese organisaties die een *NVIDIA DGX B200 AI\-supercomputer* krijgt. Daarnaast werkt de TU/e aan optimale ondersteuning van *challenge\-based learning* en individuele leerpaden voor studenten en optimaliseren zij de dienstverlening van ondersteunende diensten met focus op het leveren van *end\-to\-end services* en het harmoniseren van processen.


De TU/e onderwijst studenten (ruim 13\.000\), doet onderzoek en bevordert kennis in wetenschap en technologie ten behoeve van de mensheid/de maatschappij. Zij integreren – met ruim 7\.000 medewerkers \- onderwijs en onderzoek om studenten en wetenschappers in staat te stellen *thought leaders* te worden en het ondenkbare te ontwerpen en te bereiken. In nauwe samenwerking met publieke en private partners vertalen zij fundamenteel onderzoek naar zinvolle oplossingen. Bij de TU/e omarmen en handelen zij volgens vier **CORe**\-values.


De TU/e is georganiseerd in 9 faculteiten (departments) en 4 onderzoeksinstituten (research institutes), wordt bestuurd door een College van Bestuur (CvB, Executive Board) en ondersteund door 9 diensten (support services) zoals vormgegeven in onderstaand organogram.


De ingenieurs die door de TU/e worden opgeleid zijn klaar om de uiterst complexe (maatschappelijke) uitdagingen van vandaag en morgen aan te gaan; de duurzaamheidstransitie, technologische revolutie en de toenemende impact van technologie op onze maatschappij. Deze uitdagingen, gecombineerd met andere *drivers of change*, dwingen de universiteit om koers (strategie 2030\) te bepalen; de TU/e wil *“de verandering leiden door toonaangevend onderwijs, onderzoek en valorisatie/impact,”* waarbij zij zich richten op 3 strategische thema's:

* **Talent:** op alle niveaus, want talent maakt of breekt de universiteit.
* **Samenwerking:** samenwerking met de industrie, nationaal en internationaal, binnen de Brainportregio, met alliantiepartners en op Europees niveau.
* **Veerkracht**: de organisatie continu optimaliseren en professionaliseren om de verandering mogelijk te maken een aan te laten sluiten op de ambities.

**DE DIENST**


De (service)dienst Library and Information Services (**LIS**) is verantwoordelijk voor de gehele vraag\- en aanbodketen op het gebied van informatiebeheer/\-voorziening (IV), IT en bibliotheekdiensten. De servicedienst is getransformeerd naar een productgerichte structuur, met *empowered* productteams die verantwoordelijk zijn voor de professionele dienstverlening en verdere ontwikkeling van hun product. In overleg met belanghebbenden worden behoeften verzameld, geprioriteerd en afgestemd. LIS omarmt de *Agile* mindset en werkmethoden. Binnen LIS werken circa 300 medewerkers en komt veel ondersteuning vanuit de universiteit (zoals van studentassistenten). De servicedienst bestaat uit zeven productgebieden (*areas*): Services, Library \& Open Science, Research, Education, Corporate, Data \& Insights en als laatste Platforms.


LIS opereert als IT/IV\-organisatie binnen de context van de technische universiteit. Zij voegt waarde toe door haar unieke kennis van de organisatie en klanten/gebruikers (de studenten, onderzoekers en overige medewerkers) te combineren met kennis van de markt en nieuwe ontwikkelingen/innovaties. Iedere faculteit en opleiding heeft eigen specifieke behoeften en ideeën. LIS werkt samen met haar klanten aan een veelheid aan oplossingen; dit doen zij vanuit ontwikkelde standaarden, met een persoonlijke/maatwerkbenadering (waar nodig) en inlevingsvermogen. Zo ontzorgen zij het primaire proces, waardoor zij hun focus naar onderwijs, onderzoek en impact kan uitgaan. Haar landschap is hierdoor complex en omvangrijk/breed; van applicaties, systemen tot infrastructuur, architectuur en platforms. Zij zijn als servicedienst gericht op samenwerken in de regio en met andere kennisinstellingen, hetgeen bijdraagt aan de innovatiekracht en het open karakter van de TU/e.


De LIS\-organisatie ziet ontwikkelingen razendsnel op haar afkomen en dat vraagt om meer flexibiliteit in haar dienstverlening. Daarom werken zij sinds 2023 volgens *Agile* principes. Hoewel anno 2025 zeer veel bereikt is, is de transformatie nog niet afgerond. Een van de taken van de CIO is om deze Agile\-transformatie verder te begeleiden en een solide organisatie (volgens de reeds ingeslagen route) neer te zetten met als doel wendbaar te blijven in een steeds veranderende organisatie. Deze transformatie is het resultaat van een groter doel dat de TU/e uitdraagt middels het programma Support QUAlity Drive (**SQUAD**) waarbij de diensten efficiënter en effectiever ingericht worden en ketensamenwerking in een netwerkorganisatie met een *end\-to\-end* verantwoordelijkheid een belangrijke drijfveer is.

**Interne organisatie**


Als onderdeel van deze transformatie heeft een herindeling van de afdeling plaatsgevonden in productgebieden (*areas*); in 7 areas werken zij nu in een product\-georiënteerd operating model volgens de Agile principes. Product teams bestaan uit product owners, scrummasters en experts die gezamenlijk integraal verantwoordelijk zijn voor het product dat ze leveren. Zij hebben daarbij gekozen voor duaal management en werken met product area leads (**PAL’s**) en competence managers (**CM’s**). Samen vormen de PAL’s (7\) en CM’s (4\) het management team.

**Strategie**


In 2024 is de LIS\-/digitaliseringsstrategie geïntroduceerd met als pijlers:  

 •Kennis •Ontwikkeling •Partnerschap •Digitalisering


De digitaliseringsstrategie omvat 5 strategische thema’s (*big bets*) rondom onderzoek, onderwijs, bedrijfsvoering, living labs en infrastructuur. Tot en met 2027 investeert de TU/e fors om deze ambitieuze strategie te realiseren.

**Resultaatgebieden**


De ingezette transformatie heeft al veel gebracht, waarbij de LIS\-organisatie nu toe is aan de volgende stap die zij graag samen met een nieuwe directeur gaan zetten. De resultaatgebieden waar zij voor staan zijn:

* Doorbouwen aan een visie voor de toekomst
* Tillen van haar dienstverlening naar een hoger niveau tillen (van reactief naar meer proactief)
* Doorontwikkelen van de customer experience door verder de ketensamenwerking uit te bouwen
* Onderzoeken future governance in samenwerking met andere diensten en faculteiten
* Inrichten van strategisch porto**folio management gerelateerd aan de big bets**


Als Directeur LIS rapporteer je aan het CvB en voer je periodiek overleg met het verantwoordelijke lid van het College. De functie is gepositioneerd op het niveau van managing directors. Met beide bestuurslagen vindt regulier overleg plaats en je bent strategisch adviseur voor zowel het CvB als de managing directors. Je hebt de rol van CIO met de volgende taken en verantwoordelijkheden:  

Management, Strategie \& beleid, Beheer, Organisatie en Samenwerking.

**Management**

* Stijlflexibel zijn met een goede balans tussen inspirerend, faciliterend, coachend leiderschap

**Strategie en beleid**

* Actueel houden, doorontwikkelen en uitvoeren van de digitale strategie
* Opstellen van beleidsvoorstellen richting het CvB
* Proactief adviseren en bijdragen aan de ontwikkeling van beleid

**Beheer**

* Verantwoordelijk voor de operationele dienstverlening aan de organisatieonderdelen
* Zorgdragen voor basis op orde, veiligheid en betrouwbaarheid
* Verantwoordelijk voor het verbinden van vraag en aanbod

**Organisatie**

* Aansturen, vormgeven en positioneren van de LIS\-organisatie
* Leidinggeven aan het MT, samen met hen werken aan professionaliteit, betrokkenheid, klant\-/servicegerichtheid, slagvaardigheid en innovatiekracht van de servicedienst

**Samenwerking**

* Bijdragen aan de verbinding met de andere organisatieonderdelen
* Zijn van sparringpartner van decanen en directeuren
* Actief deelnemen aan het decanen\- en directeurenoverleg
* Betrokken zijn in de (Brainport)regio richting bedrijfsleven, lokale overheid, andere onderwijs\- en onderzoeksinstellingen, samen kunnen partneren en opschalen
* Deelnemen aan externe kennisnetwerken, o.a. met de directeuren/CIO’s van andere universiteiten en SURF

### **Functie\-eisen**


We zijn op zoek naar een directeur LIS/CIO met de volgende kennis en ervaring:

* Academisch werk\- en denkniveau met een opleiding passend voor het werkgebied
* Aantoonbare ervaring met grote transformaties in internationaal georiënteerde organisaties
* Aantoonbare meerjarige ervaring met het leiding geven aan organisaties en management teams in een Agile setting met multidisciplinaire, zelforganiserende product teams met een product\-georiënteerd operating model.
* Visie op de (door)ontwikkeling van een digitaliseringsagenda
* Ervaring met strategisch portfoliomanagement en verandermanagement
* Ervaring met werken onder architectuur en zorgen dat de organisatie onder architectuur werkt


Daarnaast beschik je over de volgende competenties:

* Je bent een teambuilder die bouwt aan het MT en de servicedienst
* Je bent een visionair en toekomst gericht
* Je bent een strategisch denker en kan als boegbeeld acteren
* Je weet een verandering in gang te zetten en stakeholders daarin mee te nemen
* Je kan bent een inspirator met charisma, die vanuit vertrouwen kan faciliteren, motiveren en stimuleren
* Je bent een natuurlijk leider met gezag in een complexe en politieke omgeving
* Je bent een netwerker en verbinder met oog voor bedrijfsvoering en ketengericht werken
* Je bent omgevings\- en organisatiesensitief
* Je staat voor jouw LIS\-organisatie en weet samen met jouw mensen de boodschap uit te dragen
* Je hebt een uitstekend conceptueel denkvermogen
* Je bewaakt continu de balans tussen dienstverlenend en grenzen/prioriteiten\-stellend
* Je houdt het hoofd koel in een uitdagende, dynamische periode

Je hebt gevoel voor humor

Twijfel je of je voldoende aan de eisen voldoet, maar word je wel enthousiast van deze baan? Dan nodigen we je toch uit om te reageren – we kijken graag naar je profiel.

### **Arbeidsvoorwaarden**


Een uitdagende functie binnen een internationale en toch persoonlijke universiteit. Je werkt in een bijzondere omgeving, midden tussen de studenten, op een groene campus in de Brainportregio. Daarnaast biedt de TU/e:

* Een bruto maandsalaris tot € 10\.138 ,\- (bij een fulltime dienstverband), afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring (schaal 16, cao Nederlandse Universiteiten).
* Vakantiegeld én een structurele eindejaarsuitkering van 8,3%, waardoor het bruto jaarsalaris gaan oplopen tot ruim €140k.
* Bij een 38\-urige werkweek: 29 vakantiedagen en een gunstige regeling voor extra vrije dagen. (Een keuze om 40 uur per week te werken en 12 compensatiedagen op fulltime basis is mogelijk)
* Een keuzemodel voor aanvullende arbeidsvoorwaarden.
* Flexibele werktijden voor een optimale werk\-privébalans.
* Ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling met doorgroeimogelijkheden, zoals mentoring, workshops en coaching.
* Deels betaald ouderschapsverlof en vergoeding van reiskosten, thuiswerk\- en internetkosten.
* Een ruime werkgeversbijdrage aan het aantrekkelijke ABP\-pensioenplan.
* Bij aanvang bieden we een contract voor een jaar, met uitzicht op een vast dienstverband.


Hier ontdek je nog meer informatie over onze arbeidsvoorwaarden. Bouw verder aan je carrière bij de TU/e!

### **Informatie \& sollicitatie**


Nieuwsgierig geworden? Stuur je reactie naar TU/e@interexcellent.nl.

title: Jr. Innovation Engineer
description:
**Are you ready to make a difference a fast moving world? Do you want to contribute to the Next Generation in Logistics? Apply now!**


**We offer a signing bonus of €1\.000,00 gross if you sign before the 1st of June 2025\.**


While Innovation is becoming increasingly important – given the fast moving external environment – at Ewals Cargo Care we are committed to strike a difference in the dynamic logistics marketplace. Our mission is to stay ahead of the playing field by distinguishing, innovative solutions. We are looking for smart ways to combat interesting challenging and exploit arising opportunities. **As a Jr.** **Innovation Engineer**, you will be committed to push boundaries in the field of technology.

  


### **How will you make impact?**


We are recruiting a flexible and out\-of\-the\-box thinking Jr. Innovation Engineer to join our team. In this role, you will be at the forefront of developing novel, state\-of\-the\-art technologies and innovative solutions. You will enjoy exposure to the complete Ewals organization and will collaborate with cross\-functional teams to identify opportunities, design prototypes, and bring new ideas to life.

  


### **What will you do?**


* Develop prototypes, new products, processes and/ or systems.
* Tackle complex issues by structuring, analyzing and evaluate data and prototyping solutions
* Contribute to the ideation process of innovations and priority setting
* Closely work together with stakeholders and draft specifications for innovations required
* Strategic advisory regarding future innovations’ necessity


### **Your profile**


* Bachelor or Master background in Engineering, Innovation, Technology or similar with max 0 – 2 years’ work experience (experience in the logistics industry is a preference)
* Excellent level of Dutch and English language – other languages are a pro
* Proven experience with programming languages (preferably Python)
* Understanding of the development, impact and actuality of AI
* Hands\-on mentality aligned with our company culture
* Think out\-of\-the\-box and able to regard things from a broad spectrum of perspectives
* Ability to work collaboratively in a fast\-paced and dynamic environment (both internal and external)
* **Passion** for innovation and eager to make a difference!

  
Vestiging: Tegelen / home\-office, Nederland
  

Vakgebied: IT \& Business Intelligence
  

Datum: 17 April 2025
  
**What do we offer?**
---------------------


* A fulltime contract on our own payroll
* Competitive – market conform – primary and secondary employment conditions
* A pension scheme paid almost entirely by Ewals Cargo Care
* 28 holidays with the option to buy 10 more
* Flexible work environment conditions
* Diverse health benefits, like gym subscription discount and many more
* Strong aim for personal growth and development – supported by the Ewals Academy
* An international exposed, entrepreneurial company culture
* Possibility to dedicate your efforts to inspirational and impactful projects


### **About the Organization**


Ewals Cargo Care has approximately 2\.550 employees working in 29 locations in 14 countries throughout Europe. The main office is located in Tegelen (near Venlo). You will work in a solid family business that exists for more than 100 years and where communication lines are short. Ewals has grown into a strong international player. Our customers are offered a broad spectrum of logistics products ranging from full loads, part\- and project loads, Control Tower set\-ups and Value Added Logistics to global forwarding. Especially, but certainly not exclusively, for the transport of full loads we are known for our European multimodal network that includes some 4400 Mega Huckepack XL(S) trailers. In addition, we can rely on a solid network of partners. Ewals is also continuously improving work processes and investing in the development of our employees.


We believe in a better and meaningful supply chain for everyone and achieve this by building smart and sustainable communities together with our partners and suppliers. We provide reliable solutions to transport our customers' cargo. **We care, connect, move**.

  


### **More info?**


The planning is that as from June the development phase for innovative projects will start. Preceding period will be used to establish the new innovation department and ensure effective training/ onboarding to the Ewals organization.


The Innovation team is an independent department, part of the business stream Technology \& Information. If this vacancy sounds appealing to you – apply now! Please share your motivational letter and resumé to the attention of Freek Heesen (Manager Product Intelligence \& Innovation \| freek.heesen@nl.ewals.com).


***Acquisition is not allowed. If you send any CV we might consider them as direct applicants and continue the process without agency involvement.***

title: Field Piping Engineer
description:
️ Max Streicher SpA, EPC contractor leader nel settore Oil\&Gas (pipelines \& plants), ha sede a Parma e opera su progetti in Italia e nel mondo. ️

  

  

**Posizione:**
--------------

Per il nostro progetto a Rotterdam, siamo alla ricerca di un **Field Piping Engineer**, figura cruciale per il successo delle attività di costruzione. Il professionista sarà il punto di riferimento tecnico in campo, dove passerà la maggior parte del tempo, agendo come estensione dell’ufficio tecnico di progetto e rispondendo direttamente al Project Engineering Manager.

  

Il ruolo prevede:

* Monitoraggio e analisi del piping: valutazione della costruibilità, individuazione di criticità nei disegni e nei modelli CAD 2D/3D, emissione di richieste di chiarimento al cliente.
* Supporto operativo alla costruzione: verifica della documentazione tecnica, preparazione degli elenchi materiali e aggiornamento delle informazioni necessarie al team di costruzione.
* Gestione documentale: preparazione di Construction Method Statement (CMS) e aggiornamento dei Red Mark\-up (isometrici, P\&ID, layout, ecc.).
* Controllo qualità: supervisione dell’installazione delle tubazioni, assicurandone la conformità a disegni, specifiche e standard di sicurezza. Interfaccia con i team qualità e costruzione per il monitoraggio delle prestazioni dei subappaltatori.
* Problem Solving: anticipazione e risoluzione di potenziali criticità tecniche in collaborazione con le altre funzioni aziendali e di cantiere.

**Requisiti:**
--------------

Cerchiamo un professionista con le seguenti caratteristiche:

* Esperienza di almeno 5 anni nel settore Oil \& Gas, preferibilmente in ambito piping e costruzione.
* Background tecnico come Piping Engineer o esperienza in controllo qualità (QA/QC) con focus sul piping.
* Ottima capacità di problem solving e attenzione ai dettagli.
* Esperienza diretta in cantiere, con una spiccata attitudine al coordinamento tra ufficio tecnico e team operativi.
* Conoscenza della documentazione tecnica di progetto (P\&ID, isometrici, specifiche materiali, normative di riferimento).
* Buona padronanza della lingua inglese, scritta e parlata.

**Altre informazioni:**
-----------------------

**Prima assegnazione:** Rotterdam, Paesi Bassi \- Progetto: costruzione di una bioraffineria.


https://www.neste.com/about\-neste/how\-we\-operate/production/rotterdam\-refinery
