title: PhD Position AI/ML Algorithms for Next Generation Transportation Systems
description:
**PhD Position AI/ML Algorithms for Next Generation Transportation Systems**
============================================================================

***Are you passionate about leveraging AI and machine learning to transform transportation systems?***  

***Join us in Project Hermes, a collaborative initiative between TU Delft and Amazon Science, where you'll contribute to developing innovative, efficient, and sustainable logistics solutions with real\-world impact.***

  


#### **Job description**

  


**The Challenge**


In today's interconnected world, efficient and reliable transportation systems are the backbone of global commerce and everyday life. As these systems evolve, they face complex challenges:


* Optimizing delivery routes and capacity planning.
* Managing dynamic demand under tight deadlines.
* Ensuring cost\-effective and sustainable logistics.

  




Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) offer powerful tools to address these challenges. By leveraging data\-driven models and advanced optimization techniques, we can develop scalable solutions that navigate the uncertainties inherent in real\-world systems.


Project Hermes brings together TU Delft and Amazon Science (EU Logistics) to tackle these challenges using AI\- and ML\-driven solutions. Our goal is to develop robust, scalable, and principled algorithms that make a meaningful impact in the real world—balancing efficiency, cost, and sustainability.

  


**Your Role**


As a PhD researcher, you'll contribute to algorithmic innovations, utilizing and extending AI/ML tools alongside cutting\-edge optimization methods to create robust and scalable solutions. Your work will be grounded in real\-world use cases and evaluated in representative scenarios, in close collaboration with scientists from Amazon Science, EU Logistics.


As a PhD researcher in Project Hermes, you will:


* Develop advanced optimization models for transportation networks, considering real\-world constraints such as capacity, connectivity, and resource management.
* Design and implement scalable AI/ML algorithms, including deep learning, reinforcement learning, Bayesian methods, and online convex optimization.
* Collaborate closely with Amazon scientists on real\-world datasets and evaluate your algorithms in representative scenarios.
* Contribute to a growing research team with opportunities for interdisciplinary collaboration and visibility at leading conferences.


**What We Offer**


* A fully funded PhD position in a high\-impact research project.
* Direct collaboration with Amazon Science, including joint evaluation and mentoring.
* A vibrant, stimulating, inclusive and international research community at TU Delft.
* A prestigious, well\-funded project with international visibility.
* Support for personal and professional development, including mentoring and supervision experience.

  




#### **Job requirements**

  


**Who Are We Looking For?**


We’re looking for a curious and motivated researcher with the following profile:


Required:


* A Master's degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.
* Strong background in optimization techniques (e.g., linear programming, convex optimization) and mathematics (e.g., linear algebra, probability, statistics).
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, C\+\+, or Julia.
* Experience working with large\-scale or real\-world datasets.
* Excellent command of English, both written and spoken.


Preferred:


* Prior experience in transportation, logistics, or related industries.
* Familiarity with optimization tools like CPLEX, Gurobi, or XPRESS.
* Research experience and publications in relevant topics.
* Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, MapReduce).


We strongly believe that diversity enriches science. We therefore warmly welcome applicants from all backgrounds. We are committed to creating an inclusive and supportive research culture where everyone can thrive and feel heard.

  


#### **TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)**


Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world\-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem\-solvers, both in business and in a social context.

  


At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core values and we actively engage to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.

  


Challenge. Change. Impact!

  


#### **Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mathematics and Computer Science**


The Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mathematics and Computer Science (EEMCS) brings together three scientific disciplines. Combined, they reinforce each other and are the driving force behind the technology we all use in our daily lives. Technology such as the electricity grid, which our faculty is helping to make completely sustainable and future\-proof. At the same time, we are developing the chips and sensors of the future, whilst also setting the foundations for the software technologies to run on this new generation of equipment – which of course includes AI. Meanwhile we are pushing the limits of applied mathematics, for example mapping out disease processes using single cell data, and using mathematics to simulate gigantic ash plumes after a volcanic eruption. In other words: there is plenty of room at the faculty for ground\-breaking research. We educate innovative engineers and have excellent labs and facilities that underline our strong international position. In total, more than 1000 employees and 4,000 students work and study in this innovative environment.

  


, Mathematics and Computer Science.

  


#### **Conditions of employment**


Doctoral candidates will be offered a 4\-year period of employment in principle, but in the form of 2 employment contracts. An initial 1,5 year contract with an official go/no go progress assessment within 15 months. Followed by an additional contract for the remaining 2,5 years assuming everything goes well and performance requirements are met.  

  

Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities, increasing from € 2901 per month in the first year to € 3707 in the fourth year. As a PhD candidate you will be enrolled in the TU Delft Graduate School. The TU Delft Graduate School provides an inspiring research environment with an excellent team of supervisors, academic staff and a mentor. The Doctoral Education Programme is aimed at developing your transferable, discipline\-related and research skills.  

  

The TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, discounts on health insurance, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged.  

  

For international applicants, TU Delft has the Coming to Delft Service. This service provides information for new international employees to help you prepare the relocation and to settle in the Netherlands. The Coming to Delft Service offers a Dual Career Programme for partners and they organise events to expand your (social) network.

  


#### **Additional information**


These PhD positions are part of Project Hermes, a collaboration between TU Delft and Amazon, aimed at designing the next generation of transportation networks and logistic systems. Successful candidates will be supervised by Dr. G. Iosifidis in close cooperation with the Amazon Science Team, EU Logistics, that is led by Dr. Georgios Paschos.


The successful applicants will have access to real\-world problems, industry insights, mentorship, and internship opportunities. They will join a dynamic, inclusive, and stimulating environment, to work on innovative theoretical advancements with tangible industry and societal impact, at the intersection of Transportation and Computer Science disciplines.

  

  

If you would like more information about this vacancy or the selection procedure, please contact Dr. G. Iosifidis, via g.iosifidis@tudelft.nl.


Want to know more about our group? Please check our website: https://www.tudelft.nl/ewi/over\-de\-faculteit/afdelingen/software\-technology/networked\-system.s

  

#### **Application procedure**


Are you interested in this vacancy? Please apply no later than 18 May 2025 upload the following documents:


* CV.
* Short motivational letter discussing your academic ambitions, your fit to the vacancy, and relevant research experience.


You can address your application to Dr. G. Iosifidis.


We are looking forward to you application!

  


Doing a PhD at TU Delft requires English proficiency at a certain level to ensure that the candidate is able to communicate and interact well, participate in English\-taught Doctoral Education courses, and write scientific articles and a final thesis. For more details please check the Graduate Schools Admission Requirements.  

  

**Please note:**


* You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post.
* A pre\-employment screening can be part of the selection procedure.
* A knowledge security check will be part of the selection procedure (for details page 45: national knowledge security guidelines).
* Please do not contact us for unsolicited services.

  
Faculty/Department: Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mathematics \& Computer Science
Salary range: €2901 \- €3707
Hours per week: 36\-40
FTE: 1\.0
Submission is possible until: 18 May 2025
ID job: 1669

title: AI tech stage/ internship: Deep Learning Localisation
description:
Are you an ambitious student fascinated by artificial intelligence and excited to explore cutting\-edge research?

This internship is perfect for students seeking to dive deep into state\-of\-the\-art deep learning and RF localisation techniques, pushing the boundaries of indoor positioning accuracy.

**About this internship**

At Crownstone, we're constantly innovating to enhance our indoor localisation technology. Your internship will focus on investigating and improving existing RF localisation methods using advanced deep learning techniques. This research\-oriented role will allow you to explore, benchmark, and propose enhancements to state\-of\-the\-art methods, impacting our technology's accuracy and efficiency.

**What will you do and learn?**

This internship offers a unique chance to combine theoretical research with practical implementation. You’ll:

* Conduct extensive literature research on current state\-of\-the\-art RF localisation techniques.
* Identify potential improvements using advanced AI methods, particularly deep learning.
* Develop, implement, and benchmark AI models to enhance localisation accuracy.
* Collaborate closely with research engineers and data scientists.
* Gain firsthand experience of innovation within a tech startup.

**About you**

We don’t expect you to know everything already. If you’re studying science or engineering and have a strong interest in AI and deep learning, you’ll be a great match.

Ideally, you:

* Are currently studying computer science, artificial intelligence, electrical engineering, or a related field.
* Are in your final year or pursuing a master’s degree.
* Have a passion for deep learning, AI research, and innovation.
* Are proficient in Python and familiar with deep learning frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow).

It’s a bonus if you:

* Have previous experience or coursework related to RF communication, wireless networks, or signal processing.
* Have participated in research projects or hackathons.

**About Crownstone**

This internship is at one of our daughter companies, namely Crownstone.

Crownstone is revolutionizing indoor location tracking, transforming how businesses and technologies interact with physical spaces. Our technology is used for indoor localization, enabling the tracking of various devices like tags, smartphones, and other BLE devices.

We are a small\-scale and flat organization. The culture is informal, and communication lines are short. We don’t like office politics.

Employees are given the space to work independently. We empower our employees to voice their ideas. If you enjoy taking initiative, have many ideas, and wish to execute them, you’ll feel right at home.

**We offer**

* Real hands\-on experience: Apply what you’ve learned in your studies to real\-life situations
* A peek into the international tech scene
* Build a network with industry pros
* Guidance and mentorship from people who’ve been in your shoes

Interested? Apply now!

Soort dienstverband: Stage

Werkschema:

* ma\-vr

Werklocatie: Hybride werken in 3013 Rotterdam

title: Embedded Engineer Intern
description:
**Location:** Amsterdam


**Department:** Product Development


**Position Type:** Internship  

**Duration:** Minimum 3 months

  


**About FeelGroup:**



As pioneers in the sexual wellness tech industry, we’re at the forefront of creating innovative software and devices that enhance online experiences. Our mission is to enhance intimate experience through state\-of\-art technology and design.



At Feel Group, we don’t just value your contributions; we genuinely care about your well\-being. Our vibrant and inclusive ‘Feel Culture’ promotes open communication, diversity, and authenticity, creating an environment where your ideas are not only heard but also celebrated.

  

**Our brands include:**


* **Kiiroo.com****:** Elevating pleasure with cutting\-edge IoT devices.
* **FeelConnec**t: Our mobile app, connecting devices to interactive content or partners remotely.
* FeelMedia: A leader in live streaming, building meaningful online relationships.
* FeelMe.com: Revolutionizing online sexual experiences with AI technology.


**What You’ll Be Doing:**

  

We offer a hands\-on internship that goes beyond observation—you’ll gain real technical experience and actively contribute to the development of embedded systems. This internship will give you exposure to both hardware and firmware development in a product\-focused, fast\-paced environment:


* Support ongoing projects involving PCBA (Printed Circuit Board Assembly) design, including component selection, schematic capture, and layout review
* Assist in firmware development and debugging for ESP\-based microcontrollers (ESP32, ESP32\-C3, etc.)
* Participate in hardware bring\-up and testing of prototypes and production boards
* Collaborate closely with engineers to develop, test, and validate embedded solutions, including sensor integration, communication protocols, and low\-power optimizations
* Contribute to design reviews, documentation, and continuous improvements of embedded system workflows


This internship is ideal for someone passionate about embedded systems and eager to get hands\-on experience in designing, building, and programming real\-world electronic devices.

 **Who We’re Looking For:**


* A motivated, hands\-on, and curious engineering student (Electrical, Electronics, or related field)
* Basic experience with microcontrollers, preferably ESP32/ESP\-IDF or Arduino frameworks
* Familiarity with PCB design tools such as KiCad, Altium Designer, or Eagle
* Understanding of embedded C/C\+\+ programming
* Strong problem\-solving skills and attention to detail
* A team player who is open to learning and enjoys working on practical technical challenges
* **What we offer:**
* Hands\-on experience
* Monthly internship allowance of €500 based on fulltime
* Reimbursement of travel expenses
* A friendly and supportive team environment where collaboration and learning are encouraged
* Regular team\-building activities to foster connection and engagement
* Complimentary office snacks and drinks to keep you fueled throughout the day

  


**How to Apply:**



Interested candidates should submit their resume, along with the study they are currently pursuing. The ideal candidate is situated in the Netherlands, close to Amsterdam and is able to travel to the office a minimum of 3 x per week.

title: Internship: Process Optimization using AI
description:
Job Title
Internship: Process Optimization using AI
Job Description
Assignment type: Internship
Start date: June / September
Assignment duration: 4\-6 months
Location: Veghel
Education level: Bachelor/Master
Desired study: Mechanical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Supply Chain Management, Econometrics or related studies
Language: Dutch/English
Description of assignment
Investigate the usage of AI in data analysis and process optimization, specifically within the simulation department, also focusing on power and energy sectors.
Department description
In the Simulation Department you will join a group enthusiastic, highly trained young professionals. This team of simulation engineers conducts studies on the dynamic interaction in \- and the logistics performance of \- the complex material handling systems sold by Vanderlande. The team is involved in all the market segments and the large number of different processes within the Vanderlande organization, ranging from sales to service and from project execution to technology.
Tasks/responsibilities* Analyze current processes and identify areas where AI can increase efficiency and speed of work.
* Implement AI tools to automate tasks, allowing team to work more efficiently
* Collaborate with the team to enhance the quality and productivity of tasks through AI integration.
* Optimize simulation models
* Explore and improve functionalities of current tools for better data analysis and efficiency
* Implement and study the impact of new simulation features


Outcome: By the end of the internship, the intern will have helped streamline processes, increased productivity, and lowered the threshold for AI adoption within the department.
Your profile* Excellent communication skills in both Dutch and English
* A proactive attitude
* Experience with Excel and a process/system way of thinking is a must.
* Python/Matlab is a plus.
+ Mandatory enrolment to a Dutch Education System \& resident of The Netherlands.


Contact
Do you recognize yourself in this challenging profile? Are you looking for an internship in our organization? Please fill out the application form and upload your resume and cover letter. For more information, contact us by e\-mail: internship@vanderlande.com.

title: Hyperautomation engineer
description:
**Functie inhoud**
------------------


Als hyperautomation engineer focus je op het realiseren van slimme oplossingen. Je werkt samen met diverse betrokken partners in het proces, van zorgverleners tot ondersteunende diensten, om te onderzoeken wat nodig is voor automatisering van hun werkzaamheden. Je analyseert processen om de juiste oplossingen te selecteren. Je combineert verschillende hyperautomation technologieën zoals Robotic Process Automation (RPA), Gen Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML) en Process Mining. Dankzij deze intelligente en complexe automatiseringsoplossingen zijn administratieve repetitieve taken niet meer dagelijkse bezigheden van onze medewerkers en bereiden we ons voor op toekomstige veranderingen en uitdagingen.


Je taken en verantwoordelijkheden bestaan voornamelijk uit:


* Ontwerpen en ontwikkelen van schaalbare automatiseringsoplossingen passend bij onze digitale strategie.
* Bouwen, testen en implementeren van automatiseringsoplossingen.
* Monitoren, optimaliseren en evalueren van bestaande automatiseringen.


**Werkomgeving**
----------------


Informatiemanagement Bedrijfsvoering (IM BV) is onderdeel van de Directie Informatie \& Technologie (I\&T). I\&T bestaat uit de onderdelen ICT Services, Informatiemanagement, Medische Technologie en Projecten. Het levert als partner hoogwaardige kennis en professionele diensten die noodzakelijk zijn voor het realiseren van de ambities van het Erasmus MC. De Directie draagt hiermee zichtbaar bij aan veiligheid en kwaliteit.


De afdeling IM BV werkt met verschillende scrumteams. Dagelijks werken er ruim 30 collega's met veel plezier en expertise aan de informatiebehoeften van het Erasmus MC. Als Hyperautomation engineer ben je hier onderdeel van.


**Profiel**
-----------

* Je hebt een afgeronde hbo\- of wo\-opleiding, bij voorkeur in de richting van IT/ Zorgmanagement/ Technische Geneeskunde.
* Je hebt aantoonbare affiniteit en ervaring met procesautomatisering middels hyperautomation oplossingen.
* Je hebt affiniteit met de zorg en begrijpt hoe technologie het werk van Erasmus MC professionals kan ondersteunen.
* Je bent proactief, resultaatgericht, analytisch en communicatief sterk.
* Je hebt kennis van agile werken en denkt gemakkelijk out of the box.
* Ervaring met ziekenhuisprocessen en HiX is een pluspunt.
* Een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift is vereist.


**Wat bieden wij**
------------------

* Een jaarcontract met uitzicht op een vast dienstverband.
* Een bruto maandsalaris tussen de € 3\.493,\- en € 5\.504,\- (schaal 10\) bij een volledige werkweek van 36 uur.
* Een 13e maand die we in november uitkeren en een reiskostenvergoeding.
* Een pensioenverzekering bij het ABP. Wij betalen 70% van je pensioenpremie waardoor je netto salaris hoger uitvalt dan je misschien denkt.
* Sportfaciliteiten in het Erasmus MC. En heb je een lekke band? Onze fietsenmaker repareert deze graag.


**Meer informatie**
-------------------


Maak van deze vacature jouw nieuwe baan! Solliciteer nu via de sollicitatiebutton. Het begint met doen.


Inhoudelijke vragen over de vacature? Sandra Baart, centraal informatiemanager Bedrijfsvoering, beantwoordt deze met plezier via 06 311 351 00\.

title: Senior AI Developer / Engineer (freelance)
description:
Voor een tijdelijke opdracht zoeken wij een ervaren en gedreven AI Developer/Engineer die een sleutelrol gaat spelen in het ontwerpen en ontwikkelen van een chatbot\- en AI\-agentoplossing. Je bent een technisch expert met uitstekende kennis van de laatste technologische ontwikkelingen. Je weet wat erbij komt kijken om (open source) AI\-modellen te implementeren en de bijbehorende infrastructuur op te zetten. Voor dit project ligt de focus op de AI\-modellen van OpenAI en de bijbehorende API’s.

**Verantwoordelijkheden:**

* Ontwikkelen en implementeren van een chatbot (prototype) met behulp van het developer platform van API's van OpenAI.
* Ontwerpen, opzetten en beheren van de technische infrastructuur die nodig is voor de AI\-toepassing.
* Monitoren van de prestaties en het gebruik van de AI\-modellen, met specifieke aandacht voor token\-verbruik en kostenoptimalisatie.
* Samenwerken met en adviseren van interne stakeholders om de functionele en technische eisen te vertalen naar concrete oplossingen.
* Documenteren en kennisoverdracht van architectuur, processen en configuraties.

**Functie\-eisen:**

* Aantoonbare ervaring als Software Developer/Engineer (minimaal 3 jaar) met een sterke programmeerachtergrond (o.a. Python).
* Kennis van en hands\-on ervaring met AI platformen van OpenAI (GPT\-modellen) en andere open source AI\-modellen/platformen.
* Op de hoogte van de laatste ontwikkelingen op het gebied van AI, LLMs, deployment\-strategieën
* Uitstekend begrip van hoe LLM’s werken, inclusief tokenization, en het analyseren en beheren van token\-kosten.
* Kennis en ervaring met het API's.
* Kennis van cloud platforms (bijv. AWS, Azure of GCP)
* Analytisch en probleemoplossend vermogen.

**Pre's:**

* Kennis van developer platform en API van Mistral (Le platforme)
* Kennis van Huggingface
* Kennis van RAG\-Langchain
* Kennis van fine\-tuning van LLM’s
* Kennis van vector databases

**Wij zoeken**

Wij zoeken een enthousiaste freelancer die wil werken aan een mooie, uitdagende opdracht met veel ruimte voor eigen inbreng. De werkzaamheden zullen deels op locatie (Hilversum Mediapark) en deels remote plaatsvinden. Ben jij flexibel, zelfstandig en direct beschikbaar? Dan komen we graag snel met je in contact! Stuur je reactie naar volkan.korkmax@omroepmax.nl.

**Over MAX**

*MAX: verbindend, betrokken en betrouwbaar. Als publieke omroep bieden wij 50\-plussers kwalitatief hoogwaardige content op radio, televisie en internet. Daarnaast komen wij op voor hun belangen. Je kent ons van programma’s als Heel Holland Bakt, Tijd voor MAX, Droomhuis gezocht en MAX Maakt Mogelijk.*

*Omroep MAX streeft naar een inclusieve organisatiecultuur, die de diversiteit van de maatschappij weergeeft. Onze vacatures staan dan ook open voor iedereen die zich in deze vacature herkent.*

Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Parttime

Werklocatie: Hybride werken in 1217 Hilversum

title: Forecast Operations Engineer
description:
We are Dexter Energy! We are an **Amsterdam\-based scale\-up** that’s building **AI\-based forecasting and optimization products** to help renewable energy companies become **more predictable and profitable**, helping push fossil fuels out of the market, and speeding up the energy transition. Our mission is to enable a sustainable and affordable power system that changes the energy market. We truly believe we can make a significant impact on climate change.

#### **Your team**


This position is part of the **Customer Success team**. This team ensures that our AI\-based forecasting and optimisation products are live and running smoothly with our energy clients.

#### **Role overview**


As our **Forecast Operations Engineer**, As Forecast Operations Engineer you will be the key source of knowledge on Dexter’s forecasting platform for our clients. Together with the Customer Success Managers you will be driving our operational excellence and striving for an exceptional customer experience.

  

Are you an analytical person who values open communication and embraces challenges? Read along!

#### **Responsibilities**

* You will be responsible our **energy customers' full technical lifecycle**: from pilot to integration, to expansion, and to operational excellence.
* The crucial element is **operational excellence**: ensuring technical integrations progress efficiently and smoothly, monitoring product performance, validating operational data flows, and proactively helping customers where you can.
* You will be an **internal product advocate**, tracking product processes and contributing to the platform by synthesizing feedback you get back from customers into actionable issues.
* You will be customers’ key **source of knowledge on the Dexter platform** and APIs, the underlying web technologies, and industry\-standard integration methods and best practices.

#### **Why consider this role?**

**Mission** – Minimising balancing risk and maximizing trade profits for renewable energy companies.  

**Smart Colleagues** – Experts in mathematics, physics, energy, and meteorology.  

**Ambitious, Supportive Culture** – A place where high performance meets genuine care for people.  

**AI \& Forecasting** – Core components of our product.

#### **What we offer**

* Our salary is in the **top 30% of the market**
* We offer a **NS Business card** or a **Swapfiets**
* A personal **Learning \& Development budget**, plus a dedicated **Learning \& Development Day every month**
* A healthy, flexible work environment with **trust, ownership**, and **room for your ideas**
* Budget for home office setup
* **Office lunches**, 5 min from Overamstel

#### **About you**


To be successful in this role, you’ll at least need:

* **At least 2 years experience in a customer facing role in the energy domain**, ideally working with forecasting or trading systems
* A **university degree** in Computer Science, Econometrics, Mathematics, or a related technical field
* Hands\-on skills with **Python**, and preferably **SQL** and tools like Pandas or Jupyter Notebook
* At least **two signs of excellence**, e.g. rapid career growth, experience in high\-barrier companies, academic achievements (PhD is a plus)
* Experience working with **APIs** and navigating technical systems
* A strong interest in clean energy and solving complex operational challenges

**Join Dexter Energy as a Forecast Operations Engineer**, where you'll harness the power of data to drive the renewable energy revolution.

  

Apply now and be part of an inclusive, innovative team that is shaping the future of sustainable energy.  

  

*Dexter is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.*

title: (Junior) Network Engineer
Software Engineer II, Box Sign
description:
**WHAT IS BOX?**



Box (NYSE:BOX) is the leader in Intelligent Content Management. Our platform enables organizations to fuel collaboration, manage the entire content lifecycle, secure critical content, and transform business workflows with enterprise AI. We help companies thrive in the new AI\-first era of business. Founded in 2005, Box simplifies work for leading global organizations, including AstraZeneca, JLL, Morgan Stanley, and Nationwide. Box is headquartered in Redwood City, CA, with offices across the United States, Europe, and Asia.



By joining Box, you will have the unique opportunity to continue driving our platform forward. Content powers how we work. It’s the billions of files and information flowing across teams, departments, and key business processes every single day: contracts, invoices, employee records, financials, product specs, marketing assets, and more. Our mission is to bring intelligence to the world of content management and empower our customers to completely transform workflows across their organizations. With the combination of AI and enterprise content, the opportunity has never been greater to transform how the world works together and at Box you will be on the front lines of this massive shift.


**WHY BOX NEEDS YOU**



As the leader in cloud content management, Box helps enterprises transform how people work together. With Box Sign we are enabling all businesses to manage their e\-signature document flows in the same place where content lives. The team is growing very fast to bring Sign to all the customers using Box and to simplify their needs of signing critical business documents.  

  

**WHAT YOU'LL DO**


* You'll be part of the core team to build, improve and support the young Box Sign product.
* This team’s product roadmap is focused on security and compliance aspects of Box Sign along with reporting capabilities. Some examples are:
* + Secure signatures through CFR part 11 compliance.
	+ Signing using smart cards.
	+ Leverage reporting of customers sign request.
* Team up with other engineers to foster solid engineering principles and represent our engineering values.
* Utilize both your technical and interpersonal skills to lead large scale projects to completion.
* Model solid engineering practices around architectural design, testability, scalability and maintainability.
* Partner with product managers, designers and other cross\-functional stakeholders to align on requirements and understand how your work will impact the business.
* Create APIs to be consumed by frontend and/or integration with other systems.


**WHO YOU ARE**


* You have 1\+ year of professional software development experience in an object\-oriented or functional programming language, such as Python, Java, Scala, Javascript, etc.
* You are a problem solver and you look for a team of like\-minded people.
* You like to be an owner and strive to do work you're proud of, both technically and in your team interactions.
* You appreciate an efficient developer environment.
* You are passionate about solving hard technical problems.
* You inspire other people to work with you and enjoy mentoring, coaching and learning from other engineers.
* You understand the importance of balancing security, performance and usability.
* You geek out on web architectures, spanning front\-end and back\-end layers.
* You have a deep understanding of algorithms, data structures and software design.
* You are experienced in collaborating with other internal and external engineers to define API contracts.
* Ability to go into our Amsterdam office in a hybrid fashion.


**TOOLS WE'RE USING**


* Build server \- Jenkins
* Virtualization \- Docker
* Provisioning \- Terraform/Terragrunt
* Cloud infrastructure \- GCP/AWS
* Operating system \- Linux, macOS
* Application stack \- Python/Django/Javascript/Vue.js/React.js/Node.js and Java
* Databases \- PostgreSQL


**PERCENTAGE OF TIME SPENT**


* New features \- 50%
* Maintaining existing features \- 30%
* Developer support \- 10%
* Meetings \- 10%


At Box, we believe unique and diverse experiences benefit our culture, our products, our customers, our company, and our world. We aim to recruit a passionate, high\-performing workforce that reflects the world we live in. If you are head\-over\-heels about this role but unsure if you meet all the requirements, we encourage you to apply!



Box lives its values, with community and in\-person collaboration being a core part of our culture. Boxers are expected to work from their assigned office a minimum of 2 days per week, with a focus on Tuesdays and Thursdays. Your Recruiter will share more about how we work and company culture during the hiring process.


**EQUAL OPPORTUNITY**



We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability, and any other protected ground of discrimination under applicable human rights legislation.



 For details on how we protect your information when you apply, please see our Personnel Privacy Notice.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Dit zijn wij
------------

  

Dedimo is de innovator in de geestelijke gezondheidszorg: een koepel van zorgbedrijven met een laser focus op innovatie en kwaliteit. Ondernemen en vernieuwen staan voorop en Dedimo omarmt daarbij moderne technologische ontwikkelingen met volle overtuiging. Dochterorganisaties ADHDcentraal, WPEX en QS gezondheidsmanagement delen hun kennis binnen een overkoepelende afdeling Research \& Development. R\&D gebruikt deze kennis om innovatieve producten en diensten terug te geven aan onze zorgverleners en cliënten. Op onderzoeksgebied werkt Dedimo samen met het Amsterdam UMC. Onze onderzoekers publiceren regelmatig baanbrekende wetenschappelijke artikelen.


Data, AI en software development nemen een centrale plaats in bij Dedimo. Het datateam ontwikkelt een eigen dataplatform rond Airflow, Python en BigQuery. In samenwerking met IT bouwen we moderne AI oplossingen om het werk van onze behandelaren makkelijker te maken en met een externe partner ontwikkelt Dedimo een eigen patiënten app en behandelaarsportaal.


Dedimo is de plek waar jij als data engineer echt het verschil kunt maken in een platte organisatie met korte lijntjes en zero red tape.

  

Werkgever
Dedimo Central Staff B.V.
Locatie
Utrecht (hoofdkantoor)
Uren per week
40
Salaris
€ 3\.500 \- 6\.200Dit ben jij
-----------

  

Een data engineer met brede interesses en skill set.


Bij Dedimo denken we niet in hokjes. Je focus is op data en AI. Maar deze functie heeft geen harde grens bij de backend. Wij passen bij elkaar als je een brede interesse hebt en bijvoorbeeld niet terugdeinst om als data engineer ook mee te bouwen aan de frontend. We maken samen oplossingen, geen bouwblokjes. Je bent nieuwsgierig, experimenteert graag en helpt bij het opzetten van POC’s met nieuwe technologieën.

Dit breng je mee
----------------

  

Het team vertrouwt op jou voor:

* Ontwikkeling, beveiliging en onderhoud van API’s in FastAPI;
* Cloud infrastructuur op Azure en Google Cloud, inclusief infrastructure as code, scalable cloud native opslag in databases en blob storage;
* Deployment met Git, Docker, Kubernetes / Functions / Cloud Run en CI/CD pipelines;
* VPC en cloud networking;
* Data Pipelines (batch) met Apache Airflow als orchestrator;
* CDC en streaming, momenteel met Datastream en BigQuery;
* LLM gedreven oplossingen integreren in ons applicatielandschap.


Ruimte voor groei.


Heb je wel de makers\-mindset, maar nog niet alle skills? Solliciteer gewoon! We overleggen samen over een opleidingstraject.

Dit bieden wij
--------------

* Een startsalaris van € 3\.500,\- tot € 6\.200,\- per maand bij 40 urige werkweek;
* Het gaat om een functie van minimaal 32 uur;
* Flexibel hybride werken;
* Moderne thuiswerkplek met 34 inch curved scherm en de mogelijkheid om op een high end linux laptop te werken indien gewenst.
  

Kennismaken?


Wil je meer informatie over deze vacature, wens je graag een vrijblijvende kennismaking of wil je eens zien hoe het er bij ons aan toe gaat? Je bent van harte welkom!  

Neem contact met één van onze recruiters op:


Brenda Bootsma \+31 6 52 47 24 67  

Mirjam van Golen \+31 6 30 62 38 71

 *Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.*

title: React Engineer
description:
**Functieomschrijving**


Ben jij een React Engineer die graag werkt met moderne technologieën en AI\-tools? Wil je bijdragen aan sociaal relevante webapplicaties die dagelijks door tienduizenden mensen worden gebruikt? Dan is deze functie bij Embrace iets voor jou!


Je werkt aan de Embrace Suite, een modulair platform dat bestaat uit verschillende modules voor sociale intranetten, klantportalen en woonruimteverdeling. Je wordt onderdeel van een van onze squads en draagt samen met collega's bij aan innovatieve oplossingen voor klanten in de zorg, overheid en woningcorporatiesector.

**Wat ga je doen?**

* Ontwikkelen en verbeteren van gebruiksvriendelijke interfaces met React, TypeScript en GraphQL.
* Werken in een monorepo structuur met meer dan 100 herbruikbare widgets.
* Implementeren van nieuwe features en verbeteren van bestaande functionaliteit.
* Samenwerken met back\-end developers, UX\-designers en product owners.
* Gebruikmaken van AI\-tools zoals GitHub Copilot en Claude om je ontwikkelproces te versnellen.
* Bijdragen aan code reviews en helpen bij het verbeteren van de codekwaliteit.
* Deelnemen aan Agile ceremonies en bijdragen aan sprintplanning en uitvoering.

 **Wat breng je mee?**

* Ervaring met React en TypeScript.
* Bekendheid met moderne front\-end ontwikkelpraktijken en tools.
* Ervaring met GraphQL of bereid dit snel te leren.
* Effectief kunnen werken met Git en CI/CD\-pipelines.
* Affiniteit met AI\-tools om je ontwikkelproces te verbeteren.
* Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden en teamgeest.
* Woonachtig in Nederland.
* Een leergierige instelling en bereidheid om je continu te ontwikkelen.


Voldoe je net niet aan alle functievereisten? Solliciteer dan gerust alsnog. Bij Embrace krijg je volop mogelijkheden om je verder te ontwikkelen.

**Waar werk je aan?**


De Embrace Suite ondersteunt het intranet, klantcontact en serviceprocessen bij woningcorporaties, zorginstellingen en gemeentes. De frontend is gebouwd met React en een modern componentensysteem gebaseerd op webstandaarden.


Je werkt aan modules zoals Chat, CRM en Serviceportaal – allemaal met focus op performance en gebruiksvriendelijkheid.

**Development \& DevOps**


Je werkt in een DevOps\-omgeving waar CI/CD en testautomatisering vanzelfsprekend zijn. Frontend builds draaien in Azure DevOps\-pipelines en we deployen naar een multi\-tenant SaaS\-omgeving. Features worden in korte iteraties gebouwd, voorzien van automatische tests, accessibility\-checks en linters.

**AI \& Developer Experience**


Elke developer bij Embrace heeft toegang tot AI\-assistentie zoals GitHub Copilot, Claude, Cody.ai of Cursor – jij kiest. We stimuleren actief gebruik van deze tools voor het schrijven van tests, refactors en documentatie.

**Onboarding \& Community**


Je krijgt een gestructureerde onboarding met buddy. In je eerste week doe je al je eerste pull request. We hebben een actieve frontend community met guilds, tech talks en pizza\-meetings.

**Technische omgeving**

* Frontend: React, TypeScript, GraphQL (Apollo), Emotion (CSS\-in\-JS)
* Tooling: Yarn workspaces, Lerna, Jest, React Testing Library
* CI/CD: Azure DevOps, Terraform
* AI\-tools: GitHub Copilot, Claude, ChatGPT
* Architectuur: Monorepo met modulaire widgetstructuur

**Wat bieden wij jou?**

* Een goed salaris (afhankelijk van ervaring).
* Een fijne sfeer met toffe collega's en een organisatie die in beweging is.
* Verrassende teamuitjes, pubquizen en ontspannen vrijdagmiddagborrels.
* 25 vakantiedagen (bij fulltime).
* Flexibele werktijden en hybride werken vanuit huis en ons kantoor in Sneek.
* Een passende thuiswerkvergoeding.
* Goede pensioenregeling.
* Een laptop van de zaak.
* Toegang tot AI\-tools en moderne technologieën.
* AI\-assistenten in je favoriete IDE.
* Ruimte voor professionele ontwikkeling via opleidingen en conferenties.

**Over ons kantoor in Sneek**


Ons kantoor ligt aan de Hegedyk 2 in Sneek en is goed bereikbaar per auto, het openbaar vervoer en natuurlijk de fiets.


Sneek is een sfeervolle Friese stad met een gezellig centrum, vlakbij natuur en water – ideaal voor wie houdt van een relaxte werkomgeving buiten de Randstad.

**Over Embrace**


Embrace the Human Cloud helpt organisaties succesvol te zijn in een snel veranderende wereld. Onze software digitaliseert processen slim en brengt geautomatiseerde dienstverlening en menselijke kennisuitwisseling samen. Met ruim 110 medewerkers bedienen we meer dan 400 organisaties in de zorg, overheid en woningcorporatiesector.


Onze suite bestaat uit drie hoofdproducten:

* Embrace Social – sociaal intranet en digitaal werkplekportaal.
* Embrace Customers/Portals – klantvolgsystemen en klantportalen.
* Embrace Housing – woonruimteverdeling.

**Klinkt goed? En nu?**


Denk jij dat jij onze nieuwe collega bent? Solliciteer dan nu via https://werkenbij.embracecloud.nl. En mocht je nog vragen hebben over deze vacature stuur dan een berichtje naar Hans Eilers. We kijken ernaar uit om met je in gesprek te gaan!

title: Control Engineer – R&D Passenger Tire
description:
Engineering
 VMI Netherlands
 HBO, WO
 3\-6 jaar
 Fulltime
In het kort
Binnen VMI werkt een groot aantal medewerkers constant aan Research \& Development (R\&D) projecten voor onze machines. Hierbij worden projecten op verschillende manieren uitgewerkt.



Als Control Engineer R\&D ontwikkel je software voor bandenbouwmachines. Tevens werk je aan de doorontwikkeling van ons standaard producten pakket. Je werkt binnen een multidisciplinair engineeringsteam en bent nauw betrokken bij ontwikkelingsprojecten vanaf het brainstormen tot en met de oplevering bij de klant. Je maakt software voor de ontwikkelprojecten en test deze op machines en kijkt hoe deze in standaarden op de eigen afdeling, maar ook buiten de afdeling verwerkt en beheert kunnen worden. Daarnaast kan het voorkomen dat je op locatie bij de klant werkt aan machines.



Binnen onze organisatie werk je samen en kun je terug vallen op specifieke expertise groepen zoals bijvoorbeeld AI toepassingen, camera\`s, et cetera.


Jouw werk
Als Control Engineer op de afdeling R\&D Passenger Tire werk je samen in een multidisciplinair team met Mechnical en Electrical Engineers aan het ontwerpen van de software van de machines, installaties en of deelsystemen.


Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het ontwikkelen en uitwerken van nieuwe en bestaande functionaliteit, met name in PLC\-code. Ook het testen, valideren en beheren hoort hierbij. Tevens ben je betrokken bij het inbedrijfstellen van deze software.



Daarnaast ondersteun je, indien nodig, Sales, Product management en de Project Managers met een klant bezoek. Je werkt mee aan de toekomstige ontwikkelingen op de afdeling en hebt oog voor de laatste trends en ontwikkelingen in de markt.


Werkomgeving
Je gaat aan het werk op de afdeling R\&D Passenger Tire met 25 collega’s. Deze groep bestaat uit 10 Mechanical Engineers, 9 Control Engineers, 2 Electrical Engineers, 3 Technical Project leaders en de Manager R\&D.


Jouw profiel
Jij vindt het leuk om nieuwe dingen te bedenken op het gebied van Software. Je kan zaken goed vastleggen en waar nodig communiceren met stakeholders. Daarnaast beschik je over:


* Een hbo\- of wo\-opleiding in de richting van Software Engineering;
* Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Software Engineer binnen de machinebouw;
* Je bent creatief en durft verder vooruit te kijken;
* Je staat ervoor open om te reizen (maximaal 60 dagen reizen op jaarbasis);
* Vloeiend Engels in spreken en schrijven;
* Brede algemene interesse in de techniek.


We bieden
VMI is wereldwijd een toonaangevende, zeer sterke en betrouwbare speler in de markt. We ontwikkelen en produceren hightech, innovatieve producten.



Technische kennis is er dan ook in overvloed, kortom een mooie kans om jouw kennis te verbreden binnen Engineering. Door de grootte van het bedrijf zijn er voldoende uitdagingen en doorgroeimogelijkheden.



Hierbij valt te denken aan een overstap naar een andere productgroep, eventuele overstap van Order Engineering naar R\&D of andersom, meer verantwoordelijkheid als bijvoorbeeld lead engineer, project engineer, coördinator of doorgroei naar een andere afdeling binnen VMI.



Verder is van belang om te vermelden:


* Naast een prima salaris bieden we een goede balans tussen werk en privé onder andere door een ruime verlofregeling van 40 verlofdagen (bij fulltime dienstverband), mogelijkheden voor thuiswerken en een flexibel werkrooster.
* We hebben een royale overwerk compensatie en vergoedingen bij reizen naar het buitenland.
* Er is een uitstekende winstdelingsregeling.
* Een informele, prettige werksfeer waarin we nauw met elkaar samenwerken.
* Mogelijkheden tot opleidingen, toegang tot de VMI Academy (een online leeromgeving) en interne ontwikkeltrajecten.
* Internationale mogelijkheden door onze vestigingen en klanten wereldwijd.
* Innovatie is een belangrijk thema binnen VMI, we besteden meer dan 5% van onze jaaromzet aan R\&D om voorop te blijven lopen in de markt.
* En niet te vergeten, hoe mooi is het om als Engineer naar de productiehal te kunnen lopen om jouw bijdrage aan de machine te bekijken.
* VMI heeft een vitaliteitsprogramma waarbinnen diverse activiteiten worden georganiseerd.
* Ben je sportief? Bij VMI kun je je energie kwijt bij verschillende sportevenementen, vaak gekoppeld aan de sponsoring van een goed doel.


Geïnteresseerd?
Ben je geïnteresseerd in deze vacature? Solliciteer dan direct via de sollicitatiebutton bovenaan deze pagina. Voor meer informatie kun je contact opnemen met Noah Smit van de afdeling HR via telefoonnummer 06\-33019888\.



Een screeningsonderzoek maakt onderdeel uit van de sollicitatieprocedure.

  

**Noah Smit**
-------------


06\-33019888
nsmit@vmi\-group.com
**300\+**
---------


engineers


**500\+**
---------


patenten


**100\+**
---------


engineering e\-learnings


### **Sollicitatieprocedure**


#### **Stap 1: “Beoordeling van je sollicitatie”**


Zodra we jouw sollicitatie ontvangen, gaan we deze zorgvuldig beoordelen. Indien nodig nemen we telefonisch contact met je op voor verdere informatie.



#### **Stap 2: “Gespreksproces”**


Je wordt uitgenodigd voor een gesprek op locatie waarin we graag nader kennis met je maken. (afhankelijk van de situatie kan dit ook via Teams worden georganiseerd)  

Na een succesvol eerste gesprek volgt vaak een tweede gesprek, waarbij je een collega van de afdeling ontmoet. Indien gewenst, is een derde gesprek of een dagdeel meekijken op de afdeling ook mogelijk.



#### **Stap 3 “Aanbod \& screening”**


Wanneer onze ambities overeenkomen en we een wederzijdse match zien, ontvang je van ons een arbeidsvoorwaardelijk voorstel.  

Bij akkoord van dit voorstel wordt afhankelijk van de functie een screening opgestart. (meer informatie hierover ontvang je van de Recruiter)



#### **Stap 4: “Welkom bij VMI”**


Gefeliciteerd, je hebt het aanbod geaccepteerd en wordt onderdeel van VMI!  

Op je eerste dag start je met een introductie en afhankelijk van je functie een onboarding programma.

title: Graduate Program Data & Generative AI
description:
**Digitale transformatie verandert de wereld in rap tempo! Bedrijven willen niet alleen begrijpen wat er is gebeurd, maar ook real\-time inzichten verkrijgen én voorspellen wat er komen gaat. Met de opkomst van generative AI ontstaan er bovendien volledig nieuwe manieren om data om te zetten in waardevolle oplossingen.**


Ben jij gepassioneerd over technologie en wil je digitale oplossingen bouwen met data en AI? Heb je sterke analytische vaardigheden en werk je graag in multidisciplinaire teams? Dan is dit Graduate Program Data \& Generative AI misschien wel wat je zoekt!


Het programma is gericht op recent afgestudeerden en junior professionals die een kickstart willen maken in de wereld van data en AI. In vier maanden leer je de technische en consultancyvaardigheden die je nodig hebt om als engineer impact te maken bij klanten. Je volgt intensieve trainingen en werkt in een gesimuleerde klantomgeving om te oefenen met projectmatig werken in een dynamische setting.


De inhoud combineert het beste van twee werelden: data\-engineering én generative AI. Je leert onder andere:

* Hoe je betrouwbare datapipelines ontwikkelt en grote datastromen verwerkt
* Hoe je machine learning toepast voor analyse en voorspelling
* Hoe je generative AI inzet, bijvoorbeeld met large language models
* Prompt engineering, model\-integratie en het bouwen van AI\-assistenten
* Hoe je inzichten visualiseert in dashboards en bedrijfsregels automatiseert


Na vier maanden stroom je door naar een klantproject, waar je jouw vaardigheden direct toepast in de praktijk.

  

Je krijgt de mogelijkheid om je op de beste manier te ontwikkelen, onder persoonlijke begeleiding van de rest van het team. Daar hoort het volgende bij:

* €3\.000 bruto maandsalaris
* €115 onkostenvergoeding

title: Cloud Engineer | Azure
Verpleegkundige in de wijk
description:
's\-Heerenberg, Didam, Zeddam


mbo niv 4


8 \- 16 uur, 16 \- 24 uur


FWG 45 VVT (€2770 tot €3944\)


  
De complexiteit in de wijk neemt steeds verder toe. Care\- en case\-complexe casuïstiek zijn inmiddels écht van alle dag. Als verpleegkundige bij Sensire richt jij je op de zorg van de toekomst waar (pionieren met) innovatie en digitalisering een belangrijke plaats innemen. Spreekt jou dit aan? Lees dan snel verder!
**Wat ga je doen als verpleegkundige?**  

  

Als verpleegkundige wil jij het liefst aan de slag met zorgtaken waarvoor je bent opgeleid: inventariseren van zorgbehoefte, coördineren van de zorgverlening en uitvoeren van hoog complexe zorg met een combinatie van care\- complex (verpleegtechnisch handelen) en case\-complex (achtergrond/situatie). Door de grote diversiteit aan zorgvragen bij klanten in de wijk is het niet altijd mogelijk om alléén dit type werk te doen, daar moeten we realistisch in zijn. Uiteraard streven we dit wel na.


**Welkom in gemeente Montferland**


Montferland is een veelzijdige gemeente met in elke wijk een andere sociale mix van klanten, met alle uitdagingen die daarbij horen. Collega’s geven aan dat de klanten zowel in het dorp als in het buitengebied erg toegankelijk zijn en jou als zorgprofessional waarderen. Jouw zorgteam is je basis, waar verbinding, waardering en gezelligheid belangrijke waarden zijn. We hebben oog voor elkaar en zorgen voor een gemoedelijke werksfeer waarin we steeds nieuwe inzichten en ideeën opdoen die de kwaliteit van onze zorg ten goede komen. In gemeente Montferland werken we in drie verschillende gebieden: Bosrijk (o.a. Beek, Kilder en Zeddam), Didam en S´heerenberg. Je komt te werken in een team van (wijk)verpleegkundigen, verzorgenden IG en helpenden (plus). Ondanks dat je zelfstandig op pad gaat in de wijk, sta je er nooit echt alleen voor; jouw collega's staan altijd klaar om je te ondersteunen op de achtergrond. Kom jij werken in regio Montferland?

**Zo dragen we bij aan jouw werkgeluk**  

  

Er zijn een aantal zaken waar je zelf de regie op kunt en moet pakken. Je hebt daardoor de vrijheid om keuzes te maken die passen bij jouw persoonlijke situatie en behoeften en zorgen voor een goede balans tussen werk en privé.

* Jij maakt de keuze hoeveel uur per week je wil werken. De planner zet dit naar rato van je contract om naar een aantal diensten van zes of acht uur. Je hoeft hierdoor minder dagen per week te werken en er zijn geen gebroken diensten meer;
* Bij Sensire werken we met diensten van 6 of 8 uur die bestaan uit geplande klantzorg en niet\-geplande tijd om te vullen met directe tijd (GFI, rapporteren en inlezen, overdracht naar collega’s);
* De starttijd van de route binnen de dienst kan variëren. Soms begin je direct bij start van je dienst met de geplande klantzorg. Soms heb je eerst niet\-geplande tijd. Dat geeft veel flexibiliteit;
* Samen met je collega’s ben je verantwoordelijk voor de telefonische bereikbaarheid als onderdeel van je dienst;
* Je hoeft geen nachtdiensten te draaien;
* Je krijgt van ons een chromebook en smartphone in bruikleen.

De functie verpleegkundige valt in de schaal FWG 45 conform de cao VVT. Afhankelijk van de ervaring die je meebrengt bepalen we de exacte hoogte van jouw salaris.  
* 

  

**Wie ben jij?**  

  

Werken in de wijk is werken in een uitdagende werkomgeving met veel diversiteit. Je weet eigenlijk nooit wat je achter de deur aantreft. Dat vraagt van jou veel. Snel schakelen en individueel handelen is soms noodzakelijk zonder dat je in de stress schiet. Je draagt hierdoor een grote verantwoordelijkheid. Met een gezonde dosis nieuwsgierigheid weet jij de wensen en behoeften van onze klant feilloos te achterhalen, je weet de juiste prioriteiten te stellen en stemt daar de ondersteuning die je biedt op af. Preventie is een vanzelfsprekend onderdeel van jouw benadering.
  

  

**Praktische zaken**  

  

Om aan de slag je kunnen als verpleegkundige vragen wij een aantal praktische zaken van jou:

* Een afgeronde mbo\-opleiding verpleegkunde niveau 4 of hbo\-V opleiding;
* Je bent in het bezit van een BIG\-registratie en bent minimaal bevoegd voor het uitvoeren van voorbehouden en risicovolle handelingen;
* Je bent in het bezit van een rijbewijs;

Een Verklaring Omtrent het Gedrag (VOG) kun je bij indiensttreding overleggen.  
* 

  

**Enthousiast geworden?**  

  

Solliciteer en wij zullen zo spoedig mogelijk contact met je opnemen. Heb je eerst nog vragen? Neem dan contact op met Sjors Twigt, Adviseur Werving \& Selectie op nummer 0622102634\. Bij meer inhoudelijke ragen kan hij/zij je in contact brengen met de wijkverpleegkundige.
company_description: Werken bij Sensire is samenwerken. Met klanten en collega’s die niet alleen de zorg maar een gelukkig leven centraal stellen.

title: Scientific programmer: Accelerating RAG and VectorDB from storage
description:
**Your function**
-----------------


Retrieval\-augmented generation (RAG) has become more and more popular due to its potential to achieve comparable performance with smaller models compared with large LLM modes. In the RAG architecture, the knowledge is embedded and stored in external vector databases for retrieval of relevant knowledge by the LLMs instead of the model weights during training. To process a user query, the RAG framework first retrieves relevant knowledge from the vector database, and this knowledge is fed to the generator (an LLM) as external knowledge to generate the final answer. Advanced RAG frameworks retrieve the knowledge from the vector database multiple times during the generation. Thus, the vector database plays an important role in the end\-to\-end performance of RAG such as accuracy and latency. However, RAG also brings new challenges to vector databases as the ever\-increasing size of datasets cannot fit into the main memory and thus needs to be offloaded to SSDs.  

  

The aim of this exploratory project is to understand what roles VectorDB plays in the performance of overall RAG pipelines, and how modern fast storage help accelerate the performance of VectorDBs.

**Your duties**


* Building programs that investigates the differences in latency, throughput, and scalability of different vector database and indexing algorithms.
* Investigating how the performance of vector databases affect the end\-to\-end performance of RAG.
* Help with building the next generation of vector databases for the RAG workloads.


**Your profile**
----------------

* Bachelor's or Master’s degree in computer science
* Experience with Python
* Experience with Linux
* Experience with database systems, large language models, and RAG is preferred but not mandatory
* Experience with ML frameworks such as PyTorch is preferred but not mandatory
* Fluent in English


As a university, we strive for equal opportunities for all, recognising that diversity takes many forms. We believe that diversity in all its complexity is invaluable for the quality of our teaching, research and service. We are always looking for talent with diverse backgrounds and experiences. This also means that we are committed to creating an inclusive community so that we can use diversity as an asset.


We realise that each individual brings a unique set of skills, expertise and mindset. Therefore we are happy to invite anyone who recognises themselves in the profile to apply, even if you do not meet all the requirements.


**What do we offer?**
---------------------


A challenging position in a socially engaged organisation. At VU Amsterdam, you contribute to education, research and service for a better world. And that is valuable. So in return for your efforts, we offer you:


* a salary of minimum € 3\.378,00 (scale 10, level 0\) and maximum € 3\.707,00 (Scale 10, level 2\) gross per month.This is based on UFO profile Education and Research Technician \- O profile 2\. The exact salary depends on your education and experience.
* a position for at least 0\.8 FTE. Your employment contract will initially last 1 year.


We also offer you attractive fringe benefits and regulations. Some examples:


* A full\-time 38\-hour working week comes with a holiday leave entitlement of 232 hours per year. If you choose to work 40 hours, you have 96 extra holiday leave hours on an annual basis. For part\-timers, this is calculated pro rata.
* 8% holiday allowance and 8\.3% end\-of\-year bonus
* contribution to commuting expenses
* solid pension scheme (ABP)
* optional model for designing a personalized benefits package


**About us**
------------

**Our group**  

The scientific programmer will be embedded in the Massivizing Computer Systems (MCS) group, which focuses on research in distributed computing systems and ecosystems, and currently spans over 40 diverse people of which 3 staff. The group aims to contribute to solving high\-challenge, high\-impact scientific and societal challenges, and has much international and national visibility in research and education in computing systems.


**Faculty of Science**  

Researchers and students at VU Amsterdam’s Faculty of Science tackle fundamental and complex scientific problems to help pave the way for a sustainable and healthy future. From forest fires to big data, from obesity to malnutrition, and from molecules to the moon: we cover the full spectrum of the natural sciences. Our teaching and research have a strong experimentally technical, computational and interdisciplinary nature.


We work on new solutions guided by value\-driven, interdisciplinary methodologies. We are committed to research, valorisation and training socially engaged citizens of the world who will make valuable contributions to a sustainable, healthy future.


Are you interested in joining the Faculty of Science? You will join undergraduate students, PhD candidates and researchers at the biggest sciences faculty in the Netherlands. You will combine a professional focus with a broad view of the world. We are proud of our collegial working climate, characterised by committed staff, a pragmatic attitude and engagement in the larger whole. The faculty is home to over 11,000 students enrolled in 40 study programmes. It employs over 1,600 professionals spread across 10 academic departments.


**Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam**  

Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam stands for values\-driven education and research. We are open\-minded experts with the ability to think freely \- a broader mind. Maintaining an entrepreneurial perspective and concentrating on diversity, significance and humanity, we work on sustainable solutions with social impact. By joining forces, across the boundaries of disciplines, we work towards a better world for people and planet. Together we create a safe and respectful working and study climate, and an inspiring environment for education and research. Learn more about our codes of conduct


We are located on one physical campus, in the heart of Amsterdam's Zuidas business district, with excellent location and accessibility. Over 6,150 staff work at the VU and over 31,000 students attend academic education.


**Diversity**  

Diversity is the driving force of VU Amsterdam. VU wants to be accessible and receptive to diversity in disciplines, cultures, ideas, nationalities, beliefs, preferences and worldviews. We believe that trust, respect, interest and differences lead to new insights and innovation, to sharpness and clarity, to excellence and a broader understanding.


We stand for an inclusive community and believe that diversity and internationalisation contribute to the quality of education, research and our services.


Therefore, we are always searching for people whose backgrounds and experience contribute to the diversity of the VU community.


**Interested**
--------------


Are you interested in this position and do you believe that your experience will contribute to the further development of our university? In that case, we encourage you to submit your application.


Submitting a diploma is part of the application process.


*Applications received by e\-mail will not be considered.*


*Acquisition in response to this advertisement is not appreciated.*
company_description: De Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam staat voor waardengedreven onderwijs en onderzoek. Wij zijn vrije denkers met kennis van zaken en een open houding – a broader mind.

title: Financial planning and Analysis Manager
description:
**FP\&A Manager**

Are you ready to truly shape the financial future of Van Raam Group? As our FP\&A (Financial planning and Analysis) Manager, you’ll play a crucial role in steering our financial planning, analysis, and strategic decision\-making. You’ll collaborate closely with teams across the organization, turning complex data into clear insights and actionable recommendations for senior management.

**Your responsibilities:**

* Lead the annual budgeting process, working closely with department heads to set ambitious yet realistic financial targets.
* Develop and maintain long\-term financial models and rolling forecasts, ensuring alignment with our strategic goals and market trends.
* Analyze variances between actuals, budgets, and forecasts—clearly explaining results and highlighting risks and opportunities.
* Prepare and present monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports, including KPIs, variance analysis, and trend insights.
* Build and maintain dashboards and reports that provide timely, actionable information to management, investors, and banks.
* Conduct financial analyses to support strategic initiatives, investment decisions, and business development.
* Analyze profitability by product, customer, channel, or business unit to drive performance improvements.
* Prepare clear presentations for senior management and the executive team.

**Business partnering:**

* Act as a key financial partner for designated departments, offering guidance and support to help them achieve their goals.
* Develop a deep understanding of business operations and the key drivers behind financial performance.
* Collaborate with department heads to monitor progress against financial targets and identify areas for improvement.
* Provide insights and recommendations to boost operational efficiency and profitability.

**What you bring:**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field.
* At least 5 years of progressive experience in financial planning \& analysis, ideally in a production environment or the cycling industry.
* Strong analytical and problem\-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data and draw meaningful conclusions.
* Excellent communication skills—able to present financial information clearly to both financial and non\-financial audiences.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast\-paced environment, managing multiple priorities and deadlines.
* Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and experience with large datasets; knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) is a plus.

**Soft skills:**

* Strong interpersonal and collaboration skills
* Proactive, detail\-oriented and you want to make impact
* A continuous improvement mindset and a knack for problem\-solving
* Ability to influence and build relationships across the organization

**What we offer:**

* A collaborative and supportive team with a real ‘can do’ mentality.
* The opportunity to make a significant impact on the financial performance of a growing company.
* Plenty of room for professional growth and development.
* Competitive salary, generous vacation days, and a solid pension plan.

**About Van Raam** 

With approximately 270 employees, Van Raam manufactures unique, adapted bicycles in Varsseveld, the Netherlands. Our bikes are shipped worldwide and are designed and produced in one of the most advanced and sustainable factories in the Netherlands. At Van Raam, we have strong growth ambitions, with digitization playing a key role in our success.

As a family\-owned business, Van Raam fosters a collaborative and innovative work environment. We believe in "growing together", meaning you will have the freedom to shape your role, express creativity, and take the initiative. We support our employees in unlocking their full potential, providing access to modern tools and innovative techniques.

More information about us can be found at www.vanraam.com.

**Let’s all cycle!**

Ready to help drive Van Raam’s financial success? We’d love to hear from you!

Job Types: Full\-time, Part\-time

Expected hours: 32 per week

Opleiding:

* Bachelor (Vereist)

Ervaring:

* Financiën: 5 jaar (Gewenst)

Work Location: In person

title: Yield Manager/ Programmatic Specialist
description:
As a Yield Manager you will play a crucial role in optimizing our online advertising inventory to maximize revenue and efficiency. You will be responsible for managing and analyzing data, implementing pricing strategies, and collaborating with various teams to achieve our revenue goals. This role requires a deep understanding of online advertising, strong analytical skills, and the ability to thrive in a fast\-paced and dynamic environment. Some basic knowledge of ad operation is required.


Within this role you will be responsible for yield management across the online properties of CoolGames and Keesing.

  



**Key Responsibilities:**

* Inventory Optimization: Monitor, analyze, and optimize the allocation of advertising inventory across various channels and platforms to maximize revenue; Regularly run A/B tests in order to optimize yield.
* Pricing Strategy: Develop and implement pricing strategies to ensure competitive rates while maximizing yield and profitability.
* Ad Tech Integration: Collaborate with the ad operations team to integrate and optimize ad technologies, such as header bidding, programmatic advertising, and ad exchanges.
* Advertising Compliance, Data \& Privacy: Ensure compliancy with industry regulations and policies; Prepare and execute plans for the 3rd party cookies deprecation in 2024\.
* Data Analysis: Analyze data and performance metrics to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement in advertising yield; Working with GA4 and data visualization tools as Looker Studio is a plus. \=
* Market Research: Stay updated on industry trends, competitive landscape, and emerging technologies to identify new revenue opportunities; Use marketplace insight and feedback from demand partners to identify areas for development, product needs and revenue growth.
* Basic ad operation tasks as booking PMP’s or direct campaigns.

**A plus if you can:**

* Demand Partnerships: Build and maintain relationships with demand\-side partners, negotiate terms, and manage ad network relationships to increase demand and fill rates.
* Reporting: Prepare regular reports and presentations to communicate performance and revenue optimization strategies to senior management; Automate and streamline business reporting.

**Requirements**

* Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, or a related working field.
* Proven experience in online advertising, yield management, or revenue optimization roles (3\-5 years).
* Strong analytical skills and proficiency in data analysis tools and platforms.
* In\-depth knowledge of ad tech, programmatic advertising, and ad exchanges.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast\-paced environment.
* Familiarity with industry regulations and compliance requirements.
* Basic programming knowledge is an asset.
* Working with GAM is an asset.

**Benefits**

**About CoolGames**


CoolGames is a dynamic organization in the gaming world located in the center of Amsterdam. We started more than 10 years ago as a pioneer in developing games in HTML5\. Now big\-tech companies such as Facebook, Snapchat and Google ask to work with us. We partner with global brands, working on IPs such as Angry Birds, Monopoly, Battleship and Sudoku.


We are a company which believes it’s important to constantly improve and innovate as we strive to be the best. We work in an informal environment with enthusiastic and smart individuals from all over the world to design and create great casual games.

**About Keesing Media Group**  

Keesing Media Group is the biggest braintainment company in the world, producing more than 200 million puzzle books a year, as well as a range of online braingames. Keesing was founded in 1911 and is now global market leader in print and online puzzle formats. The company offers puzzle enthusiasts all over the world challenging and innovative game concepts and is rapidly expanding its digital footprint by organic growth, participations like Elevate Labs in the US and acquisitions like recently CoolGames in Amsterdam and Synonymer.se in Stockholm. The headquarters are in Amsterdam and the company has offices in 12 countries.


**About the team**  

As Yield Manager you take the lead in optimizing the online advertising inventory from CoolGames and other Keesing Media Group platforms like Synonymer.se. You will work closely together with the CoolGames team consisting of Data and Monetization Specialists, Partnership and Content Managers and the Digital managers within the Group which platforms you work with. You report to Head of Advertising and User Acquisition at CoolGames.


**Benefits**  

We offer you a challenging job with a broad responsibility and an attractive compensation package:

* Company pension plan and travel cost compensation;
* Company culture that supports personal professional development;
* Healthcare insurance compensation;
* Sports allowance;
* Flexibility to work remote part\-time;
* An attractive office location in the center of Amsterdam;
* High\-end PC, Macbook Pro or other laptop;
* An open, informal and international company culture.

  

\* EU candidates only \*

title: Intern Data and Analytics
description:
**WE ARE DENIM HEADS.**



We love denim. Live and breathe it. It’s in our DNA.  

At G\-STAR, we see no limit to what denim can do. We believe it can be force of progress and innovation for both people and planet. How? By hiring the most creative, curious and caring minds. People who think beyond fashion. Bringing big ideas to big challenges. Driven by possibility.Those who work hard, make mistakes, but always continue to grow. Denim is in our DNA, our people are our stitching.  

Join the denim heads making raw denim!



We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and welcome applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of background, identity, or experience.



**HERE'S WHAT WE'LL DO TOGETHER:**



We’re looking for a Data and Analytics intern, who’s ready to join our G\-STAR Data \& Analytics Team!



Just imagine –



As our new Data Analytics Intern, you will be part of the Data \& Analytics team within G\-STAR. The Data \& Analytics department plays a key role in driving data\-driven decision\-making across the company. Through deep analytical insights, data governance, and collaboration with various business units, the team ensures that data is leveraged effectively to support strategic goals. You will work cross\-functionally with teams across different departments (E\-commerce, Trade and Digital Marketing) gaining hands\-on experience in a dynamic and international environment. This is your chance to be at the heart of G\-STAR’s data\-driven transformation and make a real impact.



**YOUR TASKS \& RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Continuous support on the day\-to\-day business in various business areas.
* Impact analysis on incoming requests and performing data quality checks.
* Optimizing and standardizing existing Dashboards.
* Support business in creating their own reports.
* Creating guidelines and templates for new Dashboards.
* Support in creating an internal information sharing platform.


**WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE:**


* You are a Bachelor or Master student, preferably with a specialization in the areas of: Data, Mathematics, Business or similar.
* Strong problem\-solving, analytical and conceptual skills.
* You have a ‘can\-do’ mentality and can think outside the box.
* You are proficient in Microsoft Excel and are familiar with SQL.
* A big plus would be if you already have experience with data visualization tools (preferably Tableau) and you are familiar with Digital Analytics Tools (e.g. Google Analytics).
* You are available full\-time (at least 32hrs per week) for 5 to 6 months starting in August / September 2025\.
* You are enrolled at a university or college in the Netherlands or EU, during the whole length of the internship. Unfortunately, we cannot provide immigration support for internships at this time.
* If you are a non\-EU student in The Netherlands, you are in possession of a mandatory internship assignment.
* You are already living in the Netherlands and are in the possession of a BSN, or in a process of getting one.
* Finally, if you have a strong personality and excellent verbal and written communication skills in English, we’d love to meet you!


**HERE'S WHAT WE BRING TO THE TABLE:**



In addition to €600 monthly allowance for your internship, working at G\-STAR brings so many perks and exciting opportunities, we don’t know where to begin… How about:


* An awesome and diverse team that collaborates to inspire,
* A work environment that offers room for fun, inspiration and innovation,
* A clothing budget of €400 to buy the latest G\-STAR items!
* To keep up the greatness we also offer you a healthy, fresh, and delicious lunch in our HQ in Amsterdam,
* If you don’t have an OV student travel card, we will cover your travel expenses,
* You will also enjoy two paid days of leave per month!


**HERE'S WHAT WILL HAPPEN NEXT:**


* During this job application, we will ask you to play a couple of short **neuroscientific games**. These games provide you with the opportunity to showcase your potential, talents, and personality.
* As a result, we can ensure equal opportunities for everyone who applies, by evaluating everyone based on objective, scientifically proven insights rather than gut feeling.
* As we value personal growth and transparency, we will make sure you receive your results on the games as well.
* When we hopefully find what we are looking for, we will get in touch with you and if it’s a good fit, we’ll plan our **first interview**.
* When we’re ready to commit to each other, we’ll finalize the terms we’ve discussed and we’ll explain to you how to order your first pair of jeans from the G\-STAR employee store.

Good luck!
