title: PhD position - Resilience of biodiversity and ecosystem functioning across landscapes
Retail Operations Intern - Rookie Program FW' 2025
description:
**Values \& Innovation**
------------------------


At Under Armour, we are committed to empowering those who strive for more, and the company's values \- Act Sustainably, Celebrate the Wins, Fight on Together, Love Athletes and Stand for Equality \- serve as both a roadmap for our teams and the qualities expected of every teammate.

  

Our Values define and unite us, the beliefs that are the red thread that connects everyone at Under Armour. Our values are rallying cries, reminding us why we're here, and fueling everything we do.

  

Our pursuit of better begins with innovation and with our team's mission of being the best. With us, you get the freedom to go further \- no matter your role. That means developing, delivering, and selling the state\-of\-the\-art products and digital tools that make top performers even better.

  

If you are a current Under Armour teammate, apply to this position on the **Internal Career Site Here.**

**The Rookie Program**
----------------------


Do you have what it takes to make an impact?! Join the Under Armour Rookie (internship) Program:

**Start date 1st of September '25 \- Jan 31st '26 \- with an option to extend for an additional 5 months until June 30th'26**

  

In order to be eligible for an internship you must be:


Enrolled in a Dutch University (not on\-line) in a Bachelor or a Master for the entire duration of the program (full 5 months) AND be an EU citizen passport holder OR a Non\-EU Citizen studying in the Netherlands (Internship should be then a mandatory part of your curriculum).

  

At Under Armour, we're looking for fearless Rookies who are ready to take on a challenge! As a company dedicated to making athletes better, our ultimate goal is to inspire you with performance solutions that you never knew you needed but can't imagine living without. As an Under Armour intern, you'll have the opportunity to play a crucial role in bringing our mission and vision to life through a hands\-on project that challenges you to develop new skills and push boundaries. This strategic project will test your skills and help you challenge the status quo, making a real business impact during your 5\-month internship.

  

Alongside this project, you'll work closely with a mentor and cross\-functional teams, gaining valuable global exposure and collaborating with talented professionals from across the company. With access to executive Q\&A sessions and personalized guidance from our talent advisors, you'll be well\-equipped to tackle any challenge that comes your way.

  

At Under Armour, we believe that an intern's experience should be enriched beyond their job responsibilities. That's why our interns get unparalleled Go\-To\-Market exposure and learn how our innovative products transition from development to sales and ultimately into the market.

  

Our internship program is designed to provide a holistic understanding of the Under Armour brand. Through in\-person and online training, you'll have a deep dive into our values, expand your horizons, and connect with a powerful network of professionals worldwide through our career coaching platform.

  

As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to participate in our Teammate Resource Groups, where you can share experiences, build relationships, and grow as a team. You will also step inside the exciting world of retail and explore the fast\-paced environment that keeps our customers coming back for more.

**Purpose of Role**
-------------------


Strategic Projects:


**Retail Incentive Program Rollout**

* Conduct data analysis to track the effectiveness of the Retail Incentive Program.
* Develop reports and insights to measure store performance growth and employee engagement.
* Support the coordination and communication of the program rollout across stores.
* Gather feedback from store teams and propose improvements for future program iterations.

**RFID \& Shrinkage Inventory Management Discrepancies**

* Analyze RFID and inventory data to identify patterns and key areas of shrinkage.
* Support the development of a standardized process for managing and reducing inventory discrepancies.
* Collaborate with retail teams to test and refine proposed solutions.
* Provide an action plan \& execution with recommendations to improve inventory accuracy and reduce shrinkage rates.

  

Key Responsibilities:

* Support the Retail Operations team in analyzing and optimizing the Retail Incentive Program, ensuring effective implementation and measurable improvements in store performance.
* Assist in identifying and addressing RFID and inventory management discrepancies by analyzing data, developing process improvements, and supporting store teams in reducing shrink rates.
* Collaborate cross\-functionally with retail, finance, and supply chain teams to gather insights, track key metrics, and contribute to operational efficiency.
* Provide actionable recommendations based on data analysis to enhance retail operations, ultimately driving store performance, inventory accuracy, and overall operational excellence.
* Work on developing short\-, mid\-, and long\-term action plans to support store maintenance requirements and improve ways of working (WoW) for operational efficiency.
* Support and connect cross\-functional information to drive successful commercial results and retail execution, aligning on opportunities and ensuring expected deliverables are met.
**Your Impact**
---------------


As a Retail Operations Intern, you will play a key role in supporting critical projects that drive operational efficiency, enhance store performance, and improve inventory accuracy across the EMEA region. By analyzing data, developing process improvements, and collaborating with cross\-functional teams, you will help streamline ways of working, reduce inventory discrepancies, and contribute to the successful execution of retail initiatives. Your insights and proactive approach will directly support the brand’s commercial success, ensuring a seamless in\-store experience for both employees and customers.

**Qualifications**
------------------

* Student of: Business Administration, Retail Management, Supply Chain, Finance, Data Analytics, or a related field.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and generate insights.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and other data visualization tools is a plus.
* Excellent communication and organizational skills, with the ability to collaborate across teams.
* Passion for retail, operations, and process improvement.
**Workplace Location**
----------------------

* **Location:** This individual must reside within commuting distance from our Amsterdam office.
* **Return to Work Designation:** Starting in October, teammates are required to work on\-site for 3 days per week. This will increase to 4 days per week beginning January 2026
**Relocation**
--------------

* No relocation provided


\#LI\-KC1


\#LI\-Hybrid

**Benefits \& Perks**
---------------------

* 750 euro gross monthly allowance
* Health and Wellness allowance (50 euro net monthly) OR Free Classpass membership
* Under Armour Merchandise Discounts
* Access to Under Amour's Human Performance Institute (Gym) on site
* NS Business Card
* 38 hours working week
**Our Commitment to Diversity**
-------------------------------


At Under Armour, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, family or paternal status and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Under Armour believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities upon request.

title: Bachelor/Master Internship: Monitoring the application landscape
description:
Create a dashboard to monitor the application landscape for PACCAR Financial Europe PFE\-ITD manages a complex application landscape with multiple integration layers and interfaces. Currently there’s no single point to overview our application landscape, identify issues in real\-time, and track the status of our integration layers. Information is scattered in (project)documents, log files, systems, etcetera. The goal is to enhance operational efficiency and to have an overview across our systems.  

Your assignment will be to:* Setup the requirements for dashboard to monitor the application landscape
* Investigate which possible applications can be used
* Propose an application
* Design the dashboard in the application and connect possible sources in an agile way
* Conduct testing and validation of the dashboard to ensure accuracy and functionality
* Document the development process and create user guides for future reference.
* Participate in team meetings and contribute ideas for improving dashboard features and usability


* A view behind the scenes at a large international corporation;
* You will get a lot of freedom and responsibility. We are open to your initiatives and depending on the assignment you see your results back in the workplace;
* An experienced coach and supervisor who can teach you a lot and is willing to help you with your assignment;
* After your graduation, you will have the opportunity to start your career at DAF;
* An internship wage of € 375,\- (HBO) and € 450,\- WO per month on full\-time base
* A travel allowance, if you don’t have a student travel product (provided by the Dutch government);
* A housing allowance, if you temporarily rent a room near DAF.


Each intern will have the opportunity to participate at the Student Event. During this event you will meet other interns and find out more about DAF/PACCAR!  

  

Would you like to know more about the experiences of other students? Here you can read stories of our former interns. PACCAR Financial Europe (PFE) provides financial services to DAF dealers and end customers to support the sales of DAF trucks. PFE is part of the worldwide PACCAR Financial organization, has its headquarters in Eindhoven at the DAF premises and is active in a large number of European countries with its own sales offices and used trucks centers. The PFE Information Technology department is responsible for the development, configuration, testing and deployment of innovative IT\-solutions, management of these systems during their lifecycle and support of the users of these systems. PFE\-IT consists of appr. 25 fte. of which 20 are internal and works according to the agile framework. Most of the systems are subject to SOx\-regulations.  

  

PFE contains 4 lines of business areas: Wholesale Financing to DAF\-dealers, Retail Financing to End Customers, Short Term Leasing and Asset Management \& Used Trucks Remarketing. The Retail Financing systems landscape has been renewed recently and a new state\-of\-the\-art systems landscape for Asset Mgt. \& Used Trucks Remarketing is currently under development as part of a large IT\-project. Other projects are already planned. We are looking for an enthusiastic intern with the following skill set.* HBO/WO student who is pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Software Engineering, or a related field
* Familiarity with web development technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) and frameworks
* Knowledge of RESTful APIs and data integration concepts
* Basic understanding of data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Grafana) is a plus
* Analytical and problem\-solving skills
* Communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
* Self\-motivated, eager to learn, and capable of managing time effectively.
* Language skills: English (written and verbal)
* Preferred period of the internship: 4\-5 months starting in September 2025\.


Please upload your resume and motivation below. For more information you can contact Campus Recruitment on phone number 040\-2142616\.

title: Analyst/Reporting Specialist at Investments, Corporate Finance
description:
Within the Investment team based in Amsterdam, we’re currently looking for an Analyst/Reporting specialist Corporate Finance, capable of combining technical/programming skills with affiliation for investments .
  
The main responsibilities of the Analyst Corporate Finance are: Prepare the Solvency II files and reconciliations relating to investments using programming languages (RStudio, potentially Python at a later stage), Identify opportunities to improve the quality of reports produced as well as to achieve process efficiency, while using Excel and programming capabilities, Actively support transition between old and new investment administration systems, including managing data enhancement, reconciliations, and cleaning, ensuring proper data administration in the new environment, co\-designing reports answering the current reporting and information sharing demands regarding investment assets, Provide in\-depth analysis of the Atradius investment portfolio, Liaise with internal and external parties providing information on investments, Liaise with various stakeholders in adapting internal systems and processes to the changes within the investment portfolio, in line with the EIOPA updates and IFRS regulations.
  
Knowledge, skills and experience Solid experience in Excel and programming languages like R or Python, Excellent quantitative and analytical skills, Affinity with financial instruments is an advantage, Track record of gathering requirements, defining and executing analysis, Experience in designing and developing models (e.g. relating to risk, income projections), Proven track record in building tools automating generation of enhanced data results, comparisons, visualization of data, Being goal\-minded towards efficiency, quality, and practicality, Capable of working independently or with minimal supervision, but also being an effective team player, Excellent written and verbal communication skills, Languages: English is a must, command of Spanish is an advantage, Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in Business Economics, Finance, Computer/Data Science, Mathematical Finance, Econometrics, Experience with any modern investment administration tool will be an advantage, Eligible to work in the Netherlands (without a requirement for a visa).
  
Atradius
  
The Atradius Group provides trade credit insurance, surety and collections services worldwide, and has a presence through 160 offices in 52 countries. The products offered by Atradius protect companies around the world against the default risks associated with selling goods and services on credit.
  
At Atradius, we believe in personal development and the Growth Mindset. Our Culture is based on teamwork, reliable accountability, constantly improving and unrivalled service. Read on more on our Career site: https://careers.atradius.com/en/careers .
  
  

Department Description
  
The investment team, being a part of Corporate Finance, Tax \& ESG department, is the centralised unit responsible for developing and implementing the Atradius Group’s investment strategy, maintaining a state\-of\-the\-art investment process, optimising the Group’s investment result, and delivering of the Solvency II data relating to market risk.
  
  

What do we offer?
  
A dynamic, international and challenging work environment
  
Training and support to reach your full potential including the opportunity for continuous professional development
  
Attractive terms and conditions, including competitive salary, pension package and a range of flexible benefits and rewards
  
Challenging tasks with individual development and training opportunities
  
  

Equal opportunities for all
  
The success of our organisation stands with the quality of our people and the ideas they have. Insights and innovative solutions for our customers are the result of an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. That is why diversity is extremely important to Atradius. To ensure that all colleagues within Atradius can develop their qualities, we promote an inclusive culture in which everyone feels involved and valued. We encourage and welcome everyone to apply to our positions.
  
  

I am Atradius! \- Do you want to know who we are?
  
**Get to know Atradius colleagues in this video:** https://www.youtube.com/watch?v\=NnsgT04OpTU\&t\=4s
  
  

Atradius is a global provider of credit insurance, bond and surety, collections and information services, with a strategic presence in over 50 countries. The products offered by Atradius protect companies around the world against the default risks associated with selling goods and services on credit. Atradius is a member of Grupo Catalana Occidente (GCO.MC), one of the largest insurers in Spain and one of the largest credit insurers in the world.
  
**You can find further information on our website:** https://group.atradius.com

title: Assistant Manager Digital Analytics x3
description:
At adidas your role as an Assistant Manager Digital Analytics, where we have 3 openings across our Business Performance, Marketing or Experience Analytics teams, you will play your part in analyzing consumer shopping behavior within the adidas e\-commerce, enabling our teams to make decisions based on sales trends. You are supporting for reporting tools, KPIs, insights and measurement supporting several different teams in EU ecommerce team to take data\-driven decisions. You will be working with multiple dashboards and data sets to report on and generate insights that help adidas understand how our business is performing – where do we have challenges and where do we have opportunities \- to ultimately help drive sales.  

  

You will be someone that is constantly curious, always asking the right questions whilst at the same time having a passion for data and uncovering insights about our business. This role has a great balance between data, business understanding and critical thinking.
YOU GOT THIS and we are excited to be part of your journey.  


Main Responsibilities:  


Foundations \& Automation:  


* Support in the automation of analytical data processes
* Support in the process of a strong data quality and resolution of defects

  


Reports \& Dashboards:  


* Build and maintain self\-service data tools in Power BI to track the business performance
* Support in managing backlogs for development and enhancements of our dashboards

  


Reporting \& Insights:  


* Support in reporting on business performance during our commercial \& campaign moments
* Support in conduct deep dives into business problems and areas of underperformance
* Identify opportunities
* Understand the business data in the context traffic \& conversion

  


Measurement:  


* Support team in sizing opportunities to drive business growth

  


Key Relationships:  


* EU e\-commerce teams (Buying \& Planning / Trading / Outlet / Digital Visual Merchandising / Finance / Analytics)
* Global Digital Analytics
* Global Data Engineering

  


Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:  


Technical\-Skills:  


* Experience in data manipulation using SQL
* POWER BI or equivalent data visualization tools such as Tableau or Looker
* Adobe / Amplitude
* Confident working with large data sets

  


Business and Communication\-Skills:  


* Strong communication skills: ability to articulate complex concepts clearly
* Comfortable presenting to larger groups
* Fluent in English

  


Requisite Education and Experience / Minimum Qualifications:  


* University degree in a numerical/business discipline
* 2\+ years’ experience in a similar role
* Experience in eCommerce is a plus


AT ADIDAS WE HAVE A WINNING CULTURE. BUT TO WIN, PHYSICAL POWER IS NOT ENOUGH. JUST LIKE ATHLETES OUR EMPLOYEES NEED MENTAL STRENGTH IN THEIR GAME. WE FOSTER THE ATHLETE’S MINDSET THROUGH A SET OF BEHAVIORS THAT WE WANT TO ENABLE AND DEVELOP IN OUR PEOPLE AND THAT ARE AT THE CORE OF OUR UNIQUE COMPANY CULTURE: THIS IS HOW WE WIN WHILE PLAYING FAIR.




COURAGE: Speak up when you see an opportunity; step up when you see a need..


OWNERSHIP: Pick up the ball. Be proactive, take responsibility and follow\-through.


INNOVATION: Elevate to win. Be curious, test and learn new and better ways of doing things.


TEAMPLAY: Win together. Work collaboratively and cultivate a shared mindset.


INTEGRITY: Play by the rules. Hold yourself and others accountable to our company’s standards.


RESPECT: Value all players. Display empathy, be inclusive and show dignity to all.


**ADIDAS CELEBRATES DIVERSITY, SUPPORTS INCLUSIVENESS AND ENCOURAGES INDIVIDUAL EXPRESSION IN OUR WORKPLACE. WE DO NOT TOLERATE THE HARASSMENT OR DISCRIMINATION TOWARD ANY OF OUR APPLICANTS OR EMPLOYEES. WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER.**

title: STUDENT DATA ANALYST (INTERNSHIP) NETHERLANDS (AMSTERDAM) TREVOLUTION
description:
We are looking for a Student Data Analyst Intern to join our Trevolution team within Dyninno Group travel division.


**Trevolution** is a global leader in air ticketing and travel services, serving retail and corporate clients in 50\+ markets. With over 20 years of expertise and an entrepreneurial spirit at our core, we combine modern tech with a customer\-first approach to simplify travel. As the 4th\-largest US airline ticket consolidator, we partner with 70\+ airlines, offering a full booking experience with expert support – focused on value and convenience. Our products, including online sales, call bookings, and semi\-OTAs, are continually expanding to meet market trends.



As a **Student Data Analyst Intern**, you will gain hands\-on experience in data collection, analysis, and visualization. You will work closely with our data and business teams to extract meaningful insights, support decision\-making, and contribute to ongoing projects.


**Internship Period:** July 2025 – December 2025 (can be negotiated).  

**Hours:** 32\-40 hours per week.



RESPONSIBILITIES:


* Analyze data from various sources.
* Assist in developing reports and dashboards.
* Support business teams in data\-driven decision\-making.
* Identify trends and patterns in large datasets.
* Collaborate with colleagues on improving data processes.

REQUIREMENTS:


* Student must be enrolled in a Dutch university HBO/WO program in Data Science, Business Analytics, Econometrics, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Strong analytical and problem\-solving skills.
* Experience with data analysis tools such as Python, R, or SQL is a plus.
* Knowledge of data visualization tools (Looker, Power BI, Tableau) is advantageous.
* Detail\-oriented with strong communication skills.
* Able to work both independently and in a team.

WHAT WE OFFER:


* Internship allowance: subject to discussion, based on university policy.
* Travel cost reimbursement (if needed).
* Hands\-on experience in a data\-driven environment.
* Guidance from experienced professionals.
* A dynamic and inspiring workplace.
* **Please note that we only offer a regular internship and not a research internship.**


Interested? Send your CV to **hr\_netherlands@dyninno.com** with the subject **“Internship**  

**Application – Student Data Analyst”** by the 16th of May.
company_description: Dyninno is a group of companies providing products and services in the travel, finance, entertainment, and technology sectors in 50 countries.

title: Data Analytics and Sales Reporting Intern
description:
Lotus Cars builds world\-class, high\-performance and lightweight sports cars that are sold all around the world.


Lotus Cars Europe B.V. is responsible for the Marketing, Sales and After Sales of the Lotus Cars products in the European region.

**Summary:**


We are looking for a HBO (or WO) student in the third or last year of study as Data Analytics and Sales Reporting Intern in our Sales Department. This will be for a period of 6 months starting asap in our European HQ based in Amsterdam.  

  

This internship provides an excellent opportunity to gain hands\-on experience in data analytics within the automotive industry while contributing to the success of a renowned brand. You will support our sales and marketing team by analyzing data, generating insights, and creating reports to drive strategic decision\-making.

 **Activities:**

* Analyze sales data, including revenue recognition, registrations \& order takes.
* Identify opportunities for growth and optimization.
* Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using Microsoft Excel and PowerBI to visualize sales performance metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs).
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams to gather requirements, understand business needs, and provide data\-driven recommendations.
* Assist in data collection, cleansing, and preparation to ensure accuracy and reliability of analysis.
* Conduct ad\-hoc analyses to answer specific business questions and support decision\-making processes.
* Assist in documenting processes, methodologies, and best practices for data analytics and reporting.

  

  

**We are looking for a person who:*** Real passion and proficiency in data analytics and management, with strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
* Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel for data manipulation, analysis, and modeling.
* Experience with Microsoft Power BI or similar business intelligence tools for data visualization and report generation.
* Ability to interpret complex data sets and communicate insights effectively to non\-technical stakeholders.
* Strong problem\-solving skills and a proactive approach to identifying opportunities for improvement.
* Excellent organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast\-paced environment.
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively communicate in English within cross\-functional teams.
 **What do we offer?**

* A challenging internship within a dynamic organization;
* Introduction to the different aspects of Automotive business;
* The opportunity to learn in a highly international environment;
* A monthly internship allowance of **600 euro** plus commuting allowance.

**If you recognize yourself in the above vacancy and your interest is aroused to do an internship at a very dynamic car brand record your Video CV now.**

 **Our Company:**


Group Lotus is a leading sports car manufacturer with a 75\-year long history of iconic designs, groundbreaking engineering and legendary victories on the F1 track. Today we are transforming into a truly global performance car brand focused on the electrical future. In 2022 we launched the Eletre, the world’s first all\-electric hyper\-SUV, and in 2023 Emeya, our fully\-electric Hyper\-GT. By 2026 Lotus will produce three more all\-electric lifestyle models that change the game.


As part of the Lotus team, you push boundaries. Those of the car industry and of your own. Every member of the Lotus family has some of the pioneering mindset of founder Colin Chapman in them. In Lotus Cars Europe we form a diverse and international team working from our European HQ based in Amsterdam.


We're not just a car company; we're a diverse mix of talent from all walks of life. At Lotus Cars Europe, we firmly believe that diversity and inclusion are not just buzzwords but essential pillars of a thriving and successful organization. Read more here: Equity, Diversity \& Inclusion in Lotus.


Do you want to know what Sophisticated, Rebellious and Pioneering mean for Lotus Cars Europe? Come and take a look at our career site and join the incredible adventure: https://careers.eu.lotuscars.com/

title: Thesis Intern Data Visualization
description:
### **Job Applicant Privacy Notice**


**Thesis Intern Data Visualization**
====================================

Publication Date: Apr 14, 2025
Ref. No: 527649
Location:
Amstelveen, NL
Eviden, part of the Atos Group, with an annual revenue of circa € 5 billion is a global leader in data\-driven, trusted and sustainable digital transformation. As a next generation digital business with worldwide leading positions in digital, cloud, data, advanced computing and security, it brings deep expertise for all industries in more than 47 countries. By uniting unique high\-end technologies across the full digital continuum with 47,000 world\-class talents, Eviden expands the possibilities of data and technology, now and for generations to come.

  


**Your Role at Eviden**  

*Launch your career in data with us!*

  


As a **Graduate Thesis Intern Data Visualization**, you will play a supporting role in advising our clients to become more data\-driven by ensuring data is well\-managed, understood, and accessible. Working alongside experienced consultants, you’ll learn more about data visualization projects and learn how data can be turned into valuable insights for businesses.


This is a fantastic opportunity to deepen your knowledge in data visualization, management, and strategy within a supportive and innovative environment. You will work closely with both technical teams and business stakeholders, learning how Eviden translates data concepts into tangible business value.


For this thesis internship, we seek a candidate interested in researching how AI and Generative AI can be leveraged in data visualization solutions.

  


**About Digital Transformation Consulting**

  

  

At **Eviden Digital Transformation Consulting**, we guide organizations on their journey to becoming digital\-first businesses. We help clients build digital capabilities to navigate an increasingly complex and fast\-moving world. You’ll be part of our **Benelux \& Nordics team**, joining a diverse and motivated group of professionals who work across industries like Healthcare, Manufacturing, Energy, Financial Services, and more.


At Eviden, we believe in growing together. We offer our junior colleagues mentorship, training, and the chance to work on real client projects from day one.

  


**What We’re Looking For**


We’re seeking an enthusiastic and curious team member who is eager to learn and grow within the field of data visualization. You don’t need years of experience—just the right mindset and a strong interest in data!

  


**You might be a great fit if you:**


* Are in the final phase of your WO master or HBO bachelor studies in Data Science, Information Management, Computer Science, Digital Business, Business Analytics, or a related field.
* Are available for 4\-6 months starting August or September 2025\.
* Have a proactive, can\-do attitude and a passion for turning data into real business value.
* Have working proficiency in Dutch and English (minimum B2 level according to the CEFR).
* Enjoy working in a team and are not afraid to ask questions.
* Experience with PowerBI or other data visualization tools like Qlik or Tableau is a plus.

  




**What We Offer**


* We offer a flexible internship program with the potential for advancement into a junior consultant position. This internship will involve both remote work and time spent at our Amstelveen office.
* Mentorship from experienced professionals during your thesis process. Your thesis holds priority, and we are pleased to offer our support.
* Opportunity to learn more about Digital Transformation Consulting at Eviden.
* A structured learning path with access to internal and external courses.
* A collaborative and international working environment.
* A workplace that values diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities.

  




**Apply Today**  

If you’re excited about starting your career in data and want to make an impact from day one, we’d love to hear from you. No need to tick every box—if you’re eager to grow, we’re eager to support you.


Apply now! We look forward to helping you grow into the data professional you aspire to be!

  


\#LI\-SD3

  


**Let’s grow together.**

In this role, you will be responsible for maintaining, improving and documenting the SLIPDB (SLIP database), an automated data pipeline to report SLIP. You will use Python and Databricks to process a wide range of data, from multiple sources. You will work in a multidisciplinary environment, involving physics, data processing and analysis, and interacting with multiple departments.

title: Merch Planning Intern - Rookie Program FW' 2025
description:
**Values \& Innovation**
------------------------


At Under Armour, we are committed to empowering those who strive for more, and the company's values \- Act Sustainably, Celebrate the Wins, Fight on Together, Love Athletes and Stand for Equality \- serve as both a roadmap for our teams and the qualities expected of every teammate.

  

Our Values define and unite us, the beliefs that are the red thread that connects everyone at Under Armour. Our values are rallying cries, reminding us why we're here, and fueling everything we do.

  

Our pursuit of better begins with innovation and with our team's mission of being the best. With us, you get the freedom to go further \- no matter your role. That means developing, delivering, and selling the state\-of\-the\-art products and digital tools that make top performers even better.

  

If you are a current Under Armour teammate, apply to this position on the **Internal Career Site Here.**

**The Rookie Program**
----------------------


Do you have what it takes to make an impact?! Join the Under Armour Rookie (internship) Program:


Start date 1st of September '25 \- Jan 31st '26

  

In order to be eligible for an internship you must be:


Enrolled in a Dutch University (not on\-line) in a Bachelor or a Master for the entire duration of the program (full 5 months) AND be an EU citizen passport holder OR a Non\-EU Citizen studying in the Netherlands (Internship should be then a mandatory part of your curriculum).

  

At Under Armour, we're looking for fearless Rookies who are ready to take on a challenge! As a company dedicated to making athletes better, our ultimate goal is to inspire you with performance solutions that you never knew you needed but can't imagine living without. As an Under Armour intern, you'll have the opportunity to play a crucial role in bringing our mission and vision to life through a hands\-on project that challenges you to develop new skills and push boundaries. This strategic project will test your skills and help you challenge the status quo, making a real business impact during your 5\-month internship.

  

Alongside this project, you'll work closely with a mentor and cross\-functional teams, gaining valuable global exposure and collaborating with talented professionals from across the company. With access to executive Q\&A sessions and personalized guidance from our talent advisors, you'll be well\-equipped to tackle any challenge that comes your way.

  

At Under Armour, we believe that an intern's experience should be enriched beyond their job responsibilities. That's why our interns get unparalleled Go\-To\-Market exposure and learn how our innovative products transition from development to sales and ultimately into the market.

  

Our internship program is designed to provide a holistic understanding of the Under Armour brand. Through in\-person and online training, you'll have a deep dive into our values, expand your horizons, and connect with a powerful network of professionals worldwide through our career coaching platform.

  

As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to participate in our Teammate Resource Groups, where you can share experiences, build relationships, and grow as a team. You will also step inside the exciting world of retail and explore the fast\-paced environment that keeps our customers coming back for more.

**Purpose of Role**
-------------------


STRATEGIC PROJECT: ELEVATE CATEGORY ASSORTMENT

* Analyse data to contribute to building the right assortment mix for the brand, ensuring that product offerings meet market demands and align with the brand's strategic goals.
* Support workflow by gathering data related to line architecture/ product hierarchy/ productivity targets (e.g. document new processes and workflows, ensuring that all steps are clearly outlined and accessible for future reference).
* Identify and implement automation tools to streamline manual processes (Excel).
* Enhance data reporting and visualization to support decision\-making to help streamline the processes and formalize the documentation.
**Your Impact**
---------------

* Support in building the right assortment mix for the brand. This ensures that the product offerings align with sales analysis, market demands and the brand's strategic goals, leading to better customer satisfaction and increased sales.
* Documenting processes and workflows ensures that knowledge is preserved and easily accessible for future reference, contributing to a more organized and informed team.
* Identify and implement Excel\-based automation tools to streamline manual processes. This could include using formulas and leveraging Excel's advanced features.
* Create visual reports and dashboards that make complex data easier to understand, facilitating quicker and more effective decision\-making
**Qualifications**
------------------


Student of: Economics/ Business Administration/ Data Science or Statistics/ Brand Management with strong skills as below.


Skills:

* Proficiency in Excel, incl. advanced functions and data visualization tools.
* Strong ability to analyze and interpret data.
* Ability to document processes clearly and effectively.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills for reporting and presenting findings.
* Attention to detail ensuring accuracy in data analysis and reporting.
* Ability to identify inefficiencies and propose effective solutions.
**Workplace Location**
----------------------

* **Location:** This individual must reside within commuting distance from our Amsterdam office.
* **Return to Work Designation:** Starting in October, teammates are required to work on\-site for 3 days per week. This will increase to 4 days per week beginning January 2026
**Relocation**
--------------

* No relocation provided
**Benefits \& Perks**
---------------------

* 750 euro gross monthly allowance
* Health and Wellness allowance (50 euro net monthly) OR Free Classpass membership
* Under Armour Merchandise Discounts
* Access to Under Amour's Human Performance Institute (Gym) on site
* NS Business Card
* 38 hours working week
**Our Commitment to Diversity**
-------------------------------


At Under Armour, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, family or paternal status and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Under Armour believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities upon request.


\#LI\-MS1

These initiatives will be instrumental in optimizing our spend across serval business units, facilitating alignment across teams and ensuring we drive sustainable sales growth while maintaining profitability

**Your Impact**
---------------

* Evolve current reporting structures to enable business segment insights.
* Create insightful scorecards to highlight areas of opportunity or risk within the business.
* Collaborate cross\-functionally within Finance, Controlling and Business partners to elevate and enhance cost controls.
**Qualifications**
------------------

* Strong analytical and quantitative skills.
* Proficient in Excel and other analytical tools; familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau) is a plus.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly and concisely.

title: Market Research Assistant (Internship)
description:
**About the Hiring Team**
=========================

Level Infinite is Tencent’s global gaming brand. It is a global game publisher offering a comprehensive network of services for games, development teams, and studios around the world.
  

  

We are dedicated to delivering engaging and original gaming experiences to a worldwide audience, whenever and wherever they choose to play while building a community that fosters inclusivity, connection, and accessibility. Level Infinite also provides a wide range of services and resources to our network of developers and partner studios around the world to help them unlock the true potential of their games.
**What the Role Entails**
=========================

As a market research assistant, you will work closely with your mentor \& other (senior) researchers to gather, analyze and interpret data that will directly impact our game development and marketing strategies. This is an exciting opportunity for anyone looking to gain hands\-on experience in consumer insights as well as the gaming industry.
* Assist in all phases of quantitative and qualitative research process (surveys, focus groups, interviews), including study design, questionnaire drafting, fielding, data analysis \& reporting.
* Assist in quality control processes at each stage of the research, including proof\-reading, checking survey links \& data cleaning.
* Assist with data visualization and presenting findings in a clear \& concise manner.
* Conduct desk research to support research projects including competitor analysis, emerging trends \& keeping up with the gaming industry.
* Perform additional duties and administrative support assigned by the mentor / manager.

**Who We Look For**
===================

* Currently a registered student in a university in the Netherlands, or a fresh graduate who has a legal residence permit to work as an intern in the Netherlands.
* Currently pursuing a degree in Marketing, Business, Psychology, Game Design or a related field.
* Analytical mindset with an eye for detail.
* Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, with the capacity to articulate ideas in a clear and succinct manner.
* Able to work well in a fast\-paced environment, multi\-tasking, and promptly adapting to shifting priorities to deliver tasks in a timely manner.
* A positive attitude, eager to learn and grow in the field of consumer insights.
* A passion for video gaming is a huge asset.
* Proficiency with Excel \& PowerPoint.
* Experience with data analysis tools (SPSS, Tableau, Power BI, etc.) is a plus.
* Fluency in English.

**Note:**

* This is an on\-site intern position in our Amsterdam office, requiring 32\-40 hours per week for a period of at least 6 months.
* We do not offer any relocation support or sponsor any work permit for this internship.

\#LI\-AW1


**Equal Employment Opportunity at Tencent**
===========================================

As an equal opportunity employer, we firmly believe that diverse voices fuel our innovation and allow us to better serve our users and the community. We foster an environment where every employee of Tencent feels supported and inspired to achieve individual and common goals.

title: Intern Data and Analytics
description:
**WE ARE DENIM HEADS.**



We love denim. Live and breathe it. It’s in our DNA.  

At G\-STAR, we see no limit to what denim can do. We believe it can be force of progress and innovation for both people and planet. How? By hiring the most creative, curious and caring minds. People who think beyond fashion. Bringing big ideas to big challenges. Driven by possibility.Those who work hard, make mistakes, but always continue to grow. Denim is in our DNA, our people are our stitching.  

Join the denim heads making raw denim!



We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and welcome applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of background, identity, or experience.



**HERE'S WHAT WE'LL DO TOGETHER:**



We’re looking for a Data and Analytics intern, who’s ready to join our G\-STAR Data \& Analytics Team!



Just imagine –



As our new Data Analytics Intern, you will be part of the Data \& Analytics team within G\-STAR. The Data \& Analytics department plays a key role in driving data\-driven decision\-making across the company. Through deep analytical insights, data governance, and collaboration with various business units, the team ensures that data is leveraged effectively to support strategic goals. You will work cross\-functionally with teams across different departments (E\-commerce, Trade and Digital Marketing) gaining hands\-on experience in a dynamic and international environment. This is your chance to be at the heart of G\-STAR’s data\-driven transformation and make a real impact.



**YOUR TASKS \& RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Continuous support on the day\-to\-day business in various business areas.
* Impact analysis on incoming requests and performing data quality checks.
* Optimizing and standardizing existing Dashboards.
* Support business in creating their own reports.
* Creating guidelines and templates for new Dashboards.
* Support in creating an internal information sharing platform.


**WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE:**


* You are a Bachelor or Master student, preferably with a specialization in the areas of: Data, Mathematics, Business or similar.
* Strong problem\-solving, analytical and conceptual skills.
* You have a ‘can\-do’ mentality and can think outside the box.
* You are proficient in Microsoft Excel and are familiar with SQL.
* A big plus would be if you already have experience with data visualization tools (preferably Tableau) and you are familiar with Digital Analytics Tools (e.g. Google Analytics).
* You are available full\-time (at least 32hrs per week) for 5 to 6 months starting in August / September 2025\.
* You are enrolled at a university or college in the Netherlands or EU, during the whole length of the internship. Unfortunately, we cannot provide immigration support for internships at this time.
* If you are a non\-EU student in The Netherlands, you are in possession of a mandatory internship assignment.
* You are already living in the Netherlands and are in the possession of a BSN, or in a process of getting one.
* Finally, if you have a strong personality and excellent verbal and written communication skills in English, we’d love to meet you!


**HERE'S WHAT WE BRING TO THE TABLE:**



In addition to €600 monthly allowance for your internship, working at G\-STAR brings so many perks and exciting opportunities, we don’t know where to begin… How about:


* An awesome and diverse team that collaborates to inspire,
* A work environment that offers room for fun, inspiration and innovation,
* A clothing budget of €400 to buy the latest G\-STAR items!
* To keep up the greatness we also offer you a healthy, fresh, and delicious lunch in our HQ in Amsterdam,
* If you don’t have an OV student travel card, we will cover your travel expenses,
* You will also enjoy two paid days of leave per month!


**HERE'S WHAT WILL HAPPEN NEXT:**


* During this job application, we will ask you to play a couple of short **neuroscientific games**. These games provide you with the opportunity to showcase your potential, talents, and personality.
* As a result, we can ensure equal opportunities for everyone who applies, by evaluating everyone based on objective, scientifically proven insights rather than gut feeling.
* As we value personal growth and transparency, we will make sure you receive your results on the games as well.
* When we hopefully find what we are looking for, we will get in touch with you and if it’s a good fit, we’ll plan our **first interview**.
* When we’re ready to commit to each other, we’ll finalize the terms we’ve discussed and we’ll explain to you how to order your first pair of jeans from the G\-STAR employee store.

Good luck!

title: Bachelor/Master Internship: Monitoring the application landscape
description:
Create a dashboard to monitor the application landscape for PACCAR Financial Europe PFE\-ITD manages a complex application landscape with multiple integration layers and interfaces. Currently there’s no single point to overview our application landscape, identify issues in real\-time, and track the status of our integration layers. Information is scattered in (project)documents, log files, systems, etcetera. The goal is to enhance operational efficiency and to have an overview across our systems.  

Your assignment will be to:* Setup the requirements for dashboard to monitor the application landscape
* Investigate which possible applications can be used
* Propose an application
* Design the dashboard in the application and connect possible sources in an agile way
* Conduct testing and validation of the dashboard to ensure accuracy and functionality
* Document the development process and create user guides for future reference.
* Participate in team meetings and contribute ideas for improving dashboard features and usability


* A view behind the scenes at a large international corporation;
* You will get a lot of freedom and responsibility. We are open to your initiatives and depending on the assignment you see your results back in the workplace;
* An experienced coach and supervisor who can teach you a lot and is willing to help you with your assignment;
* After your graduation, you will have the opportunity to start your career at DAF;
* An internship wage of € 375,\- (HBO) and € 450,\- WO per month on full\-time base
* A travel allowance, if you don’t have a student travel product (provided by the Dutch government);
* A housing allowance, if you temporarily rent a room near DAF.


Each intern will have the opportunity to participate at the Student Event. During this event you will meet other interns and find out more about DAF/PACCAR!  

  

Would you like to know more about the experiences of other students? Here you can read stories of our former interns. PACCAR Financial Europe (PFE) provides financial services to DAF dealers and end customers to support the sales of DAF trucks. PFE is part of the worldwide PACCAR Financial organization, has its headquarters in Eindhoven at the DAF premises and is active in a large number of European countries with its own sales offices and used trucks centers. The PFE Information Technology department is responsible for the development, configuration, testing and deployment of innovative IT\-solutions, management of these systems during their lifecycle and support of the users of these systems. PFE\-IT consists of appr. 25 fte. of which 20 are internal and works according to the agile framework. Most of the systems are subject to SOx\-regulations.  

  

PFE contains 4 lines of business areas: Wholesale Financing to DAF\-dealers, Retail Financing to End Customers, Short Term Leasing and Asset Management \& Used Trucks Remarketing. The Retail Financing systems landscape has been renewed recently and a new state\-of\-the\-art systems landscape for Asset Mgt. \& Used Trucks Remarketing is currently under development as part of a large IT\-project. Other projects are already planned. We are looking for an enthusiastic intern with the following skill set.* HBO/WO student who is pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Software Engineering, or a related field
* Familiarity with web development technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) and frameworks
* Knowledge of RESTful APIs and data integration concepts
* Basic understanding of data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Grafana) is a plus
* Analytical and problem\-solving skills
* Communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
* Self\-motivated, eager to learn, and capable of managing time effectively.
* Language skills: English (written and verbal)
* Preferred period of the internship: 4\-5 months starting in September 2025\.


Please upload your resume and motivation below. For more information you can contact Campus Recruitment on phone number 040\-2142616\.

title: Assistant Manager Digital Analytics x3
description:
At adidas your role as an Assistant Manager Digital Analytics, where we have 3 openings across our Business Performance, Marketing or Experience Analytics teams, you will play your part in analyzing consumer shopping behavior within the adidas e\-commerce, enabling our teams to make decisions based on sales trends. You are supporting for reporting tools, KPIs, insights and measurement supporting several different teams in EU ecommerce team to take data\-driven decisions. You will be working with multiple dashboards and data sets to report on and generate insights that help adidas understand how our business is performing – where do we have challenges and where do we have opportunities \- to ultimately help drive sales.  

  

You will be someone that is constantly curious, always asking the right questions whilst at the same time having a passion for data and uncovering insights about our business. This role has a great balance between data, business understanding and critical thinking.
YOU GOT THIS and we are excited to be part of your journey.  


Main Responsibilities:  


Foundations \& Automation:  


* Support in the automation of analytical data processes
* Support in the process of a strong data quality and resolution of defects

  


Reports \& Dashboards:  


* Build and maintain self\-service data tools in Power BI to track the business performance
* Support in managing backlogs for development and enhancements of our dashboards

  


Reporting \& Insights:  


* Support in reporting on business performance during our commercial \& campaign moments
* Support in conduct deep dives into business problems and areas of underperformance
* Identify opportunities
* Understand the business data in the context traffic \& conversion

  


Measurement:  


* Support team in sizing opportunities to drive business growth

  


Key Relationships:  


* EU e\-commerce teams (Buying \& Planning / Trading / Outlet / Digital Visual Merchandising / Finance / Analytics)
* Global Digital Analytics
* Global Data Engineering

  


Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:  


Technical\-Skills:  


* Experience in data manipulation using SQL
* POWER BI or equivalent data visualization tools such as Tableau or Looker
* Adobe / Amplitude
* Confident working with large data sets

  


Business and Communication\-Skills:  


* Strong communication skills: ability to articulate complex concepts clearly
* Comfortable presenting to larger groups
* Fluent in English

  


Requisite Education and Experience / Minimum Qualifications:  


* University degree in a numerical/business discipline
* 2\+ years’ experience in a similar role
* Experience in eCommerce is a plus


AT ADIDAS WE HAVE A WINNING CULTURE. BUT TO WIN, PHYSICAL POWER IS NOT ENOUGH. JUST LIKE ATHLETES OUR EMPLOYEES NEED MENTAL STRENGTH IN THEIR GAME. WE FOSTER THE ATHLETE’S MINDSET THROUGH A SET OF BEHAVIORS THAT WE WANT TO ENABLE AND DEVELOP IN OUR PEOPLE AND THAT ARE AT THE CORE OF OUR UNIQUE COMPANY CULTURE: THIS IS HOW WE WIN WHILE PLAYING FAIR.




COURAGE: Speak up when you see an opportunity; step up when you see a need..


OWNERSHIP: Pick up the ball. Be proactive, take responsibility and follow\-through.


INNOVATION: Elevate to win. Be curious, test and learn new and better ways of doing things.


TEAMPLAY: Win together. Work collaboratively and cultivate a shared mindset.


INTEGRITY: Play by the rules. Hold yourself and others accountable to our company’s standards.


RESPECT: Value all players. Display empathy, be inclusive and show dignity to all.


**ADIDAS CELEBRATES DIVERSITY, SUPPORTS INCLUSIVENESS AND ENCOURAGES INDIVIDUAL EXPRESSION IN OUR WORKPLACE. WE DO NOT TOLERATE THE HARASSMENT OR DISCRIMINATION TOWARD ANY OF OUR APPLICANTS OR EMPLOYEES. WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER.**

title: Data Analytics and Sales Reporting Intern
description:
Lotus Cars builds world\-class, high\-performance and lightweight sports cars that are sold all around the world.


Lotus Cars Europe B.V. is responsible for the Marketing, Sales and After Sales of the Lotus Cars products in the European region.

**Summary:**


We are looking for a HBO (or WO) student in the third or last year of study as Data Analytics and Sales Reporting Intern in our Sales Department. This will be for a period of 6 months starting asap in our European HQ based in Amsterdam.  

  

This internship provides an excellent opportunity to gain hands\-on experience in data analytics within the automotive industry while contributing to the success of a renowned brand. You will support our sales and marketing team by analyzing data, generating insights, and creating reports to drive strategic decision\-making.

 **Activities:**

* Analyze sales data, including revenue recognition, registrations \& order takes.
* Identify opportunities for growth and optimization.
* Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using Microsoft Excel and PowerBI to visualize sales performance metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs).
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams to gather requirements, understand business needs, and provide data\-driven recommendations.
* Assist in data collection, cleansing, and preparation to ensure accuracy and reliability of analysis.
* Conduct ad\-hoc analyses to answer specific business questions and support decision\-making processes.
* Assist in documenting processes, methodologies, and best practices for data analytics and reporting.

  

  

**We are looking for a person who:*** Real passion and proficiency in data analytics and management, with strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
* Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel for data manipulation, analysis, and modeling.
* Experience with Microsoft Power BI or similar business intelligence tools for data visualization and report generation.
* Ability to interpret complex data sets and communicate insights effectively to non\-technical stakeholders.
* Strong problem\-solving skills and a proactive approach to identifying opportunities for improvement.
* Excellent organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast\-paced environment.
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively communicate in English within cross\-functional teams.
 **What do we offer?**

* A challenging internship within a dynamic organization;
* Introduction to the different aspects of Automotive business;
* The opportunity to learn in a highly international environment;
* A monthly internship allowance of **600 euro** plus commuting allowance.

**If you recognize yourself in the above vacancy and your interest is aroused to do an internship at a very dynamic car brand record your Video CV now.**

 **Our Company:**


Group Lotus is a leading sports car manufacturer with a 75\-year long history of iconic designs, groundbreaking engineering and legendary victories on the F1 track. Today we are transforming into a truly global performance car brand focused on the electrical future. In 2022 we launched the Eletre, the world’s first all\-electric hyper\-SUV, and in 2023 Emeya, our fully\-electric Hyper\-GT. By 2026 Lotus will produce three more all\-electric lifestyle models that change the game.


As part of the Lotus team, you push boundaries. Those of the car industry and of your own. Every member of the Lotus family has some of the pioneering mindset of founder Colin Chapman in them. In Lotus Cars Europe we form a diverse and international team working from our European HQ based in Amsterdam.


We're not just a car company; we're a diverse mix of talent from all walks of life. At Lotus Cars Europe, we firmly believe that diversity and inclusion are not just buzzwords but essential pillars of a thriving and successful organization. Read more here: Equity, Diversity \& Inclusion in Lotus.


Do you want to know what Sophisticated, Rebellious and Pioneering mean for Lotus Cars Europe? Come and take a look at our career site and join the incredible adventure: https://careers.eu.lotuscars.com/

title: Software Artist
description:
#### **Wij creëren digitale kunst. Geen standaard mediabureau, maar een team van creatieve doeners die durven vernieuwen en inspireren.**



Stage
Parttime
Fulltime
Jij bent niet zomaar een developer. Je ziet software als kunst en code als een middel om verhalen te vertellen. Innovatie, creativiteit en technologie gaan bij jou hand in hand. Als **Software Artist** bij ons bouw je digitale ervaringen die niet alleen slim, maar ook visueel en interactief verbluffend zijn.


Jouw werk gaat verder dan functionele software. Je experimenteert met AI, generative design en grensverleggende interfaces om technologie tastbaar en impactvol te maken. Algoritmes zijn jouw penseel, data jouw kleurenpalet. Je zoekt de perfecte balans tussen techniek en esthetiek, functionaliteit en emotie.


Je hebt een passie voor tech, design en alles ertussenin. Je denkt analytisch, maar voelt intuïtief aan wat werkt. Je hebt een eigen visie, maar gelooft ook in samenwerking met andere pioniers. Samen pushen we de grenzen van het digitale mogelijk.

**Denk jij dat jouw code het digitale canvas kan transformeren?**  

Let’s break the code and create something unforgettable.

title: EMEA Event Manager, AWS (Fixed Term - 14 Months), EMEA Events & Sponsorship Team
description:
\- Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field
\- 5\+ years of work experience in an event\-related role
\- Experience in developing, owning and executing successful B2B event programs end to end
\- Experience in driving innovative brand presence at large B2B trade shows
\- Skilled at driving central enablement support to enhance scale
\- Strong written and verbal communication skills
\- Innovative mind\-set, ad\-hoc problem\-solving and ability to deal with ambiguity
\- Prior experience working with cross\-functional and international teams.
\- Experience using data and metrics to measure impact and determine improvements
\- A willingness to travel and ability to work independently and autonomously, and work across time zones
  

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking a talented, self\-directed EMEA Event Manager to develop and grow the cloud computing businesses in Europe, Middle East and Africa.
The EMEA Event Manager role is responsible for developing, improving, executing and measuring highly impactful B2B event programs. This is a fixed term contract for 14 months (maternity cover). This is a unique opportunity to play a key role in an exciting, industry leading technology business.
Key tasks will include:
\* Own event projects end\-to\-end, incl. strategy, goal setting, budget management, agency management, project planning, stakeholder management, delivery, result tracking and de\-briefs 
\* Drive enablement, scale and process improvements for AWS presence at third party events across EMEA (incl. events with strong AI focus)
\* Own overall event strategy for AWS presence at third party events in EMEA (why, what, how) in close alignment with global and local stakeholders
\* Use data and customer feedback to constantly improve event programs and the customer experience
\* Deliver results including clear ROI reporting
\* Think around the corner and drive innovation
The location of this role is either Munich (Germany), Amsterdam (Netherlands), or London (UK).
About the team
AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small\- and mid\-market accounts to enterprise\-level customers including public sector.
Within SMGS, EMEA Events \& Sponsorship Team is a diverse team of driven event, program and sponsorship managers. We are known to deliver bar\-raising event strategy, planning, enablement and execution for AWS events and third party trade shows. We work backwards from our external and internal customers and innovate on their behalf. We work hard, have fun and make history.
  

* Masters’s degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field
* Work history in a (global) tech company
* Experience in Generative AI Marketing

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how\-we\-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
company_description: Amazon Web Services (AWS) offers the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform, with over 200 powerful services that enable our customers and our people to make more of an impact.

title: Senior Inbound Marketing Manager
description:
We’re on a mission to help recruitment agencies and in\-house teams go to zero admin and unlock more hires with less hassle. Our AI\-powered platform is built by a team that previously exited a disruptive recruitment tech company \- and now, we're rewriting the rules of hiring again.

#### **What do we look for?**


Carv is growing fast, and we’re looking for an Inbound Marketing Manager who can build and scale organic growth engines across multiple product funnels. You’ll be the architect of our inbound motion \- driving pipeline through SEO, content, landing pages, and nurture flows \- all while strengthening the Carv brand.

#### **Your Responsibilities?**

* Develop and execute inbound strategies that align with pipeline goals
* Own keyword research and translate it into actionable, SEO\-driven content plans
* Manage freelance writers and collaborate with in\-house creators
* Optimize and expand inbound conversion paths, landing pages, and nurture flows
* Lead organic social strategy in alignment with brand and product teams
* Use tools like Ahrefs, GA4, and our CMS to track performance and spot opportunities
* Write content when needed (\~30% of the role), ensuring high quality and voice consistency

#### **Your Mission**


You’ll lead the strategy and execution of Carv’s inbound marketing engine, building awareness and demand across:

* 3\+ modular product funnels (each with distinct ICPs and buyer journeys)
* A brand\-level awareness funnel that showcases Carv’s story and value
* Supporting layers like social, email, and SEO \- all tied to performance and growth

  

With a strong foundation already in place, you’ll help Carv reach new audiences, convert interest into action, and drive measurable impact through organic, content\-led marketing.

#### **Our offer to you**


We offer the excitement of building out the global Carv brand. With a management team boasting a combined experience of 20\+ years in the recruitment tech/SaaS space, you’re not starting from the ground up but are stepping onto a launching pad.  

  

A glimpse of what else is in store:

* Unlimited paid time off;
* Competitive base salary;
* Company stock options;
* MacBook Pro;
* Personal development budget;
* Flexibility and hybrid work set\-up
* At least 4\+ years in B2B SaaS marketing (inbound, SEO, or content\-focused)
* Strong hands\-on SEO skills (Ahrefs, GA4, CMS)
* Confidently managing content production workflows
* Organized, strategic, and proactive in cross\-functional work
* industry knowldge \= pre
* Generative AI Search Optimization

title: PhD Paper Mills and Systematic Manipulation in Research Publishing
description:
Vacancy number
15601
Job type
PhD positions
Hours (in fte)
1,0
External/ internal
External
Location
Leiden
Placed on
15 April 2025
Closing date
13 May 2025 24 more days to apply


**PhD candidate Paper Mills and Systematic Manipulation in Research Publishing**  

The past decade has seen the rise of distinct new challenges for research integrity in the context of scientific publishing. These include the proliferation of paper mills, defined by the Committee on Publication Ethics (COPE) as operations through “which manufactured manuscripts are submitted to a journal for a fee on behalf of researchers with the purpose of providing an easy publication for them, or to offer authorship for sale”. Research also suggests an uptick in related forms of systematic manipulation of the publishing process, such as fraudulent editorial handling and peer review as well as mechanisms to artificially inflate citations to manuscripts. Most recently, generative AI has made it easier to produce not just fake manuscripts and manipulate images and measurements, but also deceive plagiarism scanners more effectively. Scientific publications involving these and other forms of misconduct usually lack a genuine contribution to the scholarly literature, characterized by low or non\-existant methodological rigor, and originality. Besides the problem of circulating contributions without scholarly merit and potential abuse of research grants, they create serious problems in the form of safety risks for patients and other supposed beneficiaries of scientific research.


In collaboration with the publishing company Wiley and the University of Sheffield, the Centre for Science and Technology Studies (CWTS) at Leiden University is recruiting a PhD candidate to carry out research on paper mills and related forms of systematic manipulation in scientific publishing. The focus of the research will be on the operation and scale of such practices in different national contexts and research fields; how they are enabled by local career and incentive systems; and how science systems could effectively combat them.

  

**What you will do**  

The purpose of this position is to produce original PhD research that contributes to the goals of the CWTS strategic Focal Area on Evaluation \& Culture. The research entails the following:

* Develop an original, empirical social science research project on paper mills and related forms of systematic manipulation in scientific publishing in different national contexts and research fields, with a focus on understanding their operation and scale and how they are enabled by local career and incentive systems.
* Develop and apply suitable new research methods, for example by combining quantitative approaches to reconstruct suspicious activities in the context of journal submissions with participant observation in online settings, survey research, and semi\-structured interviews.
* Contribute to the development of strategies for combating paper mills.
* Participate in the life of CWTS; this may include contributions to teaching of courses and other training events related to the research topic.

The research will be jointly supervised by Wolfgang Kaltenbrunner (Leiden), Stephen Pinfield (Sheffield), and Ludo Waltman (Leiden).


**Where you will work**  

The Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences consists of five institutes: Centre for Science and Technology Studies, Cultural Anthropology and Development Sociology, Political Science, and Psychology. The faculty has approximately 7000 students and 1000 staff members. Within the institutes, not only education is provided but also groundbreaking research is conducted that pushes the boundaries of our understanding of human behaviour and societal structures. What makes our faculty unique is the diversity of research topics, the various styles of teaching, and the way professional support is organized; this provides you with the opportunity to explore and develop your interests and expertise. Visit our website for an impression: Welcome to the Leiden Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences \- Leiden University.

*Centre for Science and Technology Studies (CWTS)*  

The Centre for Science and Technology Studies (CWTS) is a research institute at Leiden University working on improving how science is practiced and governed and how it serves society. Besides our cutting\-edge research, we also provide training, consultancy, and research intelligence, we engage in advocacy initiatives, and we contribute to policy making. Our work focuses on three broad areas: (1\) societal engagement and inclusion in the research system, (2\) responsible research evaluation and healthy research cultures, and (3\) openness of research information. For more information, please visit our website.


You will work in the *Evaluation \& Culture Focal Area of CWTS*, where you will join a vibrant community of science studies researchers interested and engaged in research and practical interventions around scholarly communication and research assessment reform activities. You will be expected to contribute to the further development of the Evaluation \& Culture Focal Area, and its embedding within CWTS and wider research and stakeholder communities.

**What you bring**  

The successful candidate has:

* A Master’s degree in social sciences or another relevant field;
* Qualitative and quantitative research skills (e.g., in data science, network analysis etc.) and a track record of innovative combination of research methods;
* Interest in academic literature in fields such as the sociology of science, science \& technology studies, quantitative science studies;
* Fluency in English, both spoken and written; other language skills are a plus;
* Strong communicative and interpersonal skills, and a flexible and supportive attitude towards colleagues.

**What we offer**  

Our goal is to work together to create a transparent and inclusive work environment in which everyone feels welcome and appreciated. Our organisation is always evolving and we need your ideas for improvement and innovation to take us further. We want to devote attention to your personal development.


You can expect an enjoyable job within the socially relevant world of education and research. The University's inspiring and international work environment is located just steps away from Leiden’s lively city centre or the bustling city centre of The Hague. We also want to work with you to devote attention to your health and vitality, for example with the fun activities we organise through Healthy University.

**We also offer:**

* An employment contract for (38 hours per week) as a PhD candidate, initially for a period of 1 year, with the possibility of extension for 3 years after a positive evaluation. This contract falls under the CLA of Dutch Universities;
* A salary of a minimum of € 2901,00 gross per month (scale P0\), based on a full\-time appointment (38 hours);
* A holiday allowance (8%), an end\-of\-year bonus (8,3%), and an attractive pension scheme at ABP;
* Flexible working hours: as a standard, you are entitled to a minimum of 29 leave days on the basis of a full\-time working week of 38 hours; you can also save for extra leave, for example by working 40 hours a week, and in this way accrue an extra 96 leave hours, or exchange 96 leave hours for a 36\-hour week.
* Lots of options when it comes to secondary employment conditions; we can, for example, discuss options for a sabbatical or paid parental leave. Within our terms of employment individual choices model, you can exchange leave days and/or salary for benefits such as an advantageous sports subscription or bicycle scheme, and we also offer child\-care options;
* If your work allows it, hybrid working is possible within the Netherlands;
* A home\-working allowance (day and internet allowance) and attention for good workplaces. The University will also provide you with a laptop and a mobile telephone (if applicable for the position).


For more information about employment conditions, see https://www.universiteitleiden.nl/werken\-bij/sollicitatieprocedure\-en\-arbeidsvoorwaarden

**What we find important**  

Promoting an inclusive community is central to Leiden University’s values and vision. Leiden University aims to be an inclusive community in which all students and staff members feel valued and respected, and are able to develop to their full potential. Diversity in experiences and perspectives enriches our teaching and strengthens our research. High\-quality education and research means inclusive education and research.

**Want to apply or find out more?**  

Please use the button to submit your application and upload a) a narrative CV outlining your qualifications, career history, and 3\-5 achievements or competences that are particularly relevant to the vacancy; b) 2\-3 samples of your academic writing in English (e.g. previously published papers, undergraduate work, reports, or blog posts); c) a letter of motivation (ca. 2 pages). In your motivation letter, you should reflect on the topic of the vacancy and make suggestions for how you propose to approach it in terms of methods of data collection and analysis. If you would like more information about what the job entails, please contact Wolfgang Kaltenbrunner, Senior Researcher, via email (w.kaltenbrunner@cwts.leidenuniv.nl). You can apply until May 13; applications will be processed immediately.


To help us get to know each other better, we follow a number of steps in the application procedure. For more information, see https://www.universiteitleiden.nl/werken\-bij/sollicitatieprocedure\-en\-arbeidsvoorwaarden

* A pre\-employment screening (references, diplomas, certificate of good conduct (VOG)) may be part of the selection procedure.
* Acquisition in response to this vacancy is not appreciated. If you nevertheless choose to send us CVs, no rights can be derived from this.
